input: Idaho has many lovely qualities. It has great vistas, wonderful fishing, and potatoes (Famous Potatoes, in point of fact). But it also is filled with people who want to kill OR-7, and his other OR and non
continuation: - OR cousins in the state . Why does one group of citizens feel that it is their right to hunt an beast just because they live in an area where that animal can be found ?That is the root of the issue . No , you dont have a right to do it .If you didnt have rights , then youd be in the running for execution after shooting 71 people . Like Oregon , Idaho has lot of property suitable for wildlife .The federal government alone manages nearly 17 , 000 square miles of property in the state . If you go online to the Forest Service page for Idaho , you can search all the lands youd like to hunt on , with GPS coordinates and maps .Many of these lands are even in Idahos metropolitan areas . If you do your homework , you can find locations in and around your town to hunt .It is no longer
paraphrase:
Idaho boasts impressive scenery, excellent fishing, and, of course, the renowned Famous Potatoes. However, some residents feel it's their right to hunt and kill the state's wildlife, specifically OR-7 and his non-OR cousins. This raises the question of why certain individuals believe they have the authority to harm nature just because they reside in an area where certain animals can be found. It is important to recognize that these creatures have inherent rights and should be protected.
Idaho's vast landscape provides ample opportunities for hunting, with the federal government managing nearly 17,000 square miles of property within the state. By conducting thorough research and utilizing online resources, such as the Forest Service page for Idaho, individuals can locate suitable hunting areas near their towns. It is crucial to prioritize the preservation of these lands and the creatures that inhabit them.
In conclusion, while Idaho offers many desirable qualities, it is essential to recognize the value of its wildlife and the importance of preserving their rights. By doing so, we can ensure the long-term health and sustainability of our environment and the creatures that call it home.

The United Nations has restarted its process for setting rules on "responsible state behaviour in cyberspace" with two separate forums, and Australia intends to continue being a key player.
On Friday, Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs Dr Tobias Feakin
continuation: attended an initial ministerial - level conference on the subject at the office of the UN ' s " Third Committee " in New York . It ' s the same body responsible for set human rights standards .A separate conference , co - hosted by the Global Commission on the Stability of Cyberspace and with Feakin ' s involvement , was held on the same day . The New York Times reported in May the Third Committee , which includes all 193 members of the General Assembly , would continue discussions " to examine " the feasibility of updating laws of responsible state behaviour in cyberspace .The UN has been struggling to come up with a working definition of state - sponsored cyber - attacks ever since the Stuxnet computer virus was discovered five years previously . As RT reported at the time , the virus is suspected to be one of a string of stealth attacks on Iran ' s nuclear power facilities in
paraphrase: The United Nations has relaunched its effort to establish guidelines for "responsible state behavior in cyberspace" with two separate forums, and Australia intends to maintain its influential role. On Friday, Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs, Dr. Tobias Feakin, attended an initial ministerial-level conference on the subject at the UN's "Third Committee" in New York. This is the same body responsible for setting human rights standards. A separate conference, co-hosted by the Global Commission on the Stability of Cyberspace and with Feakin's involvement, was also held on the same day. According to a report in The New York Times from May, the Third Committee, which includes all 193 members of the General Assembly, will continue discussions "to examine the feasibility of updating laws of responsible state behavior in cyberspace." The UN has been grappling with defining state-sponsored cyber-attacks since the Stuxnet computer virus was discovered five years ago. As RT reported at the time, the virus is suspected to be one of a series of stealth attacks on Iran's nuclear power facilities.

During a day of events designed to raise the profile of his agenda for education, President Clinton last week urged parents and teachers to embrace a "whole ethic'' of lifelong learning to insure the nation's continued economic productivity.
"The fact of the
continuation: matter is , over the next quarter century , if we are going to lead the world economy , we have to produce more extremely trained people than any other countries on the face of the earth , ' ' he said . " A century ago , there was a huge debate among economists whether economic progress depended on superior numbers of workers , or superior skills of workers , or whether it was going to be a combination of both .The answer today is that economic progress in a highly competitive climate is a combination of both . We ' ve got to do better at both , ' ' Mr . Clinton said .Among the other items on the President ' s agenda for the nation ' s schools is a proposal to funnel more support into math and scientific programs , meant to assist the nation compete with Japan and other industrialized countries . The President ' s " National Education Partnership ' ' will also focus on boosting federal - state
paraphrase:
Last week, President Clinton emphasized the importance of a "whole ethos" of lifelong learning during a series of events aimed at raising the profile of his education agenda. He stressed that over the next 25 years, the United States needs to produce more highly trained individuals than any other country in the world to maintain its economic competitiveness.
Clinton noted that there was a century-old debate among economists about whether economic progress depended on superior numbers of workers, superior skills, or a combination of both. Today, he said, the answer is that economic progress in a highly competitive environment requires a combination of both. The President highlighted his proposal to increase support for math and scientific programs to help the United States compete with Japan and other industrialized countries. Additionally, his "National Education Partnership" will focus on boosting federal-state support for education.

input: I was given this medicine by my doctor for several health issues I was having back in 2006, Sharapova said, specifying everything from the flu to magnesium deficiency, irregular EKG heart results, and warning signs of early diabetes
continuation: . I thinking I was doing the right thing , I thinking it was OK to take .Sharapova has publicly stood by her drug using since an anti - doping hearing declared her two - year ban in March , however shes been forced to retract her earlier remarks after Russias Anti - Doping Agency admitted shed been wrongly shown the medicine by her physician . Sharapova , 29 , issued a tearful apology to the tennis world for her use of the banned drug and publicly promised to make things right , but she failed to find the backing of the ITF , WTA , and IOC .Russian Tennis Federation President Alexander Medvedev also denounced the five - time Grand Slam winner . Medvedev described the drug trial as irresponsible , noting that it will be impossible for people to forgive Sharapova in Russia
paraphrase: In 2006, my doctor prescribed me a medicine for various health issues I was experiencing, including the flu, magnesium deficiency, irregular heart results, and warning signs of early diabetes. At the time, I thought I was doing the right thing by taking the medication, but it was later revealed that it was a banned drug. Sharapova has faced criticism for her use of the drug, including a two-year ban at an anti-doping hearing. Despite her apology and promise to make things right, she failed to gain support from tennis organizations such as the ITF, WTA, and IOC, as well as the Russian Tennis Federation President Alexander Medvedev. Medvedev called the drug trial "irresponsible" and stated that it will be difficult for people to forgive Sharapova in Russia.

input:
Following the Australian government citing a lack of separation of edge and core in 5G, Huawei has demonstrated what it says is full isolation of each network component in New Zealand on a trial network with Spark.
Huawei has revealed a 5G trial network
continuation: in New Zealand that the telco claims provides complete separation of its core and edge network , with no backhaul involved . The trial , undertaken with Spark , has been designed to mirror what it calls a real - world commercial network and is focused on providing core , edge , and enterprise systems .What youre looking at in the installation of the edge unit is the full spectrum of what is required for 5G , Spark CTO Brad Whitlock added . Youre able to connect out to the telco core .You have services being provided into that core network . Youve got what is effectively what we are calling overlay applications , or those services that require to be provided directly to the edge on the device to make sure it works with the core .The trial itself utilizes a transparent core network which offers SDN functionality at the core , and ran through to the edge and service nodes , which
paraphrase: Huawei has successfully demonstrated complete separation of its 5G network components in New Zealand, with no backhaul involved, according to the Australian government. The trial network, set up with Spark, mimics a real-world commercial network and allows for the testing of core, edge, and enterprise systems. According to Spark's CTO Brad Whitlock, the trial showcases the full scope of what is required for 5G, including the installation of edge units that provide direct connectivity to the core network. Services can be delivered directly to the edge of the network, and overlay applications, or services that require direct interaction with the core, can also be tested. The trial utilizes a transparent core network that offers SDN functionality at the core, edge, and service nodes.

Now that hes gone from office, Hollywood insiders reveal the Obama White House constantly asked for access to

AP I believe Obama was the greatest supporter of the arts and culture in our history , said Ruth Carter , who created the costumes for Selma . The Obamas loved to be on the film circuit , added a high - level studio source , noting that several studio chiefs would actually inform what screenings Obama might want to attend .And Obamas squad , not Hollywood , played hardball to shield their guests at one such screening , Gravity , which the president watched . The $ 250 million space thriller became the first film
paraphrase:
It is highly likely that the Obama family will be tuning in to the Academy Awards ceremony on February 26, given their avid interest in movies. According to Hollywood insiders, the Obama administration consistently sought access to exclusive film screenings and actively worked to block access to reviews and foreign press coverage. The President, First Lady Michelle Obama, and their daughter Malia have even graced the red carpet for high-profile events, including the finale of Selma at the White House.
Renowned costume designer Ruth Carter, who worked on Selma, praises President Obama as a steadfast supporter of arts and culture, noting that he was instrumental in fostering a love for cinema within the White House. Several studio executives corroborate this sentiment, revealing that Obama was known to actively seek out and enjoy film screenings. In fact, Obama's inner circle was so passionate about shielding their guests from advanced screenings that they reportedly played hardball to ensure their privacy was maintained, even for blockbuster hits like Gravity. Despite the glamour and glitz surrounding the film industry, the Obamas remained firmly grounded in their love for the art form.

input: Processor IP vendor ARM made the case yesterday afternoon that its processor IP is finding its way into more and more mobile devices. Certainly ARM based devicesincluding processors from companies such as Apple, Marvell, MediaTek, Nvidia, Qualcomm, Samsung
continuation: , ST - Ericsson , Texas Instruments , TI - Mobile , and many otherscontinue to be hot goods in the smartphone and tablet markets . ARM even predicted that the number of mobile phones used its processors will probably jump over the last five decade .And yet in its earnings call yesterday , the company mentioned that smartphones that do not use ARM processors have been gaining in market share . While ARM pointed out that its often tough to guess which phones are using its processors , the company mentioned computers use Intel chips from Nokia , Acer , and Alcatel - Lucent .ARMs prior forecast for mobile phones remained relatively consistent for the quarter ending in September 2011 . The manufacturer forecast that smartphone sales would hit 470 million units during the calendar decade of 2011 , with tablet sales
paraphrase: ARM, a leading processor IP vendor, recently emphasized the widespread adoption of its technology in mobile devices. According to the company, various ARM-based processors from prominent brands such as Apple, Marvell, MediaTek, Nvidia, Qualcomm, Samsung, ST-Ericsson, Texas Instruments, and TI-Mobile continue to be in high demand in the smartphone and tablet markets. In fact, ARM anticipates that the number of mobile devices using its processors will likely see a significant increase over the next five decades. However, during its earnings call, the company also acknowledged that non-ARM processor-based smartphones are gaining market share. Despite this, ARM noted that it's challenging to determine which phones use its processors, while mentioning that Intel chips are used in computers from Nokia, Acer, and Alcatel-Lucent. ARM's previous forecast for mobile phones remained relatively consistent for the quarter ending in September 2011, with projected smartphone sales of 470 million units during the calendar decade of 2011, along with tablet sales.

input:
Nigeria remains deeply divided over a ban imposed last month on television stations showing so-called "miracles".
Programmes showing miracles have disappeared from screens in compliance with an edict from the Nigeria's National Broadcasting Commission, which took effect from
continuation: 1 May . The ban was imposed after the evangelical churches , which have a broad following in Nigeria , said they had saw a spate of fake miracles on TV , and lodged a complaint with the broadcasting watchdog .All of Nigeria ' s state - operated TV networks have declined to carry the controversial shows . Some of the miracles , including healing by the laying on of fingers , feature the priest ' s ask on church members to touch or even hugged the hand of the preacher as he prays .A retired evangelist , Dr Okonofua , denounced the ban , said that if anyone could fake a miracle , it was not the church . " I am an evangelist , and I am not embarrassed to say this is not a miracle .What you are doing is not what I do," he said."But if you are a spiritual person
paraphrase:
Nigeria remains deeply divided over a recent decision to restrict television broadcasts of alleged "miracles".
In compliance with a recent edict from the National Broadcasting Commission of Nigeria, many television programs featuring miracles have been removed from screens, effective May 1st. This decision was made in response to complaints filed by Nigeria's evangelical churches, who have a significant following in the country, regarding the authenticity of some miracles being broadcast on TV. All state-owned TV networks in Nigeria have chosen not to air these controversial shows. Some of the miracles being shown include healings that involve the laying on of hands, where church members are asked to touch or hug the hand of the preacher as he prays.
A retired evangelist, Dr. Okonofua, has spoken out against the ban, stating that anyone can fake a miracle, but he himself is not embarrassed to say that he does not perform miracles. "I am an evangelist, and I am not ashamed to say this is not a miracle. What you are doing is not what I do," he said. However, he acknowledges that there are those who are spiritual and may be moved by these broadcasts.

An Illinois man who purchased a handgun and more than 100 rounds of ammunition in Marion, Iowa, was sentenced to more than three years in prison yesterday in federal court in Cedar Rapids.
Montarrance Wilson, age 27, from Chicago, Illinois,
continuation: was sentenced after a November 15 , 2018 , guilty plea to one count of unlawful receipt of a weapons , United States Attorney Kevin W . Techau announced . Wilson was in possession of a handgun and more than 100 shots of cartridges at the time he acquired the gun and ammunition on November 2 , 2017 , at the Iowa River Firearms Range located at 2616 South 1st Avenue in Marion , Iowa .Wilson was later convicted of unlawful possession of a firearm in Cook County , Illinois . Wilson was prohibited from possessing guns under federal law as a convicted felon .Wilson was sentenced to 40 months imprisonment , to be followed by two years of supervised release . Wilson was ordered to pay a $ 5
paraphrase: A man from Illinois, who purchased a handgun and over 100 rounds of ammunition in Marion, Iowa, was sentenced to over three years in federal prison yesterday. Montarrance Wilson, 27, from Chicago, pleaded guilty on November 15, 2018, to unlawfully receiving a weapon. According to United States Attorney Kevin W. Techau, Wilson was found to be in possession of a handgun and over 100 rounds of ammunition on November 2, 2017, at a firearms range in Marion. Wilson was convicted of unlawful possession of a firearm in Cook County, Illinois, and was prohibited from possessing guns under federal law as a convicted felon. Wilson was sentenced to 40 months in prison, followed by two years of supervised release, and was ordered to pay a $5,000 fine.

input:
Education or Indoctrination in Texas?
The news from the nation's most influential state board of education is another reminder of the difficulty of creating a curriculum that passes muster with all stakeholders. In early March, the Texas board released its social studies standards
continuation: , which , according to some critics , are too politicized and too focused on the Bible . The revision cycle has been dramatic .It began in June 2010 , when the board elected two new members who , it soon became clear , sought to reshape the standards . One of them , Don McLeroy , is a proponent of " intelligent creation " and a long - time opposition of teaching evolution .Under McLeroy ' s leadership , the board demanded a review of the new criteria and hired two businesses to revise them . The work of the two contracted firms , the History and Social Studies Continuum Committee and the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills Continuum Committee , takes nearly two years and resulted in new criteria that were more inclusive , according to the head of the social studies committee , Charles Cunningham .But McLeroy still wasn ' t satisfied
paraphrase: In the Lone Star State, the debate surrounding education has taken center stage once again. The Texas State Board of Education has faced criticism for its revised social studies standards, with some arguing that they are too politicized and focused on religious ideologies. The revision process has been a long and contentious one, dating back to June 2010 when two new board members were elected with differing opinions on the subject matter. Don McLeroy, a vocal proponent of "intelligent creation" and evolution critic, was instrumental in demanding a review of the new standards. The board later hired two businesses to revise the criteria, which took nearly two years to complete. While the head of the social studies committee, Charles Cunningham, claims the new standards are more inclusive, McLeroy remains unsatisfied with the outcome.

input:
Should it be business as usual and a comfortable position of passivity, or should it answer, with action, the Palestinian call for solidarity and support?
At their base, these are the questions fuelling recent debates about the department of international relations'
continuation: ( IR ) failure to host a talk or a debate at Nelson Mandela University ( NMU ) about the Palestinian conflict . NMU students voted to support the call for a boycott , divestment and sanctions campaign in Israel .The two sides will reconvene at 1pm on 29 September to consider the part NMU plays in the context of the South African political , social and economic context , and the action proposal to drive the college to execute the boycott , divestment and sanctions ( BDS ) campaign . The South African Federation of Trade Unions ( Saftu ) and the Palestine Solidarity Alliance ( PSA ) are working in the background with NMU ' s student committee to ensure a successful meeting on campus .However, Mpumelelo Mhlongo, NMU's spokesperson, said it has become clear there are people who want
paraphrase: It is a matter of great significance whether the institution of international relations (IR) should adopt a stance of inactivity or take proactive action in response to the Palestinian call for solidarity and support. The source of the recent debate at Nelson Mandela University (NMU) revolves around the IR department's failure to host a talk or debate on the contentious issue. NMU students have voted in favor of endorsing the boycott, divestment, and sanctions (BDS) campaign against Israel, which has sparked heated discussions on campus. The two sides will reconvene at 1 pm on September 29 to reassess the role of NMU in the broader South African political, social, and economic context, as well as the proposed action plan to execute the BDS campaign. Behind the scenes, the South African Federation of Trade Unions (Saftu) and the Palestine Solidarity Alliance (PSA) are collaborating with NMU's student committee to ensure a successful meeting on campus. However, Mpumelelo Mhlongo, NMU's spokesperson, has observed that there are individuals who object to the university's stance on the issue.

input:
A certain politician recently lost their very high-profile, very powerful job. While this was not a surprise to other people, they say it was a surprise to them.
They also say that what happened was unfair and uncalled for.
Despite
continuation: the fact that this very powerful politician once claimed to be their personal friend , they won ' t comment on the situation because " it ' s just not my place . " Matthew Blaskovich , via email Mine , yours , theirs , ours , what ' s the difference ?Our case studies might have to be shrunk to postage stamp - sized if the drama involved were our own . " I knew I ' d feel better after some time , but I feel worse about me and my own life , " asks Kevin .But rather of accepting these feelings , we like to relinquish them and lay them at somebody else ' s doorstep . Whose though ?It hardly matters , but this serves as a handy way of buying ourselves time in which to sulk . " I was in despair and I feel so bad that I realized my own life didn ' t matter as much as it did , " continues Kevin .Except, of course
paraphrase:
A prominent figure recently faced a significant career setback. Although it was anticipated by others, they expressed surprise at the turn of events.
They have deemed the situation unfair and unjustified. Despite their previous claim to be on cordial terms with the individual, they refused to comment on the matter, citing a lack of relevance. Matthew Blaskovich, via email, mused about the difference between "mine," "yours," "theirs," and "ours," in the context of the unfolding drama.
Kevin expressed reservations about how the situation was affecting his mental state, feeling worse about himself and his life in general. Rather than confronting these feelings, he preferred to shift the focus onto someone else, granting himself time to indulge in self-pity.
In a candid admission, Kevin shared his feelings of despondency, realizing that his life had taken a backseat to the tumultuous events. However, he soon reiterated his stance, emphasizing that the situation was not his concern.

input: The race for the Republican and Democratic nominations for president continue this week, as candidates face a crucial election in Michigan. Following the water crisis in Flint and Detroits bankruptcy, voters could be looking for a non-establishment candidate  which would be
continuation: a nod towards Bernie Sanders or Donald Trump . Challenges to Michigander Republican Donald Trump have come in the form of entrepreneur Mitt Romney , retired neurosurgeon Ben Carson , and former Florida Gov .Jeb Bush.Former Florida Gov.Jeb Bush , and Louisiana Gov . Bobby Jindal are two candidates who have suspended their campaigns , and were initially think to pose a danger to Trump .On the Democratic side , the race has saw former U . S . Secretary of State Hillary Clintons lead , although voters are also looking at U . S . Sen . Bernie Sanders ( I - Vt . ) , ex Maryland Gov . Martin OMalley , and current Rhode Island Gov .Lincoln Chafee , who have suspended their campaigns . Clinton and Sanders are campaigning for voting in Michigan and have both previously won there , and Sand
paraphrase: The political race for the Republican and Democratic nominations for president heats up this week, as candidates battle it out in Michigan. Voters may be looking for an alternative candidate, possibly leaning towards Bernie Sanders or Donald Trump, following the Flint water crisis and Detroit's bankruptcy. Trump faces challenges from entrepreneur Mitt Romney, retired neurosurgeon Ben Carson, and former Florida Governor Jeb Bush. Former Florida Governor Jeb Bush and Louisiana Governor Bobby Jindal have suspended their campaigns, initially seen as potential threats to Trump. On the Democratic side, Hillary Clinton maintains her lead, but voters are also considering U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.), former Maryland Governor Martin O'Malley, and current Rhode Island Governor Lincoln Chafee, who have suspended their campaigns. Clinton and Sanders campaign in Michigan and have both previously won there, with Sanders highlighting his progressive platform.

input: Senior quarterback Calvin Brownholtz threw two touchdown passes and Isaiah Rutherford and Jason Gallagher each rushed for scores in a game that drew a large crowd to Hanson McClain Advisors Stadium despite the 4:45 p.m. kickoff. Jesuits
continuation: leading receiver , Connor Wist , caught a 61 - yard touchdown pass , while Lane Johnson had five catches for 102 yards . Brady Schafer had eight tackles and the defensive touchdown , and was selected MVP of the game .The St . Edward win was the second in three tries over the defending state champions . The Irish also defeated De La Salle 20 - 17 in Week 10 previous year .It was quite amazing , Jesuit coach Matt Nock stated . Its one thing to going over there and winning .Its another to come over there and get the win in front of a packed house . I believe our men expected to getting beat , but they wanted to come in and making a statement .They wanted to prove that the NFL network piece [ on Jesuit ] didnt going to their heads . They
paraphrase: Calvin Brownholtz, the seasoned quarterback of Jesuit, threw two scoring passes and rushed for two more touchdowns in a thrilling game at Hanson McClain Advisors Stadium. The game drew a large crowd despite the 4:45 p.m. kickoff. Wide receiver Connor Wist hauled in a 61-yard touchdown pass, while Lane Johnson had five receptions for 102 yards. Brady Schafer made eight tackles, including one for a touchdown, and was named MVP of the game. This victory was the second in three attempts over the defending state champions for Jesuit, who also defeated De La Salle 20-17 in Week 10 of last year. According to coach Matt Nock, "It's one thing to go out there and win, but it's another to come in and get the win in front of a packed house. Our men expected to be beat, but they wanted to make a statement and prove that the NFL network piece on Jesuit didn't go to their heads."

input: Just when you think AMC has reached maximum saturation of zombie programming, they announce there will be another Walking Dead spin-off  this time set on a plane. Yes, thats right, Zombies on a Plane (there has been no confirmation
continuation: on what the official title is yet ) . The Zombies on a Plane episode will air as part of an epic three - hour event , comprised of both of the season sevens finales for The Walking Dead and Fear the Walking Dead .This special will air Sunday , October 15 at 8pm on AMC . In terms of plot , it will probably follow the dead coming back to life on a plane , much like what was seen in the trailer for season seven of The Walking Dead .There have been numerous attempts to bring the Walking Dead series to a new platform . The biggest was the multiplayer video title that debuted this past November for Xbox One , Playstation 4 and PC .That title was so poorly received that it got an F from reviewers and gamers . The game is also in development for the Nintendo Switch , but there is no word on when it will launch
paraphrase: AMC has surprised fans by announcing a new Walking Dead spin-off set on a plane. The latest installment, whose official title has yet to be confirmed, will be part of a three-hour event featuring the season finale of both The Walking Dead and Fear the Walking Dead. The special episode will air on October 15 at 8pm on AMC. Fans can expect to see the undead rising on a plane, similar to the trailer for season seven of The Walking Dead. There have been numerous attempts to expand the Walking Dead franchise onto new platforms, including a poorly received multiplayer video game that launched last November for Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and PC. While there is no word on when the game will be available on Nintendo Switch, it's clear that AMC is committed to pushing the Walking Dead brand further.

input:
John Carney found out the hard way that the internet is just like the Hunger Games.
The Breitbart finance and economics editor was incredibly disturbed by the cover of Vogues September issue, which features actress Jennifer Lawrence posing on a boat in front
continuation: of a huge cross . His fury began a couple of days earlier , after which he went on a Facebook rant against liberal , left - wing Christianity and directed his ire towards Democratic congresswoman Debbie Wasserman Schultz , the chairwoman of the Democratic National Committee .( Schultz has been the target of a far - right smear campaign about her being a paid , pro - Israel Jew . ) Democratic National Chairwoman Debbie Wasserman Schultz is trying to make her party fewer religious by supporting atheists and waging war on Christian beliefs , Carney wrote .This is a basic aspect of liberal , left - wing Christianity . He continued , So wheres the anger ?Wheres the ridicule?Wheres the mockery?Wheres the hatred ? I see hate - filled conspiracy
paraphrase: John Carney discovered that the internet shares similarities with the Hunger Games, much to his dismay. His initial frustration began a couple of days prior, after he came across the cover of Vogue's September issue, featuring actress Jennifer Lawrence posing on a boat in front of a massive cross. This sparked a heated Facebook rant against liberal and left-wing Christianity, with a particular focus on Democratic National Committee Chairwoman Debbie Wasserman Schultz. Carney accused her of attempting to make the Democratic Party less religious by supporting atheists and waging war on Christian beliefs. He questioned why there was a lack of anger, ridicule, and mockery towards Wasserman Schultz and her supposed agenda.

input: World Sake Day or "Nihonshu no Hi" is a significant day on the Japanese calendar with celebrations held annually on 1 October. This date is considered "New Year's Day" for sake because it marks the first day of the sake
continuation: - making season . As is the case with many holidays , there are a number of legendary and historical events linked with the origin of this vacation , the most significant one being associated with the founding of the Kuroda - style Gekkeikan sake brewery in 1637 .This tale is depicted on a sign at the brewery today and can be viewed in the image above . Although the beginnings of the festival are murky , one major element that can be attributed to Nihonshu no Hi is the appreciation of the alleged advantages of a small amount of alcohol , particularly sake , to one ' s health .The holiday evolved at a time when Western ideas about Japan ' s drank traditions began to enter the mainstream of Japanese thinking . A website promoting the holiday ( and a number of others such as Umeshu No Hi - Plum Wine Day ) suggests the following method
paraphrase: On October 1st, Japan celebrates World Sake Day, also known as "Nihonshu no Hi." This day marks the beginning of the sake-making season and is considered the new year for sake. The origins of the festival are shrouded in legend and history, with one significant event being the founding of the Kuroda-style Gekkeikan sake brewery in 1637. According to a sign at the brewery, the tale of the brewery's founding is depicted in the accompanying image. Although the origins of the festival are unclear, one aspect that can be attributed to Nihonshu no Hi is the appreciation of the potential health benefits of moderate alcohol consumption, particularly sake. As Western ideas about Japan's drinking culture began to gain popularity, the holiday evolved to promote the enjoyment of sake and other traditional Japanese beverages in moderation. A website promoting the holiday and others like it, such as Umeshu No Hi (Plum Wine Day), suggests enjoying a small amount of sake or other drinks for health benefits.

input: James Jeans illustrations of fairylike deities garnered him a cult following, with comic book fanboys at one end of the spectrum and high-end designer Miuccia Prada at the other. Four years ago, Prada tapped Jean,
continuation: along with Nicolas Ghesquiere and a host of fashion illustrations other bigwigs , to create its art book , Miu Miu : Imaginary Places , a departure for the clothing brand whose focusing , until then , had been on outfits rather than artists . The 300 - page books futuristic surrealism was a perfect fit with Pradas marketing : a slew of young , fashion - forward ladies liked to wore the outfits , but also wanted a little of that Prada magic in their home .The appeal is two - fold . Firstly , Jeans drawings speak of gods who might or may not have lived on Earth , but definitely living somewhere else .Theyre strange , haunting and otherworldly ; its this sort of creativity that resonates with Prada , which tapped modern artists like Lindsay Lohans
paraphrase: James Jean's fantastical depictions of mythical deities captivated a diverse range of admirers, from comic book enthusiasts at one end to high-end designer Miuccia Prada at the other. Four years ago, Prada collaborated with Jean, along with other renowned fashion illustrators, to create an art book titled Miu Miu: Imaginary Places. This creative venture marked a departure for the clothing brand, which until then had focused primarily on clothing designs rather than artist collaborations. The 300-page book's futuristic and surreal themes aligned perfectly with Prada's marketing strategy, which targeted young, fashion-forward individuals who desired both functional clothing and artistic expression in their homes. The appeal of Jean's work lies in its otherworldly quality, with drawings that suggest the possibility of deities inhabiting realms beyond Earth. These creations resonated deeply with Prada, who sought to incorporate modern artists' unique visions, such as Lindsay Lohan's, into their brand.

input:
A 22-year-old man was killed in a shooting at Opry Mills, which caused chaos for shoppers inside.
First responders initially answered a call of an active shooter in the mall, which prompted a heavy police presence, but they learned the
continuation: victim was shooting at an area between the store and the Opry Country Music Hall . Nashville officers stated on Twitter the shooter had been arrested , and the investigation was continuing .Nashville Mayor Megan Barry spoke with the suspect on scene after he was taken into custody , WZTV - TV reported . " We ' re not always prepared to deal with a suspect that ' s armed with a long rifle , and that ' s what we have , " Nashville Police Chief Steve Anderson informed journalists ." I just seen the shots and I see two men run across the street , but there ' s still no sense of what ' s happening , " explained Linda Prince , a shopper . " Everybody is running out , you just can ' t believe this is happening in the mall . "A SWAT crew was on the scene , and a mobile control center was set up . "
paraphrase: A young man of 22 was tragically killed in a shooting at Opry Mills, leaving chaos among shoppers. Law enforcement officials initially responded to a report of an active shooter in the mall, leading to a heavy police presence. However, they later discovered that the victim was shot near the area between a store and Opry Country Music Hall. The suspect was arrested by Nashville officers and the investigation is ongoing. Nashville Mayor Megan Barry spoke with the suspect on scene after he was taken into custody, according to WZTV-TV. "We're not always prepared to handle a suspect armed with a long rifle, and that's what we're dealing with," Nashville Police Chief Steve Anderson told reporters. "I just saw the shots and I saw two men run across the street, but there's still no sense of what's happening," said Linda Prince, a shopper. "Everybody is running out, you just can't believe this is happening in the mall." A SWAT team was present on the scene, and a mobile command center was set up.

input:
The seven-day plan for getting your home and yard ready for summer.
On the HouseMitch KuffaGuest columnist FHA and private home housing inspector and licensed builder Mitchell Kuffa, of St. Clair, Wednesday April 14,
continuation: 2004 . I getting asked a lot of questions about everything related to homes , and one of the most commonly asked is , " How do I make my home ready for the come summer ? "That is a question that requires to be asked and replied . We can all recall the dog days of the summer , when things were at their hottest , and the most humid , and you were hot , and tired , and going bonkers .What can we do to avoid this ? There are many things that we can do to enjoy the summer , and to minimize the headaches that the summer can cause .Here are a few proposals . No .1 : Make sure your plumbing is in good order , and check your water heater for appropriate operation . A good tip is to put a small water in the water heater and turn it on .You should getting a decent hiss of water going out of the spout
paraphrase:
Here is a paraphrased version of the input passage:
To ensure your home and yard are ready for the warm weather of summer, follow this seven-day plan. On day one, inspect and repair any plumbing issues to avoid any leaks or bursts that may cause damage or discomfort during the hot summer months. Additionally, check your water heater to ensure it's functioning properly and test it by running a small amount of water through it.
On day two, focus on decluttering and organizing your home to keep it cool and comfortable during the summer. This includes cleaning out any unnecessary items and arranging furniture in a way that promotes airflow.
On day three, pay attention to your home's exterior. Trim any overgrown shrubs and trees, and power wash your deck or patio to remove any dirt or debris that may accumulate during the winter months.
On day four, turn your attention to your home's interior. Use a dehumidifier to remove excess moisture from the air, which can help prevent mold and mildew growth. Additionally, consider using window treatments such as blinds or curtains to keep your home cooler by blocking out the sun's rays.
On day five, focus on your home's roof. Check for any damaged or missing shingles, and replace them as needed to prevent water damage or leaks. Also, inspect your gutters and downspouts to ensure they're clear of debris and functioning properly.
On day six, take care of any outdoor projects that may be necessary to prepare your yard for the summer. This includes mowing the lawn, trimming any overgrown trees or shrubs, and adding any necessary landscaping features such as mulch or plants.
On day seven, take some time to relax and enjoy the fruits of your labor. With your home and yard in tip-top shape, you can now enjoy the warm weather without worrying about any unexpected issues.
By following this seven-day plan, you can ensure that your home and yard are ready for the summer months and provide you with a comfortable and enjoyable place to live.

input:

NAGPUR: Former Indian skipper and national women's team coach
continuation: Divya Singh is impressed with the talent exhibited by nation ' s top 18 women prospects still receiving training at the basketball development program . I have experienced tremendous talent here at the camp . They should be provided with the best facilities and infrastructure to hone their talent .All the best athletes in the camp can come on to represent the nation at the international level and it will be the duty of the federation to back these athletes , which I pray they would , " Divya explained . " The camps should be more intense and the training should be on yearly basis to getting the best results .More camps must to be organized in this way . We can ' t rely on a
paraphrase: Former Indian skipper and national women's team coach, Divya Singh, is impressed with the exceptional talent displayed by the country's top 18 women prospects currently enrolled in the basketball development program. Singh believes these young athletes have the potential to represent the nation at the international level and emphasizes the need for the federation to provide them with the best facilities and infrastructure to hone their skills. Singh also suggests that the camps should be more intensive and frequent to achieve the best results.

input:
The best boys high school basketball players in the San Angelo area are honored on our annual All-West Texas Basketball Team.
Morrow was named to the TABC all-state Class 1A team after helping Irion County reach the regional final for
continuation: the second consecutive year . The sophomore guard averaged 17 points , 6 rebounds and 2 assists per game , leading the Bulldogs to an 18 - 11 record .Morrow had 33 points in a district game against Eldorado . He ' s the son of Darren and Julie Morrow .Morrow , an 11th - grader , will play for Sonny Smith at Shamrock High School next season . Carlile was a four - year varsity letterman for Andrews High School .He was selected to the Class 3A All - State first team after leading the Mustangs to a district title and a 31 - 5 record . Carlile , a senior , averaged 15 . 5 points , 5 . 5 rebounds and 3 . 3 assists per game .He was selected to the Super Five first team by the Texas Association
paraphrase:
The most exceptional high school boys basketball players in the San Angelo region are celebrated on our annual All-West Texas Basketball Team.
Morrow, a talented sophomore guard from Irion County, was chosen for the TABC all-state Class 1A team after leading his team to the regional final for the second consecutive year. Morrow had an impressive average of 17 points, 6 rebounds, and 2 assists per game, earning him a spot on the All-West Texas Team. In a standout district game against Eldorado, Morrow scored 33 points, showcasing his incredible skill. He is the son of Darren and Julie Morrow and will play for Shamrock High School next season under coach Sonny Smith.
Carlile, a four-year varsity letterman from Andrews High School, was selected to the Class 3A All-State first team after leading his team to a district title and an impressive 31-5 record. Carlile averaged 15.5 points, 5.5 rebounds, and 3.3 assists per game, making him a force to be reckoned with on the court. He was also chosen to the Super Five first team by the Texas Association of Basketball Coaches, solidifying his position as one of the top players in the region.

input:
Australia's entertainment industry was in mourning today for former Crowded House drummer Paul Hester who hanged himself in a Melbourne park.
The 46-year-old father-of-two was found dead at Elsternwick Park in Brighton on Saturday
continuation: morning . A post - mortem will be performed today to identify the cause of death but police sources say there were no suspicious conditions .Mr Hester had battled depression for decades and was in a number of therapy facilities in the previous few years . His bandmates were among those who displayed shock and grief on Monday .We are all astonished and shocked by this tragedy , Neil Finn said in a statement . It is a tragedy not just for those who knew Paul but for all who loved him .Paul had battled depression but he had given up drinking and was beginning to live a calmer more settled existence . AAP confirmed that former Prime Minister Julia Gillard said she talked to Mr Hester and his wife Kristy Saggers last month , after Hester was involved in a bicycle crash that caused him with major head injuries .
paraphrase: The Australian entertainment industry is mourning the loss of former Crowded House drummer Paul Hester, who was found dead in a Melbourne park on Saturday morning. He was 46 years old and leaves behind two children. While the cause of death is still to be confirmed through a post-mortem examination, police sources indicate that there were no suspicious circumstances. Hester had been struggling with depression for many years and had received treatment in several facilities in recent years. His bandmates are in shock and grieving, with Neil Finn saying in a statement that "it is a tragedy not just for those who knew Paul, but for all who loved him." Despite his struggles with depression, Hester had been making progress in his recovery, having given up drinking and starting to lead a more peaceful and stable life. According to AAP, former Prime Minister Julia Gillard revealed that she spoke to Hester and his wife Kristy Saggers just last month, after he was involved in a serious bicycle accident that left him with head injuries.

input:
A MULTI-MILLION pound treatment centre which aims to slash waiting times for patients at Leighton Hospital has moved closer.
Health chiefs at the South Cheshire hospital cut the first sod to mark the start of building at the site of
continuation: the former Radcliffe School , in the village of Moulton . Now the area is known as the Medicahealth Campus , and is next to a major housing project at Willaston .Cheshire primary care trust director executive Simon Stollery cutting the first sod on the latest phase of the development . The multi - million pound flagship is on the same site as the new St Luke ' s Unit for elective medicine and the John Peel Centre for therapy .When it opens in April 2007 the facility will provide patients with fast and easy access to a range of services , notably recovery and physiotherapy . The 22 , 000 square foot purpose built centre will provide services to around 20 , 000 patients each week and will be sited next to the Dial - a - Ride bus stop and dedicated patients ' car park .Ch
paraphrase: A new state-of-the-art healthcare facility is set to take shape in Leighton Hospital, aimed at significantly reducing waiting times for patients. Health officials at South Cheshire Hospital marked the commencement of construction at the former Radcliffe School site in Moulton, now known as the Medicahealth Campus. The multimillion-pound project is located adjacent to a major housing development in Willaston. The director of primary care trust, Simon Stollery, ceremoniously cut the first sod to initiate the latest phase of the project. The flagship facility, slated to open in April 2007, will provide patients with swift and seamless access to a variety of services, including recovery and physiotherapy. The 22,000 square foot purpose-built center will serve approximately 20,000 patients every week and will be situated near a Dial-a-Ride bus stop and a designated patient parking area.

input:
Candidate Master Bob Mugana inspired KCB Bank Chess Club to four wins in Mombasa helping his club go top of the 2019 Kenya Premier Chess League.
The bankers won 5-0 against Stima Chess Club, Strathmore University,
continuation: UniSport , University of Nairobi and Nairobi Water FC all in the same day to open a one point lead over the chasing pack in the 2018 - 19 Kenya Premier Chess League . The best player in the division will win Sh50 , 000 at the end of the 2018 - 19 season .Meanwhile , ex Kenya international Kiran Kumar Karthikeyan improved his record to 7 / 7 with a 3 . 5 / 4 performance helping Kenya Breweries upset Kenya Police 4 - 1 . It was the same sc
paraphrase:
Candidate Master Bob Mugana ignited KCB Bank Chess Club's winning streak in Mombasa, propelling his team to the top of the 2019 Kenya Premier Chess League with four consecutive victories.
The bankers convincingly defeated Stima Chess Club, Strathmore University, UniSport, and Nairobi Water FC in the same day, catapulting them into first place in the league standings. Mugana's exceptional form contributed significantly to the team's success, as he emerged as the highest scorer with 4/4 and received a prize of Sh10,000. The best player in the division will receive Sh50,000 at the end of the 2018-19 season. Meanwhile, ex-Kenya international Kiran Kumar Karthikeyan elevated his record to 7/7 with a impressive 3.5/4 performance, leading Kenya Breweries to an upset victory over Kenya Police with a score of 4-1.

input:
Marriott hotel in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Photo: Marriott.com.
Forget about a struggling economy and other issues: Marriott International still plans to increase its number of locations in Brazil nearly threefold by 2018. A few years ago, Brazil
continuation: seemed to be the destination of choice for foreign hotel businesses ; however , the countrys economy has been stuck in a slump since 2013 . To date , Marriott has 60 hotels and more than 16 , 000 rooms in Brazil and plans to double its footprint by 2018 , by added 50 hotels and 10 , 000 rooms to its current portfolio .We are strengthening our presence in the upper - upscale and luxury segments , says Toni Stoeckl , president and CEO of Marriotts Latin American area . This section has exhibited good growth in Brazil and our findings from the flagship hotels have been quite excellent , particularly in Rio .The brand is building two luxury hotels in Rio de Janeiro and a dual - branded property in Sao Paulo . These hotels are part
paraphrase: Marriott International intends to almost triple its number of locations in Brazil by 2018, despite economic challenges and other issues. The company currently has 60 hotels and over 16,000 rooms in Brazil and plans to double its footprint by 2018 through the addition of 50 hotels and 10,000 rooms to its current portfolio. Marriott is focusing on expanding its presence in the upscale and luxury segments, according to Toni Stoeckl, President and CEO of Marriott's Latin American area. The brand is also investing in new luxury hotels in Rio de Janeiro and a dual-branded property in Sao Paulo. These hotels are expected to perform well, particularly in Rio, where Marriott is building two luxury hotels.

input:
Hillary Rodham Clinton has chosen a Brooklyn Heights office building as the headquarters for her all-but-declared presidential campaign, according to several reports.
The former first lady, U.S. senator and secretary of state is renting space at One Pier
continuation: repont Plaza , just blocks from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade and the Montague Street Stop on the F and G trains . The rental was made through DeSilva & Phillips , a leading New York City business real property brokerage .This is the first real property decision by the Clinton campaign since it is all but sure that she will race for president in 2016 , Andrew DeSilva says , according to Crains New York . She is not run for re - election to the Senate but instead she is uses her small office at the One United Nations Plaza on First Avenue to run a distinct campaign committee , she is generating finance and running a payroll for supporters .Ms . Clintons Brooklyn Heights office is a space shared with DeSilva & Phillips , a brokerage business with abundant skills in office space leasing and sales
paraphrase: Hillary Clinton has reportedly chosen a Brooklyn Heights office building as the base of her anticipated 2016 presidential campaign. According to sources, the former First Lady, Senator, and Secretary of State has rented space at One Pierrepont Plaza, located near the Brooklyn Heights Promenade and a nearby subway stop. This marks the first real estate decision made by the Clinton campaign since it is widely expected that she will run for president next year. The rental was facilitated through DeSilva & Phillips, a leading New York City business real estate brokerage. Clinton is currently using her small office at One United Nations Plaza on First Avenue to manage a separate campaign committee, where she is focusing on fundraising and payroll management for supporters. The Brooklyn Heights office she has rented is shared with DeSilva & Phillips, a company with extensive expertise in office space leasing and sales.

input: You remember the tragic story about the murder of Chauncey Bailey, the editor of a weekly newspaper in Oakland, Calif., killed on Aug. 2 as he was walking to work. Police quickly made arrests following the slaying, which they think was
continuation: motivated by what the victims were writing and publishing about Your Black Muslim Bakery , whose leader is Yusuf Bey IV , the son of the bakery ' s longtime founder . Bey IV has been in jail since his arrest .At a Friday preliminary hearing , Judge William I . Henderson bound over his two alleged accomplices for trial . The first was Devaughndre Broussard , 21 , whose court appearance came just a day after his 20th birthday , on Sept . 19 .The second was Antoine Mackey , 32 , who is in a mental hospital . The court made what , to me , was a very astute observation about the atrocities and other crimes of Bey IV and his associates : " There was no point in killing Mr . Bailey , there was no way they were going to getting away with murder , " explained Judge William I .
paraphrase: The tragic story of Chauncey Bailey's murder in Oakland, California, still lingers in memory. In August 2007, Bailey, the editor of a local newspaper, was brutally killed while walking to work. The police quickly apprehended suspects and believe the murder was motivated by the newspaper's reporting on Your Black Muslim Bakery, led by Yusuf Bey IV, the son of the bakery's longtime founder. Bey IV has been in custody since his arrest. At a recent preliminary hearing, Judge William I. Henderson bound over Bey's two alleged accomplices for trial. The first accused, Devaughndre Broussard, turned 21 just a day before his court appearance on September 19. The second accused, Antoine Mackey, is currently in a mental hospital. The court astutely observed that there was no point in killing Bailey, as they would have been unable to get away with murder.

input:
Friends and supporters of a Tamil family, who are facing deportation, have marched through the rain to Peter Dutton's Brisbane office.
Singing The Seekers hit I am, you are, we are Australian, the protesters first rallied at a crowd
continuation: of 500 people on the lawn of Dutton ' s office . Then they marched on Dutton ' s office in nearby Albert Street .They then staged a sitting - in outside the building . Supporters say the parents facing deportation because the husbands are refugees and the women married them before a change in the law in 2006 .Sources within Immigration Department say that while 48 , 000 other people would not be deported , it is not certain what happens to the 10 , 000 persons who face deportation because they breaks the rules of the previous regime .
paraphrase: A group of supporters and friends of a Tamil family, who are at risk of deportation, braved the rain to march to Peter Dutton's office in Brisbane. They began their protest with a rally of around 500 people on the lawn outside Dutton's office, then marched to the nearby Albert Street building. The group then staged a sit-in outside the building, with supporters highlighting that the parents facing deportation are refugees and married their Australian partners before a law change in 2006. According to sources within the Immigration Department, while around 48,000 people would not be deported, the fate of the 10,000 individuals who broke rules under the previous regime is uncertain.

input:
An organization representing Cardinal Mooney High School minority graduates is calling a classroom lesson purportedly aimed at recreating the experience of slavery, deeply troubling.
The Cardinal Mooney High School Minority Alumni Council has issued a statement saying that a Black History lesson subject
continuation: ed applicants to alleged bullying , misrepresented Black culture , and put pupils in physical risks . The lesson , the Alumni Council says , consisted of students pretending to be slaves , white overseers , and immigrants from the Irish and Italian diaspora ." The lesson also involved the teacher told the pupils that they had to lying on the floor if a slave master asked them to and had to remain there until he allowed them to get up , " the Council wrote . " The teacher did not told the pupils how long they had to lying on the floor , the kids stayed down until she telling them to get up .The majority of the kids had been down for at least 30 moments , until one of the African American pupils complained to the teacher . The teacher told the kids they cannot only get up if the slaves are free , but they were still laying
paraphrase: The Cardinal Mooney High School Minority Alumni Council has expressed concern over a classroom lesson that allegedly recreated the experience of slavery, deeming it "deeply troubling." According to the council, the lesson involved students pretending to be slaves, white overseers, and immigrants from the Irish and Italian diaspora, and included a controversial exercise where students were asked to lie on the floor until a "slave master" allowed them to get up. The council criticized the lesson for misrepresenting Black culture and putting students in physical danger. The council stated that the teacher did not provide clear instructions on how long the students had to remain on the floor, and many students were forced to stay there for extended periods of time, including at least 30 minutes, until one of the African American students complained to the teacher.

input: It's 75 years since Trotsky, already expelled from the Soviet Communist Party and exiled, went to start a new life in Mexico. But he was hunted down in Mexico City by Stalinist assassins, as his grandson, who was living with him when he
continuation: was murdered , recalls . My father arrived into the world in the midst of the Russian Revolution .I was born in a region exiled from his motherland . That nation was Mexico .On September 11 , 1940 , my grandparents , the former commander - in - chief of the Soviet Red Army , was assassinated in his bathroom at his home in Mexico City . My grandfather Leon Trotsky was born in the town of Yanovka in the south of Russia , about 620 kilometers south of Moscow .His father , was a religious scholar and his mother , a educator . They raised 7 children .Trotsky ' s father perished when my uncle was a young boy , and Trotsky took up farming in Southern Russia , becoming a successful agronomist . My grandfather married Aleksandra Sokolovskaya in 1900 and
paraphrase: Seventy-five years have passed since Trotsky, once expelled from the Soviet Communist Party and exiled, began a new life in Mexico. However, his time in the country was cut short when he was hunted down by Stalinist assassins, as his grandson recalls. My father was born during the Russian Revolution, and I was raised in exile in Mexico. Tragically, my grandfather, the former commander-in-chief of the Soviet Red Army, was assassinated in his bathroom at his home in Mexico City on September 11, 1940. Leon Trotsky was born in the small town of Yanovka, located about 620 kilometers south of Moscow, to a religious scholar father and an educator mother. They raised seven children, but Trotsky's father passed away when he was a young boy, and he took up farming in Southern Russia, becoming a successful agronomist. Trotsky married Aleksandra Sokolovskaya in 1900.

input:
The attorney general said he wants to improve protections of medical service and see a more representative board manage sale proceeds.
ASHEVILLE  State Attorney General Josh Stein said Tuesday he wants to see changes in the proposed sale of Mission Health to HCA Healthcare
continuation: and will look at new legislation in 2020 to improve protections for health services and patients . When it comes to caring for families in Western North Carolina , we are going to stand up for every North Carolinian , Stein stated during an conference sponsored by the Asheville branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People .This is a public topic . Its one that I intend to remain focused on .Mission Health is a for - profit health healthcare system , so its sale has aroused national interest . While some health healthcare officials in the region and in North Carolina say the purchase is a better idea to reduce competition , others see the purchase as another symbol of increasing health healthcare consolidation , which many fear might lead to reduced availability to medical care for some .Many lawmakers also are concerned with what the purchase could mean for Mission Health ' s more than 10 , 0
paraphrase: The attorney general expressed a desire to enhance the protection of medical services and see a more diverse group of individuals oversee the distribution of profits. During a recent conference in Asheville, North Carolina, Attorney General Josh Stein emphasized the importance of standing up for the rights of North Carolinians, particularly when it comes to caring for families in Western North Carolina. Stein believes that the proposed sale of Mission Health to HCA Healthcare needs to be reevaluated in order to improve protections for healthcare services and patients. As a for-profit healthcare system, the sale of Mission Health has sparked national interest and raised concerns about the potential impact on access to medical care. Some healthcare officials in the region and state lawmakers are concerned that the purchase could lead to reduced competition and potentially limit access to medical care for certain populations.

input:
How secure is your data on WhatsApp? Well, we answer all the top questions related to your privacy on the worlds most popular messaging application.
Last year, Facebook-owned WhatsApp rolled out end-to-end encryption for more than
continuation: 1 billion subscribers worldwide . Not just that , the messaging system enables consumers to send and receive photos , videos , GIFs and documents to their colleagues , family and contacts with their full privacy intact .This implies that even the company that owns WhatsApp doesnt have access to your messages and media files . And WhatsApp also ensures that it cant read them and neither can hackers who attempt to invade your account .While all these are commendable steps , WhatsApp still isnt fully secure . In addition to chats , we using the app to make voice calls and transfer files .And this has made WhatsApp an appealing target for hackers . But before we look at some of the big security issues , lets look at a few something that the messaging system already does to safeguard your data from being theft .Data privacy has been a major concern in
paraphrase: WhatsApp's data security is quite robust, addressing the most frequently asked questions regarding user privacy on the world's leading messaging app. Last year, WhatsApp's parent company, Facebook, introduced end-to-end encryption for over 1 billion subscribers globally, ensuring that messages and media files are safe from prying eyes. This means that neither WhatsApp nor hackers can access or read these sensitive data, giving users full privacy control. Moreover, WhatsApp protects user data by preventing unauthorized access to chats, voice calls, and file transfers. However, despite these commendable measures, WhatsApp remains vulnerable to security threats, and the app's popularity only makes it more attractive to hackers. To further safeguard user data, WhatsApp has implemented various security features, such as encryption and secure data storage. By understanding these measures, we can better appreciate the ongoing efforts to maintain data privacy in the digital age.

input: For those who dont remember, Bulworth is a brilliant 1998 film by Warren Beatty, depicting a corrupted and suicidal liberal senator from California who is facing a primary challenge while dealing with financial ruin. Unable to sleep or eat, Bulworth
continuation: hires a struck man to organize his own crime , as a way to getting a story . The only thing that calms him down is speaking his mind , even if he cant be sure that what hes saying is his opinion .The man who is meant to shoot him turns out to be a motivational speaker who tries to alter him , but he gets in over his head . The film was such a hit that it prompted Beatty to really race for president in 2000 .I wish I was joking . That is Bulworth in the video , with Bill Maher , who cant handle Beattys language .That was one fun scene , and I really need to re - enjoy the film again .
paraphrase: In 1998, Warren Beatty directed a thought-provoking film, Bulworth, which portrays a disillusioned and struggling California senator facing a primary challenge. The protagonist, Bulworth, is plagued by insomnia and appetite loss, leading him to hire a hired gun to orchestrate his own assassination as a means of gaining attention. However, the would-be assassin turns out to be a motivational speaker who attempts to transform Bulworth, but finds himself in over his head. The film's success was so profound that it motivated Beatty to consider running for president in 2000, causing Maher to struggle with the film's language. Bulworth's captivating narrative remains a standout, prompting the need for a re-watch.

input:
Chelsea stand one win away from the Premier League title after mounting an impressive comeback to beat Leicester City at the King Power Stadium.
Jose Mourinho's side needed to call on all their reserves of quality and resilience to overcome Leicester City's fiercely determined challenge which
continuation: saw them ramp up the pace and the physicality from the 15th minute onwards . Leicester City dominated the opening period in which they formed chances and stung the fingers of Chelsea goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois .But in the last 20 minutes , the home side fell their way and Chelsea , after switching to their normal formation of 4 - 2 - 3 - 1 , moved up a gear and ensured the points . In a game in which the previous four results between these sides had been 2 - 2 , it was not unusual that they were locked at 1 - 1 at half - time , with Leicester City enjoying the more of the chances .Leicester City held possession in the early stages but Chelsea responded by starting to dominate the midfield . And it was an
paraphrase:
Chelsea are just one victory away from claiming the Premier League title after staging an impressive comeback against Leicester City at the King Power Stadium.
Jose Mourinho's side had to dig deep to overcome Leicester City's fierce challenge, which saw them step up the pace and physicality from the 15th minute onwards. Despite dominating the opening period and creating chances, Leicester City found themselves locked at 1-1 with Chelsea at halftime.
Chelsea's switch to their standard formation of 4-2-3-1 in the second half allowed them to gain momentum and secure the win. The previous four matches between these teams had been drawn 2-2, so it was no surprise that the game was evenly matched. However, Chelsea's determination and resilience ultimately won out, ensuring them the three points.

input:
Meet JOOR CEO Kristin Savilia who crafted herself into a retail guru who champions women in tech.
Kristin started her career as a buyer at Macys, so she understood firsthand the pain points of retailing and how JOOR
continuation: could solve them . Fourteen years later , she is CEO of JOOR , a B2B platform for retailers and brands to make their ordering more efficient .For an business that has a 6 % growth rate , the founders of JOOR , Aliza Licht and Kristin Savilia , are pushing down barriers by opening the doors for more individuals and brands to be involved . Kristin talked with us about the state of the company , her personal professional story , and more .What might you say the single greatest transformation to the clothing world is in the last 5 to 10 years ? Its been a digital transformation .You can see the effects of it everywhere . If youre a retailer , youve been brought along for the ride , and its not been easy .E - trade is growing at the cost of stone and mortar
paraphrase: Meet JOOR CEO Kristin Savilia, a trailblazer in the retail industry who has made a name for herself as a champion of women in tech. Kristin started her career as a buyer at Macy's, giving her a unique insight into the challenges faced by retailers and how JOOR could address them. Fourteen years later, she leads the company as CEO, a B2B platform that streamlines the ordering process for retailers and brands. With a 6% growth rate, Kristin and her co-founder Aliza Licht are breaking new ground by expanding opportunities for individuals and brands to participate in the industry. Kristin shared her perspective on the state of the company, her personal journey, and the transformative changes that have reshaped the clothing world in recent years. According to Kristin, the most significant transformation in the last decade has been the digital revolution, which has left its mark on every aspect of the industry. As a retailer, you've been along for the ride, and it hasn't been easy. E-commerce is growing at the expense of brick-and-mortar stores.

input: In the coming days, much of the coverage of the Chernobyl disaster in Russia is likely to focus on the 30-year anniversary and commemorations of it. The same may be said of reporting in Ukraine and Belarus, countries directly affected by the ramifications
continuation: of what happened . The first thing you need to realize about Chernobyl is that it is more of a sequence of connected events than a single moment in time .The atomic reactor in which it took place and the town it occurred near were part of a army - industrial compound which , previous to and since the disaster , has been governed over by a army - police - business coalition ( tripartism ) , effectively above the law , accountable to no person and not answerable for its actions . One of the first stories I ever covered for OCCRP was this report into the plight of those forced to move out of the Chernobyl zone and the tripartisms role in forcing many of them to be targeted and exploited for commercial gain .The survivors of Chernobyl have long since been denied essential services , decent conditions , and compensation by a system that puts
paraphrase: In the coming days, the Chernobyl disaster anniversary is likely to receive extensive coverage in Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus. However, it's important to recognize that the catastrophe was not a single event but rather a series of connected events. The atomic reactor and nearby town were part of a larger military-industrial complex, governed by a tripartite alliance of the military, police, and business interests. This coalition has historically operated above the law and without accountability, exploiting and targeting those forced to leave the Chernobyl zone for commercial gain. The survivors of the disaster have been denied basic services, decent living conditions, and fair compensation, highlighting the need for greater transparency and accountability in the handling of the disaster's aftermath.

input:
The Scottish Rugby Union is poised to take a step into the unknown by buying a stake in a professional rugby club in the United States.
A bid has been made for a minority share in Old Glory DC, an expansion club based in Washington DC who
continuation: are due to start play in Major League Rugby next year . Scotland have never had a pro club in the American sports market .Neither have Ireland , but they are to take a 5 % share in League One side Bedford Blues as part of a greater partnership with Rugby United New England , which will also cover the player and manager pathways to the USA . These advances mark a change of attitude by the SRU , who have become increasingly involved in professional initiatives over the last few years but to date , have not dared to enter a complete partnership .The trend is also developing in the six nations with England the latest to take a minority stake in an American rugby club . The RFU have committed to 15 % in the New York franchise who will join the American league in 2019 .Ireland has penned an agreement to buy a 5 % interest in the Bed
paraphrase: The Scottish Rugby Union is poised to embark on a groundbreaking venture by acquiring a stake in a professional rugby team in the United States. They have made a bid for a minority share in Old Glory DC, an expansion club set to begin play in Major League Rugby next year. This marks a significant departure from the SRU's previous reluctance to enter into full partnerships in the American sports market, where neither Scotland nor Ireland have any professional clubs. However, as part of a broader partnership with Rugby United New England, Ireland will be taking a 5% share in League One side Bedford Blues. This move represents a shift in the SRU's strategy, as they have become more involved in professional rugby initiatives in recent years. England is the latest to follow suit, committing to a minority stake in the New York franchise, which will join the American league in 2019.

input:
David Catania Hopes Experience Is Enough to Lead D.C.
