The 44 - month - old freshman at - large council member is trying to turn the 3 , 000 - vote difference between himself and Chairman Vincent Gray in 2010 into a lead for his 2014 run .I believe my experience is going to be my trump card in this campaign , said Catania , whos ran against Councilman Tommy Wells and longtime Councilman Michael Brown . Catania tells The Washington Post that experience would tell him the political capital to sway council members to back his agenda if he becomes the next mayor .But the Council of the District of Columbia Democratic State Committee has already endorsed Gray in the primary race . " We are endorsing Vincent Gray for the primary because of his more than 25 years in public service , " added Adrian M . Fenty , a retired Council member and mayor of the
paraphrase: David Catania is banking on his extensive experience on the D.C. Council to give him the edge in the upcoming Democratic primary. With 17 years under his belt, he believes his tenure will serve as his "trump card" in the campaign. Catania has faced off against notable opponents in the past, including Councilman Tommy Wells and longtime Councilman Michael Brown. He told The Washington Post that his experience will grant him the political capital to sway council members in his favor if he becomes the next mayor. However, the Council of the District of Columbia Democratic State Committee has already endorsed incumbent Mayor Vincent Gray in the primary race. Committee member Adrian M. Fenty added that the endorsement was due to Gray's extensive public service experience, spanning over 25 years.

input:
Drastic cuts in US funding to the United Nations would create an "insolvable problem" for the world body, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said Tuesday as he announced plans to lobby US lawmakers to reject the cutbacks.
G
continuation: uterres said he had met with White House leaders to express his fears about a budget passed by the US Congress that contains drastic cuts to the UN , an institution President Donald Trump has called useless and " so corrupt . " Guterres said he had intended to make the same case to congressmen coming month as part of a US - wide campaigning drive to restore the funding ." There is an insolvable question to be facing by the United Nations if the United States cuts , as it is planning , the main part of the funds for the UN , " he informed journalists in New York . US embassy to the UN Nikki Haley says previous week that Washington would cut its contributions by a third to the world body , although in a concession to diplomats she said the cuts might not be made until the end of 2019 .Washington is expected
paraphrase: United Nations funding cuts by the US would pose a "severe challenge" for the global organization, according to Secretary-General Antonio Guterres. Speaking Tuesday, he warned that reduced US funding would create a difficult situation for the UN, an institution President Donald Trump has previously described as unnecessary and corrupt. Guterres expressed his concerns to White House leaders and intends to make the same argument to US lawmakers in a forthcoming campaign to restore funding. "The consequences for the United Nations would be dire if the US were to cut the main source of its funding, as it is currently planning," he told reporters in New York. US Ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley announced last week that Washington would reduce its contributions to the UN by a third, although she clarified that the cuts might not take effect until the end of 2019. The US is expected to face opposition from other UN member states on this issue.

input:
A Dayton jury found a state lawmaker not guilty of assault Tuesday.
DAYTON, TN (WRCB) -- A Dayton jury found a state lawmaker not guilty of assault Tuesday.
The assault trial for State Rep. Jim Cobb opened Tuesday morning
continuation: at the Rhea County Courthouse . Cobb was accused of assaulting his son ' s ex - girlfriend in June 2008 at his Dayton home .Cobb and his wife , Nora , were captured and charged after Dayton police detectives investigated an alleged assault at their house . Cobb was arrested on a simple attack charge and his wife on a charge of official misconduct for reportedly failing to report an incident to police .Cobb pleaded innocent and so did Nora Cobb . At that point , state legislator Jim Cobb denied he ever struck his grandson ' s ex - girlfriend and replied he had not been told what she had said to him .However , he admitted he losing his temper and cursed at the woman while she was in his house . According to Dayton authorities , the couple claimed the woman was trying
paraphrase:
A jury in Dayton acquitted a state lawmaker of assault on Tuesday.
DAYTON, TN (Rhea County Times) -- A jury in Dayton reached a not guilty verdict for state lawmaker Jim Cobb in his assault trial on Tuesday. The trial began early that morning at the Rhea County Courthouse, where Cobb was accused of assaulting his son's ex-girlfriend in June 2008 at his Dayton residence. Cobb and his wife, Nora, were charged by Dayton police detectives after investigating an alleged assault at their home. Cobb pleaded innocent, as did his wife, and denied striking the woman. He admitted losing his temper and using profanity towards her, but claimed he had not been informed of what she said to him. According to Dayton authorities, the couple alleged the woman was attempting to enter their home without permission.

input: September 17, 2012 (KHARTOUM)  The rebel Sudan Liberation Movement led by Abdel Wahid Al-Nur (SPLM-AW) has urged the U.S. Administration to stop its support to the Doha Document for
continuation: Peace in Darfur ( DDPD ) alliance that finished in stalemate in 2011 . The rebel group lamented the U . S . choice to put out an e - mail on Thursday in which Washington expressed commitment to keep working with Darfur stakeholders .During talks given in Doha in February 2011 , the United States was represented by the assistant secretary for African Affairs , Johnnie Carson , and by a retired U . S . embassy to Sudan , Princeton Lyman , who both were also part of the AU - UNAMID mediating group . We believe that the document issued by the US administration on Thursday indicates US support for the lack of progress reached since the conclusion of the Doha Document for Peace in Darfur ( DDPD ) agreement in Qatar in February 201
paraphrase: On September 17, 2012, the Sudan Liberation Movement led by Abdel Wahid Al-Nur (SPLM-AW) urged the US administration to halt its backing of the Doha Document for Peace in Darfur (DDPD) alliance, which stalled in 2011. The rebel group criticized the US decision to issue an email on Thursday expressing commitment to continue working with Darfur stakeholders. During talks held in Doha in February 2011, the US was represented by Assistant Secretary for African Affairs, Johnnie Carson, and retired US Ambassador to Sudan, Princeton Lyman, who were also part of the AU-UNAMID mediating group. The SPLM-AW believes the recent US statement indicates support for the lack of progress achieved since the DDPD agreement was signed in Qatar in February 2011.

input: IN WRITING about the year gone by, the first thing that strikes one is that this was the year of the spare cash. Almost all people in the middle class seemed to have extra money to spend. In many cases it was borrowed money but
continuation: no someone appeared to mind . Indeed there was an air of unbelievable and exuberant optimism which even reached a level where the consumer came into debt for the pure love of it .There was the belief that in a new year one always does better , and the corollary was that one might look forward to good everything . But it is uncertain whether these feelings could last indefinitely .The main concern is about the level of debt . An analyst of the State Bank of India has advised of an impending problem in the retail banking field , and that might not be far from the truth .HIGH on the list of lenders ' grievances is the inadequacy of the penal interest rate clause in consumer loan agreements . This is not the only source of worry for lenders .Recently a case has coming up in the cities ' s civil court where a consumer refused to repay her credit card bill because she
paraphrase: Last year was marked by an excess of disposable income, with many middle-class individuals having more money to spend than necessary. This abundance of cash seemed to bring an air of unbridled optimism, leading some to take on debt for the sheer joy of it. The belief that the new year would bring better fortunes and improved financial prospects only added fuel to the spending frenzy. However, as the year drew to a close, concerns began to arise about the unsustainable level of debt accumulated. Analysts from the State Bank of India have expressed worry about an impending problem in the retail banking sector, and lenders are growing increasingly discontent with the inadequate penalties for loan default. In a recent civil court case, a borrower even refused to repay their credit card bill, highlighting the need for stricter regulations in consumer loan agreements.

input:
Great Britain have finished outside the medals at the World Wheelchair Rugby Championships in Canada.
However, their sixth-placed finish sees GB, who were ranked ninth in the world before the tournament, move three places up the world rankings.
Captain Steve
continuation: Bell , 23 , and Australia beat Canada 45 - 41 in the final , with the Canucks winning gold four years ago in Adelaide . The best five nations in the world had all qualified for Rio in August .GB are ranked ninth , with reigning world hosts the Netherlands third , Australia fifth and Great Britain ' s closest rivals the United States seventh . GB team captain Steve Bell , who plays for Sheffield Steelers in the GB Wheelchair Rugby League team , said : " The squad did really well , even though we didn ' t attain the objective we setting ourselves , of getting into the medals . "
paraphrase: Great Britain's performance at the World Wheelchair Rugby Championships in Canada was unsuccessful, as they failed to secure any medals. However, their sixth-place finish did result in a notable improvement in their world rankings, moving them up three spots to ninth place. Captain Steve Bell, a 23-year-old player, led the team to a thrilling 45-41 victory over Canada in the final, with the Canadian side having won gold four years ago in Adelaide. The top five nations in the world, including reigning world hosts the Netherlands, Australia, and Great Britain's closest rivals the United States, had all qualified for the upcoming Rio Olympics in August. Despite not achieving their medal objective, GB team captain Steve Bell expressed his satisfaction with the team's performance, saying, "The squad did well overall, even though we didn't meet our goal of getting into the medals."

The master bedroom contains a sitting
paraphrase:
Barbara Van Dyke, a skilled Realtor with Kuper Sotheby's International Realty, has demonstrated her versatility in marketing and selling a wide range of properties. In this month's edition of insideDfw, she showcases some of her favorite listings, including a stunning condo in the Upper Uptown area of Dallas.
This luxurious condo is located on the first floor of the Houston House building and boasts three bedrooms, three baths, and three balconies, with a second-story balcony off the master bedroom. input: And this is what happens when you take people from outside of tech, in this case Michael Pachter, an analyst at Wedbush Securities (based in LA), and collide them with topics that they dont understand, in this case,
continuation: the videogame industry . This is why I love gaming ( and Im a dork for doing a dedicated video to this asshole ) .Its a huge industry and yet its largely below the radar in the mainstream media ( who definitely hasnt done the research to show how well the sector has been doing over the last 20 decades ) . He ( Pachter ) looks at different categories .This category includes so much different gaming stuff that it could be a category all by itself . Video titles for kids and so on .But mainly hes speaking about major console games and mainly about the big 3 Microsoft ( Xbox ) , Nintendo ( Wii ) and Sony ( PlayStation ) . In some ways , hes right .Everything is more priced , far much more expensive . Thats what you get when you have an business that is now older than most people playing .
paraphrase: When outsiders like Michael Pachter, an analyst at Wedbush Securities, encounter unfamiliar topics like the videogame industry, hilarity often ensues. As someone who loves gaming, I found it amusing to dedicate a video to him. The industry has been thriving for decades, yet it remains largely under the radar in mainstream media. Pachter attempts to break down the sector into various categories, including games for kids and console titles from the big three: Microsoft (Xbox), Nintendo (Wii), and Sony (PlayStation). While he makes some valid points about the increased cost of gaming, it's clear that the industry's age and maturity have led to higher prices. Nonetheless, the sector continues to grow and evolve, making it an exciting area to watch.

input: Last week, ABCs Agent Carter burst on to the scene with a two-hour series premiere, looking to bridge the gap between Marvels blossoming TV universe and its big-screen, theatrical counter-part. The series very
continuation: quickly establishes itself as something that would make a fine inclusion into the cinematic universe , and that holds true even though the plot as a whole is a bit puzzled . Agent Carter is based on the Marvel one - shot Agent Carter , which itself was based on a concept pitched by Peggy herself .As such , the series operates as an origin story , chronicling Carters early career after Steve Rogers absence . In a plot development that Marvel TV chief Jeph Loeb believes will be further discussed in the upcoming Agents of S . H . I . E . L . D .TV series , Peggy is frozen in ice while attending a party in 1946 . Thawed 70 years later by a group of thieves , she is recruited by Howard Stark to search down the person responsible for the attack and steal the blueprints to a devastating super weapon the dazzling
paraphrase: Last week, ABC's Agent Carter made its debut with a two-hour series premiere, aiming to connect the dots between Marvel's expanding TV universe and its big-screen adventures. The show quickly establishes itself as a valuable addition to the cinematic universe, even though the plot has some minor kinks. Agent Carter is based on the Marvel one-shot Agent Carter, which was inspired by a pitch from Peggy herself. As such, the series serves as an origin story, chronicling Carter's early career after Captain America's disappearance. In an unexpected plot twist, Peggy is frozen in ice during a 1946 party and is thawed out 70 years later by a group of thieves. She is then recruited by Howard Stark to uncover the mastermind behind the attack and secure the blueprints to a powerful weapon of destruction known as the "dazzling."

input:
No official date exists to mark when valuable holdouts become critical to a team's hopes, but you can figure any player not signed by this weekend has become a major problem.
The two biggest holdouts of the season are Green Bay quarterback Don Maj
continuation: kowski and New England ' s defensive lineman William Henderson . The Packers officially have about a million dollar offer to Majkowski , who is one of three players who can still be compensated under the old salary cap .He ' ll getting a far better deal if he waits until after March 1 , but he ' ll be in limbo , making only the minimum of $ 110 , 000 if he doesn ' t sign soon . Both sides are showing they expect a agreement to be reached .Henderson isn ' t close to a deal , and if he doesn ' t sign by the weekend , the Patriots are heading to be in a huge bind . They only have about $ 1 . 7 million to spend under the cap , and only six players are under contract , so Henderson ' s 11 percent share of the salary cap comes at a critical time .Other teams have problems of their own .
paraphrase: The exact date when valuable holdouts become critical to a team's chances is difficult to pinpoint, but any player still unsigned by the weekend can be considered a significant issue. The two most notable holdouts of the season are Green Bay quarterback Don Majkowski and New England defensive lineman William Henderson. The Packers have made an official offer of around $1 million to Majkowski, who is one of three players eligible for compensation under the old salary cap. He will receive a better deal if he waits until after March 1, but he will be in a state of limbo, earning only the minimum of $110,000 if he doesn't sign soon. Both sides appear optimistic about reaching an agreement. Henderson, on the other hand, is not close to a deal, and if he doesn't sign by the weekend, the Patriots will be in a precarious position. With only around $1.7 million available under the cap, they have only six players under contract, leaving Henderson's 11% share of the salary cap to be addressed at a crucial time. Other teams are also facing their own challenges with holdouts.

input:
David Wu, a Qualcomm engineer, fell to his death from the sixth floor of Qualcomms AY building at its headquarters complex Sunday. The death was originally reported by Chinese media.
Similar Qualcomm suicides took place in 2010 and 2012. Because
continuation: Wu is a Qualcomm worker , its likely he worked on radio - related Qualcomm software . Wu , 42 , had been with the company since 2012 , after having previously worked as a mobile software engineer at Mozilla .His LinkedIn site records his previous work experience at Motorola . There is no information available at this time regarding the conditions of Wus death .
paraphrase:
David Wu, a talented engineer at Qualcomm, tragically lost his life after falling from the sixth floor of the company's AY building at its headquarters complex on Sunday. Initial reports of the incident were shared by Chinese media outlets.
Sadly, this is not the first time that a Qualcomm employee has taken their own life. Similar incidents occurred in 2010 and 2012, suggesting that the company may have a deeper issue at hand. Given Wu's role as a radio software engineer at Qualcomm, it is likely that he was involved in the development of innovative and cutting-edge technology.
Wu, a 42-year-old veteran of the company, joined Qualcomm in 2012, following stints at Mozilla and Motorola. His professional experience and skills were showcased on his LinkedIn profile. At this time, there is no further information available regarding the circumstances surrounding Wu's death.

input: Twenty five years later, I met a student who was frustrated and disappointed about his life. I asked him the simple question, why? Then he began to express himself about what he wanted to achieve in his life. I was very impressed with his ambitions
continuation: but was distressed about his lack of ability to reach his dreams . I questioned him if he had a vision statement of his life .I shared my own vision statement with him . He said it was not possible for him to write one .It sounded too boring and too difficult . At this time in my life , I was writing book after book .I shared with him that it had been like that for me also , until I finding the magic word that sparked my vision . Once I started wrote my vision statement , it flowed naturally from my soul .I found it easy to express what was vital to me , how I wanted to spend my time , and what I wanted to achieve with my life . My vision statement for my career and my personal life was : I see myself as a highly respected and appreciated professional who is an authority and specialist in my field .I am the writer and lecturer in the field of the management
paraphrase: Twenty-five years on, I had the privilege of encountering a disheartened young man. Following an invitation to share his thoughts, he unveiled his aspirations and disappointments. I was impressed by his ambition but concerned about his inability to actualize them. I inquired about his existence of a life vision statement. He expressed reservations, finding the task too daunting and uninteresting. In my own life, I have discovered the transformative power of a well-crafted vision statement. I shared my personal statement with him, highlighting my dedication to being a respected professional and authority in my field. I elaborated on how my vision statement has aided me in navigating my career and personal aspirations, allowing me to express my core values and goals with ease and clarity. My vision statement for both my professional and personal life is as follows: "I envision myself as a highly esteemed and appreciated expert in my field, utilizing my knowledge and skills to make meaningful contributions and inspire others. My work and personal life are infused with purpose, passion, and a deep sense of fulfillment." By crafting and committing to a personal vision statement, I have found it easier to stay focused, prioritize my goals, and make intentional decisions that align with my values and aspirations.

input:
DEFIANT Alan Shearer has urged his relegation-haunted Newcastle side to keep the faith.
With just one point from three games since he returned to St Jamess Park, the Geordie icon has been unable to work an
continuation: instant miracle . But Alan who takes training this week for the first time since recovering from a disease that has dogged him since early October remains convinced he can save Newcastle from the drop .Asked about rumors that the team may replace him with another boss , he commented : Theres no plans to do anything of the sort . It is a year that was always going to be impossible , but nobody has done anything .The one people who has done anything is me , but I have been sick and I have not been able to work with them . So at this moment in time we are where we are and were going to have to make the best of it .We are working hard , the players are working hard , they are doing what I am asking them to do and I have total faith that we will getting the results we require . I honestly believe we will do , but I
paraphrase: Alan Shearer has urged his struggling Newcastle side to stay united in their fight against relegation, despite their poor start to the season. With only one point from three games since he returned to St James' Park, the Geordie legend has been unable to turn things around immediately. However, he remains confident that he can save the team from the drop, having taken training this week for the first time since his illness. When asked about speculation that the team may replace him with another manager, he dismissed the rumors, stating that there are no plans to make any changes. Shearer acknowledged that this has been a tough year, but emphasized that nobody has done anything to improve the team's fortunes. He praised the players for their hard work and dedication, and expressed his faith in their ability to turn things around. Despite the challenges, Shearer remains optimistic about the team's prospects, believing that they will eventually get the results they need to stay in the Premier League.

input: This years monster El Nio is truly a monsterits been blamed for killing coral reefs. Add another die-off to the list: Southern California beaches are blanketed in hundreds of thousands of tiny crabs. So many that
continuation: local news outlets , using the amorphous plural form crabs , are cautioning tourists about the pests , noting the crabs are unlikely to hurt humans but can wreck the holiday if stepped on . Many Southern California beaches are lined with crabs ( AP ) The sun is out , the surf is up and the weathers perfect .The noises of the holiday season mix with the calls of seagulls , the splashes of tiny waves and the giggling of children playing on Santa Monica Beach , the sunniest coastal strip in Los Angeles County . Whats not so pleasant is the surprising and apparently unrelenting blizzard of cockle - looking small white crabs .The ghostly monsters seem to be a outcome of a die - off of an organism called sea butterfly larvae , a group of tiny invertebr
paraphrase: This year's intense El Nio event has brought about another devastating impact on Southern California's beaches. Hundreds of thousands of tiny crabs have invaded the shores, blanketing them in a mysterious and unexpected manner. While the crabs are unlikely to harm humans, they can cause significant disruptions to the holiday season if not handled carefully. The sun is shining, the waves are crashing, and the atmosphere is lively on Santa Monica Beach, one of the sunniest spots in Los Angeles County. However, the serene scene is interrupted by an unrelenting onslaught of small, white crabs, which seem to be a result of a die-off of sea butterfly larvae, a group of tiny invertebrates.

input:
Thousands of people march in Istanbul and around the world over raid on Gaza convoy.
Palestinians in the occupied West Bank clashed with Israeli security forces who responded with tear gas, injuring many people.
An emergency session of the United Nations Security Council
continuation: was held in New York on Saturday morning , with 14 of the 15 council members arguing for an international inquiry into the attack . The council also urged the reopening of Israel ' s blockade of Gaza .Israeli Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman says the attack was necessary to prevent an " impending terror assault . " He added that Israel would continue to prohibit the shipment of " any weapons " into Gaza , even if a commission was set up , according to the Israeli newspaper Haaretz .Among those detained was a senior Hamas official , Mahmoud al - Zahar , who was on board the Mavi Marmara . He was afterwards released but Israeli forces detained two other members of the group ' s political bureau .In Istanbul , the Turks , particularly Prime Minister Tayyip Erdogan ,
paraphrase:
Thousands of protesters across the globe, including Istanbul, rallied in solidarity with the Gaza aid convoy, which was raided by Israeli forces. Palestinians in the West Bank clashed with Israeli security personnel, resulting in injuries to many.
In response to the attack, an emergency UN Security Council meeting was held in New York, with 14 of the 15 council members calling for an international investigation. The council also urged the reopening of Israel's blockade of Gaza. Israeli Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman claimed the attack was necessary to prevent an imminent terrorist assault, adding that Israel would continue to prohibit the shipment of all weapons into Gaza, even if an investigation is conducted, according to Haaretz.
During the raid, a senior Hamas official, Mahmoud al-Zahar, was detained, but was later released. Israeli forces also detained two other members of the group's political bureau. In Istanbul, Turkish leaders, particularly Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan, were among those who protested against the raid.

input:
This is an update on the progress of efforts to suppress the wildfires that are burning out of control in Southern California.
Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger was briefed and held a Press Conference on the Canyon Fire and other Los Angeles area fires. Other fires in the
continuation: San Diego area are spreading . The President issued an Emergency Proclamation .On Tuesday October 23rd the President issued an Emergency Proclamation declaring that a major disaster exists in the State of California and authorized Federal assistance to supplement State , local , and tribal measures to save lives and to shield property . Wildfires have killed more than 415 , 000 acres and affect 500 building in Southern California .The worst of the fires is the Sawtooth Fire , which has burned nearly 166 , 000 acres in the San Bernardino National Forest and surrounding areas . The Sawtooth Fire is 20 percent contained .Wildfires have damaged more than 350 , 000 acres and kill more than 500 building in San Diego County , and have damaged 340 , 0
paraphrase:
Update on California Wildfires:
Efforts to contain the out-of-control wildfires in Southern California have been ongoing, with Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger briefed and holding a press conference on the Canyon Fire and other Los Angeles-area fires. The President has issued an Emergency Proclamation, declaring a major disaster exists in California and authorizing federal assistance to supplement state, local, and tribal measures to protect lives and property. According to the latest updates, wildfires have burned over 415,000 acres and affected 500 buildings in Southern California, with the Sawtooth Fire in the San Bernardino National Forest and surrounding areas being the most severe, with 20% containment. The wildfires have also caused significant damage to over 350,000 acres and resulted in the deaths of more than 500 buildings in San Diego County.

input: If you are willing to take the time to calculate the needed calories to bulk up, the process should be relatively simple. Bulking up or building muscle means getting a mass stimulus from resistance-training and then supplying your body with adequate
continuation: calories , protein , fat , vitamins and minerals . To do that , you need to see at the metabolic aspects of dieting for weight gain .You also need to know the kind of calories and nutrients your bodies requires and then , how to estimate them . The amount of muscle you build depends on the quantity of power ( calories ) your bodies absorbs and the rate at which your bodies broke them down into energy for muscle construction .So , how do you go about built muscle ? There are several methods to estimate the quantity of muscle protein your bodies requires and there is a huge variety of supplements on the market for each way .Some supplements are intended to expand protein metabolism ( a process that happens within muscle cells and results in new protein building ) . Other supplements help on increasing the quantity of amino acids used for muscle protein synthesis and still others work on providing the nutri
paraphrase: To effectively bulk up and build muscle, calculating the necessary caloric intake is a straightforward process. Resistance training provides the necessary mass stimulus, while adequate calories, protein, fat, vitamins, and minerals are essential for muscle growth. Understanding the metabolic aspects of weight gain and the body's nutritional requirements is crucial for estimating the necessary calories and nutrients. The amount of muscle gained depends on the amount of energy (calories) absorbed and the rate at which the body breaks it down to fuel muscle construction. There are various methods to estimate muscle protein requirements, and supplements are available to support each approach. Some supplements enhance protein metabolism, while others increase the amount of amino acids used for muscle protein synthesis. Others provide the necessary nutrients to support muscle growth. By understanding these principles and utilizing appropriate supplements, individuals can effectively build muscle and achieve their fitness goals.

input:
Airlift of a Marine Corps battalion to Lebanon demonstrated that deploying contingency forces from the continental United States to an overseas operation was feasible and expeditious.
During the Cold War, the United States deployed its Armed Forces to support the national objectives of various
continuation: allies and partners across the globe . The deployment of these forces was costly and the creation of bases overseas , while frequently essential , was less than attractive from a strategic perspective .Deployments , whether personnel or equipment , takes weeks , if not months , to plan and execute , as resources needed to be brought into theater to support units that would be deployed . The adoption of Marine Aircraft Group 14 ( MAG 14 ) , the Blue Devils , by the Marine Corps Air Station ( MCAS ) Cherry Point , North Carolina in the 1990s transformed the capabilities of the combat element , and the fast - pacing troops of the First Marine Expeditionary Force ( MEF ) began to expand its area of activities .The need to develop battle power beyond the usual two - war level dictated by 1980s - era force planning and
paraphrase: The deployment of a Marine Corps battalion to Lebanon demonstrated the feasibility and efficiency of deploying contingency forces from the United States to an overseas operation. During the Cold War, the US military deployed its forces to support the strategic objectives of allies and partners worldwide. These deployments were costly and the establishment of bases abroad was not always desirable from a strategic standpoint. Deploying personnel or equipment took weeks or even months to plan and execute, as resources needed to be brought into theater to support units that would be deployed. In the 1990s, the Marine Corps Air Station at Cherry Point, North Carolina adopted Marine Aircraft Group 14, known as the Blue Devils, which transformed the combat element's capabilities and allowed the fast-paced troops of the First Marine Expeditionary Force to expand their area of operations. The need to develop battle power beyond the usual two-war level dictated by 1980s-era force planning led to significant changes in the military's deployment strategies.

input: People and Us Weekly editors are in heaven: Both Jennifer Aniston and hubby Brad Pitt snagged Emmy noms Thursday. Aniston snagged a comedy best actress nod for having a baby on Friends; Pitt scored for a guest
continuation: appearance on his wifes thriller Dallas and a writing bid for writing and starring on Saturday Night Live . This will be the first time Pitt and Aniston will compete at the Emmys together since they married in July .
paraphrase: The editors of People and Us Weekly are overjoyed: Both Jennifer Aniston and her husband Brad Pitt have received Emmy nominations. Aniston has been nominated for Best Comedic Actress for her portrayal of a pregnant character on Friends, while Pitt has been nominated for his guest appearance on his wife's thriller series Dallas and for his writing and starring role on Saturday Night Live. This will be the first time the couple has been nominated together at the Emmys since their wedding in July.

input:
A British entrepreneur 'committed a deliberate fraud over a sustained period of time' to artificially inflate the value of his software company by billions of dollars ahead of its sale, the High Court has heard.
Hewlett-Packard (HP
continuation: ) , which bought the company , Autonomy for $ 11bn ( 6 . 5bn ) in 2011 , is suing for $ 5bn in damages , arguing that ex - CEO Mike Lynch and other trustees of Autonomy deliberately misled it over the health of the company . In 2014 , HP wrote off $ 5bn ( 2 . 9bn ) of the deal and launched its fraud inquiry .Autonomy ' s then - CEO , Mike Lynch , denied any wrongdoing and later criticized HP of an incompetent acquire . The dispute arose after HP acquired Autonomy in 2011 .But the tech corporation , which used to be part of Hewlett - Packard , said when it bought the firm it was not aware of a " shadowy consultancy group that had a say in Autonomy ' s accounting . "
paraphrase: A British entrepreneur allegedly perpetrated a deliberate fraud over a prolonged period to artificially inflate the value of their software company by billions of dollars prior to its sale, according to court testimony. Hewlett-Packard (HP), which acquired the company in 2011 for $11 billion (6.5 billion), is seeking $5 billion in damages, claiming that former CEO Mike Lynch and other trustees of Autonomy deliberately misled the company about the company's health. In 2014, HP wrote off $5 billion (2.9 billion) of the deal and launched an investigation into potential fraud. Lynch has denied any wrongdoing and later criticized HP for incompetence in acquiring the company. The dispute stemmed from HP's acquisition of Autonomy in 2011, but HP alleges that it was not aware of a "shadowy consultancy group" with influence over Autonomy's accounting practices at the time of the purchase.

input:
The fight against Ottawas proposed tax changes for small corporations isnt over, even after watered-down policies were proposed in the latest federal budget following months of business community backlash.
The Coalition for Small Business Tax Fairness, a
continuation: group of business organizations , says the introduced modifications would still harm the countrys small businesses . The organization says its not only about higher taxes but also decreasing the already - low corporate taxation rate .It says the changes will push business owners to pull money out of their companies and instead invest in other securities or personal properties . However , it welcomes the governments move to remove certain types of passive revenue from the proposals , as well as changes that restrict the using of revenue sprinkling , which sees earnings among family groups to escape taxation .Despite the changes , business owners continue question whether tax planning might remain a thing of the past for little companies .
paraphrase: The battle against Ottawa's proposed tax revisions for small businesses is ongoing, despite watered-down policies introduced in the latest federal budget after months of opposition from the business community. The Coalition for Small Business Tax Fairness, a group of business associations, contends that the revised proposals would still harm the country's small enterprises. They argue that it's not just about higher taxes but also lowering the already-low corporate tax rate, which would cause business owners to divert funds from their companies to invest in other assets or personal properties. However, they welcome the government's move to exclude certain types of passive income from the proposals and changes that restrict the use of income sprinkling, which allows earnings to be distributed among family members to avoid taxation. Despite these changes, small business owners remain skeptical about the effectiveness of tax planning in the future.

input:
This opinion piece is by Valarie Kaur, a civil rights lawyer, filmmaker, and interfaith leader who founded Groundswell, the nations largest multi-faith online organizing community.
Gunshots in a sanctuary of peace. C
continuation: ries for justice from victims families . And a surge of outrage and terror spreading from Americas neighborhoods to a divided Senate .The school shooting in Parkland , Florida , which murdered 17 people , has reignited a passionate discussion over how to keep this from happening again . In the immediate wake , victims and leaders , notably several Sikh Americans , expressed their opposition to arming educators .A few courageous legislators even dared to talk about the issue of background checks . The outrage , however , has become diluted .After only two weeks , it has become fewer about how to protect American children , and more about how to punish others in society . Focusing on the how is a form of cowardice that serves as an emotional and political cover for the failure to examine the deeper whythe structures of oppression , and the culture of in
paraphrase: In this opinion piece, Valarie Kaur, a civil rights lawyer and interfaith leader, reflects on the recent school shooting in Parkland, Florida, which resulted in the loss of 17 lives. The article highlights the immediate response to the tragedy, with victims' families calling for justice and leaders advocating for stricter gun control measures. However, Kaur argues that the outrage and passion surrounding the event have begun to fade, and instead of addressing the deeper structural issues that contribute to these shootings, there is a focus on punishing individuals in society. She suggests that this approach is a form of cowardice that avoids tackling the root causes of the problem.

input:
The Nuggets Nikola Jokic, left, is defended by the Celtics Aron Baynes during the first quarter Monday at TD Garden in Boston.
BOSTON  Isaiah Thomas got his due, and the Nuggets got their win.
continuation: Thomas scored 19 points in his first appearance at TD Garden since the Celtics shipped him to the Lakers in August , but the Nuggets ' 114 - 105 win on Monday night was about the big picture . Monday was the first month the Nuggets spending a week together in training camp .It was the first time in nine months for Jokic and Malone to practice side by side . Malone and Jokic were teammates in Spain before Jokic arrived to Denver as part of a four - club trade last season .Malone says last week that after watching tape of Jokic in Europe , he was confident the center could be an NBA talent . The Nuggets saw it all night .Jokic not only leading the Nuggets in scoring with 20 points , but he recorded a triple - double by the first quarter
paraphrase:
The Denver Nuggets' Nikola Jokic, left, was closely guarded by Boston Celtics' Aron Baynes during the first quarter on Monday at TD Garden.
Isaiah Thomas, returning to Boston for the first time since being traded to the Lakers in August, scored 19 points in the Nuggets' 114-105 win. While the victory was significant for Thomas, it was also a milestone for the Nuggets, who have been working together for only a month in training camp. Jokic and coach Malone have been practicing together for the first time in nine months, and Malone has been impressed with Jokic's NBA potential after reviewing tape of his European performances. Jokic proved to be a dominant force on the court, leading the Nuggets in scoring with 20 points and recording a triple-double by the first quarter.

input:

She says both selling were huge successes , and she needed to do another this year .Shawna
paraphrase:
If you're looking to inject some creativity into your home, you're in luck! The Haven Lamb Shop is hosting its third annual fine art, prints, and frames sale this Friday and Saturday, September 15 and 16.
Located at the picturesque Haven Lamb Farm, the sale will feature an extensive selection of original artworks, framed and unframed prints, and ready-to-hang canvas pieces. input:
There are people who insist that Super Bowl Sunday or the Kentucky Derby is the most exciting day in sports. I always argue that there is no day in sports better than tomorrow. Nothing beats the Saturday of college basketball's Final Four.
There is still
continuation: plenty of action left to be played yesterday , but I ' ll leave my analysis of what happened to my fellow Bleacher Report bracketists until Monday . My play of the night was definitely Notre Dame against Michigan State in the Sweet 16 .The Spartans , 38 - 1 at the Breslin Center , merely had too much strength on the inside and were too experienced for the Irish , which dropped behind by 18 at one point in the first half . Notre Dame turned in a fine year , but Michigan State lived up to its billing and is now one step from the Final Four .Here ' s a look at the contestants . ( 3 ) Connecticut vs . ( 11 ) George Mason The Huskies proved last night they belong here , so there is no sense in picking against them .The upstart Patriots could be 40 - point underdogs and the game might still be a rout . I ' ve
paraphrase:
There are sports enthusiasts who contend that specific days like Super Bowl Sunday or the Kentucky Derby are the most thrilling in the world of sports. However, I firmly believe that there is no day that can compare to the excitement of tomorrow. The Saturday of college basketball's Final Four is truly the pinnacle of sports enthusiasm.
While there is still plenty of action to be played from yesterday, I will reserve my analysis of the events for my fellow Bleacher Report bracketists until Monday. My highlight of the night was the intense matchup between Notre Dame and Michigan State in the Sweet 16. Despite being 38-1 at home in the Breslin Center, the Spartans were ultimately overpowered by the Irish, who found themselves down by 18 points in the first half. Despite Notre Dame's impressive season, Michigan State proved their worth and are now one step away from the Final Four.
Here's a closer look at the upcoming contest: (3) Connecticut vs. (11) George Mason. The Huskies have proven themselves to be a force to be reckoned with, making them a formidable opponent. Meanwhile, the upstart Patriots might be 40-point underdogs, but the game could still end up being a rout.

input: Red Hat bought IT automation-centric configuration management DevOps-friendly firm Ansible, okay so we know that part. Retaining the Ansible brand and names as it does, this month sees Red Hat launch Ansible Container, but what is
continuation: this , you may ask ? Well , as weve written before , warehouses are a great way to broke up a complex IT environment , allowing containers to operate in isolation and gain control over the environment and help create it more agile , owing to their light weight and flexibility .Red Hat , as well as a number of other suppliers , have been building their own container ecosystems that also feel to simplify operations . Indeed , Google held its own kind of developer summit recently , where it announced some fresh tools , amongst them Kubernetes , which is a rivals to Docker .Red Hat said that containers are revolutionizing application development and implementation . With this acquisition , Red Hat will take Ansible Container to more platforms , and bring enterprise grade support , protection and scalability to containers , and help decrease the increasing burden of controlling hybrid cloud environments .Enterprises are increasingly shifting towards a DevOps model of infrastructure
paraphrase: Red Hat has acquired IT automation-focused configuration management and DevOps-compatible firm Ansible, as we are aware. This month sees the launch of Ansible Container by Red Hat, which has retained the Ansible brand and names. Containers are used to divide a complicated IT environment into smaller, more manageable pieces in warehouses, enabling them to run independently and exert control over the environment while speeding up the development process thanks to their lightweight and adaptability. Other suppliers, including Red Hat, have been building their own container ecosystems to make operations easier. Google recently held its own developer conference, where it unveiled some new tools, including Kubernetes, which is a rival to Docker. According to Red Hat, containers are revolutionizing application creation and implementation. With this acquisition, Ansible Container will be made available on more platforms and receive enterprise-level support, security, and scalability, all of which will help lighten the load of managing hybrid cloud environments for enterprises, which are increasingly adopting a DevOps infrastructure model.

input: Most of you are part of the problem, these kids bodies are not even cold yet and you are all having the same tired argument. Wake up, regardless if you blame guns or people, we have a big problem that can only be cured with love
continuation: not scapegoats . These poor children , and those of Newtown , are so innocent , at 7 years old they are victimized by adults who make the decision to commit evil , why cant all adults saw that , give accountability , and making a difference .So sickening.
paraphrase: It's clear that many of us are complicit in this problem, with young lives cut short and yet we're stuck in the same repetitive debate. It's time to wake up and break free from the cycle of blame-shifting. We need to acknowledge that our collective inaction has led to this tragedy, and that we must take responsibility for creating a safer society. These innocent children, barely out of their elementary school years, have been victimized by the very people who were meant to protect them. It's heartbreaking that we can't seem to learn from these tragedies and instead point fingers at each other. It's time to put aside our differences and work towards a solution that starts with empathy and ends with meaningful action.

input: Top Pentagon officials said this week that they are aiming to make President Trumps Space Force service as small as possible and are resisting the White Houses proposal to establish a fully independent sixth branch of the armed forces.
continuation: [ Source ] The Pentagons management is urged President Trump to defy his own executive order that mandated the formation of the Space Force , the Washington Post comments . Bloomberg : U . S . Customs and Border Protection is preparing to turn away asylum seekers from Honduras , Guatemala and El Salvador at the southern U . S . border , unless they seek protection in a country they went through on their way to the U . S . , according to a draft memo received by Bloomberg News .The laws have already been put into place , according to the draft , a copy of which was shared with Bloomberg News . Asylum seekers would also be turned away at U . S . ports of entry unless they obtained refuge in Mexico .Customs and Border Protection has implemented a project under which refugee seekers who pass background checks are placed in shelters in Mexico while their cases are processed in the U
paraphrase: Top Pentagon officials aim to minimize President Trump's Space Force service, resisting the White House's proposal for a standalone sixth branch of the armed forces, according to sources. Despite President Trump's executive order mandating the formation of the Space Force, Pentagon management is advising him to defy it. Meanwhile, U.S. Customs and Border Protection is drafting plans to turn away asylum seekers from Honduras, Guatemala, and El Salvador at the southern U.S. border, unless they seek protection in a country they transited on their way to the U.S. or obtain refuge in Mexico. The agency has already implemented a project under which refugee seekers who pass background checks are placed in shelters in Mexico while their cases are processed in the U.S.

input: New Delhi: Prime Ministers Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a credit-linked subsidy programme aimed at generating self-employment opportunities through establishment of micro-enterprises in the non-farm sector by helping traditional artisans and unemployed
continuation: youth . Union Minister of Micro , Small and Medium Enterprises ( MSME ) Nitin Gadkari on 7 February 2016 proposed several important alterations in the project to expand the scope and outreach of the scheme .Nitin Gadkari made the announcement at the Silver Jubilee Celebrations of the National Institute of Small Industries Extension ( NISER ) in New Delhi . He also started the MSME Digitisation Initiative and Golden Jubilee Academic Research Award .He addressed more than 1000 Entrepreneurs from more than 200 districts in India . Among others , Nitin Gadkari announced 100 per cent interest subsidy to all female entrepreneurs , new provision of refinance for one year , enhanced turnover from 2 la
paraphrase: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) aims to create self-employment opportunities in the non-farm sector by supporting traditional artisans and unemployed youth through a credit-linked subsidy scheme. Union Minister of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Nitin Gadkari recently proposed changes to expand the scope and reach of the program. Gadkari made these announcements during the Silver Jubilee Celebrations of the National Institute of Small Industries Extension (NISER) in New Delhi, where he also launched the MSME Digitisation Initiative and the Golden Jubilee Academic Research Award. Gadkari addressed over 1000 entrepreneurs from 200 districts across India, including a 100% interest subsidy for all female entrepreneurs and a new provision for refinancing for one year. The program's turnover limit has also been increased from 2 lakh to 5 lakh.

input: A new year means a new me. Long gone are the days of my subtle judgment on the current climate of the music industry. With the weather having gone from cold to unearthly, and Boston looking incredibly unfamiliar to a Texas native, so I
continuation: ve began the year off with a little little more unfiltered honesty than usual . I wanted to start with what I loved about 2017 because without these records I would have disliked 2017 and wanted to stab everyone on Facebook .I wanted to make a list of 20 tracks that were my favorites previous year , but that seemed like an exercise in futility for various reasons . Some of these are 2016 albums that I started listening to in 2017 , some of these are 2017 records that I would have started listening to even if the month had ended in an 17 , and some of these albums werent even on my radar until very late in the month .I am not beholden to only records that were published in the calendar year of 2017 ( with the possible exception of a Nickelback record if the world needs to be
paraphrase: A fresh start beckons, and with it, a new perspective on the music industry. The harsh winter and unfamiliar surroundings in Boston have sparked a renewed desire for honesty and authenticity. Rather than create a list of 20 favorite tracks from 2017, I have decided to focus on the albums that truly resonated with me, regardless of their release date. Some of these gems were discovered in 2016, while others were only introduced to me towards the end of 2017. The common thread is that they have left an indelible mark on my listening experience. Emboldened by the changing seasons, I have embraced a more unfiltered approach to music appreciation, no longer bound by arbitrary calendar dates.

input:
Employers rushing to automatically enroll workers in retirement plans and directing the money to one-stop life-cycle funds are leaving old-fashioned investment advice behind in a cloud of so much dust.
That may be a mistake, say advice providers, who
continuation: say the advice would be more helpful than its get credit for . Those who believe their firms defined commitment plans create a superior retirement savings experience would benefit from talking with a respected advisor , according to the Employee Benefit Research Institute .Those with high yearly incomes or higher education levels , or who have a higher net worth , also are more likely to sought advice , according to the institute . Plans that automatically enroll workers at 3 percent with a yearly boost might be sufficient for some , but possibly not those who believe a 4 percent allocation is suitable , according to Andrew Ang , a scholar at Northwestern Universitys Kellogg School of Management .But advisers and providers might worry that the employer will say workers are getting advice if its come from a plan - level fund , Ang said . Im not certain thats the case .Workers
paraphrase:
Employers are hastily ushering workers into retirement plans and directing their savings into one-stop life-cycle funds, leaving traditional investment advice in the dust. (1st paraphrased sentence)
However, some experts claim that this approach may be misguided, as personalized advice could be more beneficial than it is given credit for. (2nd paraphrased sentence)
Those who believe their companies' defined contribution plans create a superior retirement savings experience would greatly benefit from consulting with a seasoned advisor, according to the Employee Benefit Research Institute. (3rd paraphrased sentence)
Furthermore, those with higher incomes or educational attainment, or those with a higher net worth, are more likely to seek advice, the institute found. (4th paraphrased sentence)
While some believe that automatically enrolling workers at 3% with annual increases may be sufficient for some, others argue that a 4% allocation might be more appropriate, according to Andrew Ang, a scholar at Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management. (5th paraphrased sentence)
Advisers and providers may worry that workers will assume the advice is coming from the plan-level fund, which may raise concerns, Ang noted. (6th paraphrased sentence)
Workers, on the other hand, may be uncertain about the value of employer-provided advice. (7th paraphrased sentence)
In summary, employers are rapidly adopting auto-enrollment and one-stop life-cycle funds, but some experts believe that personalized advice could be more beneficial for workers.

input: In summertime, many women shelve their foundation and reach for beauty products that proffer a sheer, sun-kissed glow. In unpracticed hands, however, tinted moisturizers and bronzers can streak and pool faster than a
continuation: redwood got chopped down . Learn the right way to getting that sun - kissed glow , then try these nude makeup products that work on any skin tone and look amazing paired with natural makeup looks .How to do nude makeup : 11 steps This barely - there makeup look is the perfect choice for a bright summer day , but its also fabulous for weekends when you want to have a lazy day in bed . Since the results seem natural but sophisticated , youll never know the difference between spending a morning in the spa versus curling up with a decent book .For the most part , youll look like you dont have a stitch of makeup on . All you need to do is follow these simple steps to appear like you just walked out of a spa .Lay down a layer of primer . Use
paraphrase:
This summer, many women trade in their heavy foundation for lightweight, sun-kissed beauty products. However, novice application can lead to uneven, streaky results that resemble a redwood forest clear-cut. Fear not, as we will reveal the secret to achieving a natural, radiant glow without any hassle. To attain this effortless look, we have curated a selection of nude makeup products that complement any skin tone and work beautifully with natural makeup styles.
To create a flawless nude makeup look, follow these 11 simple steps:
1. Apply a layer of primer to create a smooth canvas for your makeup.
2. Use a tinted moisturizer to add a subtle, sun-kissed glow to your complexion.
3. Bronzer is the next step, but be careful not to overdo it, as it can quickly become too dark and obvious.
4. Continue to build up your glow with a shimmering highlighter applied to the high points of your face.
5. Softly blend a pink-based lip balm to add a touch of color to your lips.
6. Enhance your eyes with a light brown or gray eyeshadow applied to the inner corners of your eyes.
7. Define your brows with a subtle, clear brow gel.
8. Set your makeup with a light-hold hairspray to keep everything in place.
9. Finish off your look with a light dusting of setting powder to keep your skin looking smooth and polished.
10. Take a step back and admire your radiant, effortless look, perfect for brighter days or cozy nights in.

In conclusion, with these simple tips and products, anyone can achieve a natural, sun-kissed glow that looks effortless yet sophisticated. So, say goodbye to heavy makeup and hello to a bright, carefree summer.

input:
LOS ANGELES  Dusty Baker has had a distinguished baseball career, through 19 seasons as a major league player and 22 more as a manager (and three Manager of the Year awards).
Yet Baker, who turns 69 in a week, readily acknowledges
continuation: he hasnt known enough . Hes still educating himself about the game .And so , he is in Cleveland this summer , for his third trip to Progressive Field in 11 weeks . Already , hes been here to see Indians pitching trainer Mickey Callaways work and a few other Cleveland areas of interest .And as the San Francisco Giants arrive in Cleveland for their four - game series against the Indians , hell take along a pitcher who impressed him in Cleveland this past spring . Jared Hughes , who was a minor - league free agent a year earlier , signed with the Indians and making their opening - day roster .He made two spot starts and was designated for assignment on April 29 , ultimately being sent to Triple - A Columbus . On May 22 , the Giants claimed him off waivers .Hughes
paraphrase: Dusty Baker has had an illustrious baseball career spanning 19 seasons as a major league player and 22 more as a manager, earning him three Manager of the Year awards. Despite his extensive knowledge, Baker humbly admits he still has much to learn. This summer, he is embarking on his third trip to Progressive Field in Cleveland in 11 weeks, where he has been observing the Indians' pitching trainer, Mickey Callaway, and exploring other areas of interest. As the San Francisco Giants prepare to face the Indians in a four-game series, Baker will be bringing along a promising pitcher he encountered in Cleveland earlier in the season. Jared Hughes, who was a minor league free agent the previous year, impressed Baker enough to earn a spot on the Indians' opening day roster. However, he was later designated for assignment on April 29 and eventually sent to Triple-A Columbus. The Giants subsequently claimed him off waivers on May 22.

input: What if the research agenda of the University of Texas College of Natural Sciences were drafted not by the professors who actually conduct the studies but by, say, the alumni who funded the department? We might end up with research on the stickiness of Mr.
continuation: Sloans left nostril hairs , or Mr . Steptoes work on the auditory impact of broken hemorrhoids , or Mrs . Jacksons attempts to train her puppy , Rex , to gulp oysters . The graduates might be perfectly within their rights to finance such studies and the teachers would be under no obligation to accept the money .The point , however , is that we wouldnt desire our research projects to be regulated by such tastes , even if they were only tastes of one people and not a huge group . Same goes for investments in the private sector .There are problems with having government running everything but that doesnt mean the private sector is pure and untainted . Mind - control legislation , notably that included in the 1996 Telecommunications Act , has had unusual consequences , most including the Great Opposition
paraphrase: What if the research agenda of the University of Texas College of Natural Sciences were guided not by the professors themselves, but rather by the alumni who financially support the department? We might end up with studies on topics such as the sticky nature of Mr. Sloan's left nostril hairs, Mr. Steptoes' work on the auditory effects of broken hemorrhoids, or Mrs. Jackson's efforts to train her puppy, Rex, to consume oysters. While the graduates have every right to fund such research, it is important to recognize that allowing external influences to dictate the direction of academic research can lead to undesirable outcomes. The same can be said for private sector investments. While it is true that government intervention has its own set of problems, the idea that the private sector is immune from outside influences is overly simplistic. For example, the 1996 Telecommunications Act has had unintended consequences, including the Great Opposition.

input: Most of mobile right now is focused on trying to figure out where the whales arethe big dollar advertising, says Jeffrey Peden. Seems to be an accurate statement, considering the big deal activity Boston has seen lately with major mobile
continuation: players like OnMobile , Exelis , Q - Aim , and Stayzilla . A glance at Bostons past five major deals shows that seven of the eight were mobile - related .Peden suggests Boston companies may have many opportunities in this industry as the space continues to expand . Though the Boston area is probably not the first spot youd think of when you consider about mobile technology , Peden adds his survey demonstrates Boston has had a long tradition of mobile technology that predates the regions present fame as a hub for high - technology giants .Back in the 1980s and 1990s , Boston companies popularized a variety of telephone and wireless technologies . These included UTStarcom , Polycom , Bay Networks , and Nokia .However , the companies that Peden surveyed never became the behemoths that we remember them to be nowadays . They had the
paraphrase: Most mobile companies today are concentrated on locating where the whales are when it comes to advertising, according to Jeffrey Peden. It appears that this statement is accurate based on the recent high-profile deals in Boston, which have included major mobile players like OnMobile, Exelis, Q-Aim, and Stayzilla. A quick look at Boston's last five significant deals reveals that seven of the eight were mobile-related. Peden suggests that Boston companies may have many opportunities in this industry as it continues to expand. Although Boston may not be the first place that comes to mind when thinking about mobile technology, Peden's survey suggests that the region has a long history of mobile technology dating back to the 1980s and 1990s, when Boston companies were instrumental in popularizing various telephone and wireless technologies such as UTStarcom, Polycom, Bay Networks, and Nokia. However, the companies surveyed by Peden never reached the same level of success as they do today.

input:
A quick run-through of basic measures of investment value for shares and stock markets.
The most widely used calculation, this ratio compares a companys value with its profits. To work it out, you take the share price and divide it
continuation: by the net profit after taxes . Profits are typically calculated in two ways : net profit or operating profit .The net profit is the end result of all accounting actions , including taxes and any regulations made . The operating profit is calculated after removing various costs and costs .The higher the ratio , the higher the value is put on a companys ability to earn profits . A measure of a companys efficiency at turning its capital into revenues .The ratio is calculated by separating the net profit after taxes by the book price of gross assets . The book price of assets gives how many it would cost the company to replace all its assets , as of the financial year ending .This does not necessarily reflect the present market price of these assets . Book value / Market value This ratio represents the relationship between a companys book price and its market price .It is calculated by dividing the book price of gross assets by the stock price . Price /
paraphrase:
A brief overview of key measures of investment value for shares and stock markets.
The most commonly used metric, this ratio compares a company's value with its profits. To calculate it, you divide the share price by the net profit after taxes, which is the result of all accounting actions, including taxes and regulatory adjustments. A higher ratio indicates a higher valuation of a company's ability to generate profits.
Another measure of a company's efficiency in converting its capital into revenue is the price-to-book ratio. This is calculated by dividing the net profit after taxes by the book value of gross assets, which represents how much it would cost the company to replace all its assets as of the financial year ending. However, this does not necessarily reflect the current market price of those assets.
Finally, the price-to-market ratio compares a company's book value to its market price. This is calculated by dividing the book value of gross assets by the stock price. This ratio represents the relationship between a company's intrinsic value and its market value.
In summary, these measures provide valuable insights into a company's financial health and market valuation, allowing investors to make informed investment decisions.

input: One of the nifty new features that debuted in Firefox 3.5 last week was support for the W3C Geolocation API Specification, a Web standard that can fake a GPS-like effect by using clues such as the Wi-Fi networks
continuation: a user is linked to to identify where that user is situated . The new Firefox feature worked wonderful when I tested it , and while Im a believer in Web technology , Im also a believer in good old - fashioned spookware , so I decided to hack up a simple Firefox add - on called ShareMyLocation that helps you share the GPS coordinates of your location with whomever you like .Im sure there will be some people who thought its an incredibly creepy stuff to do , and I can see where thats coming from . My own took is that theres a ton of information leaked every night , as we broadcast our whereabouts by cellphone , Facebook , and Twitter .Why not letting folks know where you are without being creepy about it ? The Geolocation spec defines six potential features and apps can use whichever features are supported .For
paraphrase: One of the exciting new features introduced in Firefox 3.5 last week was support for the W3C Geolocation API Specification, a web standard that can simulate a GPS-like effect by using clues such as Wi-Fi networks to determine a user's location. When I tested the new feature, it worked seamlessly, and as a believer in both web technology and traditional spyware, I decided to create a simple Firefox add-on called ShareMyLocation, which allows users to share their GPS coordinates with others. While some may find this feature creepy, I argue that there is already a wealth of information broadcast each night through cellphones, social media, and other sources. Why not be more open about one's location? The Geolocation spec defines six potential features, and apps can utilize whichever are supported.

input: A new travel site called Rome2Rio launches today, the brainchild of two ex-Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren. The sites main innovation? Its vehicle agnostic, in a way
continuation: that few travel locations have been to date . Whereas much sites focus on which flights you can take from point A to point B , for example , and some focus on driving directions ( though , in reality , not many ) , Rome2Rio is focused on telling you precisely what you need to do to getting from A to B , whether thats traveling by car , bus , railway , or jet .Its even tackling carpooling ( or carsharing ) for the first time . To date , the site has gained funding from angel partners , and has not raised a venture round .The site itself doesnt look like much if youve shown Kayak , youve witnessed a very identical layout but this particular niche of travel is surprisingly underserved by anyone like a cross - matching of rates , times , and paths . And whats more , it turns out that those same routes can shift depending
paraphrase: Today marks the launch of Rome2Rio, a groundbreaking travel platform created by two former Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren. The site's novelty lies in its vehicle-agnostic approach, a rarity in the travel industry thus far. Most travel websites focus on flights from point A to point B, while some provide driving directions, but Rome2Rio sets itself apart by offering a comprehensive guide to reaching your destination, be it by car, bus, train, or even carpooling/carsharing (a first for the industry). Despite gaining funding from angel investors, the site has yet to raise a venture round. The layout may look familiar to those who've used Kayak, but Rome2Rio's niche of travel is surprisingly underserved, with a cross-comparison of rates, times, and paths that the site aims to provide. And, as a bonus, these routes can change depending on various factors.

input:
The salesman, showman and visionary who dreamed up the Indianapolis 500 would be proud: The 100th running this weekend will host the first official sellout and one of its largest crowds to date.
But "Crazy" Carl G. Fisher --
continuation: so - called by fellow businessman John Dillinger - - was always about much more than large races . He did it all .His brash business acumen , vision and persistence propelled him to the pinnacle of both Indianapolis auto sport and the glitterati of early - 20th - century society . He built the auto trade into the nation ' s second - largest company , on a par with General Motors and Ford .As if that wasn ' t enough , he dabbled in medicine and politics , too . He ' s also a man who was born and died on what ' s now a landfill site , who failed to pay his property taxation and once taken the Studebaker automobile corporation public in a midnight - day stock - market debacle .He was colorful , sure , but there ' s no question his was a life without rules . " When they
paraphrase:
The visionary entrepreneur and showman who conceived the Indianapolis 500 would be ecstatic about this weekend's 100th running, which will feature the first official sellout and one of the largest crowds to date.
Carl G. Fisher, affectionately known as "Crazy," was a man of many talents and pursuits. He was a trailblazer in the world of Indianapolis auto racing and a prominent figure in the glitterati of early 20th-century society. Through his unwavering business acumen, innovative vision, and unrelenting drive, he built his company into the nation's second-largest auto manufacturer, on par with industry giants like General Motors and Ford. However, his entrepreneurial spirit didn't stop there. He also dabbled in medicine and politics, further cementing his status as a true Renaissance man. Despite facing setbacks like failing to pay property taxes and experiencing a public stock debacle with the Studebaker automobile corporation, Fisher's life was a testament to the power of unbridled ambition and creativity.

Eastern Libyan forces have reportedly taken control of the town of Gharyan, less than 100 kilometers from
continuation: the capital , Tripoli . Forces faithful to Eastern Libyan army leader Khalifa Haftar seized the strategic town on Tuesday , according to the Libya al - Ahrar media agency , which is associated with the militia groups that favor Haftar .The decision coming soon after the town was shelled by Tripoli - based forces . Haftar , the leader of the so - called Libyan National Army , has been pushing a army campaign against a variety of militias aligned with the internationally acknowledged regime in Tripoli .The decision threatens to escalate a war that has already killed 1 , 000 people since April and compelled 200 , 000 to escape the fought in and around the capital . Gharyan ' s fall may pave the way for the LNA to reach the
paraphrase: Commander Khalifa Haftar of the eastern-based forces in Libya attended a security conference in Benghazi on October 14, 2017. Reports indicate that eastern Libyan forces have taken control of the strategic town of Gharyan, located around 100 kilometers from the capital Tripoli. According to the Libya al-Ahrar media agency, which is associated with militia groups supporting Haftar, the town was seized on Tuesday following shelling by Tripoli-based forces. Haftar, the leader of the Libyan National Army, has been leading an offensive against various militias allied with the internationally recognized regime in Tripoli. The development threatens to escalate a conflict that has resulted in over 1,000 deaths and displaced 200,000 people since April. Gharyan's capture could pave the way for Haftar's forces to advance closer to the capital.
