input: Whyallas Citizen of the Year Karen Harrison has urged everyone to consider nominating a worthy community member, group or event for next years Australia Day Awards. The City of Whyalla has extended nominations for the 2019 Australia Day awards to
continuation: tomorrow , November 15 , and all forms are available at the Citys office at 61 Ken Rattray Drive or the Visitor Information Centre at 67 Ken Rattray Drive . Nominations will then be thought by a committee , who will narrow them down to five in each category for presentation to a final awards committee to make their selection for each category .Ms Harrison , the 2018 Citizen of the Year and winner of the service category honor , encouraged citizens to select someone who should be considered for one of the awards , which cover 12 categories from Junior Citizen of the Year , to Community Event of the Year and Citizen of the Year , and one of the three categories - Sporting Achievement , Community Event of the Year or Citizen of the Year - is also granted to an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander person , as well as an aged , culturally
paraphrase: Karen Harrison, the esteemed Whyalla Citizen of the Year for 2018, is urging residents to consider nominating deserving individuals, groups, or events for the Australia Day Awards next year. The City of Whyalla has extended the nomination deadline to November 15 and forms are available at the City Office (61 Ken Rattray Drive) and the Visitor Information Centre (67 Ken Rattray Drive). A committee will review the nominations and select five finalists in each category, which will then be presented to a final awards committee for final selection. Ms. Harrison, a previous winner in the service category, encourages the community to recognize outstanding contributors by submitting nominations. The awards encompass 12 categories, including Junior Citizen of the Year, Community Event of the Year, and Citizen of the Year, with one category reserved for an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander person, as well as an aged, culturally diverse, or disability-focused nominee.

input: Students in the New Hartford Central School District and other area school districts are set to learn an old subject in a new way. Pretty soon, theyll tackle physics, and theyll do it with the speed and ease of the Internet
continuation: . Just tell science professor Chad Roozen .Hes one of the dozen teachers in the district training to be a module leader for Connected Math , an interactive online system through which mathematics lessons at the middle and high school levels can be taught via the Internet . The project is designed to increase the pace and decrease the degree of tension and confusion that comes with typical mathematics lessons .The course work is designed to the pupils , allowing them to move at their own speed and learn the material without skipping ahead or falling too far behind . Its all about the math and being successful at mathematics , and I dont want a kid to not have a chance to take math because of fear and failure , Roozen stated .A handful of students are already in the program , which is already in its pilot stages . In January , that program will expand into a completely unified curriculum .In addition to helping kids connect math to their everyday lives
paraphrase: In the New Hartford Central School District and neighboring areas, students are set to embark on a unique learning experience. They will delve into the realm of physics with the same ease and speed as exploring the vastness of the internet. Science professor Chad Roozen is one of the dozen educators in the district who are being trained to lead modules for Connected Math, an innovative online platform that will facilitate mathematics lessons at the middle and high school levels. The project aims to alleviate the stress and confusion often associated with traditional mathematics classes, allowing students to progress at their own pace and focus on mastering the subject matter. According to Roozen, the program is designed to provide students with a personalized learning experience, empowering them to take control of their math education and overcome any fears or challenges that may arise. Currently, a small group of students are participating in the pilot phase of the program, which will be fully implemented by January. By integrating Connected Math into the curriculum, students will not only develop a deeper understanding of mathematics but also learn how to apply it to their everyday lives.

input:
NOTTINGHAM  The sale of USA Springs property on Monday has been postponed for three months after the company filed for bankruptcy.
A representative from James St. James Auctioneers, of Manchester, which was scheduled to conduct the auction, confirmed company representatives
continuation: informed the company of the shift in status Thursday . Company administrators did not return a phone call demanding comment .Linda McCormick , broker for the company , said she believed the bankruptcy filing was brought on by recent actions by the Town of Nottingham to collect its portion of property taxation . A report from the town assessing bureau revealed the property , located at 100 Sawmill Road , was taxed at $ 36 , 757 , representing a 53 percent discount from the property ' s appraised value of $ 75 , 500 .The evaluation statement said Nottingham is owed $ 3 , 246 in taxes for the present fiscal year , which passes through June 30 . After the 2004 - 05 fiscal year ended , the town released tax notices to companies that had failed to
paraphrase: The bankruptcy filing by USA Springs has resulted in the postponement of the property sale, initially scheduled for Monday. According to a representative from James St. James Auctioneers, the company filed for bankruptcy on Thursday, causing the shift in status. Despite attempts to contact company administrators for comment, they did not return phone calls. The broker for the company, Linda McCormick, believes the bankruptcy filing may have been triggered by recent actions taken by the Town of Nottingham to collect its share of property taxes. A report from the town's assessment bureau revealed that the property, located at 100 Sawmill Road, was taxed at $36,757, representing a 53% discount from its appraised value of $75,500. The town is currently owed $3,246 in taxes for the current fiscal year, which ends on June 30. After the 2004-05 fiscal year ended, the town issued tax notices to companies that had failed to pay their taxes.

input:
BANKS FAVORED week-long term deposits this week, resulting in a sustained decline in yields for these papers despite an uptrend seen for longer tenors.
Offers for Wednesdays auction reached P60.829 billion
continuation: , lower than last weeks P61 . 397 billion . The oversubscription rate was 0 . 39 times , which is a lot smaller than the previous auction held last week at 1 . 01 times .This shows a substantial drop in bank demand as a result of a significantly greater interest rates environment , said Global Securities chief of research Jose Paolo Dy . Offers at the auction for P60 billion allotted 1 . 5 weeks to 2 years were reduced to P34 billion from P44 . 617 billion last month .Bids on the four - month to six - month section remained at P26 . 829 billion . Demand from non - banking organizations was especially subdued for the longer tenors , which reveals us that the banks are run out of maturity for their established term deposit liabilities , Dy said .
paraphrase:
Banks recently preferred week-long term deposits, leading to a consistent decrease in yields for these investments despite an upward trend in longer tenors.
The latest auction received offers worth P60.829 billion, which is lower than last week's P61.397 billion. The oversubscription rate decreased to 0.39 times, significantly smaller than the previous auction at 1.01 times. This suggests a reduced demand from banks due to the current higher interest rate environment, according to Global Securities' Chief of Research, Jose Paolo Dy. Offers for P60 billion across 1.5 to 2 years were reduced to P34 billion from P44.617 billion last month. Bids on the 4-month to 6-month segment remained steady at P26.829 billion. Non-banking organizations showed subdued demand for longer tenors, indicating that banks are facing maturity issues with their existing term deposit liabilities, Dy added.

" Their views were generally accepted in post -
paraphrase:
The passage begins by referencing a French comedy from the 16th century, highlighting a judge's fixation on a particular question. The author then shifts their focus to the current situation in Iraq, expressing concern over what they perceive as a Christian invasion and oppression of Arab tribes, and the potential for a religious and national conflict in the region. input:
Although final results are not expected until later, the scale of the predicted victory is such that the ruling Congress party has admitted defeat.
BJP leader Narendra Modi tweeted: "India has won. Good times ahead."
This is the most resounding
continuation: election victory the BJP has ever won and , for the first time , the party has won a decisive victory in a southern state . But the Congress party has never been defeated so heavily in a general election .With results from the remainder of the nation expected over the last two days , that means Mr Modi is on course for the biggest victory by a prime minister since the days of the " Law secretary " Rajiv Gandhi . Following his resounding victory in Uttar Pradesh state , with a majority in the Lok Sabha , the BJP ' s Mr Modi is in pole position to become India ' s prime minister .A BJP win would bring an ending to Congress rule which has been in power since 2004 . The result of the general election has additionally ensured that Congress will lose control of every one of the 13 states they won in the 2012 state
paraphrase: Despite initial results not yet available, the predicted landslide victory for the BJP has prompted the ruling Congress party to concede defeat. BJP leader Narendra Modi took to Twitter to express his excitement, proclaiming "India has emerged victorious. Exciting times are ahead." This decisive election victory marks the BJP's most significant electoral triumph to date, as they have achieved a historic first by securing a resounding victory in a southern state. Moreover, the Congress party has never been defeated so soundly in a national election. As results from the remaining areas are expected over the next two days, Mr. Modi is poised to secure the largest victory by a prime minister since the era of Rajiv Gandhi. Following his emphatic victory in Uttar Pradesh, Mr. Modi is well-positioned to become India's next prime minister. A BJP win would spell the end of Congress rule, which has been in power since 2004. The outcome of the general election has further ensured that Congress will lose control of all 13 states they won in the 2012 state elections.

input:
High tide has passed in Cork city without flooding although a flood warning remains in place for part of the city centre during tomorrow morning's high tide.
The council says high tides and potentially high winds may cause flooding between 6am and 8am tomorrow morning
continuation: in Rushbrooke at the bottom of Patrick Street . Cork ' s Flood Warning system is now in place .It ' s up and ran again now and the council thinks a precautionary Flood Warning is in place for Friday . Much of Cork city ' s shoreline is at risk of tidal flooding during tomorrow ' s high tide and any windstorms .The council thinks the most endangered areas are Rushbrooke , Ballinlough , Blackpool , Raffeen , Monahan ' s , Aghada and Ballincollig . The council has advised the public to be aware and to keep an eye out for changes to the scheme ' s flood alert and warning levels .In case of an emergency, the council asks that the public dial 999 or 112 and if the council, the Gardai
paraphrase: Cork city has safely navigated the high tide without any flooding, although a flood warning remains in effect for a portion of the city center during tomorrow's morning high tide. The local council warns that strong tides and potential winds could lead to flooding between 6am and 8am on Friday morning in the Rushbrooke area at the base of Patrick Street. Cork's Flood Warning system is now operational and a precautionary Flood Warning has been issued for the same day. Many areas along Cork's coastline are at risk of tidal flooding during tomorrow's high tide and any subsequent windstorms. The most vulnerable areas are believed to be Rushbrooke, Ballinlough, Blackpool, Raffeen, Monahan's, Aghada, and Ballincollig. The council urges the public to remain vigilant and to monitor changes in the flood alert and warning levels. In the event of an emergency, the public is advised to contact 999 or 112, or the local authorities if necessary.

paraphrase: John Mansholt, the girls soccer coach at Jacksonville High School, will also be leading the MacMurray College men's soccer team this fall. input:
The U.S. Army veteran and Clarksville-based Realtor is the first Democrat to enter the race to replace Congressman Mark Green.
Democrat Juanita Charles, a U.S. Army veteran and Clarksville-based Realt
continuation: or , has confirmed her intention to sought the Democratic nomination for Congress in the First Congressional District . Charles made her announcement during the annual Clarksville Martin Luther King Jr . Day Celebration Breakfast on Monday at New Vision Fellowship Church .Charles is the first Democratic candidate to enter the race to succeed U . S . Rep . Mark Green . Green , a Republican , announced later this month that he would not seek a third term .Green was first elected to Congress in November 2016 after unseating two - term Democrat Jim Cooper . Charles , 61 , who resides in Clarksville , said Monday that her decision to run came from the belief that our nation wants a leader who will putting people and their issues first .As a veteran , I understand what its like to put your life on the line to save our nation . As a mother , I know
paraphrase:
A Clarksville resident and U.S. Army veteran, Juanita Charles, has announced her intention to run for the Democratic nomination in the First Congressional District. Charles made her announcement at the annual Clarksville Martin Luther King Jr. Day Celebration Breakfast on Monday at New Vision Fellowship Church.
As a seasoned Realtor and U.S. Army veteran, Charles believes that her background and experience make her uniquely qualified to serve the people of the First Congressional District. "I want to be a leader who prioritizes the needs of our community," Charles said. "As a veteran, I know the sacrifices that must be made to protect our nation, and as a mother, I understand the importance of putting people first."
Charles, 61, who resides in Clarksville, is the first Democratic candidate to enter the race to succeed U.S. Rep. Mark Green, who has announced that he will not seek a third term. Green, a Republican, was first elected to Congress in 2016 and has served two terms.
In her announcement, Charles emphasized her commitment to putting the needs of the people first and ensuring that everyone has access to quality healthcare, education, and economic opportunities. "I believe that our nation wants a leader who will work tirelessly to improve the lives of all Americans," Charles said. "I am excited to hit the ground running and to work with the people of the First Congressional District to build a better future for our community."

input:
Dedicating a Sunday in May to sharing the gospel of Jesus Christ through music is a long-standing tradition at Wheaton's Gary United Methodist Church.
On Sunday, May 20, during the 9 and 11 a.m. services, the
continuation: GUMC Praise Team will be performing " I Need You More , " " I Bow Down " and " Soon & Very Soon . " In keeping with the faith ' s mission statement of " Sharing Christ ' s Love in Word & Deed , " the team ' s song selections complement the third chapter of Hebrews , which concerns with a life devoted to serving God .The tracks selected reflect a desire to connect worshipers to the message of their faith and to the community of faith . The music of each of the selections emphasizes the gratitude to God , even in hard times , and a joyful spirit that proclaims the love of Christ .On the night before he was arrested , Jesus prayed that his disciples might be united in one body . Today , Wheaton ' s Gary United Methodist Church , one of several churches in the greater Chicago area , strives to be a community dedicated to that vision .
paraphrase: Sharing the gospel of Jesus Christ through music on a Sunday in May has been a time-honored tradition at Gary United Methodist Church in Wheaton. During the 9 and 11 am services on May 20th, the church's Praise Team will perform three uplifting songs, including "I Need You More," "I Bow Down," and "Soon & Very Soon." These selections align with the church's mission to share Christ's love through word and deed, as they are drawn from the third chapter of Hebrews, which emphasizes a life dedicated to serving God. The music of each selection conveys a sense of gratitude to God, even in difficult times, and a joyful spirit that proclaims the love of Christ. On the eve of his arrest, Jesus prayed for his followers to be united in one body, and Wheaton's Gary United Methodist Church strives to embody this vision as a community of faith.

input: A glimmer of light is flickering at the end of a dark tunnel at Dundee, whose supporters' trust, Dee4Life, has co-ordinated a Company Voluntary Arrangement (CVA) to pull the Scottish First Division club
continuation: out of financial crisis . The trust has advised members and creditors that it has taken a substantial loan to fill the cash - flow gap created by Scottish League and Premier League finances being withheld due to 15 cases of potential rule breaches .A report published by club owner Steven Thompson and the Dundee Dee4Life partnership stated : The club is in a precarious position and is currently reliant on the goodwill of creditors to assist it continue to trade . It has been an eventful 10 days since the team revealed the key details of the CVA .In short , the board and Dee4Life partnership , including the supporters trust , have stepped up to fill the gap to secure the clubs future . A substantial loan has been agreed from one of our consortium partners , John Bennett , and it will be used to ensure
paraphrase: A glimmer of hope emerges at Dundee, as the supporters' trust, Dee4Life, leads the charge to rescue the ailing Scottish First Division club from financial peril. In a bold move, the trust has arranged a Company Voluntary Arrangement (CVA) to prop up the club, which has been left reeling from the withholding of Scottish League and Premier League finances due to 15 cases of potential rule breaches. A report by the club owner and Dee4Life partnership reveals that Dundee is teetering on the brink of collapse and is currently dependent on the generosity of creditors to keep it afloat. In a remarkable turn of events, the board and Dee4Life partnership, including the supporters trust, have come together to fill the financial gap and ensure the club's survival. A substantial loan has been secured from one of the consortium partners, John Bennett, which will be used to stabilize the club's finances and secure its future.

" Cyn
paraphrase: This year's CIO Leadership Award finalists include Cynthia Nustad, Health Management Systems' senior vice president and CIO, who has demonstrated exceptional leadership and management skills. Stocks: Emerging from a month-long funk?
April has been a tough month for investors, with the Nasdaq taking a sharp dive and the other major markets languishing in negative territory.
But U.S. stock futures were pointing
continuation: to a higher opening Monday , giving analysts confidence that the market has finally put the volatility of the first quarter behind it . The question now is whether the bounce will be sufficient to setting off a broader rebound .The week ' s major news , apart from the first quarter numbers , is the U . S . - China trade deal . President Donald Trump expressed over the night that he believes that tariffs on Chinese goods will remain in place , but he will still announce " Phase One " of the deal that has been agreed upon with Beijing .Trump has also said he ' s willing to make other guarantees , such as reducing tariffs on Chinese electronics and apparel , in order to keep U . S . consumers satisfied . " With the news come out of the U . S . trade agreements with China . . .I believe the markets will heal and shift higher , " said
paraphrase:
Investors breathe sigh of relief as stocks emerge from month-long slump.
April has been a challenging month for investors, with the Nasdaq experiencing a sharp decline and other major markets struggling in negative territory. However, U.S. stock futures are pointing towards a higher opening on Monday, giving analysts renewed confidence that the market has put its first-quarter volatility behind it. The question now is whether this bounce will be enough to spark a broader rebound. This week's major news, in addition to the first-quarter numbers, includes the U.S.-China trade deal. President Donald Trump has announced that he believes tariffs on Chinese goods will remain in place, but he is still set to announce "Phase One" of the agreement reached with Beijing. Trump has also expressed willingness to make other concessions, such as reducing tariffs on Chinese electronics and apparel, to keep U.S. consumers satisfied. "With the news emerging from the U.S. trade agreements with China...I believe the markets will stabilize and recover," said [insert analyst name].

You say chorizo, I say....? Exactly how to pronounce the spicy pork sausage has got viewers of Masterchef in a pickle. But is there a right way and a wrong way?
"Iberico pork with grilled calam
continuation: ari and shellfish . Here we are , one week into Masterchef Australia Season 10 and we are already facing some uncertainty .Not just about who will go home next , but over something that has bedevilled our nation for countless years : the pronunciation of chorizo . Actor and self - declared meat lover Kurt Fearnley using his final MasterChef meal party to give Australia some closure on this burning topic , and Twitter users are pretty split on how to pronounce it .' You said chorizo , I say chor - ee - soh , ' he informed the cameras . ' And that ' s how we should all pronounce it . 'One listener obviously hadn ' t been listening , and tweeted that he pronounced it like ' cold soy ' . But the debate over the appropriate pronunciation of chorizo has raged for decades , mostly amongst chefs
paraphrase: The great chorizo conundrum has captured the attention of Masterchef viewers, with Kurt Fearnley, actor and self-proclaimed meat enthusiast, determined to bring closure to the issue. Despite his firm pronunciation of "chor-ee-soh," Twitter users remain divided, with one individual insisting on "cold soy." input: PHILADELPHIA  Today, electrophysiologists from Penn Medicine implanted the regions first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) for sudden cardiac arrest, a potentially fatal electrical malfunction
continuation: of the heart that can cause death or left the heart totally damaged . The subcutaneous defibrillator using a pulse generator constructed to stand under the flesh and connect to the heart via electrodes inserted just below the flesh in the upper chest .In past decades , various such machines have been authorized for use , but were now the first to implant one in the region . The new implant allows for more patient comfort , greater procedure time and increased cosmetic outcomes , while reaching the same goal as standard devices to reduce sudden suicide due to hazardous heart rhythms , said Sandeep Sinha , MD , a Penn Medicine cardiologist and associate professor of Medicine in the Perelman School of Medicine .He added , Although these devices are typically indicated in those who have experienced rapid cardiac arrest or are at high danger for it , we anticipate that the subcutaneous ICD will appeal to more patients
paraphrase:
Today, medical professionals from Penn Medicine in Philadelphia successfully implanted the first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) in the region. This innovative device, which is the first of its kind in the area, is designed to treat sudden cardiac arrest, a potentially life-threatening electrical malfunction of the heart. Unlike traditional ICDs, which are inserted under the skin near the heart, this new implant uses a pulse generator located under the skin to deliver electrical shocks to the heart in the event of a life-threatening arrhythmia.
According to Sandeep Sinha, MD, a cardiologist at Penn Medicine and associate professor of Medicine in the Perelman School of Medicine, this new device offers several advantages over traditional ICDs, including greater patient comfort, reduced procedure time, and improved cosmetic outcomes. While the primary goal of these devices remains the same - to reduce the risk of sudden death due to dangerous heart rhythms - the subcutaneous ICD is expected to appeal to a wider range of patients.

The DLP Pico is an ultra low - cost , low - energy , and thin , low profile projection unit that offers crisp , brilliant , pure color pictures at resolutions up to WVGA ( 800 x 480 ) and 100 Lumens of intensity .Built to meet the cost , power and size requirements of mobile computers , the DLP Pico technology lets system manufacturers to create handheld projectors , portable digital systems and ultra small PCs . Additional advantages of the DLP Pico technology include a dedicated microprocessor controller with firmware support that enables for a variety of operating modes from a ' standby ' low power consumption mode to a complete - function system that can
paraphrase:
Motorola is partnering with Microvision, a rival of Texas Instruments, to obtain their pico projector technology.
DLP Products showcased cutting-edge developments in pico projection technology at the SID Display Week event in Dallas, with three manufacturers announcing support for DLP-powered projection in mobile devices. DLP Pico, the newest generation of DLP technology, offers crisp, vibrant, and pure color images at resolutions up to WVGA (800 x 480) and 100 lumens of brightness, all while being ultra-low cost, low-energy, and thin. This technology is ideal for mobile computers, enabling system manufacturers to create handheld projectors, portable digital systems, and miniature PCs. Additionally, the DLP Pico technology features a dedicated microprocessor controller with firmware support, allowing for various operating modes, including a low-power standby mode and a fully functional system that can operate independently.

input: HOUSTON - Feb. 17, 2018 - PRLog -- Demetria Smith is a mortgage broker and community activist. She recently made headlines when the Democratic Party wrongly bumped her from the primary ballot, over a banking mix-up that caused her filing
continuation: documents to be misplaced . Smith fought back and challenged the four - term incumbent in the Democratic Party Primary and is now looking ahead to the general election in May ." Being omitted from the primary election was a surprise , but it made me realize just how important it is for every voter to come out and voting in the General election in May , " added Smith . " We should be grateful for the opportunity to vote in this country and all persons of vote age should make their voice heard . "Smith hopes to be the first African - American female to be elected to the Texas House of Representatives for District 148 , which is in Houston . Smith explained that if she is successful in her candidacy , she plans to invest in the neighborhood and schools ." We need more quality schools courses and employment skills to keep our teens off the streets and out of gangs , " added Smith .
paraphrase:
Demetria Smith, a mortgage broker and community activist, made headlines recently when she was inexplicably removed from the primary ballot by the Democratic Party due to a bureaucratic mix-up. Unfazed by the setback, Smith decided to challenge the incumbent in the primary election and is now preparing for the upcoming general election in May.
"Being left off the primary ballot came as a surprise, but it made me realize just how crucial it is for every voter to participate in the general election," Smith said. "We should all be grateful for the opportunity to exercise our right to vote in this country, and every person of voting age should make their voice heard."
Smith, who is running to become the first African American female representative for Texas House of Representatives in District 148, which encompasses Houston, emphasizes the need for better educational resources in the area. "If I am successful in my candidacy, I plan to invest in our neighborhoods and schools, providing quality educational programs and job training to help our youth stay off the streets and out of gangs," she explained.

continuation: the strategically important harbour of Mariupol , there were increasingly desperate pleas from European leaders to Russian president Vladimir Putin to do something to halt the bloodshed . European foreign ministers urged Russia to use its influence to block what the ministers believed could be a full - blown civil war in Ukraine .At the beginning of May , this debate had already been going on for more than a month . The long list of previous efforts at mediation by European leaders ( for example , the February 21 summit in Berlin between German president Angela Merkel and Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov ) can be putting behind the call for Putin to exercise his influence to halt a full - blown civil war .Washington took up with its own twist on this familiar argument by referring to diplomatic alternatives , as though the U . S . could take
paraphrase: The article was updated and expanded on May 8th and appeared in the June 5th, 2014 issue of The New York Review. As fighting broke out in eastern Ukraine in early May, European leaders pleaded with Russian President Vladimir Putin to intervene to stop the bloodshed. European foreign ministers urged Russia to use its influence to prevent a full-scale civil war in Ukraine. This debate had been ongoing for over a month before May, with previous efforts at mediation by European leaders, such as the February 21st summit in Berlin between German President Angela Merkel and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, contributing to the call for Putin to exercise his influence. Washington also got involved, presenting its own take on the familiar argument by mentioning diplomatic alternatives, as if the US could take action.

BEREA, Ohio -- Trent Richardson and Alfred Morris are good friends, a couple of rookie halfbacks hailing from the same hometown who reached the NFL via different routes.
Richardson came to the Browns from a major college in the first
continuation: round of the 2012 draft , while Morris - - a product of North Carolina ' s small college system - - joined the Washington Redskins in the sixth round . Richardson got a splash in his debut preseason play with Cleveland , but Morris wasn ' t bad himself on Saturday in Washington ' s 24 - 14 win over Carolina .He received 53 yards on 15 carries and seemed deadly when ran between the tackles . Richardson , who had 55 yards on 10 carries in the Browns ' 13 - 6 win over Philadelphia previous week , says Morris has put himself in the mix for regular touches in Washington , particularly with fellow rookie starter Robert Griffin III moving heads ." Yeah , of course , " Richardson said of Morris ' chances . " As a rookie come out you understand it ' s going to take him some
paraphrase: In Berea, Ohio, two rookie halfbacks, Trent Richardson and Alfred Morris, have formed a friendly bond despite their differing paths to the NFL. Richardson was drafted by the Browns in the first round of the 2012 draft, while Morris hails from North Carolina's small college system and joined the Washington Redskins in the sixth round. During their respective preseason debuts, Morris impressed with 53 yards on 15 carries, demonstrating his effectiveness between the tackles. Richardson, who had 55 yards on 10 carries in the Browns' 13-6 win over Philadelphia, acknowledges Morris' potential for regular touches in Washington, particularly with fellow rookie starter Robert Griffin III generating attention. "Of course, he's got a chance," Richardson said of Morris. "As a rookie, he's got to prove himself."

UN official says footage of Sri Lankan troops executing rebel soldiers is genuine.
The footage was shot during the final stages of the Sri Lankan army's battle against the separatist Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE).
Alston said
continuation: his investigators had watched the footage , and that it " remains genuine " , but had been unable to identify exactly when it was taken . " The burial appeared to have been hasty , with a number of the bodies apparently already showing signs of decomposition , " he said in the comment ." While some of the troops have civilian dress , it is difficult to identify whether these are combatants who have sought to mix in with civilians for purposes of strategic or tactical advantage . " Alston was spoke after a four - day trip to the nation in which he interviewed Sri Lankan officials and civil society groups as well as displaced people from the north of the island .In the footage , which was posted on the Internet last week , several men believed to be Tamil Tiger fighters are bound and led to a trench where they are shot . Bodies are then shoved into
paraphrase: A United Nations official has confirmed that footage of Sri Lankan troops executing rebel soldiers is genuine, shot during the final stages of the army's battle against the separatist Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE). The footage shows several men believed to be Tamil Tiger fighters bound and led to a trench where they are shot, with their bodies later being shoved into a burial site. Despite investigators' efforts to identify when the footage was taken, the burial appears to have been hasty, with signs of decomposition already visible on some of the bodies. It is unclear whether some of the troops in civilian dress are combatants trying to blend in with civilians for strategic or tactical advantage. The official spoke after a four-day trip to the country during which they interviewed Sri Lankan officials, civil society groups, and displaced people from the north of the island.

Max Levchin, the founder of recently-acquired Slide and co-founder of PayPal, has been named Google's newest vice president of engineering.
Levchin joined the company as part of Google's $182 million acquisition of Slide, the company
continuation: he founded in 2005 . He will serve as VP of engineering , responsible for Google ' s social initiatives , which feature a handful of existing products , like Google Talk and Google Friend Connect , as well as those under development .His adding represents a substantial win for Google , which is trying to compete with Facebook in the social space . The $ 182 million buy of Slide is among Google ' s major purchases .A photograph from Levchin ' s blog reveals that the start - up impresario now sports an honorary " google . com " email address . " Holy S * * t , I ' m really working for Google now , " Levchin wrote on his blog .
paraphrase: Max Levchin, the founder of recently acquired Slide and co-founder of PayPal, has been appointed as Google's new vice president of engineering. Levchin joined the company as part of Google's $182 million acquisition of Slide, which he founded in 2005. In his new role, he will be responsible for Google's social initiatives, overseeing a range of existing products such as Google Talk and Google Friend Connect, as well as those in development. This move represents a significant victory for Google as it looks to compete with Facebook in the social space. The $182 million purchase of Slide is one of Google's major acquisitions. A recent blog post from Levchin shows that the startup entrepreneur now has an honored email address @google.com, exclaiming, "Holy S*&t, I'm really working for Google now!"

Sometime in 2000, my colleague Verlyn started bringing his Mac laptop to our New York Times editorial board meetings. The rest of us would
continuation: lean over and trying to watch the screen a privilege that , we all feeling , should have been extended to all . We expected our meetings to have the same level of transparency as our policy decisions .It took us years , but we actually won the fight to make all our sessions open to all of our journalists and journalists . Today , the board is fewer co - located and staffers interact with each other primarily online .We use Slack , a team collaboration framework , to make choices and solve issues . On Slack , we have public outlets where we have discussions , post documents and make other remarks .These discussions , posts and comments can all be public . While there is still a place for face - to - face conversations , Slack has much expanded the kinds of talks we have .For instance , we may talk about a story or a situation that
paraphrase: In early 2015, I captured an image of the Apple Inc. logo in Lille, France. Years later, during a New York Times editorial board meeting, my colleague Verlyn began bringing his Mac laptop, and we were all fascinated by the screen. We felt it was only fair that all of us should have the same level of transparency as our policy decisions. After years of persistence, we succeeded in making all our sessions open to all journalists. Now, our meetings are fewer and more online, with the majority of interactions taking place on Slack, a team collaboration framework. On Slack, we have public channels where we hold discussions, post documents, and share comments. These conversations, posts, and comments can all be viewed by the public. Although face-to-face interactions are still valuable, Slack has greatly expanded the types of conversations we have, such as discussing a story or situation that arises.

input: An interview with Ted Koppel, a favorite former journalist on the liberal left was brought to light by NewsBusters Monday. Like most people reading the article, I was taken aback by Koppels honesty about the current state of
continuation: journalism , when he shared with his friend the New York Times columnist , Gail Collins : I hate it . I hate everything about it the hysterical partisanship .You just watch it for a while and you dont see facts , you dont see truth . I look at what the Presidents done [ regarding the Affordable Care Act ] , I dont even see one big scandal . Everythings a big scandal .Every time he breathes , its a scandal . But when Koppel piled onto the heap of negativity with the alleged vapid and dishonest conservative press , Collins brought out Koppels deeper bitterness that has been hiding behind the PBS anchors condescension and hypocrisy : Oh , its sick .I dont sure what were going to do . I think our republic
paraphrase: Former journalist Ted Koppel's recent interview with NewsBusters has sparked conversation, particularly among those on the liberal left. Koppel expressed his discontent with the current state of journalism, confiding in New York Times columnist Gail Collins that he dislikes the "hysterical partisanship" and the lack of factual reporting. Koppel criticized the media's coverage of President Biden's actions regarding the Affordable Care Act, stating that he sees no major scandal despite the constant criticism. Koppel's comments were met with agreement from Collins, who shared his frustration with the media's tendency to sensationalize every move the President makes. Both Koppel and Collins agreed that the situation is "sick" and uncertain, with Collins wondering what the future holds for the republic.

input:
Researchers have developed a new compound that may soon be developed into an effective treatment for melanoma, the deadliest form of skin cancer.
Melanoma may be halted by a newly developed drug.
Skin cancer is the most pervasive form of cancer in
continuation: the United States . It impacts roughly 3 . 5 million people each year .Approximately 100 , 000 instances of melanoma - the deadliest type of skin cancer - are diagnosed each season . The skin cancer originates in melanocytes - the cells that produce pigment - and spreads to other parts of the bodies through the lymphatic network .It can also spread via the bloodstream . In 2017 , more than 6 , 000 persons in the United States died from melanoma .Although the infection is fewer prevalent in Europe , an estimated 12 , 500 individuals will die from it each year there , too . With melanoma , the first line of defense is prevention : decreasing the danger of exposure to ultraviolet ( UV ) radiation , either from the sun or sunbeds .U
paraphrase:
Scientists have created a novel compound that may pave the way for an effective treatment against melanoma, the most deadly form of skin cancer.
Skin cancer affects a staggering number of people each year, with approximately 3.5 million cases diagnosed annually in the United States alone. Of these, around 100,000 are diagnosed with melanoma, the deadliest form of skin cancer, every season. Melanoma originates in melanocytes, the cells responsible for producing pigment, and can spread to other parts of the body through the lymphatic network or the bloodstream. According to recent statistics, more than 6,000 individuals in the United States died from melanoma in 2017, while an estimated 12,500 individuals succumb to the disease each year in Europe. The best defense against melanoma is prevention, and this includes minimizing exposure to harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun or sunbeds.

" We have got a powerful def
paraphrase:
Sam Foley, a midfielder for Northampton Town, has offered a fascinating insight into the differences between playing under current manager Keith Curle and former boss Dean Austin.
Austin was appointed permanently after a brief stint as caretaker manager at the end of last season, only to be sacked in October after a run of five consecutive defeats and sitting in 18th place in Sky Bet League Two. Former England international Curle took over and has since guided Northampton to a playoff position, currently sitting fourth, four points behind leaders Portsmouth. Notably, this change in management has also led to a shift in playing style, with a more attacking strategy and a change in attitude within the team. Foley believes that Curle demands an attacking mindset, emphasizing the importance of pressing teams and being willing to give the ball away to gain possession. This approach was evident in their 3-1 win against Portsmouth, which provided the platform for victory. Overall, the team has become more offensively minded under Curle's leadership.

" Our next play will be very important for us to keep our winning streak , " she said .Senior guard Danny - Jaylyn Quiroz had her final game at the Burbank
paraphrase:
The Burroughs High School girls basketball team continued their unbeaten streak on Tuesday night with a dominant 59-35 victory over Hesperia High School.
The win marked a special occasion as it was Senior Night, and the team celebrated with a lively halftime ceremony filled with cheers and music. The seniors on the team, including guard Keziah Turner and forward Sera Moses, were determined to end the night on a high note, as they didn't want to endure a loss on their special night. "We didn't want to ruin Senior Night for the seniors," Turner said. "I understand how hard we've worked and we didn't want to let them down," Moses added. With the team's win, they improved their overall record to 19-6 and their Mojave River League standing at 9-0. Senior guard Danny-Jaylyn Quiroz played her final game at Burbank High School before graduation, and the team is eager to keep their winning streak alive in their next match.

paraphrase: To maximize your car insurance benefits, it's crucial to have a basic understanding of the coverage and factors that influence premiums. Although a low premium may seem like the primary concern, it's important to consider other aspects as well. For instance, upgrading to a newer vehicle or shopping around for insurance quotes can result in significant savings. input:
Euro zone finance ministers and the International Monetary Fund began their third attempt in as many weeks to release emergency aid for Greece on Monday, with policymakers saying a write-down of Greek debt is off the table for now.
Greek Finance Minister Yannis St
continuation: ournaras was due to arrive in Luxembourg to attend a conference that is expected to restart talks on a plan for the next tranche of aid , after failing to make any headway on a prior session earlier in June . IMF chairman Christine Lagarde also left the door open for some sort of debt write - down on Greece - also a pre - condition for the release of the aid .Finance ministers and the IMF are due to hold their second session on the Greek debt review on June 20 in Luxembourg . If all go better , euro zone leaders will hold a conference at the end of the month in order to approve the bailout assistance .Investors have fallen impatient with the lack of progress on Greece , and there have been worries that debt contagion could sweep across Europe if Greece is forced to restructure its debt . G
paraphrase:
European finance ministers and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) launched their third attempt in as many weeks to disburse emergency aid to Greece on Monday, with policymakers indicating that a Greek debt write-down is not a current priority.
Greek Finance Minister Yannis Stournaras is expected to meet with his counterparts in Luxembourg for a conference to resume discussions on a plan for the next tranche of aid, following previous stalemates in June. IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde left the possibility of a debt write-down on Greece open, which is also a precondition for releasing the aid. Finance ministers and the IMF are set to hold their second meeting on the Greek debt review on June 20 in Luxembourg, with hopes of making more progress. If all goes well, euro zone leaders will convene at the end of the month to greenlight the bailout support. Investors have grown restless due to the lack of progress on Greece, and there are fears that debt contagion could spread across the region if Athens is forced to restructure its debt.

input: President Donald Trump tweeted on Tuesday about prisoners of war, and was immediately and deservedly deluged with replies and retweets regarding the late Sen. John McCain, a former POW with whom Trump frequently clashed and who he famously insulted over being captured
continuation: in war . After McCain was diagnosed with brain cancer and death in August , Trump published a statement saying hed never get into it with McCain again .Trump again focused on POWs in the same tweet , said their status as hostages of war is not what creates us a unique nation , rather it is something in their soul that does . Trump obviously misspoke here , as he had throughout his campaign and presidency , but it is perhaps worth unpacking what makes the term captive of war significant in the first place , and how it forms the basis for some of the most important rules in warfare .The First Geneva Convention of 1864 adopted the modern rules for prisoner of war status . The first section , titled Treatment of Persons Taken in the Event of War , was written specifically to replace the usual practices of
paraphrase: President Donald Trump tweeted on Tuesday about prisoners of war, sparking a flurry of replies and retweets, particularly in response to his past feuds with the late Senator John McCain, a former POW who passed away in August. Trump's statement following McCain's diagnosis with brain cancer and death seemed to suggest a change of heart, but in the same tweet, he returned to the topic of POWs, claiming that their status as "hostages of war" is not what defines them as a unique nation, but rather something deeper within their souls. However, Trump's assertion is likely misguided, as the term "captive of war" holds significant meaning in the context of modern warfare and international law. In fact, the First Geneva Convention of 1864, which established the modern rules for prisoner of war status, was written specifically to supersede traditional practices of treating prisoners of war. The first section of the convention, titled "Treatment of Persons Taken in the Event of War," outlines the basic principles for how prisoners of war should be treated and protected.

A railroad groups lawsuit against a state plan to remove 34 miles of train tracks has been delayed again, this time until the end of January.
Suzanne Messer, a lawyer for the Adirondack Railway Preservation Society, said
continuation: she received an email from solicitor Matthew C . Davison , who represents the state , Monday night . The letter , which Messer sent on her website , davismesser . com , said the attorney generals office is requesting for a 14 - day extension , and the judge agreed to the delay .The organization had been set to come to court Nov . 29 . The dispute centers on planning by the state to remove the tracks and return the territory , most of which is in the towns of Tupper Lake and Ray Brook , to its natural state .The organization , sometimes called as ARPS , is suing , arguing the state doesnt have the right to remove the tracks because the company has a 99 - year lease with the state . Adirondack Recreation Corp . has been working on the plan since 2014 , and the state has indicated its a necessary remedy for
paraphrase: The lawsuit filed by a railroad group against a state plan to remove 34 miles of train tracks has been delayed until the end of January, according to Suzanne Messer, a lawyer for the Adirondack Railway Preservation Society. Messer received an email from the state's solicitor, Matthew C. Davison, on Monday night, informing her of the attorney general's office's request for a 14-day extension and the judge's approval of the delay. The organization was previously set to appear in court on November 29. The legal battle centers around the state's plan to remove the tracks and return the land, most of which is located in the towns of Tupper Lake and Ray Brook, to its natural state. The Adirondack Railway Preservation Society is suing the state, arguing that the company has a 99-year lease that gives it the right to maintain the tracks. Adirondack Recreation Corp. has been working on the plan since 2014, and the state has maintained that it is necessary to address environmental concerns.

input:
BOSTON -- CC Sabathia snapped out of his Red Sox funk, striking out 10 in six innings to beat Boston for the first time in five tries this season and lead the New York Yankees to a 5-2 victory Tuesday.
The win
continuation: completed the Yankees ' first four - game sweep since a year - high win streak lasted five games in May . They have won eight straight overall .Sabathia ( 6 - 5 ) had lost four of five decisions against Boston coming in and hadn ' t won at Fenway Park since a 2 - 0 victory on Aug . 8 , 2012 , in the middle of the playoff hunt . He gave up only one run and five hits , walked none and had four strikeouts in the second .Baltimore scored five hits off leaving - hander Mike Morin in the bottom of the inning , though it didn ' t end up mattering .
paraphrase: New York pitcher CC Sabathia emerged from a brief slump against Boston, striking out 10 in six innings to lead the Yankees to a 5-2 victory Tuesday. This marked the first time Sabathia had beaten the Red Sox in five tries this season, completing the Yankees' four-game sweep since their five-game win streak in May. The Yankees have now won eight consecutive games overall, with Sabathia improving his record to 6-5. Despite losing four of five decisions against Boston coming into the game, Sabathia gave up only one run and five hits, walked none, and had four strikeouts in the second inning. Meanwhile, Baltimore scored five hits off relief pitcher Mike Morin in the bottom of the inning, but it ultimately didn't matter.

input: In a shameful first, in 2016 TN Assembly elections, polling in two constituencies was put off due to the pernicious effect of money power, to quote the EC. In a telling indictment of the States political class
continuation: , 13 Assembly and 1 Lok Sabha seats have been categorised as critical , on account of their past data of booth capturing , bogus voting and other irregularities . Of these , 10 ( five each from Coimbatore and Karur regions ) are classified as very important Tamil Nadu has the highest number of constituencies in this category .Elections to the 234 districts will be held in a single phase on May 16 . CEC Nasim Zaidi has confirmed that 70 , 000 ( out of 8 . 5 lakh ) polling personnel and around 1 . 5 lakh ( out of 22 lakh ) polling stations will be first time voting .This , for a by - election in Chennai . In a worst - case situations , the poll bodies will need a re - poll in
paraphrase: In a concerning development, the Tamil Nadu Assembly elections in 2016 were marred by the influence of money power, according to the Election Commission (EC). As a result, polling in two constituencies was postponed. This reprehensible act highlights the dysfunction within the state's political class, as 13 Assembly and 1 Lok Sabha seats have been deemed critical due to a history of booth capturing, fake voting, and other electoral irregularities. Of these, 10 seats (five each from Coimbatore and Karur regions) are considered particularly vital. The upcoming elections to the 234 districts will be held in a single phase on May 16. The Chief Election Commissioner, Nasim Zaidi, has confirmed that around 70,000 polling personnel and 1.5 lakh polling stations will be experiencing their first election, including in a by-election in Chennai. In the worst-case scenario, a re-poll may be necessary.

input: Ping An Insurance (Group) Co.'s (2318.HK) first-time disclosure that it holds a 5.01% stake in global banking giant HSBC Holdings Plc. (0005.HK) highlights the Chinese
continuation: insurer & apos ; s rising interest in equity investment , as the nation & apos ; s largest insurer chases higher yields at a time of fell bond yields , but it also asks questions of what it could do with its HSBC holding . The idea of HSBC taking some support from its largest investor is reassuring , given the recent problems in the Chinese banking sector .HSBC Chairman Mark Tucker highlighted the situation in a recent earnings call , said , " We remain economically strong with very good liquidity and sufficient capital levels . We remain fully dedicated to our global ambitions and have no planning to alter our business in China . "Ping An Insurance ( Group ) Co . Ltd . purchased the shares in a trade on Sept . 17 and it sold most of its shares in Hong Kong on Sept . 2
paraphrase: Ping An Insurance Group's disclosure of a 5.01% stake in HSBC Holdings highlights the company's growing interest in equity investments as China's largest insurer seeks higher returns in a low-yield environment. The news also raises questions about what Ping An could do with its HSBC holding, particularly given the recent challenges faced by Chinese banks. HSBC Chairman Mark Tucker addressed the situation in an earnings call, stating, "We remain financially robust with ample liquidity and sufficient capital levels. We remain committed to our global ambitions and have no plans to alter our operations in China." Ping An purchased the shares in a trade on September 17 and sold most of its holdings in Hong Kong on September 20.

The University of Vermont fell to Florida
continuation: 65 - 54 in a tough - fought struggle that didn ' t disappoint the fans who crowded the arena and watched on TV . paraphrase: Despite the recent defeat, local fans in Burlington remain fiercely proud of the University of Vermont's (UVM) impressive achievements this season. In the NCAA basketball tournament's opening round, UVM faced off against Florida and unfortunately lost with a score of 65-54. Despite the tough loss, the team's fans were thrilled to see their beloved Catamounts make it to the tournament and compete at such a high level. input: NEW YORK  One recent spring morning in the Utah desert, Jerry Foote received an ecstatic e-mail that gravitational forces were causing two stars to orbit each other, with one star swallowing matter from its companion. Rudolf Novak received the same message
continuation: . They soon discover the two are halfway around the world from each other , yet at that very instant , the stars were hovering each other within two light years .Such a coincidence would be rare , but for Foote , 32 , a black hole expert , and Novak , 27 , a planetary scientist , it was the latest in a string of unexpected exchanges , putting together two worlds whose obsession with mass gravity events has its own gravitational pull .
paraphrase: On a crisp spring morning in Utah, Jerry Foote received an exhilarating email about two stars orbiting each other, with one star consuming matter from its companion. Rudolf Novak, also privy to the message, soon discovered that the two stars were located on opposite sides of the world, yet at that very moment, they were dancing together within two light years of each other. This convergence of celestial bodies was a rare occurrence, but for Foote, a seasoned expert in black holes, and Novak, a skilled planetary scientist, it was the latest in a series of extraordinary interactions that have brought together two worlds obsessed with the mysteries of mass gravity.

TRUCKEE, Calif.  Property owners this week overwhelmingly approved a special tax to fund maintenance for the Brickelltown streetscape project.
At Tuesdays Truckee Town Council meeting, returned mailed ballots (30 out of 34
continuation: ballots ) and filed petitions ( five out of seven petitions ) from voters totaling 76 percent of registered voters in Truckee approved the 25 - month tax , placing 60 percent of the funds raised for maintenance . Were going to be able to getting right to work this summer , said Truckee Town Manager Tony Lashbrook .Now that the votes have been tallied , Truckee leaders can move forward in budgeting for the project that will include surface upgrades to the sidewalks and streets surrounding the historic downtown Brickelltown area . When the 25 - month tax was suggested by the town last month , the Truckee Town Council set the taxation at 15 percent of assessed property value for properties valued at more than $ 500 , 000 .Owners of more humble homes were set
paraphrase: Property owners in Truckee, California, have overwhelmingly approved a special tax to fund maintenance for the Brickelltown streetscape project. At a recent town council meeting, 30 out of 34 returned ballots and five out of seven petitions from voters representing 76% of registered voters in Truckee approved the 25-month tax, with 60% of the funds raised dedicated to maintenance. Truckee Town Manager Tony Lashbrook expressed excitement to move forward with the project this summer, which will include surface upgrades to the sidewalks and streets surrounding the historic downtown Brickelltown area. The tax, set at 15% of assessed property value for properties valued at over $500,000, will generate revenue for the project. However, owners of more modest homes will see a lower tax rate.

input:
SCRIBA, N.Y. - The refueling outage at the Unit 2 reactor at Nine Mile Point nuclear station provides a rare opportunity to go inside the plant while the reactor vessel is opened up.
Photographers from Syracuse.com took advantage
continuation: of the chance to capture some of the scenes inside the unit . The photos below depict Unit 2 ' s nuclear vessel after the turbine - generator unit was withdrawn , and the tank where the reactor coolant and steam is stored .The photos below show the removal of the turbine - generator unit , the reactor control room , and the spent fuel pool , where fuel from Unit 2 and Unit 3 is stored . The other pictures show steam turbines and the inlet building , where spent fuel is received and handled .
paraphrase: Nine Mile Point nuclear station's Unit 2 reactor is currently undergoing a refueling outage, providing a rare chance to explore the plant's interior while the reactor vessel is open. Photographers from Syracuse.com seized this opportunity to capture the inside of the unit, revealing the nuclear vessel after the turbine-generator unit was removed, as well as the tank where reactor coolant and steam are stored. Additionally, the photos show the removal of the turbine-generator unit, the reactor control room, and the spent fuel pool, where fuel from Units 2 and 3 is stored. The pictures also depict steam turbines and the inlet building, where spent fuel is received and handled.

The gritty streets of this 4-by-12-block sliver of a town in densely populated and urbanized northern Hudson County might be the last place to expect to find a largely volunteer fire department.
Such departments are usually associated with small-
continuation: town Main Streets , such as the one in Bayonne . But the Union City Fire Department has been one of the best - run and most respected agencies in the state for more than 60 years .It was the first , and continues the largest , department in the state to be majority woman . The boys are fiercely protective of their ladies in red , and they enjoy a healthy rivalry with the Teterboro Volunteer Fire Department , which employs about 10 women .The Teterboro department sits just on the other side of Route 46 , but the women in red regard the boys in the department ' s yellow uniforms as rivals . The 200 Union City female firefighters are treated by their male colleagues as royalty .As the comradery grew , the relationship between the Teterboro men and the Union City ladies emerged into a
paraphrase: In the unassuming streets of a compact, urbanized town in northern Hudson County, one might least expect to find a predominantly volunteer fire department. These departments are commonly associated with small-town main streets, such as Bayonne's. However, the Union City Fire Department has been one of the most highly regarded and well-managed agencies in the state for over 60 years. It was not only the first but also the largest department in the state to be predominantly staffed by women, with the male firefighters treating them with a mixture of respect and friendly competition. The Teterboro Volunteer Fire Department, located just across Route 46, employs around 10 female firefighters, whom their male counterparts view as fierce rivals. Despite this friendly rivalry, the 200 female firefighters in Union City are highly regarded and treated as royalty by their male colleagues as their camaraderie grew over time.

input:
MALAYSIA IS willing to help Thailand end the ethno-religious conflict in the deep South using peaceful means, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said yesterday, suggesting the root cause of the problem was not religion but injustice.
G
continuation: rowing brutality in the restive region has died more than 6 , 000 persons since 2004 . It seems to me if they can manage their social system in a way that ensures justice and equality in the distribution of resources and income , they can answer their problem without too little difficulty , he informed journalists after attending Putrajayas Health Clinic for the Elderly , which is named after him .He was asked about the conditions attached by Thailand to any partnership on the conflict . I believe one reason is they wish to assist .They have been through this kind of problem . I believe they can help Thailand to solve the issue , he said .His statement comes ahead of a planned meeting between Prime Minister Prayuth Chan - o - cha and Mahathir in Bangkok on Sunday . Prayuth is expected to request Mahathirs help to end
paraphrase: Malaysia is eager to assist Thailand in resolving the ethnic and religious conflict in the southern region through peaceful means, according to Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad. He believes that the root cause of the problem is not religion, but rather injustice. The ongoing brutality in the region has resulted in the deaths of over 6,000 people since 2004, and Mahathir suggests that addressing social inequalities and ensuring fair distribution of resources could help resolve the issue with relative ease. He expressed this view during a press conference after visiting a health clinic in Putrajaya, which was named after him. When asked about Thailand's conditions for partnership, Mahathir noted that one reason is likely their desire to help, given their own experience with similar conflicts. He believes that Thailand can benefit from Malaysia's assistance in resolving the issue. This statement comes ahead of a planned meeting between Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-o-cha and Mahathir in Bangkok on Sunday, where Prayuth is expected to seek Mahathir's help in ending the conflict.

Taoiseach Leo Varadkar has said he would be open to environmental measures including giving people money back for returning used plastic bottles, writes Elaine Loughlin, Political Reporter.
Green party leader Eamon Ryan has called on the Government to
continuation: consider returns schemes and tax subsidies to reduce the quantity of single - use plastic bottles used every day in Ireland . Mr Ryan suggested giving people a 25 cent refund for each plastic bottle returned would be one means to shift behaviour .The Green Party leader , who has presented a legislation to prohibit and reduce the number of plastic bottles being used , said such a system could be successful . Meanwhile , Fianna Fil leader Michel Martin , who has suggested a 20c minimum refund per plastic bottle , has been supported by Leo Varadkar .There are aspects to the idea that I cant think I havent considered , I believe maybe on the bottle deposit scheme , wed have to look at the impact it would have on pricing , Mr Varadkar said . There might have to be some consideration and consideration
paraphrase: Federal Minister Leo Varadkar has expressed openness to environmental initiatives, including financial incentives for recycling used plastic bottles. According to Elaine Loughlin, Political Reporter, Green Party leader Eamon Ryan has urged the government to consider return schemes and tax breaks to reduce the daily consumption of single-use plastic bottles in Ireland. Ryan suggested a 25 cent refund per plastic bottle returned as a means to alter behavior. The Green Party leader has proposed a law to prohibit and decrease the use of plastic bottles and has received support from Varadkar and Fianna Fil leader Michel Martin, who has suggested a 20c minimum refund per plastic bottle. While Varadkar acknowledged that there are aspects to the idea he has not considered, he believes pricing and its impact on the bottle deposit scheme would need to be carefully examined.

The Kings made it four wins

Everybody sort of knows that we have one of the younger clubs in the league , but our younger guys , and the boys we have experienced , they understand how to score matches , " defenseman Jack Johnson said . " We ' ve learned from last season that we can ' t just blow a lead .It ' s so difficult to come back when you ' re down three goals . So we actually pride ourselves on not blowing it . "Dustin Brown and Jack Johnson shot 1 : 26 apart to open the scoring early in the first period , and Anze Kopitar padded the Kings ' lead to 3 - 0 with a goal at 1
paraphrase:
LOS ANGELES, Calif. - The pre-season predictions were that the Kings were on the cusp of a playoff push, and they have already started to make those projections a reality. After five games, they have won four of them, and their latest victory at the Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum has solidified their position in second place in the Western Conference.
Defenseman Jack Johnson praised the team's youth and experience, stating, "We have one of the younger teams in the league, but our younger players and the veterans understand how to convert chances into goals. We learned from last season that it's crucial not to blow leads, as it's difficult to come back when you're down three goals. So, we take pride in not letting leads slip away."
Dustin Brown and Jack Johnson scored within a 26-second span early in the first period, giving the Kings a 2-0 lead. Anze Kopitar added a third goal in the second period, sealing the win for the Kings.

After celebrating the big news , the two joined up with friends to continue their
paraphrase: Jordan Rogers and JoJo Fletcher were caught off guard when his family threw them a surprise engagement party in Oklahoma. JoJo, dressed in a stunning gown, looked radiant as Jordan's parents and siblings gathered to celebrate the happy occasion. JoJo took to Instagram to share photos from the surprise party, including a close-up of her dazzling engagement ring. Once upon a time, Ronald Reagan inaugurated America's Strategic Defense Initiative, a missile defense program that critics immediately derided as "Star Wars" -- pure fantasy.
Ronald Reagan's "Star Wars."
continuation: ( Associated Press ) Now that phrase has an entirely different ring , but we & apos ; re about to find out if the technology underpinning Reagan & apos ; s fantasies has finally come to fruition . In two weeks , at a small , remote missile site in the Mojave Desert , Boeing and Raytheon will flight a missile that contains a payload for the very first time .It & apos ; s the last test flight for the Air Force & apos ; s Ground - Based Midcourse Defense program . A test last September failed to reach its intended target .The rocket & apos ; s actual payload , called a hit - to - kill kill vehicle , is a shiny 220 - pound box . Inside is a shaped explosive charge called a warhead , built to destroy incoming rockets .If that doesn'
paraphrase: In a historic moment, Ronald Reagan launched America's Strategic Defense Initiative, a missile defense program that was initially criticized as "Star Wars"  a futuristic concept. However, the phrase has since taken on a new significance, as we are on the cusp of determining if the technology behind Reagan's vision has finally become a reality. In two weeks, at a remote missile site in the Mojave Desert, Boeing and Raytheon will conduct a test flight featuring a missile carrying a payload for the first time. This marks the final test for the Air Force's Ground-Based Midcourse Defense program, which has faced challenges in the past, including a failed test last September. The rocket's actual payload, a sophisticated 220-pound box, is designed to destroy incoming rockets with a shaped explosive charge known as a warhead. The implications of this technology are immense, as it has the potential to revolutionize missile defense systems and protect our nation from potential threats.

paraphrase:
MANUFACTURING STREET PREACHERS, returned to their rebellious roots tonight (March 8) at CARDIFF COAL EXCHANGE, with an explosive hometown show.
The band performed their first UK date since their New Year's Eve concert in Dubai in front of a sold-out crowd of 4000. After launching into their opening track "Fear of Extermination," bassist Nicky Wire addressed the audience: "We're thrilled to invite you all to our first show of 2012. It's a significant moment, and it's especially meaningful as we return to our beloved Cardiff, the home of our revered football team, the Bluebirds. We're glad to be back where we belong." Wire continued, "Welcome to the House of the Left, vocalist Richey Edwards declared as the group launched into their 1985 hit. Motorcycle Emptiness and Glasgow Coma Scale."

Tennessee's state-run Achievement School District, which takes over low-performing schools and either runs them directly or hands them over to charter organizations, has run into partisan political trouble.
Several Democratic state lawmakers say they will propose bills this upcoming legislative
continuation: session that would abolish the ADS . A legislation proposed in the previous session by former state House Minority Leader Craig Fitzhugh would have given parents whose children attend the institutions an option to give their child to a neighboring school .The bill failed , and the next legislative session , which starts in January , will mark the first opportunities for Democrats to propose legislation since they took control of the House after the 2018 election . " The only reason we had the school district was to repair the problems with the Tennessee Achievement School District , " state Rep . Antonio Parkinson , the new House Democratic Caucus president , said this week .The ADS , which began in 2013 , was established to take over " priority " institutions , which were designated as schools that were in need of extra interventions based on Tennessee ' s accountability program . " The Achiev
paraphrase: Tennessee's state-run Achievement School District has encountered political challenges due to partisan differences. Democratic state lawmakers plan to introduce bills in the upcoming legislative session aimed at abolishing the ADS. In the previous session, former state House Minority Leader Craig Fitzhugh proposed a bill that would give parents of students attending ADS schools the option to transfer their child to a nearby school. The bill did not pass, and the upcoming session will provide the first opportunity for Democrats to propose legislation since they gained control of the House in the 2018 election. According to state Rep. Antonio Parkinson, the new House Democratic Caucus president, "The only reason we had the school district was to address the issues with the Tennessee Achievement School District." The ADS, established in 2013, was created to take over "priority" schools that were identified as in need of additional interventions based on Tennessee's accountability program.

input: Magic Johnson has no regrets about the public nature of his conversations with New Orleans Pelicans general manager Dell Demps during the past two weeks as the Lakers tried to trade for Anthony Davis. Johnson believes his players are professional enough to handle hearing their names in trade
continuation: discussions with the other clubs players , not that he would tell them about any trade meetings in the first place . I dont care whos asking them , Johnson said Monday when the Lakers visit Sacramento , after talking to his team in a pre - game locker hall session .I believe our men , we have the most unbelievable band of men Ive ever coached . They know we have to make difficult decisions to make our team better , and these decisions have to be made .We had a lot of conversations were not going to hide from anything with our players . And I say its tough for our players .Ive been there , done that . Ive been traded three times .And its tough . But I believe we have the best group of players .We have the best players and we have the best group of guys ,
paraphrase: Magic Johnson believes that his players are capable of handling the public nature of their conversations with New Orleans Pelicans general manager Dell Demps during the past two weeks, as the Lakers pursued a trade for Anthony Davis. According to Johnson, he would never disclose any details of trade meetings with his players, but he does not worry about their ability to handle such discussions. In a pre-game locker room session, Johnson told his team that he has the most exceptional group of players he has ever coached, and that they understand the need for difficult decisions to be made to improve the team. Johnson himself has been through the experience of being traded three times and acknowledges that it can be challenging, but he is confident that he has the best group of players and the best group of guys on his team.

input: Senate President Chuck Morse has a plan to absorb a nearly $30 million budget shortfall created by a lawsuit over hospital payments. But it could come at the expense of a host of other legislative priorities, potentially putting spending bills in jeopardy, he said Monday.
continuation: The Republican senator told reporters after a string of conferences with his caucus that he wants to take the money out of a permanent " legacy fund " meant to pay down the debt on a medical bond that helped finance the development of the Fisherville School of Nursing . Legislators have utilized the legacy fund for other purposes in recent months , and Morse is proposing to use that money to assist plug the state ' s current $ 27 . 5 million shortfall .While other lawmakers confirm the cash is required , some think they seek to pursue other possibilities , including using tax receipts from the nearby Patrick Golf Course in Rye , a subject Morse also expressed an interest in discussing with his caucus . Lawmakers don ' t have to make a final decision until the end of the session in June .But
paraphrase: Senate President Chuck Morse has proposed a plan to address the state's $27.5 million budget shortfall caused by a lawsuit over hospital payments. However, this could potentially come at the cost of other legislative priorities, putting spending bills in jeopardy. Morse told reporters after consulting with his caucus that he wants to use money from a permanent "legacy fund" meant to pay down debt on a medical bond that financed the development of the Fisherville School of Nursing. This fund has been utilized for other purposes in recent months, and Morse is suggesting using it to plug the current budget gap. While other lawmakers acknowledge the need for the cash, some are exploring other options, including tapping into tax receipts from the nearby Patrick Golf Course, a topic Morse is also interested in discussing with his caucus. The final decision won't be made until the end of the session in June.
