The Miami Heat star is on his maiden visit to the country to promote the game. The 3-on-3 event will be held in Hyderabad, Bangalore and Delhi before culminating with the finals in Mumbai on September 29.
Two-time National
continuation: Basketball Association ( NBA ) champion LeBron James touched down in India and is making his first - ever visit to the nation . Ahead of the maiden NBA Jam India event , he said , " I ' ve never been here before and I ' m really thrilled to come to India and seeing all the great basketball culture . "" It ' s just so cool to come to a different part of the world and be able to be inspired by everyone here in India as well , " he added . The NBA Jam India event will provide 12 players the ability to compete in a 3 - on - 3 tournament , with the loser earning a once - in - a - lifetime travel to New York to meet James at the 2019 NBA Draft in June .The NBA Jam is being held in India in partnership with Rise Worldwide India , who is a leading basketball academy based
paraphrase:
LeBron James, the renowned Miami Heat star, is embarking on his first-ever visit to India to promote the sport. As part of the maiden NBA Jam India event, James will visit Hyderabad, Bangalore, and Delhi before culminating in the finals in Mumbai on September 29.
Excited about his arrival in India, James expressed his eagerness to experience the rich basketball culture of the country. "I've never been to India before, and I'm really thrilled to be here and see all the fantastic basketball enthusiasts. It's just incredible to come to a new place and be inspired by the passion and energy of the people here," he said.
The NBA Jam India event will provide 12 players with the opportunity to compete in a 3-on-3 tournament, with the losing team earning a once-in-a-lifetime chance to meet James at the 2019 NBA Draft in June. This exciting event is being held in collaboration with Rise Worldwide India, a leading basketball academy based in the country.

Swirling dust devils on Mars have given NASA scientists both a scientific treat and a very welcome power boost.
On 10 March, the rover Spirit captured images of two dust devils in one day. It is the first time any have been seen on Mars
continuation: , although they are common on Earth . The dust devils were detected by Spirit ' s mast camera , which had been specially designed to manage the severe environment of Mars .The mast sensor takes panoramic images at 300 - nanometre resolution and has very high dynamic range , allowing it to take images of the sun and skies . The mast camera is sited near the rover ' s navigation cameras , so scientists are able to keep an eye on the terrain that they pass over .According to planetary scientist Tim Goudge , of the University of Arizona , Tucson , " it is possible that the dust devils in the photographs are related to what Spirit ' s wheels and rover tracks look like . " So far Spirit ' s rover wheel tracks have not shown any sign of flaws , suggesting the tracks may simply be ' ghost ' tracks created by a dust demon .But G
paraphrase: NASA's Spirit rover has captured breathtaking images of swirling dust devils on Mars, marking the first time such formations have been observed on the red planet. These rare phenomena are not uncommon on Earth, but the Spirit's mast camera has managed to capture them in stunning detail. With its specialized design, the mast camera can take panoramic images at 300-nanometer resolution and boasts a high dynamic range, allowing for captivating images of the sun and sky. The mast camera is strategically positioned near the navigation cameras, enabling scientists to monitor the terrain as the rover passes over it. According to planetary scientist Tim Goudge of the University of Arizona, the dust devils in the images may be linked to the peculiar appearance of the rover's wheels and tracks. So far, the tracks have shown no signs of damage, leading scientists to speculate that they may be the result of "ghost" tracks created by a Martian dust demon.

input: Standard & Poor's said on Wednesday it was more likely than before to cut General Electric Co's credit rating in the next two years after activist investor Nelson Peltz's purchase of a $
continuation: 2 . 5 billion stake in the industrial conglomerate . A cut to GE & apos ; s credit rating might increase its borrowing costs and could also putting pressure on its stock .GE , which does not comment on ratings , has say it intends to buy back $ 50 billion in stock in the last two years , which Peltz , head of investment group Trian Fund Management LP , supports . GE & apos ; s market price has fell about $ 120 billion since July 2015 , when the group posted its second loss in a year , a drop which has additionally turned the credit rated into a downgrade .
paraphrase: Standard & Poor's has recently indicated that it is more likely than before to downgrade General Electric Company's credit rating in the next two years following activist investor Nelson Peltz's purchase of a $2.5 billion stake in the industrial conglomerate. A downgrade could lead to increased borrowing costs for GE and may also put pressure on its stock price. GE has not commented on the ratings, but has stated its intention to buy back $50 billion in stock over the next two years, a move that Peltz, CEO of investment group Trian Fund Management LP, supports. Since July 2015, GE's market value has declined by around $120 billion, a drop that has contributed to the credit rating being downgraded.

input:
Over half of Europeans think that Israel now presents the biggest threat to world peace according to a controversial poll requested by the European Commission.
According to the same survey, Europeans believe the United States contributes the most to world instability along with Afghanistan, Iran,
continuation: Russia , Pakistan and China . The EU statistics organization , Eurostat , published the polling statistics at the behest of the European Commission , the executive arm of the European Union .The survey was done between November 2007 and February 2008 among over 27 , 000 respondents aged 15 and older across the 27 EU member states . Seven percent of respondents in Britain , Italy , Sweden and Ireland stated Israel is the greatest threat to world peace , while 8 percent of the Polish and Czech respondents stated the same .Israel ranked second among respondents from the Netherlands and Turkey , and third among respondents from the UK , Italy , Sweden , Poland and Greece . Over quarter of those polled said they had no trust in the US administration and 47 percent of those polled said the US had a mostly negative influence on world affairs .Israel ranked third among the
paraphrase: A majority of Europeans believe that Israel poses the greatest threat to global peace, according to a contentious survey conducted at the behest of the European Commission. The survey found that over 70% of respondents believed the United States, along with Afghanistan, Iran, Russia, Pakistan, and China, contribute significantly to global instability. The poll was conducted among over 27,000 individuals aged 15 and older across the 27 EU member states, between November 2007 and February 2008. Interestingly, Israel ranked second or third, depending on the country, among respondents from certain regions, including the Netherlands and Turkey. Meanwhile, over a quarter of those polled expressed a lack of trust in the US administration, while 47% believed the US had a mostly negative influence on global affairs.

input: If President Clinton wants to see how activist government can solve social problems with strong public support, he should take a few days to visit Canada. With Toronto's World Series victory, the nationwide referendum on constitutional reform (including the status of Quebec), and the
continuation: political firestorm over the Quebec referendum , there ' s been a plenty of talk about the inadequacies of the US system . At the same time , in a sign of how far matters have went in Canada , the Toronto Star editorialized against the referendum legislation because it infringed too much on civil liberties .The Canadian system has some things in its favor . The country is more homogeneous and wealthy than the US and has fewer sharp divisions .There are local and provincial differences , but in Canada they are far less sharp than in the US . Canada also has much more public participation .Some of the policy innovations - - equalization paid to poorer provinces , bilingual schooling in Quebec , army duty for aboriginal citizens - - were passed only because public opinion prompted the federal government to shift . At the same time , the federal government ' s role in public affairs is much larger than in the US .Canadian statutes are often
paraphrase: If President Clinton seeks to observe how an activist government can address social issues with broad public support, he could spend a few days in Canada. With Toronto's recent World Series victory, the nationwide referendum on constitutional reform (including the status of Quebec), and the political upheaval over the Quebec referendum, there has been much discussion about the limitations of the US system. Meanwhile, in a sign of how far things have gone in Canada, the Toronto Star editorialized against the referendum legislation due to its infringement on civil liberties. Canada has some advantages over the US. With a more homogeneous population and greater wealth, Canada has fewer sharp divisions. While there are local and provincial differences in Canada, they are less pronounced than in the US. Additionally, Canada has greater public participation in government. Some policy innovations, such as equalization payments to poorer provinces, bilingual education in Quebec, and mandatory army service for indigenous citizens, were only passed after public opinion prompted the federal government to reconsider. However, the federal government's role in public affairs is significantly larger in Canada than in the US. Canadian statutes are often shaped by public opinion, illustrating the country's more activist approach to governance.

Gov. Parris N. Glendening is seriously considering vetoing legislation that would make Maryland the first state to require that all public school students take a gun safety class.
The governor has been besieged with calls from teachers troubled by the measure's
continuation: potential to lead to a flood of weapon - toting students and school lockdowns , according to several administration leaders . But in the end , he will probably let the bill go to his desk , said a Republican assistant to the governor .Mr . Glendening told last month that he would sign it . " A lot of instructors are concerned about this bill , " added Theresa Williams , the governor ' s press secretary ." He ' s asked for more input . " The measure , which passed the General Assembly last week , calls for training all public school children in how to identify firearms , dial 911 , and find support in emergencies .Teachers are opposition , arguing that the legislation produces a recipe for crisis . " I believe I spoke for all teachers when I say we are opposition to this bill , even though there is a mandate for it , " commented Joan Herrnstein , the president of the Maryland
paraphrase: Governor Parris N. Glendening is carefully evaluating a bill that could make Maryland the first state to require all public school students to take a gun safety course. However, the governor has been bombarded with concerns from educators who fear the measure could lead to an influx of students carrying weapons and school lockdowns. Despite these concerns, the governor is likely to let the bill reach his desk, according to a Republican aide. The governor previously expressed support for the measure, stating that he will sign it. "Many instructors are concerned about this bill," added Theresa Williams, the governor's press secretary. "He has asked for additional input." The proposed legislation aims to train all public school students in identifying firearms, dialing 911, and seeking help in emergencies. Teachers are opposed to the bill, arguing that it could create a dangerous situation in schools. "I speak for all teachers when I say we are against this bill, despite the mandate for it," said Joan Herrnstein, president of the Maryland State Education Association.

In their case , they packed animal innards in skins and boiled them , thereby creating " salarium " or " sausage " .Originally , it was a savoury meal reserved only for soldiers , thus the term salarium : salere , in latin , meaning " salt " . The term itself has , apparently
paraphrase:
Oh no, you might be thinking, is this article about to reveal a disturbing secret? Perhaps it's going to discuss something as heinous as sausages made from adorable puppies. "Oh my goodness," you might be thinking, "do they really make sausages out of puppies? I had no idea. I'm so curious to know what's inside a sausage!" But I must advise you to heed your instincts and stop reading right away. If you're of a more adventurous spirit and enjoy learning about sausages, then by all means, proceed. After all, learning more about sausages can't possibly be fatal, can it?
In ancient times, the Romans and Greeks were among the first to create sausages. They stuffed animal innards into skins and boiled them, thus inventing "salarium" or "sausage." Initially, it was a savory meal reserved for soldiers, hence the term "salarium" in Latin, meaning "salt." The term itself has a fascinating history, it seems.

input: At its AppsWorld developer conference, in front of an estimated 10,000 customers and developers, Oracle president Chuck Philips harped on the shows theme of software integration. In his opening keynote, Phillips noted that interoperability (getting software to
continuation: work together ) is a major theme of Oracles new partner policy . Thats all well and good , except theres a back story to this .In its mid - 1990s heyday , Oracle was best known as a database provider , despite its other product lines . As such , it adopted the notion of combining its own products with third - party applications ( software from corporations that arent part of Oracle , of course ) to provide best of breed software .Then brought the dot - com bubble and the emergence of horizontal applications ( such as CRM , financial and ERP ) , and Oracle began putting most of its energy into get those applications to run on its proprietary hardware . It becoming a hardware firm , rather than a software firm .Now , Oracle wants to reclaim its software identity . That implies a return to software integration .But now , the main vendors , including
paraphrase: At Oracle's AppsWorld developer conference, President Chuck Philips emphasized the theme of software integration during his opening keynote. Philips highlighted the company's new partner policy, which places a strong emphasis on interoperability (getting software to work together). However, there is more to this story. In Oracle's heyday in the mid-1990s, the company was best known as a database provider, despite its other product lines. As such, it adopted the approach of combining its own products with third-party applications (software from non-Oracle corporations) to offer best-of-breed software. However, the emergence of horizontal applications such as CRM, financial, and ERP, and Oracle's subsequent focus on getting those applications to run on its proprietary hardware, led the company to transform into a hardware firm rather than a software firm. Now, Oracle aims to reclaim its software identity, which implies a return to software integration. Nevertheless, the major players in the industry, including [insert names of other major players], also continue to prioritize software integration in their strategies.

Barca ' s Neymar was second with 16 goals as Sporting Gijon forward Kevin Rodrigues was third with 14 .Valencia defender Nicolas Otamendi was selected as the best centre - back in La Liga while Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitic claimed home the prize for best player in La Liga . Real Madrid keeper
paraphrase: Antoine Griezmann, forward for Atletico Madrid and France, has been awarded the best player in La Liga for the previous season. However, the glamorous awards ceremony in Valencia was marred by the absence of Barcelona players, as manager Luis Enrique was overlooked for the best coach award for the fourth time in a row. Griezmann was also named the league's top player of the season and sealed the prestigious honor by scoring the decisive penalty in the shootout that ended Atletico's Champions League semi-final against Bayern Munich last month. Additionally, Griezmann recorded his second Pichichi award in two years, with 22 goals in the top flight, as Cristiano Ronaldo was overlooked for the second year in a row. Barcelona's Neymar was second with 16 goals, while Sporting Gijon forward Kevin Rodrigues was third with 14. Valencia defender Nicolas Otamendi was selected as the best center-back in La Liga, and Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitic won the prize for best player in La Liga. Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois was also recognized for his exceptional performance.

input:
A woman sucker punched and stabbed on the subway says the attack was motivated by hate. Wale Aliyu reports.
A woman was punched and stabbed when she got off the subway in Brooklyn by a man yelling racially charged words, her family and
continuation: the New York City Police Department ( NYPD ) said . The attack happened after 10 p . m . on Monday ( 1600 GMT ) on the 4 train at the Whitehall Street station , a high - traffic transport center , with a YouTube video showing the victims screams and a man ran away from the scene .Witness Karyn Washington say she went off the subway bus and saw the man , who began shouting Trump , Trump , Trump while attacking the victim . The attacker , recognized by authorities as Everton Ortiz , later reported himself to police .When questioned by reporters why he attacked the victim , Ortiz said , I just snapped , bro . Im sorry .I said a bad word and the woman slapped my ass , he informed journalists . In an interview
paraphrase:
A woman was brutally attacked on a Brooklyn subway, allegedly due to racial motivations. Wale Aliyu reports.
A shocking incident occurred after 10 PM on Monday when a woman was punched and stabbed as she exited a subway train at the bustling Whitehall Street station. According to the NYPD and the victim's family, a man shouting racial slurs attacked her. A disturbing video showed the victim's cries for help and the attacker fleeing the scene. Witness Karyn Washington shared that the attacker, later identified as Everton Ortiz, yelled "Trump" during the assault. In a bizarre explanation, Ortiz claimed he "snapped" and apologized for his actions, stating that the victim had slapped his behind.

input: Inside Rebel-Held Syria NPR's Kelly McEvers spent a week with anti-government rebels knows as the Free Syrian Army. The government holds the country's cities, but the rebels control considerable territory in rural area near the Turkish border.
continuation: NPR ' s Kelly McEvers stayed a week with anti - opposition rebels knows as the Free Syrian Army . The government controls the nation ' s city , but the rebels control large land in rural region near the Turkish border .
paraphrase: NPR's Kelly McEvers recently spent a week among anti-government rebels in Syria, known as the Free Syrian Army. The government still maintains control over the country's urban areas, but the rebels have a stronghold in rural regions near the Turkish border.

input:
Today's Millennials could be tomorrow's very sweaty retirees thanks to temperatures and humidity levels that are rising so fast that, by the end of this century, simply going outside could be deadly.
The study's alarming findings put into sharp perspective not just what
continuation: the future could look like for tomorrow ' s aging adults , but for society in general . With increased social and economic pressures to live longer , many governments are already projecting greater than 90 % of their populations will be 65 or newer by 2100 ." This study tells us that , unless we curb greenhouse gas emissions , we are risking the very survival of humankind in the near future , " added Simon Wong , executive director of the Center on Aging and co - writer of the study printed in The Lancet Planetary Health . " We need strong policy efforts to rapidly reduce the global temperature to the lowest possible level and maintain it there . "The study provides the first real - world estimate of how fast climate warming can affect the prevalence of human heat strain , which includes exposure to excessive heat and high humidity . U
paraphrase: Tomorrow's retirees may be today's Millennials, thanks to the rapidly rising temperatures and humidity levels that threaten to make outdoor activity deadly by the end of this century. According to a study published in The Lancet Planetary Health, governments worldwide are projecting that over 90% of their populations will be 65 or older by 2100, putting immense social and economic pressure on society. The study's findings highlight the urgent need for policy efforts to reduce global temperatures and maintain them at a low level to prevent the near-future survival of humanity. The study provides the first real-world estimate of how climate warming can impact the prevalence of human heat strain, including exposure to excessive heat and high humidity. Understanding these changes is crucial for the health and well-being of future generations.

input:
Police recruits should try to answer every question on a screening exam.
2 What Are Some Disqualifications for Getting a Job With a Police Department?
For police recruits, the psychological evaluation process represents one of the last hurdles to getting hired. The
continuation: purpose of the psychological assessment is to identify problem behaviors , and making sure the candidate is a safe person who does not have a record of violent behavior . The results of the psychological assessment can ' t be changed , although the candidate can provide additional information if the evaluator has questions about their results .No single piece of statistics from a behavioral evaluation can prevent a candidate from being hired . Instead , psychological evaluations are intended to be a comprehensive overview of a applicants emotional health , temperament and general health .A person can have some failures or difficulty areas in one or two categories , but be fine in others . After all , everyone has areas of weakness and is probably to struggle with physical problems or mental health issues at some time in life .Certain types of difficulty are more likely to block a candidate from being hired than others . Psychological evaluations are intended to identify difficult behavior and giving an overall sense
paraphrase:
Police recruits should strive to excel in every section of the screening exam to increase their chances of being hired.
The psychological assessment is a crucial step in the hiring process, as it helps identify potential red flags and ensures the candidate is a suitable fit for the job. The evaluation aims to uncover any underlying issues with the candidate's emotional health, temperament, and overall well-being. While no single statistic can automatically disqualify a candidate, certain areas of difficulty may be more likely to hinder their chances of being hired. The psychological evaluation provides a comprehensive overview of the candidate's mental and emotional state, taking into account any areas of weakness or potential issues. After all, everyone has areas of weakness and may encounter physical or mental health problems at some point in their lives. By focusing on these areas and addressing any concerns, candidates can increase their chances of being hired.

That choice is ultimately up to the board of the memorial .According to Nave , the last name to be adding to the memorial was that of Kansas Highway Patrol Trooper Robert Sp
paraphrase: In this file photo from May 4, 2018, a pipe and drum corps marches past the Kansas Law Enforcement Memorial during the 36th annual memorial service honoring peace officers who have been killed in the line of duty. The memorial, which is nearing its maximum capacity, is filled with no room to accommodate more names. The monument lists the names of over 200 officers from Kansas who died in the line of duty, with 203 names currently listed on the roll of honor after the latest addition in July. According to Chris Nave, executive director of the memorial, he does not know when the last name will be added to the roll of honor, as that decision is ultimately up to the board of the memorial.

input:
Sen. Tom Bakk will remain the DFL leader, but this time in the minority.
Sen. Paul Gazelka was elected by his Republican colleagues Thursday to be the new majority leader of the Minnesota Senate.
Gazelka will join
continuation: Minority Leader Tom Bakk as the states top two leaders for the next two years . Gazelka will assume the post that DFL Sen . Michelle Fischbach held for the previous two years .She pulled down last month after she won the race for lieutenant governor . Republicans have won the Senate in the previous few cycles , so the appointment of the next Senate majority leader is an important step in picking up the reins of power .And Gazelkas appointment as majority leader signals the degree to which Republicans have shifted to the right in recent years . As a candidate for Senate majority leader , Gazelka pledged to provide tough budget cutting to make the states funds balance and to provide a conservative agenda on social topics .Gazelkas nomination was far from unanimous . Sen . John Marty of Roseville proposed a minority member instead , arguing
paraphrase:
Senator Tom Bakk will continue as the DFL leader, but in a minority role. Senator Paul Gazelka was chosen by his Republican colleagues on Thursday to become the new majority leader of the Minnesota Senate.
Gazelka will work alongside Bakk as the state's top two leaders for the next two years. Gazelka will assume the position that DFL Senator Michelle Fischbach held for the previous two years, who stepped down last month after winning the race for lieutenant governor. The appointment of the next Senate majority leader is a significant step for Republicans as they seek to gain control of the state legislature. Gazelka's nomination as majority leader indicates the extent to which the party has shifted to the right in recent years. As a candidate, Gazelka promised to implement tough budget cutting measures to balance the state's funds and a conservative agenda on social issues. While some senators, such as John Marty of Roseville, proposed a minority leader instead, Gazelka's nomination was ultimately approved.

input:
Defensive back K'Waun Williams, shown after making a big play for the Pitt Panthers last season, has signed with the Cleveland Browns.
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- The Browns continue to add to their cornerback pile.
On Tuesday,
continuation: they agreed to terms with former Pitt standout K ' Waun Williams , a free agent signing the team indicated . The contract is a two - year contract worth up to $ 5 . 2 million , a league source told cleveland . com .Williams , who stands 6 foot tall and weighs 185 pounds , played 38 matches in his college career , notably the 2010 Tostitos BCS National Championship game for the Panthers . He was a second - team All - ACC choice and was an all - conference selection as a senior , leading the ACC with five interceptions .He has 20 career picks and one TD . Williams was the only cornerback signed last season , and is the third this offseason .The other new faces are former Bears stalwart Tracy Porter , the starter alongside Joe Haden , and 2
paraphrase:
Cleveland Browns strengthen secondary with addition of K'Waun Williams.
CLEVELAND, Ohio - The Browns continue to bolster their defensive backfield with the signing of former Pitt standout K'Waun Williams. The team announced on Tuesday that they had agreed to terms with the free agent, signing him to a two-year contract worth up to $5.2 million, according to a league source.
At 6 feet tall and 185 pounds, Williams is a versatile cornerback who played 38 games in his college career, including the 2010 Tostitos BCS National Championship game for the Panthers. He was a second-team All-ACC choice and an all-conference selection as a senior, leading the ACC with five interceptions. Throughout his career, Williams has recorded 20 career picks and one touchdown.
With this signing, the Browns have now added three new cornerbacks to their roster this offseason, including former Bears stalwart Tracy Porter, who will join starter Joe Haden in the secondary. Williams is the only cornerback to be signed last season, and his addition will undoubtedly improve the team's defensive capabilities.

input:
As Athens goes to the polls, has the British left fallen out of love with the EU?
In 1874, Karl Marx had an imaginary conversation with Mikhail Bakunin. Nowadays, they would just have had a Twitter spat, but back then
continuation: they were distinct and the terms of the debate were distinct . The gist of the debate concerned whether the Paris Commune was a purely phenomenal happening or a purely dialectical happening , and its ultimate import .To Marx , it was the former , a barricade of stones and mortar that would offer a transition to the Paris Commune of the future . To Bakunin , it was the latter : an instance of peoples struggles for emancipation from capitalism , a prototype of the revolution .Marx was willing to be proved wrong . It is this spirit of testing , challenging and pushing against the grain that is undoubtedly the most missed element of the debates within the Labour Party and wider left over Brexit .The form of the discourse has altered . In part it is a consequence of the way politics now operates : too
paraphrase: As the people of Athens head to the polls, it's worth pondering whether the British left has lost its affection for the EU. In a bygone era, Karl Marx and Mikhail Bakunin would have engaged in a lengthy debate, but today they would likely settle for a heated Twitter exchange. Back then, the terms of the debate were clear, with Marx and Bakunin disagreeing over whether the Paris Commune was a purely symbolic event or a crucial step towards a revolutionary future. For Marx, it was the former  a temporary barrier that would pave the way for a better future. Bakunin, on the other hand, saw it as the latter  a people's struggle for liberation from capitalism, serving as a prototype for a broader revolution. While Marx was open to being proven wrong, it's this spirit of challenge and critical thinking that is now sorely missing from debates within the Labour Party and the wider left on the topic of Brexit. The manner of political discourse has changed, with part of the reason being the way politics is now conducted  the shift towards more superficial and reactionary forms of engagement.

input: NOVOLUHANSKE, Ukraine (Reuters) - Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko thought he could rely for his re-election in part on the votes of soldiers who have spent years fighting pro-Russian separatists. But a visit to the frontline
continuation: on Tuesday did not win him many friends . Vova and Olga , a couple who met in the Ukrainian army , wait for Poroshenko in a break in the fight on the eastern front line between Ukrainian government forces and pro - Russian separatists , in the village of Novoluhanske , Ukraine April 2 , 2019 .REUTERS / Valentyn Ogirenko All I want is for this man to gone away , said Vova as he huddled with Olga in a foxhole in a trench on the towns outskirts , waiting for the president to come . He does not represent us and we must to leave here as shortly as possible .The Ukrainian army has struggled to fend off the rebels , backed by Russia , in the east of the nation for five years . Critics
paraphrase: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko's re-election bid may have received an unexpected setback as he visited the frontlines on Tuesday. Soldiers like Vova and Olga, who met in the Ukrainian army, expressed discontent with the president's visit. In the village of Novoluhanske, they awaited Poroshenko's arrival with a sense of unease. Vova grumbled, "All I want is for this man to go away. He doesn't represent us, and we must leave here as soon as possible." The ongoing conflict between Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists has been a long and arduous one, with the Ukrainian army struggling to fend off the rebels, backed by Russia. Critics of Poroshenko's leadership have grown louder, and the president's visit to the frontlines may not have helped his cause.

input: From the house of ZURB, creators of such apps as Bounce, Notable, Reel and Strike, comes another Web app called Spur. Its a free app that aims to help Web designers return to basics and ensure that they
continuation: keep everything simple when developing websites . Designing a blog is not an easy thing to do , and I would venture to say that many web developers are often guilty of overcomplicating things .Spur is an app that helps you keep everything simple when designing your website . It enables you to focus on your website by stripping aside all the non - essentials .The app then automatically produces sample pages based on your preferences . Everything is accomplished through the web .Theres no need to download or install anything . Once you go to the site , you can pick the kind of page you want to build .There are several choices such as a blog , business , portfolio or social site . Next , you can pick the kind of color scheme you want and adding images .You can also enter in your companys name and choose your favorite font . Finally , youll be shown a preview of what your website will look like .Once
paraphrase:
From the creators of popular web apps such as Bounce, Notable, Reel, and Strike, comes a new Web-based tool called Spur. This innovative app aims to help web designers streamline their design process by keeping things simple and focused. With the tendency to overcomplicate things in web development, Spur is here to assist designers in creating a straightforward and user-friendly website.
Upon visiting the Spur website, users can select the type of website they want to build, including a blog, business, portfolio, or social site. They can then choose from a variety of color schemes, add images, and enter their company's name and preferred font. A preview of the website's design will then be displayed, showcasing a simplified and visually appealing design.
Spur's web-based platform eliminates the need for downloads or installations, making it accessible to designers everywhere. This powerful tool helps designers keep their focus on the essentials, resulting in a more polished and effective website.

input: What were the politics of abortion like in this country before Roe v. Wade? Different than what I thought in a couple of important ways, Ive learned from a new book, Before Roe v. Wade, by Linda Greenhouse and Rev
continuation: .James C. Mohr.( It was publication in 2008 . ) The authors reconstruct a complex network of rules and court decisions .There are no quite outstanding figures at the center . Their story starts with a struggle against abortion that begun about 1830 , and that included some of the most fervent abolitionists ( or more exactly , those opposed to slavery ) , though they may not have thought it at the time .( Nor , according to the book , did their targets . ) A variety of books define the constitutional background .But this one was intriguing in its description of the tortuous mechanism by which courts ( and legislatures and state legislation ) determined who might obtain an abortion , under what circumstances . The facts on the ground meaning who might actually gotten an abortion differ a lot , but under Supreme Court case law there was an impasse , a draw , for many years .The Court said it
paraphrase: Before the landmark Roe v. Wade case in 1973, the politics of abortion in this country were more complex and nuanced than many people realize, according to a new book by Linda Greenhouse and Rev. James C. Mohr, titled "Before Roe v. Wade." The authors reconstruct a intricate network of rules and court decisions that shaped the abortion landscape. Unlike popular depictions of a single, unified anti-abortion movement, the book reveals a diverse array of actors, including some of the most fervent abolitionists, who may not have initially recognized the connection between their struggle against slavery and the issue of abortion. The authors delve into the constitutional background of abortion laws and how courts, legislatures, and state legislation determined who could obtain an abortion under what circumstances. The book offers a fresh perspective on the tortuous mechanism by which abortion became a contentious issue in American politics, with the Supreme Court often facing an impasse in its rulings. Despite the differences, the authors argue that the fight for and against abortion had a significant impact on the country's political landscape.

"Soon after the sides emerged from the rooms , the Rosellas in the front line were marking 30 - metre out , the result of dominant disposal and close , quick , runs . It was a surprise , however , to see Lantry praise the open play style of Rosellas , that took out the team ' s best and fairest award previous year ." We played some more open play footy tonight , which surprised me a bit , " he said . " We have come
paraphrase: Wests have fired an early warning shot in what their coach Matt Lantry described as "a near-complete performance". The men in green and red scored at a better than a point per minute for most of the first half before defeating Lakeside by 14 points at Windy Hill on Saturday. Lantry had a peculiar worry for the race that marked the Rosellas' season opener - it was too pleasant. "I believe the sun might have been a bit brighter," he said. "To me, it seemed a little too warm, and we struggled to play some of our more conventional game, with tough ball use and quick ball movement, which suits us better." Soon after the sides emerged from the rooms, the Rosellas were marking 30-metre out, the result of dominant disposal and close, quick runs. It was a surprise, however, to see Lantry praise the open play style of the Rosellas, which took out the team's best and fairest award the previous year. "We played some more open play footy tonight, which surprised me a bit," he said. "We have come a long way in our development."

input:
Paparazzi who took photographs of Princess Diana dying in a car wreck stopped police from getting to the scene, her inquest heard today.
Eyewitness Clifford Goorovadoo said: "It is true that when the first police officers
continuation: arrived at the scene to attend to the died princess , the paparazzi stopped the way for them . " Mr Goorovadoo was giving witness at St Pancras Coroner ' s Court , London , to support reports that paparazzi caused the death of Princess Diana by slowing down the ambulance crews .He and friend Jogi Shah had earlier told the inquest into the princess ' murder , that the ambulance might have reached the princess more swiftly . Mr Goorovadoo said : " I was down the left - hand side on the pavement and I believe that in hindsight the paparazzi slowed down the process , but that doesn ' t mean they caused her die . "He said : " The situation grew very hectic and scary . " I was yelling to everyone that the authorities were not able to gotten through ."I
paraphrase: Eyewitness Clifford Goorovadoo testified at St Pancras Coroner's Court in London that paparazzi prevented police from reaching Princess Diana after she died in a car accident. Goorovadoo and his friend Jogi Shah claimed that the paparazzi slowed down the ambulance crew, which may have delayed the princess's medical treatment. However, Goorovadoo clarified that the paparazzi did not directly cause her death. He described the chaotic scene, stating, "The situation became very hectic and scary. I was shouting to everyone that the authorities were unable to get through."

The fund has made investments in Canadian startups , including several dozen
paraphrase: Cadillac Fairview, a leading Canadian real estate developer, has recently invested $20 million in Prime Infrastructure Partners Inc., a new venture-capital fund focused on supporting local entrepreneurs and investing in the country's technology sector. This strategic move follows the footsteps of other Canadian institutions, such as pension funds, that have identified more investment opportunities in startups and newer technology firms rather than traditional industrial and office properties. S . military , she says , particularly during her period as a member of the Alaska Army National Guard ( AKARNG ) 49th Troop Command headquarters unit .After graduation , she and Ryan followed a common road , transferring to the active duty Army as a supply expert . paraphrase: Lauren Noland has a penchant for international cuisine. Growing up in Eagle River, Alaska, she credits her love for adventurous foods to the variety of wild meats available, including her favorite dish, caribou sausage lasagna. A veteran herself and the daughter of a veteran, she also shares her desire to serve her country with her husband, Ryan, a Green Beret. They met while he was in the Air Force and she was attending the University of Alaska, Fairbanks (UAF). The college town offered plenty of activities for Lauren, including playing basketball and participating in ROTC. Being a member of the U.S. military always made her feel secure, especially during her time in the Alaska Army National Guard (AKARNG) 49th Troop Command headquarters unit. After graduation, she and Ryan transitioned to active duty in the Army as a supply specialist. However, their journey was not without its challenges. In 2007, while stationed at Fort Carson, Colorado, Lauren gave birth to their second baby prematurely at 26 days. He was treated at the Michael J. Fitzpatrick Memorial Hospital.

input: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP)  Authorities apprehended a man Wednesday suspected in the early morning killings of two Des Moines area police officers who were shot to death while sitting in their patrol cars in what authorities described as separate ambush-style attacks.
continuation: The shootings prompted the canceled of a caravan of followers and police officers going from Ohio to the Iowa state Capitol on Wednesday , when officers were advising officers to be aware of their surroundings . Five hours after the first shooting , the bodies of Des Moines sergeant Jerry Wisdom , 50 , was seen outside his patrol car in an area where police cars routinely park while on duty .Less than two hours afterward , Sgt . Anthony Beminio , 38 , was killed in an attack while sat in his unmarked automobile .Police said he was attacked from behind . Authorities have not say whether the two slayings were linked .Des Moines Police Sgt . Paul Parizek called the shootings an attack - style assault that showed two officers were killed in separate locations .He added, I dont
paraphrase: Des Moines, Iowa - Authorities arrested a suspect on Wednesday in connection with the early morning killings of two Des Moines area police officers who were shot and killed while sitting in their patrol cars. The shootings occurred in separate ambush-style attacks, which prompted the cancellation of a caravan of followers and police officers headed to the Iowa state Capitol. Officers were advised to be aware of their surroundings after the first shooting, which occurred five hours prior to the second shooting. Des Moines Sergeant Jerry Wisdom, 50, was killed outside his patrol car in an area where police cars routinely park while on duty. Just over two hours later, Sergeant Anthony Beminio, 38, was attacked and killed while sitting in his unmarked vehicle. Police have not confirmed whether the two slayings were linked. Des Moines Police Sgt. Paul Parizek described the shootings as an "attack-style assault" that resulted in the deaths of two officers in separate locations. He added, "I don't think it's a coincidence that these officers were targeted in this manner."

input:
Thermal emission from erupting volcanoes on the Jupiter's moon Io. A logarithmic scale is used to classify volcanoes on the basis of thermal emission; the larger the spot, the larger the thermal emission.
A new map of
continuation: volcanoes on Jupiter ' s moon Io , released by NASA ' s Galileo satellites this week , displays a volcanic terrain that is unique even among the hundreds of active volcanoes on that planet ' s four moons . The map was produced from more than 5 , 400 thermal surveys gathered by the infrared mapping spectrometer on the Galileo shuttle as it passed Io last season .This map depicts the volcanic action that took place during 1997 and early 1998 . The data accumulated during the Galileo flyby comprise the first " worldwide thermal map " of Io ever produced .The new results also demonstrate a " dramatic improvement " in the spatial resolution , or sensitivity to detail , of the Galileo measurements . Previous thermal data was limited by the size of the infrared sensors on board the spacecraft .The new data has allowed the
paraphrase: A new infrared map of Jupiter's moon Io, recently released by NASA's Galileo satellites, reveals a unique volcanic terrain with hundreds of active volcanoes. The map was produced from over 5,400 thermal surveys taken by the infrared mapping spectrometer on the Galileo spacecraft during its passage near Io last year. The data collected during this flyby represent the first "global thermal map" of Io ever produced, showcasing the volcanic activity that occurred in 1997 and 1998. The new results demonstrate a significant improvement in the spatial resolution of the Galileo measurements, allowing for more detailed observations of Io's volcanic activity. Previous thermal data were limited by the size of the infrared sensors on board the spacecraft, but the new data have enabled researchers to gain a more detailed understanding of Io's volcanic landscape.

input:
Powerful senator and family patriarch Ted Kennedy has been working back channels to promote niece Caroline as the replacement for Hillary Rodham Clinton in the Senate, family sources told The Post.
The elder Kennedy (D-Mass.), whos battling brain cancer
continuation: , had encouraged his granddaughter to run , they says . Caroline Kennedys political friends and handlers were already reaching out to possible campaign sponsors and searching at potential campaign staffs .The selection of Kennedy would be historic . Shed be the first female senator in her own right .Shes also the first member of a First Family to going to Congress since her uncle , Teddy , was elected to the Senate . Hes also the only Kennedy senator .Hes tried to make sure [Caroline] does this....Hes helped promote her career , a source close to the Kennedys says . But a Democratic source cautioned that Caroline has never indicated interest in running for public office .Another insider confirmed that Caroline had rarely been the heir apparent . Its definitely up in the air , said the source , who indicated that her brother
paraphrase: Ted Kennedy, a prominent senator and family patriarch, has reportedly been working behind the scenes to groom his niece Caroline as his potential successor in the Senate, according to sources close to the family. The elder Kennedy, who is currently battling brain cancer, has encouraged Caroline to run for the seat, which would be a historic appointment. If selected, Caroline would become the first female senator in her own right and the first member of a First Family to serve in Congress since her uncle Teddy was elected to the Senate. Despite her uncle's efforts, Caroline has yet to express interest in running for public office, with some sources indicating that she has rarely been seen as the heir apparent. The decision remains uncertain, with one insider cautioning that Caroline has not yet shown any signs of interest in the position.

continuation: . Some individuals will say a pay is more stable and predictable than an hourly wage .Others say an hourly wage offers more certainty that they will be paying for the hours they work . However , whether a person prefers hourly or salary paying , the employer is responsible for pay the worker for the hours they work , as well as any overtime that is required .When a salaried employee does not track her hours , there might be a problem with that employee ' s pay . Identify whether the worker in question is exempt or non - exempt under the Fair Labor Standards Act .Salaried employees can be paying an annual salary , or they can be paying for each pay period based on the number of hours they job , according to the U . S . Department of Labor ' s Wage and Hour Division . Generally , employers are required to pay an hourly rate
paraphrase:
Salaried workers aren't the only ones who need to keep track of their work hours.
What if a salaried employee works more than 40 hours? It's crucial to note that employers are responsible for paying workers for the hours they work, including any overtime required. However, some individuals might prefer a salary because it offers more stability and predictability, while others might prefer an hourly wage for the certainty that they will be paid for the hours they work. Whether a worker prefers an hourly or salary pay structure, it's essential to ensure they are paid fairly and accurately for their work. To determine whether a worker is exempt or non-exempt under the Fair Labor Standards Act, employers must identify whether the worker is salaried or hourly. Salaried employees can be paid an annual salary or an hourly rate based on the number of hours they work. Generally, employers are required to pay an hourly rate, but it's crucial to double-check the employer's policies to ensure accurate payment.

input: The dominant position that Microsoft software occupies on the desktop has long been a major source of competitive advantage to Microsoft. Not only does it ensure that users of Microsoft software are familiar with the look and feel of the Microsoft interface but it also has provided a launch
continuation: ing pad for various internet and desktop services that target consumers of the products . In addition , the installed base enables a veritable set of potential customers , available at a smaller cost .However , even when Microsoft has dominance there are few examples of companies took complete advantage of the opportunity . Microsoft Windows was 99 % of desktop installations in March , even though the share of Apple computers has doubled since that time .Microsoft currently accounts for 95 % of laptop operating machines . Microsoft ' s desktop operating machines now account for about 82 % of desktop operating machines manufactured by volume .Microsoft Office was the most commonly used computer products , with nearly 70 % share and a near doubling of its share over the last 12 months . The biggest shift in the last year was in the share of the desktop applications business .Adobe ' s applications used to be a distant second . In reality , by the measure of the number of units bought , Ad
paraphrase: Microsoft's dominant position in the desktop market has long been a significant source of competitive advantage for the company. This advantage is derived from the familiarity of Microsoft's interface to users, which in turn provides a launching pad for various internet and desktop services targeting consumers of Microsoft products. Additionally, the extensive installed base of Microsoft software offers a vast potential customer base at a lower cost. However, despite Microsoft's dominance, few companies have capitalized on this opportunity. For instance, even though Apple's share of desktop computers has doubled since March, Microsoft still accounts for a considerable 95% of laptop operating systems. Moreover, Microsoft's desktop operating systems now account for approximately 82% of volume-manufactured desktop operating systems. Furthermore, Microsoft's Office suite remains the most widely used computer application, with a nearly 70% share and a notable increase in its share over the past year. A significant shift has occurred in the desktop applications business, with Adobe's applications once being the distant second. In reality, by the number of units sold, Adobe's applications have lost ground to Microsoft's products.

A motorcyclist from Worthing suffered fatal injuries following a collision with two cars on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday.
The 56-year-old motorcyclist from Worthing collided with a Jaguar travelling in
continuation: the opposite direction on the B2184 , left him with fatal injuries . The pilot of the Jaguar , a 51 - year - old guy from Worthing , was not injured .Meanwhile , a 22 - year - old woman from Harrow , who was driving a BMW , suffered minor wounds . "She added : " Officers from the severe crash investigation team are appealing for witnesses
paraphrase:
A motorcyclist from Worthing sadly passed away following a collision with two vehicles on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday. The 56-year-old biker collided with a Jaguar traveling in the opposite direction on the B2184, resulting in fatal injuries. The rider was treated by the South East Coast Ambulance Service before being transferred to Southampton General Hospital, where they later succumbed to their injuries. The crash, which occurred at 1:20 pm on Tuesday (September 13), caused the highway to be closed until around 6:30 pm. The driver of the Jaguar, a 51-year-old man from Worthing, was not injured. Additionally, a 22-year-old woman from Harrow, who was driving a BMW, suffered minor wounds. The police are appealing for witnesses to come forward and for anyone who may have captured dash cam footage of the incident to come forward.

Google has been working on retail challenges for some time. The problems: (1) how to make mobile shopping from
continuation: retailers like Target easy and more intuitive , ( 2 ) how to close the gap between buyer intent and purchase and ( 3 ) how to optimize the path to buy for a Google advertiser ( i . e . , a retailer ) on both wireless and desktop . It all sounded a lot like the problems and objectives of Google ' s competitor , Amazon .In that context , the launch of Google Shopping is curious : It ' s not an e - commerce app to compete with Amazon , but an umbrella project to assist in building better online sales channels , in the same way that Amazon does . What does the program entail ?It ' s not like the company listing pages and Amazon . Google Shopping comes in two forms : Google Shopping Campaigns and Google Shopping Actions .The former includes a combination of brand listing ads , text ads and shopping promotions . The latter , which launches this summer
paraphrase: Google's response to Amazon involves bolstering existing relationships with retailers and providing a unified checkout experience across various platforms and devices. Google has been working on improving the mobile shopping experience for retailers like Target, addressing the gap between buyer intent and purchase, and optimizing the path to buy for Google advertisers (i.e., retailers) on both wireless and desktop devices. The launch of Google Shopping can be seen as unexpected, as it's not an e-commerce app designed to compete with Amazon, but rather a project aimed at building better online sales channels, similar to Amazon's approach. The Google Shopping program consists of two components: Google Shopping Campaigns, which combine brand listing ads, text ads, and shopping promotions, and Google Shopping Actions, which launches this summer.

The Fire TV Cube is available for pre-order in the UK and Germany, with shipments starting in the UK on July 26th.

paraphrase: Before you start applying butane to cannabis, you may want to bookmark this interactive guide prepared by Vocativ.com for Oregon, which is soon to follow the trend of legalizing recreational marijuana use. The Wildcats committed 14 turnovers in the first half and 16 in the game .We needed to find some points and I just trying to gone and get as many as I can , Mathurin added . We just trying to make a lot of stops .I believe thats the
paraphrase: Arizona struggled with ball handling in the early stages of their season opener against San Jose State, with a mix of new and familiar players causing some unpredictability. However, the Wildcats were able to bounce back with a strong performance from Bennedict Mathurin, who scored 21 points and excelled in the paint. Mathurin also contributed five assists, five rebounds, and five steals, leading Arizona to a 79-75 victory. JaVier Francis added 18 points for Arizona, who led by 11 points at halftime and extended their lead to 16 in the second half. input:
Former Paterson Mayor Pat Kramer reflects on the crises facing Paterson in the wake of Joey Torres' resignation.
In light of the plea agreement made by now former Paterson Mayor Joey Torres, I was asked to reflect on the future of my beloved
continuation: city . I hesitate to do so as it is not only inappropriate but misguided for one so new in terms of city committee service to provide advising about the future of an institution as complex as the City of Paterson .Nevertheless , there are many lessons to be learned from these incidents . First and foremost , there is no straightforward solution to the problems faced by the cities of Paterson .Some difficulties are clear cut and addressable , but numerous are a product of years of the citys struggles . Neither the mayor nor the cities board has the ability to solve issues , but a broad - based pledge to solving these problems over the long - term may be a begin .The present situation did not materialize overnight . It is my hope that the council , the mayor - elect , the commercial community and all Paterson citizens commit to identifying and overcoming the challenges that so many city
paraphrase:
Former Paterson Mayor Pat Kramer shares insights on the city's future after Joey Torres' resignation.
As I reflect on the recent events in Paterson, I cannot help but feel a sense of responsibility to share my thoughts on the future of our beloved city. Although I have only recently joined the city committee, I believe it is important to learn from the lessons of the past and work towards a brighter future for Paterson.
The recent plea agreement made by former Mayor Joey Torres has brought to light the complexity of the challenges facing our city. While some issues are straightforward and addressable, others are the result of long-standing struggles that cannot be solved overnight. It is my belief that a concerted effort from the city council, the mayor-elect, the business community, and all Paterson citizens is necessary to tackle these problems head-on.
Rather than relying on any one individual or group to solve the city's problems, I believe that a collective commitment to identifying and overcoming the challenges facing Paterson is the best way forward. It is only through working together that we can hope to make meaningful progress and build a brighter future for our city.

He grins as he recalls the time his wife '
paraphrase: Elaine Tieber bantered with Dr. Thomas Goleman during her back examination, their rapport a blend of humor and camaraderie. Two years ago, she had penned a song about the affable physician, so much so that she found herself humming it during her pre-op procedure. Goleman, a skilled plastic surgeon at Sisters of Charity Health System, has a hidden talent  he's a semi-professional musician. Tieber joked that he might even join her in a bingo hall to perform the ode she wrote about their friendship. With a folksy Southern drawl, Goleman quipped that he's become more familiar with Tieber's insides than her husband, Andrew. They met at her plastic surgery appointment and have since formed a close bond. As an only child, Tieber has come to regard Goleman as a surrogate father figure. Andrew, 44, a nurse manager at Southwest General Hospital, is more than understanding of their friendship, chuckling as he recalls the time his wife sang a song about their doctor.

Senator Ryan spoke with reporters after he attended Murgon authorities offices on Monday morning to see how police were coping in the aftermath of the vicious assaults ." It ' s a traumatic incident for the local community . Police obviously taken tremendous steps to shield that local community and local parents , " he said ." It ' s very important when you have such violent home invasions that involve weapons . . . that police react very quickly . " Senator Ryan told the police force and emergency services also needed assistance ." We had 36 children active in the emergency department operations , along with adults , " he said . " These are people who need support . . . police and emergency services also need the backing of federal agencies to assist them out in these difficult situations . "Senator Ryan saying police had a 24 - hour hel
paraphrase: Queensland's police minister has announced that the violent home invasions that took place in Murgon over the weekend were not targeted. Mark Ryan spoke to reporters after visiting the Murgon police station on Monday morning to assess the situation and provide support to the local community. He emphasized the importance of quick police response in such situations, as well as the need for emergency services and federal agencies to provide assistance. Ryan expressed his concern for the 36 children and adults who were treated in the emergency department following the attacks, and emphasized the need for ongoing support for both the police and the community.

input:
Argentina labor's umbrella organization CGT, has organized a strike for Monday to protest the economic reforms being implemented y the administration of president Mauricio Macri's business friendly administration.
Tens of thousands of people have marched on Saturday in central
continuation: Buenos Aires to protest against the government ' s measures , which have been criticised for spelling the end of several state - supplied services . The recession has led many Argentines to protest in favor of a state - backed economic strategy that has saw a widening income gap and soaring poverty and inflation .Argentina ' s financial crisis came to deepen in late 2015 after a " macri bump " inflated an already overheated economy with capital inflows that had financed the nation ' s recovery from 2001 - 2002 crisis and financial crisis in 2008 . A conflict over repaying $ 100 billion of debt forced the nation to default on its overseas bond debt for the second time in 15 decades , deepening the recession , which has left the nation in recession with a devalued peso currency and a rising poverty rate
paraphrase: The Argentine labor umbrella organization, CGT, has planned a strike for Monday to protest the economic reforms being implemented by the Macri administration. Thousands of people marched in central Buenos Aires on Saturday to express their dissent against the government's measures, which have been criticized for threatening the continuation of essential state services. The economic downturn has led many Argentines to advocate for a state-backed economic approach, resulting in a widening income gap and soaring poverty and inflation. Argentina's financial crisis deepened in late 2015 after a brief period of economic growth fueled by capital inflows, which subsequently inflated the already overheated economy. The nation's default on its overseas bond debt for the second time in 15 decades further exacerbated the recession, leaving Argentina in economic downturn with a devalued peso currency and a rising poverty rate.

input:
Julia M. Carpenter, a sophomore in chemical engineering, was found dead in her Random Hall dormitory room early Monday morning. She was 20 years old.
Carpenter was a member of Alpha Chi Sigma (AXE), a professional chemistry
continuation: sorority , and was a member of the active sisterhood and treasurer of the executive board . Julia was an incredibly active member of our sisterhood , said Katie Cannella 16 , a former daughter in the sorority .She always had a grin on her face and really made an effort to make all members of our sisterhood felt unique and loved . Carpenter was also a member of the Interfraternity Council ( IFC ) Council , a committee of Undergraduate Student Government ( USG ) where she was the head of the cultural committee , overseeing activities that center on cultural groups .In her obituary on The Daily Princetonian , it was mentioned that Carpenter was an avid photographer , music enthusiast , and trivia aficionado . While Carpenter was an active undergraduate , it is still not clear why she died
paraphrase:
Julia M. Carpenter, a sophomore chemical engineering major, passed away early Monday morning in her Random Hall dormitory room. She was just 20 years old.
Carpenter was an active member of Alpha Chi Sigma (AXE), a prestigious chemistry sorority, holding positions on the executive board and as treasurer. Her former sister Katie Cannella, 16, described Julia as an "incredibly active" member who always had a smile on her face and made a conscious effort to make all members feel valued and appreciated.
In addition to her work in the sorority, Carpenter was also a member of the Interfraternity Council (IFC) and served as the head of the cultural committee, overseeing events that promoted diversity and inclusion.
According to her obituary in The Daily Princetonian, Carpenter had a passion for photography, music, and trivia. Despite her active involvement in campus life, the cause of her death remains a mystery.

input: The Dow Jones today projected a 100-point gain in pre-market hours, as investors continue to assess the impact of growing trade tensions between the United States and China. This morning's rally comes after the Dow erased a 700-point loss during Wednesday
continuation: ' s trading session . The Dow erased all of its triple - digit profits after Monday ' s open as trade tensions ramped up between China and the United States .It seems China is not interested in ongoing trade agreements , following the latest rounds of tariffs . In reaction , President Trump has advised authorities to develop increased tariffs on $ 200 billion worth of Chinese imports .Stocks fell for a second consecutive day on Thursday . The Dow Jones today was on pace to add 70 points after falling 185 points during Wednesday ' s trading session .With fresh trade war worries in the air , it ' s a smart moment to find a way to profit . Here are three companies that might benefit in the trade war .Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: JNJ) isn't the first name you might expect to
paraphrase: In pre-market hours today, the Dow Jones is expected to experience a 100-point gain as investors continue to monitor the ongoing trade tensions between the US and China. This morning's rally follows the Dow's erasure of a 700-point loss from Wednesday's trading session. However, the Dow later gave up its triple-digit gains as trade tensions escalated between the two nations. China's reluctance to adhere to existing trade agreements has prompted President Trump to instruct authorities to impose increased tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese imports. Stocks declined for the second consecutive day on Thursday, with the Dow Jones poised to add 70 points after falling 185 points during Wednesday's session. Given the current trade war concerns, it may be advantageous to explore investment opportunities in companies that could potentially benefit from the ongoing situation. Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: JNJ), for instance, might not be the most obvious choice, but its diversified portfolio and established brand could make it a worthwhile investment.

input:
Treasury Secretary Mnuchin applauded Walmart for raising its starting hourly wage.
"We thought that [tax cuts] would be great for the economy and we are thrilled with the number of companies reacting accordingly," he said Thursday.
Mnuchin also
continuation: congratulated Walmart for make its hourly wage $ 11 , up from $ 9 . Many economists say Walmarts wage hike isnt motivated by the taxation cut but by competition with Targets similar rise .Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin appeared to overstate the extent to which a recent rise in the hourly wage at Walmart is attributable to corporate taxation cuts . Mnuchin on Thursday applauded the retail giant for lifting its beginning hourly wage ." We figured that [ taxation cuts ] might be great for the economy and we are pleased with the quantity of companies reacting appropriately , " Mnuchin said . Walmart previous week said it will change its beginning salary to $ 11 an hour , up from $ 9 .Walmart claims the increase will affect
paraphrase: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin praised Walmart for its recent decision to increase its starting hourly wage. During a recent statement, Mnuchin expressed his approval for the company's move, stating that he believes the increase is a result of the positive impact of recent corporate tax cuts on the economy. Mnuchin emphasized that he is pleased with the number of companies that have reacted accordingly to the tax cuts. However, some economists have suggested that Walmart's wage hike may not be directly influenced by the tax cuts, but rather by increased competition with other retailers, such as Target, who have also recently raised their hourly wages. Mnuchin's remarks seemed to overstate the extent to which the recent wage increase at Walmart is attributable to the corporate tax cuts. Despite this, Mnuchin expressed his approval for Walmart's decision to increase its starting hourly wage, which has now risen to $11 per hour, up from $9 per hour.

I don ' t really care , " Pringle replied . " I like both sides of the ball . "B
paraphrase: Five years have passed since a Gautier athlete signed a Division I scholarship. Pringle, the latest signee, remains uncertain about his future team, the Braves, who recently clinched the SWAC championship. "I aim to win championships and make history," Pringle said. Pringle replied that he didn't care about school and was fully committed to Tulane.
