input:
China pledges "notable" emissions cut but some find lack of firm number disappointing.
But the leader of the world's biggest emitter dashed hopes that he would unveil a hard target to kickstart stalled climate talks due to be reconvened in
continuation: December . His commitment comes after the UN ' s climate scientists panel found that cutting worldwide emissions by 2050 was needed to reduce the hazardous rising in temperatures that will threaten life on earth .Rather than providing hard objectives for carbon reductions by 2020 and 2030 , the communique contained a " non - binding " pledge to " advance domestic and international efforts to meet the objectives set out in the report " . Environmental activists have been pushing for an ambitious global carbon reduction plan to replace the Kyoto Protocol , which expires in 2012 ." The Chinese promise is meaningful in terms of the threat it represents . " But China did not setting out a plan to reach this target , which is so essential for the world .This is a missed opportunity . " Carbon emissions from China surged 17 . 1 percent
paraphrase: China vows to make a "significant" emission reduction, but some remain disappointed due to the lack of a specific target. The leader of the world's largest emitter failed to unveil a firm target to revive stalled climate talks, which are set to resume in December. China's commitment comes after the United Nations' climate scientists panel warned that reducing global emissions by 2050 is necessary to mitigate the devastating effects of rising temperatures on life on Earth. Instead of providing specific reductions targets for carbon emissions by 2020 and 2030, the communiqu contained a non-binding pledge to advance domestic and international efforts to meet the objectives outlined in the report. Environmental activists have pushed for an ambitious global carbon reduction plan to replace the Kyoto Protocol, which expires in 2012. While China's promise carries significant weight, the lack of a concrete plan to achieve this target is seen as a missed opportunity. Carbon emissions from China rose 17.1 percent in recent years.

input:
Ex-chief of general staff among more than 100 former officers accused of overthrowing government in 1997.
A former Turkish army chief has gone on trial in Ankara along with more than 100 other suspects for allegedly plotting to overthrow the Turkish government 16 years ago
continuation: . The case was one of five distinct plots studied by Turkey ' s prosecutors for reportedly plotting to overthrow the nation ' s secular regime in 1997 .Husnu GAZI was among 104 former military soldiers and police officers appearing before the Ankara state security court on Tuesday . The plot involved senior military leaders who are accused of plans to bomb vital government and army installations to force a coup in the nation ." I have not read the indictment yet . But the case file contains 4 , 656 pages , " attorney Ismail MUSA , who represents GAZI , told reporters ." It ' s a colossal case . There are enormous documents that I haven ' t read yet , " he added .Earlier on Tuesday, a court in Ank
paraphrase: A former Turkish military chief has gone on trial along with over 100 other suspects in Ankara for allegedly plotting to topple the government in 1997. The trial is one of five cases being investigated by Turkish prosecutors for allegedly attempting to overthrow the country's secular regime that year. Among the accused is Husnu GAZI, who is appearing before the Ankara state security court alongside 104 former military personnel and police officers. The plot allegedly involved senior military leaders who were planning to bomb key government and army installations to spark a coup in the country. The case file contains 4,656 pages, according to the attorney representing GAZI, and it is expected to be a complex and lengthy trial.

input:
Jan. 25 - A child is pulled from rubble in Aleppo while Syria's civil war foes held their first face-to-face meeting at the start of talks to end nearly three years of conflict. Mana Rabiee reports.
The Syrian opposition
continuation: talks in Switzerland with a delegation from the government of Bashar al - Assad . The two sides meeting face to facing for the first time since the civil war beginning .And back in Syria , the dictatorship strikes rebel strongholds including Aleppo . The city which has borne the brunt of the aggression .Witnesses stated at least six civilians died in the attacks and rescue teams have been combing through the rubble for survivors . This woman was yanked from the wreckage by emergency services .The talks aim to end Syria ' s civil war that has left 150 , 000 persons killed and millions displaced . But both sides continue divided .Syrian opposition spokesman Oubai Shahbandar told Reuters : " The folks who came here want to talk to the opposition that ' s it . This is not a negotiation with the dictator Bashar
paraphrase: On January 25th, a young child was rescued from the rubble of a building in Aleppo, Syria, as the country's warring parties held their first face-to-face talks in Switzerland to end nearly three years of conflict. Meanwhile, the Syrian government led by Bashar al-Assad continued to strike rebel strongholds, including Aleppo, which has been the epicenter of the fighting. According to witnesses, at least six civilians were killed in the attacks, and rescue teams were working tirelessly to find survivors. This dramatic rescue operation unfolded as the opposition and government delegations met for the first time since the conflict began, with the goal of ending the devastating civil war that has resulted in the deaths of over 150,000 people and displaced millions. Despite the talks, both sides remained divided, as opposition spokesperson Oubai Shahbandar told Reuters, "The people who came here want to talk to the opposition, that's it. This is not a negotiation with the dictator Bashar."

input: Looks like Apple wants a slice of the wearable camera action, based on recently awarded patents. The US Patents and Trademarks Office today awarded the iPhone maker a series of 34 patents, including one that details a GoPro-like action camera system.
continuation: According to the patent , the activity camera would be embedded with a smartwatch . The camera can be configured with a passive element that can serve as a power switch that wakes the camera and starts it off .The camera can be configured with a passive element that can serve as a digital on / off switch that wakes the camera and starts it off , the patent reads . The patent goes on to explain how the wearable cameras would be paired with a smartwatch and linked up to a smartphone via Bluetooth .The smartphone would then be able to screen a number of still photographs , provide editing features and view live video . Obviously , this is just a patent at this point , which means theres no guarantee Apple will actually roll out a GoPro - like device .And theres no telling what the actual device might look like . But its definitely one of the more exciting Apple patents
paraphrase: Apple seems to be planning a foray into the wearable camera market, according to recently granted patents. The US Patent and Trademark Office has awarded the tech giant 34 patents, including one for a GoPro-like action camera system. According to the patent, the activity camera would be integrated with a smartwatch. The camera can be activated using a passive element that serves as a power switch, waking the camera and starting it up. The patent also describes how the wearable cameras would be paired with a smartwatch and connected to a smartphone via Bluetooth. The smartphone could then display still images, offer editing features, and stream live video. It's important to note that this is just a patent at this point, and there's no guarantee that Apple will actually produce a GoPro-like device. The design and features of the actual product remain a mystery, but this is an exciting development nonetheless.

The fund will be targeting mid - market private companies in India and is pursuing an investment of $ 150 million , which will be geared towards taking stakes of 25 - 49 % .The fund will principally concentrate on the small and mid - cap market of India in three key areas healthcare , education and infrastructure and will be run as a long - term private equity fund . This fund will exist as a parallel fund to the Aureos India Fund II , which Pais had co - managed .The squad would be seeking to
paraphrase: The latest entrant to the growing list of independent fund managers is the Ex-Aureos Capital's India team, which has combined forces to establish a $150-million Access India Advantages Fund. The fund aims to invest in mid-market opportunities in India, with a focus on the healthcare, education, and infrastructure sectors. The team, previously known as Antares, has been renamed and is led by former Aureos India squad manager Dilip Pais, along with his new colleagues Nitin Patil, Chandresh Rawat, and Ramakant Vishwakarma. The fund will seek to acquire stakes of 25-49% in private mid-cap companies in India and will be managed as a long-term private equity fund. This parallel fund to Aureos India Fund II, which Pais co-managed, marks a new chapter in the team's investment journey.

THOUSAND OAKS, CA (RNN) - Less than two weeks after the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting that killed 11, another mass shooting has taken a dozen lives in California.
A gunman killed 12 people, including a sheriffs
continuation: deputy , at a Thousand Oaks nightclub Wednesday day in the Southern California town north of Los Angeles . Among the victims was Sergeant Ron Helus , a veteran with the Ventura County Sheriffs Office who responded to reports of a shot at 11 : 20 p . m . As he came in , he saw the gunman , a male , he shooting him , at which moment the male dropped his gun and was still standing and turned around and shot at the deputy , Ventura County Sheriff Geoff Dean told reporters .The deputy falling and the gunman looked around and , as he was turning around , fired one more round and striking the deputy at which point the deputy fired one more round and wounded the gunman . Dean said the defendants motive remains unsure .The gunman , who was wore military - style gear and
paraphrase: A shocking mass shooting in Thousand Oaks, California, has left 12 people dead, including a veteran sheriff's deputy. The tragedy occurred at a nightclub on Wednesday night, just over a week after the Pittsburgh synagogue attack that claimed 11 lives. The gunman, a male, entered the nightclub around 11:20 PM and opened fire, killing several people including Ventura County Sheriff's Office Sergeant Ron Helus, who responded to the scene. As Helus approached the gunman, he was shot, but managed to fire back and wound the gunman before falling. The gunman then fired one more round, striking the deputy, before the deputy fired back and wounded the gunman. The motive for the attack is still unknown. The gunman, dressed in military-style gear, was armed and dangerous, highlighting the urgent need for stricter gun control measures in the United States.

The Syrian people are unlikely to welcome any extension of the Kurdish autonomous region, and ISIS remains a formidable foe in the region, with the U.S. relying on Kurdish troops to combat the terrorist organization. input: Andrew P. Fitzgerald, 50, formerly of Plattsburgh, N.Y., passed away Tuesday, March 5, 2019, at Sarasota Memorial Hospital with his family by his side. He was born in Plattsburgh, N.Y.,
continuation: May 23, 1968, the son of James F. and Mary (Fleck) Fitzgerald.He attended Clinton High School and graduated in 1986.Andrew then moved on to work at the Plattsburgh International Airport as an Air Traffic Controller . In his spare time , he enjoyed the great outdoors ; fishing , boating , golfing , and spending time with his animals .In 1997 , he took the move to Fort Lauderdale , Fla . There he had the privilege of working as a contractor at Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport .His real desire was his family . In 2016 , Andrew was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer .He fought it with courage and integrity for three years . He left behind his families , James and Mary Fitzgerald ; two sons , Andy
paraphrase: Andrew P. Fitzgerald, a man of 50 years, passed away on Tuesday, March 5, 2019, surrounded by his loving family at Sarasota Memorial Hospital. Born on May 23, 1968, in Plattsburgh, New York, he was the son of James F. and Mary (Fleck) Fitzgerald. Growing up, Andrew attended Clinton High School and graduated in 1986. He went on to pursue a career as an Air Traffic Controller at the Plattsburgh International Airport. When he wasn't working, Andrew enjoyed spending time outdoors, indulging in activities such as fishing, boating, golfing, and spoiling his beloved animals. In 1997, Andrew made the move to Fort Lauderdale, Florida, where he worked as a contractor at Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport. More than anything, Andrew cherished his family, and in 2016, he faced a difficult challenge when he was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. Despite the courageous fight he put up, Andrew passed away three years later, leaving behind his adoring parents, James and Mary Fitzgerald, and his two sons, Andy.

input: My son Kris, an Army Ranger, was one of the first killed in action on October 19, 2001, in Operation Rhino, our first incursion into Afghanistan right after 9/11. Kris had been in Ranger School during that attack on American soil
continuation: , and they were among the first ones sent to Afghanistan.They hadn't even had time to take a shakedown.One morning I was going to the Capitol and I put on the radio in my vehicle and listened to it as I drove . The president was talking .I walked to the floor of the House , and when we adjourned the bodies came in , walked down the hall , and we saw a man who was obviously very upset , and it turned out to be Dick Cheney . We went into a back room and he said , " I want to told you about my sister Liz , who was working at the World Trade Center , and how she gets away from there and her second brother was in the Pentagon when the aircraft came into it .So we ' re very concerned about how you people in Congress are going to support the president . " I was utterly shocked .I mean , Dick
paraphrase: On October 19, 2001, my son Kris, a dedicated Army Ranger, was tragically killed in action during Operation Rhino, the first military incursion into Afghanistan following the 9/11 attacks. Kris had recently completed Ranger School and was among the initial troops deployed to Afghanistan, without even having time to undergo a "shakedown" process. As I drove to the Capitol, I listened to the president's address on the radio, where he spoke of the need for Congress to provide support in the wake of this devastating event. Upon arriving at the House of Representatives, I was met with the somber news that Dick Cheney, the vice president at the time, had lost his sister Liz, who was working at the World Trade Center. His second brother was also affected, as he was in the Pentagon when the aircraft struck. The gravity of the situation hit me hard, and I was deeply moved by Cheney's emotional appeal for congressional support.

input: Alastair Cook has been granted more time to decide his future as Test captain, with England having privately advised that Fridays meeting with the director of cricket, Andrew Strauss, will not be followed by a definitive announcement on the subject.
continuation: After confirming on Monday that Englands next play would be a two - Test series in the West Indies beginning 13 May , the Board of Cricket Control in India wrote to the ECB to indicate England might have time to make a complete decision . England Cricket later confirmed they had made representations to the ICC .The ECB board will meet on Thursday to consider Cooks future and Strauss will return to his job as managing chairman , having been acting chief executive since February when Martin Johnson resigned . Johnson subsequently made it clear that England required a solid start to the World Cup if they were to stand any possibility of progressing beyond the group stage .One possibility , which appeared popular with both Cook and the England players , was for him to move down from the captaincy of the Test squad and maintain the Test vice - captaincy as well as his role as ODI captain . Cook has already stated that he did not
paraphrase: England has given Alastair Cook more time to decide on his future as Test captain, with a meeting scheduled for Friday with director of cricket, Andrew Strauss. Although the team had previously confirmed their next test series in the West Indies starting on May 13, the Board of Cricket Control in India informed the ECB that England may need more time to make a final decision. England Cricket later confirmed that they had made representations to the ICC. The ECB board will meet on Thursday to discuss Cook's future and Strauss will resume his role as managing chairman, having acted as acting chief executive since February when Martin Johnson resigned. Johnson had previously stated that England needed a strong start to the World Cup to advance beyond the group stage. One possible solution, which appeared to be popular with both Cook and the England players, was for him to step down as Test captain but remain as Test vice-captain and ODI captain. Cook has already stated that he is not interested in giving up his ODI captaincy.

input: (Leah Hogsten | The Salt Lake Tribune) Derek Miller, right, president and CEO of the Salt Lake Chamber, passes a pen to the city's business and civic leaders who gathered Thursday to sign the Utah Compact, initially adopted in 2010.
continuation: Salt Lake City , Jan . 11 , 2018 . By Benjamin Wood | The Salt Lake Tribune Salt Lake City representatives have reaffirmed their engagement to immigration and asylum policy with a formal restatement of a compact originally ratified five years previously .The Utah Compact is a document that details Salt Lake Citys goals regarding immigration and asylum policy . It was originally signed in 2010 in reaction to a resolution that passed the Utah State Legislature that directed the Utah Board of Regents to prioritize those with an immediate family member still residing in the state .During a media conference on Thursday , Salt Lake City Mayor Jackie Biskupski said that while the original compact has largely remained the same , she believes it will be a call to action to support migrants resettlement . The compact was signed
paraphrase: Salt Lake City reaffirms commitment to immigration and asylum policy with updated compact. In a show of solidarity, business and civic leaders gathered to reiterate the city's stance on immigration and asylum policy, five years after initially adopting the Utah Compact. The document outlines Salt Lake City's objectives in this regard, emphasizing the importance of supporting migrants and refugees in their resettlement. At a media conference on Thursday, Mayor Jackie Biskupski stressed that while the original compact remains largely unchanged, it serves as a reminder to continue advocating for the well-being of these individuals.

paraphrase: Arsenal made significant progress towards the Europa League semi-finals with a dominating 4-1 victory over CSKA Moscow. Meanwhile, Atletico Madrid also advanced with a 2-0 home win over Sporting Lisbon. Lazio continued their impressive run, defeating Qarabag 3-0, while Olympique de Marseille edged closer to the knockout phase with a 1-0 home win against Sporting, who struggled throughout and failed to pose any significant threats to Atletico. In an impressive individual performance, Marco Asensio notched the first goal for Atletico in the 40th minute, before Lucas Silva tapped in the second in the 57th minute. Koke then sealed the victory with a free kick in the 87th minute. Iranian goalkeeper Alireza Beiranvand put on an incredible display in Qarabaq's debut Europa League home match, making several stunning saves, including one from Seydou Doumbia before the break. Despite these heroics, Qarabaq were unable to muster any significant offense.

Patients who need cannabis as treatment have been forgotten, and before discussing the recreational use of the plant, Malta should prioritise access to more medicinal cannabis preparations, the authorities are being urged.
It is upsetting to be
continuation: told that we have to wait another year for [ the ] commercialisation [ of medicinal cannabis ] . It is vicious to ask people who are ill , in excruciating pain and suffering , to wait another year , said Dr Carol Balzan , medical director at Rethink Ireland .The NGO is lobbying for the decriminalisation of medicinal cannabis , while at the same time pushing for legalisation of recreational cannabis . Dr Balzan spoke during a public hearing that the government is holding today to collect feedback on its proposals to legalise recreational cannabis .As it sits , Malta might remain the first country in the world to legalise the recreational application of marijuana in parliament . Maltese stakeholders , as well as the European Commission , are watching the experiment closely .A several of MPs have stated fears over this scheme , fearing that the nation will be
paraphrase: Patients in need of cannabis as a treatment have been overlooked, and before discussing its recreational use, Malta should prioritize expanding access to more medical cannabis formulations, advocates are urging. It is disheartening to hear that those suffering from illnesses, excruciating pain, and distress must wait another year for commercialization of medicinal cannabis, said Dr. Carol Balzan, medical director at Rethink Ireland. The NGO is pushing for both the decriminalization of medicinal cannabis and the legalization of recreational cannabis. Dr. Balzan spoke during a public hearing today, where the government is gathering feedback on its proposals to legalize recreational cannabis. With Malta potentially becoming the first country in the world to legalize the recreational use of marijuana in parliament, stakeholders and the European Commission are closely watching the experiment. Some Members of Parliament have expressed concerns about this scheme, worrying that the country may face unforeseen consequences.

paraphrase: "On to the next phase, Jack says, as they observe the GE sign at 30 Rockefeller Center shutting down and Kabletown's sign illuminating in its place. input: That it's such a hidden statistic, however, is an embarrassing reflection of our collective ignorance. Hundreds more people died by suicide in Oregon in 2017 than by traffic crashes, firearms or drug overdose. The suicide rate in Oregon is well above the national average
continuation: . Only 28 states have greater rates than Oregon , according to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention .But with only about half of all U . S . states reporting annual suicide statistics , no someone is really sure of how suicide rates compare nationally or state to state . Oregon is among just a handful of states California , Connecticut , Florida , New Hampshire and New York with sufficient data and resources to examine the scope of the issue .All 50 states , however , able track and explore suicide rates on their own , said Nancy Aytch , a member of the national advisory committee of the Oregon Violent Death Reporting System . That ' s because the underused data already exists at a state or federal level ." As long as we ' re not actively looking for it , it ' s not going to show
paraphrase: The surprising fact that suicide is a lesser-known statistic highlights our collective ignorance. According to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, more people died by suicide in Oregon in 2017 than by traffic accidents, firearms, or drug overdoses. Oregon's suicide rate is higher than the national average, with only 28 states having higher rates. However, due to incomplete data reporting, it's difficult to determine the national suicide rate compared to state-to-state comparisons. Oregon is one of five states with sufficient data and resources to study the issue, along with California, Connecticut, Florida, and New York. Despite this, all 50 states have the ability to track and examine suicide rates on their own, as stated by Nancy Aytch, a member of the national advisory committee of the Oregon Violent Death Reporting System. The underutilization of existing data highlights the need for active effort in addressing this issue.

input:
Every year in sports, theres a breakout player or a breakout moment that inspires the masses to dig deeper for their dreams.
Justin Holiday may be the next breakout story.
Now a mainstay in the NBA, Holiday is seeing a
continuation: lot of success as an undrafted player for the Chicago Bulls , notably being called to the All - Star Team this year . One thing is clear though .He wouldnt have been able to be here without his religion and confidence in Jesus Christ . Everything about my walk is 100 % because of Jesus Christ , Holiday said .I cant be more grateful for what hes done for me and my life . Holiday was born and raised in an sports family .His father , A . J . , was a standout athlete in college and played in the NFL for the Minnesota Vikings . A . J .now operates a community center in Mesa , Ariz . , and loves taught kids what it means to be a better athlete and a better boy . His athletic skills rub off on me , Holiday said .I had a tremendous character model .
paraphrase:
Every year in sports, there is a rising star or a moment that inspires people to pursue their dreams with renewed vigor. Justin Holiday may be the next player to capture the attention of the sports world.
As a key member of the Chicago Bulls, Holiday has made a name for himself with his impressive performances on the court. He was recently selected to the All-Star Team, a testament to his dedication and hard work. But according to Holiday, it's not just his athletic abilities that have contributed to his success. He credits his religion and faith in Jesus Christ for giving him the strength and confidence to pursue his dreams.
Holiday was born and raised in a family of athletes, with his father, A.J., being a standout college athlete and later playing in the NFL for the Minnesota Vikings. A.J. now runs a community center in Mesa, Arizona, where he teaches young athletes the importance of hard work and character. Holiday has clearly inherited his father's athletic genes, but he also learned valuable lessons about sportsmanship and integrity from his father's example. As Holiday puts it, "Everything about my walk is 100% because of Jesus Christ. I can't be more grateful for what he's done for me and my life."

input: The 2019 Honda Pilot, on the outside, looks like any other modern SUV. It has the ride height and space thats convinced Americans to abandon cars and flock toward larger vehicles, and, like the rest of that segment, it blends in
continuation: . In indeed , the Pilot has had that look for a couple of years now , with some slight trim updates and a revised front fascia in 2016 .The powertrain , however , makes the Pilot distinct . Its still a little strange to see a Honda car with a large V6 and nine - speed automatic powertrain , but the two complement each other well .In the end , its an incredibly comfortable SUV that will fit the needs of most parents well . The Honda Pilot shares a lot of its design language with the Honda Ridgeline .While the Pilot has the more popular SUV profile , the Ridgeline has the higher seating position and mattress functionality of an SUV and the drivetrain of a vehicle . Both vehicles gets a refresh in 2016 , and even though its two model years later , the Pilot is
paraphrase: On the outside, the 2019 Honda Pilot appears to be a standard modern SUV, blending in with its segment and failing to stand out. However, beneath its familiar exterior lies a distinct powertrain, featuring a large V6 and nine-speed automatic, which work in harmony. Despite being released a few years ago, the Pilot remains an incredibly comfortable SUV, perfect for most parents' needs. Interestingly, the Pilot shares some design elements with the Honda Ridgeline, with the latter offering a higher seating position and multi-functional bed, along with a drivetrain more akin to a vehicle. Both models received refreshes in 2016, with the Pilot's release coming a year later, yet it still manages to maintain its appeal.

input:
Which college degrees are the most and least valuable to Floridians?
The ubiquitous career advice hurled at young people sounds so simple. Make a career of your passions.
For some, its pitch perfect. They know what they love
continuation: , and the path they seek to follow to make a living at it . For others , it can be hard to make the link .Theyve been told for decades that they should choose a career with high demand . As it turns out , some degrees are still paid off a decade after graduation while others have not even stayed at par with inflation .In an era where researchers believe students should consider earnings in choosing a college , one question on top of that : which degree will paid off ? Florida is a hotbed of college graduates , and some of its universities and colleges can be among the most expensive in the nation .But which degrees make it worth it ? In its latest college salary report , Forbes compared median salaries of graduates by their degree fields .The results might be shocking . Two degrees that a year earlier might not have qualified as having high revenues now sit in the top 1
paraphrase:
Which college degrees are the most and least valuable to Floridians?
Young people are often bombarded with generic career advice, urging them to follow their passions and make a living out of them. However, for some, it's not as straightforward. They've been told to choose a high-demand career, but some degrees are still not paying off a decade after graduation, while others haven't even kept up with inflation. In today's era of earnings-driven college choices, the question remains: which degree will provide the best return on investment? Florida is home to a multitude of college graduates, and some of its universities are among the most expensive in the nation. So, which degrees are worth it? A recent college salary report by Forbes revealed some surprising results. Two degrees that were previously thought to have low revenues have now climbed to the top of the list.

input: The Vietnamese version of the 2010 census questionnaire used the words dieu tra to describe the population tally  but what the words really conveyed was something like a communist government investigation. On Korean forms, county was translated
continuation: as ma - gu but then at the same time , letters like street , other , and unknown were somehow translated as free , barren , and whole which appear to make more sense as absolute terms . It sounds like the questions were translated into English , and then translated back into Chinese from English , and then back again into the foreign language and then into Chinese .If thats the case , those who were once accustomed to entering the census forms in English might have experienced trouble entry the forms in Chinese . Of course , the work was done for us .If we had entered the forms in Chinese , we wouldnt have known the error the ones that were not corrected until this years version of the census form . This year , the real property agent stands out .He sought a distinct column to explain his real property trade , and even though it was declined , he persisted and the question was added
paraphrase: The 2010 census questionnaire in Vietnamese used the term "diep tra" to count the population, but it conveyed something more akin to a communist government investigation. On Korean forms, the term "ma-gu" was used for "county," but unexpectedly, other terms like "free," "barren," and "whole" were translated for "street," "other," and "unknown." It appears that the questions were translated from English and then back into Chinese multiple times, resulting in confusion for those who were accustomed to filling out the forms in English. Despite the errors, the work was done for us, and those who entered the forms in Chinese may not have been aware of the issues until this year's updated census form. This year, a real estate agent persisted in requesting a separate column to describe his real estate business, even after it was initially declined, and the question was eventually added.

input:
The city took quotes on striping and marking of streets.
MUNCIE, Ind.  Local streets are due to get newly-painted center lines and other pavement markings soon.
The Muncie Board of Works and Public Safety on
continuation: Monday night decided to consider two related proposals . Bids on that development are slated to be opened on April 29 , with work beginning May 27 and continuing through the end of the month , said Kevin Smith , assistant to city builder John McDermond .The city took quotes on striping and marking of roads , with Midwest Painting , Inc . , Muncie , to take the smallest bidding . The corporation presented a proposal to mark 36 km of street with a new " green back " curb , remove existing striping and making fresh street signs , Smith said .The city additionally received an outside quote from Smitty ' s Striping , Fishers , for resurfacing work to 15 miles of roads and an additional 40 kilometers of asphalt patching and crack repair . Smith said McDermond will review the quotes and make recommendations .If the board approved
paraphrase: The municipality is set to revamp its street infrastructure with newly-painted center lines and other pavement markings. The Muncie Board of Works and Public Safety has decided to consider two related proposals, with bids scheduled to be opened on April 29. The city recently solicited quotes for the striping and marking of roads, with Midwest Painting, Inc., Muncie, submitting the smallest bid. The corporation proposed painting 36 kilometers of streets with a new "green back" curb, removing existing striping, and replacing fresh street signs. Additionally, the city received an outside quote from Smitty's Striping, Fishers, for resurfacing work on 15 miles of roads and an additional 40 kilometers of asphalt patching and crack repair. The city builder, John McDermond, will review the quotes and make recommendations to the board. If approved, the work is expected to begin on May 27 and continue through the end of the month.

input: Despite Israels siege of Gaza, and the escalating displacement in the Negev and East Jerusalem, Palestinians have some reason to celebrate. In Washington a food co-op has passed a resolution calling for a boycott of Israeli products, confirming that
continuation: this issue has gotten mainstream and is on its way to becoming the next BDS success story . Meanwhile , Israeli citizens have never looked more despondent and disaffected .That is a dangerous mixture , particularly since the Israelis are not looking to the US for direction on Gaza . The Israelis are split , with those for peace and justice battling those who are so fearing of winning their Jewish majority that they wish to re - capture Gaza , or simply to have their way in one of the worlds most vicious and powerful death - squads .The moral power of the movement for Boycott , Divestment and Sanctions is now being felt by those who are in power in the government of Israel , and it is also being felt by the broad variety of individuals across the spectrum of society that are against Israeli laws . What is behind these changes is the fact that a increased proportion of Israelis are
paraphrase: Amidst Israel's siege of Gaza and the growing displacement in the Negev and East Jerusalem, there is a glimmer of hope for Palestinians. In a remarkable turn of events, a food co-op in Washington has passed a resolution calling for a boycott of Israeli products, signaling that this issue has gained significant mainstream support and is on its way to becoming the next major success story of the Boycott, Divestment, and Sanctions (BDS) movement. Meanwhile, Israeli citizens are visibly more despondent and disillusioned than ever before, a development that could have far-reaching consequences. As the Israeli government faces mounting pressure from both domestic and international forces, the moral power of the BDS movement is proving to be a significant challenge to those in power. The shift in public opinion is particularly evident among the growing number of Israelis who are advocating for peace and justice, as they confront those who are determined to maintain their Jewish majority at any cost, even if it means reclaiming Gaza or exerting their dominance through one of the most ruthless and powerful death squads in the world.

input:
Amnesty International calls upon Hamas (the Islamic Resistance Movement) to commit unequivocally to abide by international law, respect the rights of all Palestinians across the political spectrum and repudiate its policy of targeting Israeli civilians.
"As it prepares to form the next
continuation: Palestinian Authority , Hamas must commit unequivocally to abide by international legislation , recognize the rights of all Palestinians across the political spectrum , and repudiate its policy of targeting Israeli civilians . " This policy , which is contrary to international humanitarian legislation , unable be reconciled with a Palestinian State that observes international legislation and guards the liberties of all its citizens ." Palestinians do not wish Hamas to return to its pre - election policy of ignoring the legitimacy of Israel and opposing any accommodation with it . Hamas now has an opportunity to indicate that its policy has altered ." Amnesty International feels that a Palestinian State founded on the principles of international human rights and international humanitarian law can be a peaceful , stable and democratic nation , which can
paraphrase: Amnesty International urges Hamas to unequivocally adhere to international law and respect the rights of all Palestinians across the political spectrum. Hamas must repudiate its policy of targeting Israeli civilians, which is in direct violation of international humanitarian law. This policy is incompatible with the establishment of a Palestinian state that upholds international law and protects the rights of all its citizens. Palestinians do not want Hamas to return to its pre-election stance of disregarding Israel's legitimacy and opposing any accommodation with it. Now is Hamas' opportunity to demonstrate that it has shifted its policy. Amnesty International believes that a Palestinian state founded on the principles of human rights and international law can be a peaceful, stable, and democratic nation.

input: As part of an effort to give applications more control over the infrastructure used to host them in the cloud, Riverbed Technology today at the Interop 2013 conference unveiled the Stingray Services Controller, a next-generation instance of the virtual application delivery controller (
continuation: vADC ) that extends virtual networking and network function virtualization ( NFV ) functionality to the information center . Stingray Services Controller is an application - aware networking and virtualization technology that letting the applications implemented in the cloud orchestrate the way their connections are provisioned , according to Riverbeds 14 - page information sheet .This centralizes the creation , management and decommissioning of network resources to provide cloud operations more fast and in more efficient ways . It additionally encourages multi - tenant environments , which is becoming increasingly important to consumers of public cloud networking services .The [ information ] hub has become overloaded with lots of servers and networks and tools , said John Magee , deputy chief of marketing for information center and cloud for Riverbed . Instead , with Stingray , Magee continued , developers and other software - aware workers can build self - service portals to do some of the
paraphrase:
Riverbed Technology unveiled the Stingray Services Controller at the Interop 2013 conference, a cutting-edge instance of the virtual application delivery controller (vADC) that integrates virtual networking and network function virtualization (NFV) capabilities within the data center. This innovative technology allows applications deployed in the cloud to exercise greater control over the infrastructure they rely on, streamlining the process of creating, managing, and decommissioning network resources. By centralizing these tasks, Stingray Services Controller enhances cloud operations' speed and efficiency, making it ideal for multi-tenant environments that are becoming increasingly popular among cloud networking service consumers.
According to John Magee, Riverbed's deputy chief of marketing for information center and cloud, the traditional information hub has become cluttered with an abundance of servers, networks, and tools. To address this issue, Stingray Services Controller enables developers and other software-savvy workers to construct self-service portals, thereby simplifying the process of managing network resources.

input: "Two Novelties in Russian Courts: Defense Lawyers and Jury Trials" (front page, May 11) reports that there are 50,000 lawyers in Russia, about half of them defense lawyers, many of them graduated from military or K.G.
continuation: B . institutes . The former Soviet Union spent more on lawyers than on teachers in its entire educational structure .
paraphrase: In the latest issue of "INPUT," the front page article highlights two significant developments in Russian courts: the increased presence of defense lawyers and the introduction of jury trials. According to the article, there are approximately 50,000 lawyers in Russia, with over half of them specializing in defense work. Many of these lawyers have backgrounds in military or KGB institutions, which may have contributed to the country's significant investment in legal education. It's worth noting that the former Soviet Union dedicated more resources to lawyer training than any other profession, underscoring the importance of the legal system in the country's social and political landscape.

input: The industry veteran will be honored for his creative accomplishments with a 2013 Clio Lifetime Achievement Award in May. Here, he talks with Co.Create about fighting for your ideas, how to handle clients who dont appreciate good work, and putting

Not long after Ben Kruger graduated from NYU film school in 1975 , he saw an opportunity in the fast - emerging field of music clips .Most of the people creating those at the period were still working in film and were still making filmslike Michael Mann and Milos Formanand Kruger seemed like there was a huge opportunity for somebody with the same experience , but with the new skill to do a single frame . That was him .The pairing was ideal . Soon , rock stars from the likes of the Clash , Bruce Springsteen , and the Rolling Stones were come to The Works offices to hang out and hear their clips , and The Works became the first music video development corporation in New York .Kruger and Millar left The Works to form their own company in the early 1980s , when they arrived to
paraphrase:
A seasoned industry professional will be recognized for their groundbreaking achievements with a 2013 Clio Lifetime Achievement Award in May. In an exclusive interview with Co.Create, the individual shares their insights on fighting for one's creative vision, dealing with clients who do not appreciate quality work, and the challenge of dedicating too much time to a single project.
After graduating from NYU's film school in 1975, Ben Kruger identified an opportunity in the rapidly growing field of music clips. At the time, most professionals creating these were still working in film, and Kruger saw a chance to bridge the gap between traditional filmmaking and the new medium. He began working with rock stars such as The Clash, Bruce Springsteen, and the Rolling Stones, and The Works became the first music video development company in New York. Kruger and his partner, Millar, eventually left The Works to form their own company in the early 1980s.

input:
A comeback story was crowned with a happy ending at Wimbledon on Saturday  but it was the revitalised Angelique Kerber rather than Serena Williams who lifted the trophy.
With the Duchesses of Sussex and Cambridge in the Royal Box and Tiger
continuation: Woods among the fans on Centre Court , Kerber eventually brought aside her American competitor 6 - 3 , 6 - 3 to claim a first major championship since the 2016 Australian Open . Williams failed to retain the championship she won so convincingly 12 months previously as she finished her bid to draw level with Margaret Court on 24 Grand Slam singles championships .Kerber , the world number 12 , had lost her earlier three grand slam finals but looked a different player as she powered through to claim a third Wimbledon title in five months . Kerber admitted to a bout of nerves as she recovered from a fragile start to her first major final since 2016 ." I try to hold my nerves in the beginning , " the 30 - year - old said . " I didn ' t felt comfortable because she played aggressive .
paraphrase: A heartwarming tale of redemption unfolded at Wimbledon on Saturday, with the resurgent Angelique Kerber emerging victorious against Serena Williams. The Duchesses of Sussex and Cambridge watched from the Royal Box, alongside golf legend Tiger Woods, as Kerber claimed her first major championship since the 2016 Australian Open with a dominant 6-3, 6-3 win. Williams, seeking to equal Margaret Court's record of 24 Grand Slam singles titles, ultimately fell short as she struggled to find her rhythm in the final. Kerber, the world number 12, had lost her previous three grand slam finals but showed remarkable resilience as she powered through to claim her third Wimbledon title in five months. In her post-match interview, Kerber acknowledged feeling nervous at the start of the match but credited her victory to her ability to overcome those nerves and play aggressively.

input:
Radio host Alan Chartock interviewed Gov. Cuomo on Thursday afternoon, just as he has on hundreds of occasions in the past.
It was a remarkable first.
Chartock, the most omnipresent voice on radio airwaves from Westchester to southern
continuation: Vermont , a public broadcasting icon for more than four decades , interviewed his former governor for the first time on WAMC public radio . He declined to comment Thursday , other than to say that its vital to broaden the scope of public debate .Cuomo and Chartock have had a public spat over the airwaves in the past . Their rivalry began last August when the governor informed WAMCs Brian Shields that , because of WAMCs aggressive local programming , the channel had become not a news station anymore .The tiff cracked into the open on Sept . 17 , 2014 , when the gubernatorial used the hurricane that destroyed New York City as a symbol for New Yorks deteriorating relationship with the states public media channel , including WAMC . Cuomo looks at
paraphrase: Alan Chartock, a seasoned radio host with over four decades of experience, recently sat down with New York Governor Andrew Cuomo for an interview on WAMC public radio. This marks a rare occasion, as Chartock has never interviewed Cuomo before. During the interview, Cuomo declined to provide any specific comments, but emphasized the importance of expanding the scope of public discourse. This comes as no surprise, given the history of tension between Cuomo and Chartock, which dates back to last August. Cuomo had expressed frustration with WAMC's aggressive local programming, leading to a public spat between the two. The tension escalated on September 17, 2014, when Cuomo used the devastation caused by Hurricane Sandy to illustrate New York's deteriorating relationship with its public media channels, including WAMC.

input:
Queen Elizabeth II delivered a Christmas Day speech to Britons about the importance of coming together and making sacrifices  but she apparently didnt put much thought into the decor.
The monarch was blasted for making the speech calling for self-sacrifice while
continuation: wearing a head - to - toe fur coat that is probably worth more than the combined income of every person in Britain who is on minimum salary . The Sun published a picture of the king in the fur - trimmed coat which is 200 years old and worth more than $ 750 , 000 .Queen Elizabeth II wears a head - to - toe fur coat to give her Christmas Day speech on December 25 , 2020 . ( Photo by BBC / Handout / Corbis via Getty Images ) The Duchess of Cornwall , meanwhile , wore a more casual 985 wool coat and 124 black heels to watch her sister - in - law deliver her Christmas Day statement .British newspapers stacked on and mocked the queen for her comments and how they contrasted with her very lavish outfit . Eminently relatable
paraphrase: In her annual Christmas Day speech, Queen Elizabeth II urged Britons to come together and make sacrifices, but her own fashion choices were criticized for being out of touch. Wearing a fur-trimmed coat estimated to be worth over $750,000, the monarch's message of self-sacrifice was undermined by her luxurious attire. In contrast, the Duchess of Cornwall opted for a more understated look, choosing a 985 wool coat and 124 black heels to watch her sister-in-law deliver her statement. The irony of the queen's extravagant outfit was not lost on British newspapers, which mocked the contrast between her words and actions. The incident highlights the importance of leading by example and being mindful of one's privilege and privileged lifestyle.

input:
The difficult dialogue began with a dark auditorium and a film screening, displaying the long history of the incarceration of African-Americans for the 80 students and community members in attendance.
The documentary, 13th, kept with the theme
continuation: of the debate . The film was made by filmmaker Ava DuVernay , who won an Oscar for the feature film Selma .The film focused on the 13th amendment , which abolished slavery in 1865 . However , it failed to free slaves from jail , paving the way for contemporary - day mass incarceration , DuVernay explained .Were doing the exact same thing [ slavery ] in the prison system , DuVernay said . In 2010 , the Prison Policy Initiative in Massachusetts led a survey on mass incarceration that revealed there were 2 . 3 million citizens incarcerated in the United States .The survey measured that one in 31 adults are in jail or prison , which includes 1 in 15 black men and 1 in 100 Latino
paraphrase: The engaging conversation began with a dimly lit room and a screening of a documentary, delving into the long and complex history of racial incarceration. The film, 13th, directed by Ava DuVernay, who won an Oscar for her feature film Selma, shed light on the 13th amendment's failure to truly abolish slavery in 1865, leading to the current epidemic of mass incarceration. DuVernay poignantly emphasized the parallels between the past and present, stating that "we are doing the same thing [slavery] in the prison system." A 2010 survey by the Prison Policy Initiative in Massachusetts revealed that there were over 2.3 million citizens incarcerated in the United States, with one in 31 adults, including one in 15 black men and one in 100 Latino, behind bars.

input:
Astounding? Or are you kind of afraid of a robot takeover now?
Gymnasts dreaming of a future Olympic win might find they have some competition  the robot kind.
Waltham-based Boston Dynamics shared a video Thursday of
continuation: an unnamed firm called Agility Robotics field - testing a humanoid robot named Digit . Not only is the robot so realistic - looking that its hard to tell the machine aside from the human whos waving the flag , but it can also balance itself , which should help it sprint around a gymnasium in competition with the worlds top athletes .Thats when the robot shakes and wobbles more than youd expect from a creature with 19 servos and three accelerometers . But the wobble is all in the pursuit of balance , which will allow the robot to lift heavy items in the future .Digit is ability to adapt to environmental disturbances by compensating for potential inaccuracies in its balance model , the company say . Digit has a modified Xbox Kinect camera attached to a helmet that enables the robot to see its surroundings and to
paraphrase: The thought of a robot takeover may elicit a range of emotions, from excitement to fear. As technology advances, the possibility of humanoid robots like Digit, developed by Agility Robotics, competing with human athletes in the future is becoming increasingly likely. In a recent video shared by Waltham-based Boston Dynamics, Digit was shown to be almost indistinguishable from a human, with its realistic appearance and ability to balance itself. With 19 servos and three accelerometers, the robot is capable of adapting to environmental disturbances and lifting heavy items in the future. The company emphasizes that Digit's ability to compensate for potential inaccuracies in its balance model is what allows it to shake and wobble, but ultimately maintain its balance. While some may find the idea of a robot Olympic win exciting, others may be concerned about the potential implications of such advanced technology.

input:
Liverpool have submitted a bid for Real Madrid's Karim Benzema.
Several sources in Spain have suggested that Reds boss Brendan Rodgers submitted a bid in the region of 50m for the French international, who joined Real in 2010, earlier today.
continuation: The rumors was sparked by Benzema himself , who was reportedly annoyed by the rumours , said that he had not yet been approached by the Anfield club . However , a failure of bids for Benzema has been noted by the Santiago Bernabeu hierarchy , which has led the Madrid president , Florentino Perez , to travel to the United States , where he is overseeing an ad event for his preferred choosing to manage Real , Rafael Benitez .A transfer is probably to be tying in with Real ' s moves in the Champions League against Atletico Madrid and Barcelona , where the Liga leaders have just two points between them .
paraphrase: Liverpool has made a bid for Karim Benzema, according to sources in Spain. The Reds' manager, Brendan Rodgers, allegedly offered 50 million euros for the French international, who joined Real Madrid in 2010, earlier today. Benzema himself denied the rumors, claiming he had not been approached by the Anfield club. However, a failure to secure a deal for Benzema has been noted by the Santiago Bernabeu hierarchy, leading Madrid's president, Florentino Perez, to travel to the United States for an advertising event. The transfer is likely to be linked to Real's upcoming matches against Atletico Madrid and Barcelona, with the Liga leaders currently only two points apart.

input:
Cleveland-Cliffs isn't the company it once was, but Wall Street is still pricing it that way.
For years, iron ore producer Cleveland-Cliffs (NYSE:CLF) has been in the midst of a turnaround plan
continuation: , looking to cut costs and improve profitability as a result . In 2018 , things seem to be working : The corporation ' s earnings last quarter soared on strong metal prices and pricing power .It also seems like Cleveland - Cliffs ' shares has decided to follow suit - - and if Wall Street investors are paying attention to the broader market , they probably shouldn ' t . Cleveland - Cliffs : A quick history Cleveland - Cliffs is now the second - largest producer of steel ore pellets in North America .The corporation is trying to take advantage of what should be a steady run of improving margins on the back of high demand . Over the years , however , Cleveland - Cliffs has been trying to turn its enterprise around - - and it hasn ' t been easy .In 2011 , after plummeting from $ 239 per ton in 2008 to $ 40 per
paraphrase: Despite their struggles in the past, Cleveland-Cliffs is still seen as a force to be reckoned with on Wall Street. For years, the iron ore producer has been undergoing a transformation, aiming to improve profitability through cost-cutting measures and better pricing. In 2018, the company's earnings soared due to strong metal prices and increased pricing power. Recently, the company's shares have also seen a surge, suggesting that investors are taking notice of the company's progress. Cleveland-Cliffs has a rich history as the second-largest producer of steel ore pellets in North America, and the company is poised to benefit from the ongoing demand for steel. However, the company has faced challenges in the past, including a significant decline in prices in 2011. Despite these challenges, Cleveland-Cliffs remains a significant player in the industry, with Wall Street continuing to show confidence in the company's future.

input:
Osama Abu Irshaid. Photo: Screenshot.
Facebook and Twitter posts have revealed that Osama Abu Irshaid  the pro-Hamas leader of the rabidly anti-Israel group American Muslims for Palestine (AMP)  met with
continuation: Hamas authorities on Tuesday , two days before the firefight in Gaza began . In a conference with delegations from the Gaza Strip , AMPs committee chairman met with Mohammed Nazzal and Hamas official Atef Daboush at AMP offices in Silver Spring , Md .Nazzal , the Palestinian prime secretary from 2007 - 2010 , is currently a member of the Palestinian Legislative Council representing the Islamic Resistance Movement ( Hamas ) . Both sides praised the other for their actions in assisting to achieve the Palestinian aims of ending the illegal Israeli occupation of our homeland , according to a Facebook post by Abu Irshaid .I want to thank my brother Atef Daboush for accompanying me on this meeting and the office of AMP for their hospitality
paraphrase: Osama Abu Irshaid, the leader of the pro-Hamas group American Muslims for Palestine (AMP), recently met with Hamas authorities in Maryland, two days before the Gaza firefight broke out. According to social media posts, Abu Irshaid met with Mohammed Nazzal, a former Palestinian prime secretary and current Hamas member of the Legislative Council, and Atef Daboush, a Hamas official, at AMP's headquarters in Silver Spring. Both sides reportedly praised each other for their efforts in supporting the Palestinian goal of ending the Israeli occupation of their homeland. Abu Irshaid expressed gratitude towards Daboush for accompanying him on the meeting and acknowledged the hospitality extended by AMP's office.

continuation: into the Hall of Fame this year . KENT , Ohio Former Kent State wrestling coach Ron Gray will be inducted into the National Wrestling Hall of Fame on June 1 in Stillwater , Okla . Gray , who coached the Golden Flashes for 25 seasons , is one of four members who will be inducted into the Hall of Fame this decade .Other honorees include Ricardo Oliveira of Mt . Olive , N . J . , Matthew Lindland of Sioux Falls , S . D . , and Julie Huss of Redmond , Wash . Huss is a decorated international competitor in Womens Wrestling , winning a bronze medal at the 2015 World Wrestling Championships and finishing fourth at the 2015 Pan American Games .Lindland is a retired 1999 NCAA champion and three - time All - American for Northwestern University , and currently serves
paraphrase: Former Kent State wrestling coach Ron Gray will be inducted into the National Wrestling Hall of Fame on June 1 in Stillwater, Oklahoma. Gray, who coached the Golden Flashes for 25 seasons, is one of four individuals who will be inducted into the Hall of Fame this year. Other honorees include Ricardo Oliveira of Mount Olive, New Jersey, Matthew Lindland of Sioux Falls, South Dakota, and Julie Huss of Redmond, Washington. Huss is a highly accomplished international wrestler, having won a bronze medal at the 2015 World Wrestling Championships and finishing fourth at the 2015 Pan American Games. Lindland is a retired 1999 NCAA champion and three-time All-American for Northwestern University, and currently serves as a coach and mentor to young wrestlers.

If the tone ' s going to be bipartisan , they may also walk it back from attacking people and inform the American citizens of what happened , " Schumer stated . The senior administration official defended the
paraphrase: The senior administration official revealed to reporters on a background call Friday that the tone of the upcoming State of the Union address will be one of bipartisanship. When questioned about potential additional interactions between White House leaders and Schumer, the official remained tight-lipped. input:
QUITO, ECUADOREcuador election officials have agreed to recount nearly 1.3 million votes as opposition leader Guillermo Lasso continues to allege fraud in the presidential election.
The National Electoral Council announced late Thursday it would
continuation: recount 1 , 280 , 205 votes from the April 11 runoff , about 1 . 6 % of all voting cast . Lasso , who says the election was not credible , has filed a petition for a complete recount of all ballots .He affirmed his losing but has not conceded the election . President Lenin Moreno defeated Lasso by 51 . 1 % to 48 . 9 % in the runoff .Thursdays recount results are expected to be released Friday .
paraphrase: Ecuadorian election officials have decided to recount nearly 1.3 million votes as opposition leader Guillermo Lasso continues to claim fraud in the presidential election. The National Electoral Council announced late Thursday that they would recount 1,280,205 votes from the April 11 runoff, which is approximately 1.6% of all votes cast. Lasso, who alleges that the election was not credible, has filed a request for a complete recount of all ballots. Despite losing, he has not conceded the election. President Lenin Moreno defeated Lasso by a narrow margin of 51.1% to 48.9% in the runoff. The results of the recount are expected to be released on Friday.

input:
Ms Lee, 45, an avid jogger, had been jogging almost every day for the past five years. Recently, her knees started to hurt.
Gradually, walking up and down the stairs became a problem too, so much so that
continuation: she had to use the lift and had to take a month ' s leave . Yesterday , Ms Lee finally had an MRI scan .She was so worried , she felt sick to her belly when she was handed a pair of shorts to wear for the scan , which was to be performed on her back . The results of the scan have yet to be released , but Ms Lee has already booked an appointment with an orthopaedic physician ." If I have arthritis , then I will have to gone for surgery . " A variant of this article appeared in the print edition of The Straits Times on August 17 , 2016 , with the headline ' Fitness test for older Singaporeans ' .Print Edition | Subscribe
paraphrase: Ms. Lee, an enthusiastic jogger in her mid-40s, had been consistently running for the past five years. However, recent knee discomfort has made it challenging for her to continue her daily routine. As a result, she has been relying on the stairs less frequently and utilizing the lift more often. Her recent struggle has led her to take a month's leave from her daily activities. Yesterday, Ms. Lee underwent an MRI scan to evaluate the cause of her knee pain. Although she was nervous about the procedure, she was reluctantly handed a pair of shorts to wear during the scan. The outcome of the test is still pending, but Ms. Lee has already scheduled an appointment with an orthopedic specialist. If the diagnosis reveals arthritis, she will have to consider surgical options. A similar article was published in The Straits Times on August 17, 2016, with the headline "Fitness test for older Singaporeans."

input:
A Tesco petrol station near Cambridge was raided today (February 28) by masked men, triggering a major police response.
Two men wearing hoods and masks were reported to have broken into the station at the Milton Tesco on Cambridge Road.
continuation: A witness at the scene admitted a authorities plane was circling the area and that there had been " a plenty of police around " . Cambridgeshire Police said : " The boys wear balaclavas and one of them employed a sledgehammer to bang the windows before they fled the scene . "The incident occurred at around 6am this morning . A police report says : " As a result of their efforts , we are able to confirm that a 32 - year - old guy from Cambridge has been detained on suspicion of burglary ." He has been took into custody for questioning . " A police spokesman informed the News : " We have been searching the woods and rivers around Milton , but there have been no other reports of the suspects ." This was a fairly sophisticated and determined burglary and the defendants were clearly determined to
paraphrase: A brazen robbery occurred at a Tesco petrol station near Cambridge on February 28, sparking a large-scale police response. Two masked men, their faces hidden behind hoods, broke into the station on Cambridge Road during the early hours of the morning. Witnesses reported seeing a police plane circling the area and numerous police officers on the ground. According to Cambridgeshire Police, the intruders wore balaclavas and used a sledgehammer to shatter windows before fleeing the scene. A 32-year-old man from Cambridge was later detained on suspicion of burglary and taken into custody for questioning. Despite an extensive search of the surrounding woods and rivers, no other suspects have been found. This was a sophisticated and determined burglary, and the perpetrators clearly intended to avoid detection.

input:
March 27 - A greater proportion of quota places for women is among the changes successfully proposed by the World Rowing Federation (FISA) to its qualification system ahead of Rio 2016.
The changes, which have now been approved by the International Olympic Committee
continuation: ( IOC ) , will coming into effect for the Olympic qualification rules for the Paris 2024 Games . The changes include a greater percentage of quota places being allocated to female ' s rowing activities , a move aimed at promoting participation .The changes will also create more countries to compete at the Games , and they mean that only those that receive qualification times will go to Rio . Under the new structure , the number of nations allowed to enter will remain at 67 .Countries that are ranked in the top 25 from the World Championships can earn a spot . However , only those that have competitors who achieve the qualifying times during the qualification period can take part in the Olympic regatta .The selection period will span from July 1 , 2015 to June 30 , 2016 , and the qualifying time rules for Rio
paraphrase: The World Rowing Federation (FISA) has successfully proposed modifications to its qualification system ahead of the Rio 2016 Olympics, with the International Olympic Committee (IOC) approving the changes. The revised system includes a higher percentage of quota places allocated to female rowing activities, aimed at promoting participation. This change will also result in more countries competing at the Games, with only those that receive qualification times earning a spot. The number of nations allowed to enter will remain at 67, with countries ranked in the top 25 from the World Championships earning a spot. The qualification period will span from July 1, 2015 to June 30, 2016, and the qualifying time rules for Rio will apply.

paraphrase:
Here is a paraphrased version of the input passage:
Cyclones in Category five are not meant to exist, but they serve as a terrifying reminder to children in Central Queensland to stay indoors during the summer wet season. Growing up in Mackay, cyclones were an unavoidable part of life, just like corrugated roofing, sand flies, and Christmas barbecues with Fruitabundas. While Category 5 cyclones may seem like a distant threat, Mackayites know better. They understand the devastating potential of these storms and take necessary precautions to protect themselves and their property.

Texas has become the first state in the nation to require law enforcement to obtain a warrant to read people's email, and privacy advocates are hoping the move will help quicken the passage of a similar proposal in Congress.
Texas Gov. Rick Perry signed
continuation: the bill into law on Friday . He did so after the House passed the legislation on Monday , even though some privacy groups , notably the American Civil Liberties Union , had lobbied against the bill , arguing it would create law enforcement ' s jobs more complicated ." Texas has made a firm move toward saving our liberties and closing a dangerous loophole that enables authorities to peer into our private lives , " say Texas State Rep . Lon Burnam ( D - Fort Worth ) , the writer of the bill . " The citizens of Texas have obviously spoken , and it is time for us to act . "One of the biggest criticisms of the bill was the notion that obtaining a warrant would create law enforcement ' s jobs more complicated . Texas Attorney General Greg Abbott gave the argument on the House floor Monday ."If we were to require a warrant for each and every [subpoena], the legislation would
paraphrase: Texas has become the first state to mandate law enforcement obtain a warrant before accessing individuals' email accounts, and advocates hope this move will inspire Congress to pass a similar bill. Governor Rick Perry signed the bill into law on Friday, following the House's passage on Monday despite opposition from some privacy groups, including the American Civil Liberties Union. They argued the bill would make law enforcement's jobs more complex. Texas State Representative Lon Burnam (D-Fort Worth), the bill's author, stated, "Texas has taken a crucial step in protecting our liberties and closing a dangerous loophole that allows authorities to peek into our private lives." Burnam added, "The people of Texas have spoken, and it's time for us to act." One of the main criticisms of the bill was the notion that obtaining a warrant would create unnecessary work for law enforcement. Texas Attorney General Greg Abbott made this argument on the House floor Monday. "Requiring a warrant for each and every subpoena would significantly hamper the legislation's effectiveness," Abbott argued.

The 509th Civil Engineer Squadron re-opened the Atlantis Hall dormitory in March 2019 after a year and a half of renovations at Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri.
The renovations completely overhauled the building and will be the standard for the
continuation: next 40 to 50 years . The 24 - hour facility , the largest in the Air Force , comprises 204 rooms that bed 544 airmen and has a dining facility , fitness center , game room , lounges , laundry centers , offices and a rebuilt lobby .The renovation enhanced the design of the exterior of the facility by removing graffiti from the walls and paint from the windowsills . New insulation was added to the exterior of the building , and new ADA compliant ramps and lighting were built .The front steps were replaced with pavers , and a skylight was added above the main door . The interior of the building is more modern than its 1960s facade design .Many of the common places were removed and replaced with larger , more open spaces . All of the rooms
paraphrase:
The 509th Civil Engineer Squadron reopened the Atlantis Hall dormitory in March 2019 following a 18-month renovation at Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri.
The extensive renovation transformed the building into a state-of-the-art facility, set to serve as a benchmark for future renovations. The expansive, 24-hour dormitory can accommodate 544 airmen and features a dining area, fitness center, game room, lounges, laundry facilities, offices, and a revamped lobby. The renovation also improved the building's exterior design by removing graffiti from the walls and repainting the windowsills. New insulation was added, and ADA-compliant ramps and lighting were installed. The front steps were replaced with pavers, and a skylight was added above the main entrance. The interior of the building boasts a modern, open-concept layout, with many common areas removed and replaced with larger spaces. All rooms were renovated to provide a comfortable living environment for airmen.

input: The big news on any day when President Bush delivers a "major address" regarding Iraq is never what the commander-in-chief says. Bush has been on autopilot for so long now that he does not even bother to say anything new -- even
continuation: on an occasion when it is sorely needed . Once again Bush wants to bring more troops to Iraq , but this time he is going to do it in stages .Bush also wants to raise the troop levels before a vote on the " surge " next month . In an ominous sign , he said that he has already asked the top generals on the ground to draw up plans to bring the 15 extra brigades , some of which may come from reserves .Bush confirmed that he will provide a six - point proposal at his address in California , but whatever it is , he gave it clear that none in the so - called " surge " will depend on the Iraqis . Bush also disclosed that his five - month proposal for Iraq includes building aside land for Iraqi immigrants .Bush knows his surge proposal is dead on arrival , which is why he said that he would go to the Hill and explain his strategy in person to the
paraphrase: On days when President Bush delivers a significant address regarding Iraq, the most notable aspect is not what he says, but rather what he doesn't say. Bush has become formulaic in his approach, repeating the same lines without offering any new insights. Despite the urgent need for fresh ideas, he seems to be stuck in a rut. He is contemplating sending more troops to Iraq, but this time in a phased manner. Bush has already consulted with top military leaders to develop plans for deploying an additional 15 brigades, some of which may come from reserve units. While he is set to unveil a six-point proposal in his upcoming address, he made it clear that the Iraqis will not play a significant role in his surge strategy. Furthermore, Bush's five-month plan for Iraq includes setting aside land for Iraqi immigrants. Despite acknowledging that his surge proposal is unlikely to gain traction, Bush is determined to personally explain his strategy to lawmakers on the Hill.

This is a preview of a research report from BI Intelligence, Business Insider's premium research service. Click here to learn more.
In an increasingly digital economy, banks are becoming more dependent on efficient data processing to improve customer service and products, and ensure
continuation: regulatory compliance . But , while the sector ' s investment in big information tech increased significantly in 2013 , this growth could not last if banks are not proactive in getting value from their big information projects , according to a new report from BI Intelligence .Almost 30 % of banks have increased their big information investment over the previous two years , with a large majority still intending to . But a huge majority of these attempts have been plagued by issues such as regulatory compliance , inability of skills , and the failure to collect and secure enough data .Banks also are unable to execute and prove the value of these assets . The review discovered that a huge amount of banks continue unsure about the business case for big information .The review also discovered that institutions have not , on a large scale , been able to derive and / or share the commercial value of these plans , which has held back investment .
paraphrase:
Based on the input passage, here is a paraphrased version of the text:
This is a sneak peek into a research report from BI Intelligence, Business Insider's premium research service. To know more, click here.
In today's digital economy, banks are becoming increasingly reliant on efficient data processing to enhance customer service and product offerings, as well as ensure regulatory compliance. However, while the sector's investment in big data technology saw significant growth in 2013, this growth may not be sustainable if banks do not proactively derive value from their big data projects, according to a new report from BI Intelligence. Around 30% of banks have increased their big data investment over the past two years, with a majority still intending to do so. However, most of these attempts have been hindered by issues such as regulatory compliance, lack of skills, and the inability to collect and secure sufficient data. Additionally, banks have struggled to execute and demonstrate the commercial value of these projects, with many institutions remaining uncertain about the business case for big data. The review found that many banks have not, on a large scale, been able to successfully derive and share the commercial value of these initiatives, which has held back investment.

Farrell joined the team ahead of their Six Nations opener against France in Paris previous week but was later dismissed by Johnson after allegations of a training - pitch breach .He has not been selected since and Lancaster is eager to keep the gifted 21 - year - old at his disposal as he aims to build on Englands Six Nations win over Italy and World Cup semi - final debut . Saracens are resigned to losing Farrell but had hoped to keep him until the end of the season , when a decision on his future is expected to be made .Johnson , who has been dismissed from his job as head coach , wanted Farrell to remain at Allianz Park and was said to be anxious for him to take
paraphrase: Andy Farrell appears poised to leave Saracens to take on a full-time role with England following Stuart Lancaster's appointment as head coach, according to Telegraph Sport. Lancaster was named as the permanent successor to Martin Johnson on Thursday, and this development is likely to pave the way for Farrell to assume a senior position with England, similar to Dai Young's role. Farrell joined the team ahead of their Six Nations opener against France in Paris but was later dismissed by Johnson after allegations of a training pitch breach. Despite this, Lancaster is eager to keep the talented 21-year-old on his coaching staff as he looks to build on England's Six Nations win over Italy and World Cup semi-final debut. Saracens are resigned to losing Farrell, but they had hoped to keep him until the end of the season when a decision on his future is expected to be made. Johnson, who has been dismissed as head coach, reportedly wanted Farrell to remain at Allianz Park and was said to be keen for him to continue his development at the club.

paraphrase: Liverpool manager Jrgen Klopp has hinted that the club is set to extend Joe Gomez's contract with a new deal.
