Driverless buses and other city vehicles will follow in the trailblazing path of an autonomous shuttle soon to run between the Calgary Zoo and Telus Spark, a city councillor said Thursday.
The 12-passenger Electronic Autonomous shuttle, or E
continuation: - AV , is an electric automobile and will be the first on Calgarys roads and highways to operate as a completely autonomous driverless vehicle . The Coun .Evan Spencer indicated the cities will be in a position to provide on - demand transit , decreasing emissions , increasing accessibility to transportation , decreasing wait hours for transit , and improving the affordability of transit to residents . The trial of an E - AV on the Eau Claire Market and the Telus Spark corridor will strengthen the safety and feasibility of driverless shuttles in Calgary .We will work with residents to teach about transit - associated security concerns , Spencer says . Calgary transit service costs $ 135 million monthly and is growing in operating expenses by almost 50 per cent over the last 10 years , he
paraphrase:
Calgary is set to pioneer the use of autonomous vehicles in city transportation, according to a city councillor. The city will soon introduce driverless buses and other city vehicles, following the success of an upcoming autonomous shuttle trial between the Calgary Zoo and Telus Spark.
The 12-passenger Electric Autonomous shuttle, or E-AV, is an electric vehicle that will be the first of its kind to operate as a completely autonomous driverless vehicle on Calgary's roads and highways. This innovative project aims to provide on-demand transit, reduce emissions, increase accessibility to transportation, decrease wait times for transit, and improve the affordability of transit for residents.
The trial of the E-AV on the Eau Claire Market and Telus Spark corridor will strengthen the safety and feasibility of driverless shuttles in Calgary. To ensure a smooth transition, the city will work with residents to address any concerns they may have regarding transit safety. Currently, Calgary transit service costs $135 million monthly and is experiencing a 45% increase in operating expenses over the past decade.
By embracing this cutting-edge technology, Calgary aims to create a more sustainable, efficient, and convenient transportation system for its residents.

AFL-CIO calls for urgent action to stop Indiana "right-to-work"
The AFL-CIO has issued a national appeal for help to stop passage of a so-called right-to-work law
continuation: in Indiana , with a hearing on it set for 11 a . m . EST Monday , Feb . 19 . It is proposed to be heard by the Senate Commerce and Technology Committee , headed by Sen . Brandt Hershman ( R ) .Right - to - work is a thinly - veiled attack on unions and the working people they represent , and has historically been enacted only through legislation , rather than a voter referendum , owing to its unpopularity . It opens the door to public sector union - busting , which would hamper students ability to struggle against corporate - backed student reform .Proponents are saying that they are in reality fighting against forced union dues , and have citing the 1977 Janus vs . AFSCME case before the Supreme Court as a basis for their case . In this lawsuit , Janus accused that public sector union contracts and
paraphrase: The AFL-CIO is urgently calling for action to prevent the passage of a controversial "right-to-work" law in Indiana, with a hearing scheduled for 11 a.m. EST on Monday, February 19. The proposed legislation is set to be heard by the Senate Commerce and Technology Committee, led by Senator Brandt Hershman (R). Right-to-work laws have historically been enacted through legislation rather than referendums due to their unpopularity, and have been criticized as an attack on unions and working people. Supporters argue that they are fighting against forced union dues, citing the 1977 Janus v. AFSCME Supreme Court case as a basis for their argument. However, opponents contend that this law would actually lead to public sector union-busting, hindering students' ability to resist corporate-backed education reforms.

input: (Newser)  The US is still flying Boeing 737 Max 8 planes, despite a growing number of nations grounding them following two crashes in less than five months. (NPR is keeping track of the countries and airlines that have grounded the planes so far
continuation: .)The two crashesin Ethiopia and Indonesiakilled a total of 346 people.( In December , the Wall Street Journal called for a grounding of the planes , noting , " Until Boeing understands the reason of the crashes , all airlines should halt operating the aircraft . " ) The Max 8 was grounded in China Tuesday night after the FAA ordered US carriers to suspend service of the aircraft , but American Airlines said passengers on Wednesday that it wouldn ' t " chicken out " and might fly as scheduled , the Guardian reports .It wasn ' t obvious , as NPR notes , whether American ' s announcement was " just bravado " or whether it would cancel flights ; the airline soon said it would do the latter . Next on Newser : Straws Ban May Be Waste of Money , Says Scientist Isn '
paraphrase: (Newser) Despite the growing number of nations grounding Boeing 737 Max 8 planes following two deadly crashes, the US is still flying these planes. (NPR keeps track of the countries and airlines that have grounded the planes so far.) The crashes in Ethiopia and Indonesia killed a total of 346 people. In December, the Wall Street Journal called for a grounding of the planes, saying, "Until Boeing understands the cause of the crashes, all airlines should halt operating the aircraft." The Max 8 was grounded in China on Tuesday night after the FAA ordered US carriers to suspend service of the aircraft, but American Airlines said passengers on Wednesday that it wouldn't "chicken out" and might fly as scheduled, according to the Guardian. It wasn't clear whether American's announcement was "just bravado" or whether it would cancel flights; the airline soon said it would do the latter. Next on Newser: Straws Ban May Be Waste of Money, Says Scientist.

input:
Ten years after al-Qaeda first surfaced, the US is still at war with "terrorist" groups.
In a neatly manicured garden in Nairobi, Joash Okindo limps towards a marble plaque erected in honour of those who
continuation: died in the 1998 bombing of the US embassy . Most of those dead were Kenyans who were on their way to work in the morning , others were children playing by the side of the highway or simply bystanders .That day , al - Qaeda bombers , headed by American - born citizen Fazul Abdullah Mohammed , rammed a lorry full of bombs into the ambassador . The blast destroyed the three - storey structure , killing 213 people , and ripped through the adjacent roads , wounding dozens of others .Okindo , 52 , was on the opposite side of the highway when the pickup burst . " It was like a thunderbolt , just like a huge bomb , " he recalled .A life - long tea vendor who was on his way to buy more stock from a shop ,
paraphrase: Ten years after the initial emergence of al-Qaeda, the United States is still embroiled in conflict with various terrorist groups. In a serene garden in Nairobi, Joash Okindo makes his way towards a marble plaque dedicated to the victims of the 1998 bombing of the US embassy. Most of those killed were Kenyans going about their daily routines, including children playing by the highway and innocent bystanders. On that fateful day, al-Qaeda operatives, led by American-born Fazul Abdullah Mohammed, rammed a truck filled with explosives into the embassy, causing immense destruction and killing 213 people. Okindo, then 52, was on the opposite side of the highway when the pickup truck exploded. "It was like a bolt of lightning, a massive bomb," he recalls, reflecting on the chaos and devastation that unfolded that day. A lifelong tea vendor who was on his way to restock his shop, Okindo was fortunate to escape with his life, but the trauma of that day still lingers.

input:

AIDS 2014 will attract 14,000 of the world's leading HIV scientists, policymakers and activists to discuss progress on

That ' s an incredible number , " comments Bill Baxter from AIDS Action Council Victoria . " But because of the incredible therapy we have available now , there are people living well with HIV who can take part . "More than 56 , 000 Australians are living with HIV and on average , 1 , 200 new diagnoses are making each year . This year ' s World AIDS Day topic is " Focus , Partner , Achieve : An AIDS - safe Generation " .Much has been achieved in the fight against HIV but the infection is not eliminated . Many of the biggest advances have been achieved in
paraphrase: The forthcoming AIDS conference in Melbourne is expected to draw 14,000 prominent HIV professionals, policymakers, and activists from around the world. This gathering will provide a platform for discussions on the latest advancements in HIV treatment, prevention, and cure research, as well as identifying areas that require further attention. Over 1,000 Australians living with HIV and HIV advocates will also be participating in the event. According to Bill Baxter from AIDS Action Council Victoria, the sheer number of attendees is impressive, but thanks to the remarkable treatment options available today, people living with HIV can actively participate in the conference. Currently, around 56,000 Australians are living with HIV, with an average of 1,200 new diagnoses each year. This year's World AIDS Day theme is "Focus, Partner, Achieve: An AIDS-safe Generation," highlighting the progress made in the fight against HIV but emphasizing the ongoing efforts required to completely eliminate the infection.

Like a wave breaking against the shore, it was over in a moment.
But in that moment - noon Saturday - more than 240 people stood at the water's edge in Atlantic and Neptune Beach, clasping each other's hands, united in their
continuation: sorrow . They came to lay roses and candles at memorial sites on the sand where , late last week , a joyride aboard a four - seater plane ending with the deaths of two of the aircraft ' s occupants .It was a tribute befitting the losing of loved people , said organizer Wendy Miles . But when the people who died , George F . Pranck , 63 , and Gary W . Schoenfeld , 38 , each came from one family with one root , it was also a family affair .The men were half - brothers . Their grandparents , Dorothy Pranck , 83 , of South Daytona , who raised the older Pranck , and Schoenfeld ' s mother , Margaret Spindler , 62 , of Atlantic Beach , were there as well , along with a dozen kids and grandchildren .
paraphrase: As the waves gently lapped against the shore, a somber group of over 240 individuals gathered at the water's edge in Atlantic and Neptune Beach on a Saturday noon. With tears in their eyes, they came to pay their respects to the two passengers who lost their lives in a tragic plane accident the previous week. Organizer Wendy Miles described the gathering as a fitting tribute to the loss of loved ones. However, what made this moment truly special was the bond that tied these people together - they were half-brothers, George F. Pranck, 63, and Gary W. Schoenfeld, 38, both of whom hailed from the same family tree. Joining them were their grandparents, Dorothy Pranck, 83, of South Daytona, and Schoenfeld's mother, Margaret Spindler, 62, of Atlantic Beach, as well as a dozen children and grandchildren.

paraphrase: For the next few weeks, the persistent shortage of coaches on the commuter rail will continue to cause overcrowding, according to officials who spoke on Monday. As a temporary measure, Metro - North has limited the number of cars to 2-4 per train, in order to increase the availability of train cars for future track work and upgrading on-time quality. While the MTA initially stated that the service changes might last until the end of April, it is unclear how many trains will be impacted. To alleviate the issue, Metro - North will add three additional coaches to peak trains, which will help commuter ease their journey. paraphrase: According to Helen Epstein's article in The New York Review of Books, 25-month-old Cerinah Nebanda, a fearless young member of Parliament in Uganda, passed away due to suicide. Nebanda, a member of the Democratic Party, had grown up in a poor family in Uganda's eastern district of Karamoja and studied finance and accounting, graduating from university in 2007. She joined the DP in 2008 and was one of ten candidates nominated to the Ugandan Parliament in October of the same year. Nebanda's friends were devastated when they heard the news of her suicide on December 28, 2011, finding her in her office on the fifth floor of Uganda's parliament building, deceased with broken legs.

Traffic deaths in California fell 9 percent last year  the biggest drop in 14 years  and crashes on Highway 17 continued their nearly decadelong decline.

continuation: belts and to better public education and awareness campaigns . From 1995 to 2004 , for instance , the county ' s deaths dropped 18 percent , while California ' s decreased by 8 percent ." We ' re proud of that , " added Sgt . Greg Lanzoni , of the California Highway Patrol ' s Watsonville office ." That ' s a lot of people whose lives were rescued . " Though numbers indicate that seat belt use is growing , the CHP has
paraphrase: Last year, traffic fatalities in California decreased by 9%, the largest drop in 14 years. The number of crashes on Highway 17 has been steadily declining over the past decade. State officials attribute the decrease in road-related deaths to increased seatbelt usage and improved public education and awareness campaigns. In Santa Cruz County, there were 10 fatalities on Highway 17 in 2008, six less than in 2007, and the smallest total in over 30 weeks. Preliminary data from state road patrol officers suggests that the decline in highway deaths last season is more pronounced in Santa Cruz County than in other areas of California. From 1995 to 2004, the county's deaths decreased by 18%, while California's deaths decreased by 8%. "We're proud of that," said Sgt. Greg Lanzoni of the California Highway Patrol's Watsonville office. "That's a lot of people whose lives were saved." Although seatbelt use is increasing, the CHP has continued to work towards improving road safety in the area.

continuation: The good news is that with $ 50 million in new funding from the U . S . Environmental Protection Agency , local , state , and federal authorities have the resources they need to accelerate progress on sewage treatment , septic system repair , and water conservation . The Sound offers Connecticut to the world , but we also rely on it to provide jobs , fun , and meals .In addition to its function as a recreational resource , the Sound contributes $ 5 billion to Connecticut ' s economy each year . To guarantee the Sound continues a thriving resource for us all , we must act now to keep the water clean and the coastline open .The federal money will be used to pay for water quality planning , monitoring , and public schooling in Connecticut ' s portion of the Sound , and we plan to build on that success . A short - term objective is to work with the towns to protect the Sound , and to reduce dead zones like the one
paraphrase: The revival of dolphins in Long Island Sound this summer serves as a positive indication that restoration efforts are gaining traction. However, recent reports on hypoxia and beach closures serve as a reminder of the work that still needs to be done. With an influx of $50 million in funding from the US Environmental Protection Agency, local, state, and federal authorities have the resources they need to accelerate progress on wastewater treatment, septic system repairs, and water conservation. The Sound not only provides recreational opportunities for the state but also contributes $5 billion to Connecticut's economy annually. To ensure the Sound remains a thriving resource for future generations, it is crucial that we prioritize water quality management, monitoring, and public education. Our short-term objective is to collaborate with local communities to protect the Sound and reduce dead zones, such as the one that recently formed in the area.

paraphrase:
Here's a paraphrased version of the input passage:
Most people are aware that real estate developers can potentially earn substantial profits, but they also take on significant risks. Smaller-scale real estate investors can enter the development game by starting with a single-family home rental property, which is less risky than a larger project. For example, instead of pursuing a 40-unit apartment complex, consider purchasing a commercial property with the potential to renovate some units into apartments. While there is less financial reward, the risk is also lower. A simpler approach to building a rental property portfolio is to start with a single unit and gradually expand from there. For instance, instead of eyeing a massive apartment building, consider purchasing a house and converting it into a duplex or triplex without a significant upfront investment or administrative burden. This article will provide guidance on how to buy your first home and manage your finances while doing so, including tips on getting a mortgage, why the time to buy is now, and why buying a home can be a smart investment.

continuation: summer switch from Tottenham to the Bernabeu , withdraw from international duty with Wales on Thursday . A message published through the FAW stated that he had gone home to Spain , stating that the 24 - year - old might be missing for the matches against Scotland on November 18 and Serbia on November 21 ." I have said all along that players are not computers and you have to respect the fact that they compete at a high level for their teams and ensure sure that they do not burn themselves out , " Coleman said on Friday . " Gareth can say that he looks fine and apparently has the physicians and physios to back him up on that , but in some ways it is better that he gets home , gets back to Spain , begins enjoying himself and playing football again ." Everyone is different . At the end of the night , my work is to keep players fit .I can
paraphrase: Chris Coleman revealed that he is willing to allow Gareth Bale to sit out Wales' friendly matches in the future in order to foster a strong working relationship with Real Madrid. Bale's surprise withdrawal from international duty with Wales on Thursday was met with a statement from the FAW, stating that he had returned to Spain. Coleman emphasized the importance of respecting players' high-level competitions with their teams and avoiding burnout. He believes that it's better for Bale to take a break and return to Spain to resume playing football and enjoying himself, rather than pushing himself too hard. Each player is unique, and Coleman's primary concern is to keep them fit for their respective teams.

Twelve-year-old Steffan Elliott displayed impressive fencing skills in his first Sussex Championship epee competition, finishing as runner-up. In the individual foil event, he won his half-finals, semi-final, and was promoted to the final, narrowly missing out on the championship by one hit in a closely contested match. Eve Rowe clinched a bronze medal in both the women's foil and sabre competitions, while Stewart Rowe won a bronze in the 75+ years men's epee tournament. At the national level, 17-month-old Xanthe Cox won a bronze medal in the under-18 women's foil tournament, while Lorna Elliott also took a bronze medal in the under-18 women's epee event. Xanthe Cox was photographed with her bronze medal.

input: SAGINAW, MI  A Saginaw County businessman, Paul Mitchell, recently announced he plans to seek the Republican nomination to run for the State Senate seat being vacated in 2014 by Sen. Roger Kahn, R-Saginaw.
continuation: Kahn , who has served for the last seven terms , said in December 2013 he would not seek reelection to another term as State Senator . Mitchell , founder of several hair salon and product lines , grew up in Saginaw County and currently serves as chair of the cities of Saginaws recreation advisory committee .Mitchell announced his nomination at an event holding Monday at UAW Local 602 on Mackinaw Road in Saginaw , where he was approved by his wife and local corporate representatives . Over the previous five years , state spending cutting and unfunded mandates have wreaked havoc on our community .As a business owner and resident , I see everyday how these regulations are impacting Saginaw and its inhabitants , Im dedicated to working with the legislature to provide better solutions and more effective
paraphrase: Paul Mitchell, a successful businessman from Saginaw County, has announced his intention to run for the Republican nomination for the State Senate seat being vacated in 2014. Current Senator Roger Kahn, who has served for seven terms, has decided not to seek re-election. Mitchell, who grew up in Saginaw County and is currently chair of the city's recreation advisory committee, launched his nomination at an event held at UAW Local 602 on Mackinaw Road. He was endorsed by his wife and local corporate representatives. Mitchell is committed to working with the legislature to address the issues affecting Saginaw and its residents, which he believes have been hindered by state spending cuts and unfunded mandates over the past five years. As a business owner and resident, Mitchell is dedicated to finding more effective solutions to the challenges facing the community.

Gabrielle Lyons is seeking $750,000 in a lawsuit filed this week against Baylor University, a retired football player, and his wife. input: In all probability, the main Hazratganj crossing is likely to be named after former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, as the executive committee of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation, in a meeting on Friday, gave power to mayor
continuation: Dinesh Sharma to give a proposal in this regard to the head minister . The decision to rename the place is also aimed at giving a tribute to Vajpayee ' s donation to Lucknow ." Vajpayee had a soft corner for Lucknow as he used to say that he was not from Lucknow but arrived to Lucknow , " added MLC Surya Pratap Shahi . " Therefore , we are making this project in line with the BJP ' s philosophy .As the executive commission has given us the go - ahead for it , we will send it to the state administration , and thereafter , to the Centre for the approval . " Vajpayee ' s contribution was lauded by many as the LMC prepared to commemorate the former prime minister ' s birth anniversary .At a time when development work is progressing at a breakneck pace at numerous places
paraphrase: It is highly likely that the main crossing in Hazratganj will be named after former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, as the Lucknow Municipal Corporation's executive committee has granted Mayor Dinesh Sharma the authority to submit a proposal in this regard to the state government. This decision is also seen as a tribute to Vajpayee's contribution to Lucknow, as he had a special affinity for the city and often mentioned that he did not hail from Lucknow but had arrived there. In line with the BJP's philosophy, the project aims to recognize Vajpayee's legacy and contributions. Following the executive committee's approval, the proposal will be sent to the state government for approval and subsequently to the Central government. Vajpayee's achievements have been widely appreciated, particularly as the LMC gears up to commemorate his birth anniversary. At a time when development work is progressing rapidly at various locations, this initiative serves as a fitting tribute to the former Prime Minister.

input:
What Is Business-Casual or Fancy-Casual Dress Attire?
Button-up shirts and khaki slacks work for men or women.
Dress codes at work can be confounding. Offices have loosened up and introduced business
continuation: - casual dress , but at many other employment , the definition of business - casual is uncertain . Even an business where informality is regarded a strength , such as the diner business , has a broad variety of dress codes .Dress codes in the restaurant business Whether you are a line cook or a chef , business casual and even fancy - casual dress codes are more common in restaurants today than they were in the past . With an increase in walk - in dining possibilities , chefs and executives are expected to be professional and approachable , according to Chef Darren Brown of the Blue Bayou restaurant in New Orleans , Louisiana .Chef Brown describes that a attire for waiters and servers is more common in his establishment than it was in the past . As for himself , he wears an all - black uniform of cook ' s trousers , an apron and a chef ' s jacket .Some chefs
paraphrase:
The term "business-casual" or "fancy-casual" dress attire can vary depending on the industry and workplace. For men and women in offices, button-up shirts and khaki slacks are commonly accepted as appropriate attire. However, the definition of business-casual dress can be ambiguous in many workplaces, including those in the restaurant industry.
In restaurants, business-casual and fancy-casual dress codes are becoming more common, especially in establishments that offer walk-in dining options. According to Chef Darren Brown of the Blue Bayou restaurant in New Orleans, Louisiana, chefs and executives are expected to be professional and approachable, and their attire reflects this expectation. While Chef Brown himself wears an all-black uniform of cook's trousers, an apron, and a chef's jacket, the dress code for waiters and servers in his establishment has evolved over time.
In summary, the definition of business-casual dress can vary across industries and workplaces, and it is important for individuals to understand the specific dress code expectations of their workplace to ensure they present a professional image.

input:
The Chargers recent upward trend continued Wednesday when defensive end Joey Bosa rejoined his teammates on the practice field.
The 2017 Pro Bowler has been out all season because of a foot injury and hadnt attempted to practice since early
continuation: September . But he was back in pads and stretching out his lower torso in front of his players Wednesday morning .Bosa made a positive first impression on his first morning back . When Bosa jogged out onto the field for his first stretching session in two months , running back Austin Ekeler jumped up and down a few meters away , smiling ear to ear .The defensive line especially broke into the jumping jack dance when Bosa was done . A couple of other Chargers have returned from extended injuries this season .Shaq Barrett making his debut for the Bucs after the Week 10 bye . Brandon Allen , a rookie who played QB at Arkansas and Western Kentucky , made his first career start in Week 8 and played well .
paraphrase: Joey Bosa's return to the practice field was a welcome sight for the Chargers, as the talented defensive end had been sidelined due to a foot injury since early September. Bosa made a positive first impression on his first morning back, as he jogged out onto the field for his first stretching session in two months. The defensive line was particularly excited to see Bosa back in action, breaking into the jumping jack dance when he finished his stretching routine. This season, several other players have made their returns from injury, including Shaq Barrett, who made his debut for the Buccaneers after the Week 10 bye, and Brandon Allen, a rookie who played quarterback at Arkansas and Western Kentucky, who made his first career start in Week 8 and played well.

input: Audria Herrera, a Colorado Northwestern Community College nursing student, poses for a photo recently at the Craig campus. The 34-year-old has received the colleges Brett Stearns Memorial and Albin Salton Nursing scholarships, and plans

He was always patient , kind , calm and loving , and he usually tried to make us laugh when we were sad .I knew I had to naming this scholarship for him because he reminded me so much of Brett . Stearns , a physician and avid skiing , died in December 2015 after he fell under the gun at his hunting cabin .He left behind a wife and a son , then 10 , who says he is now doing very well . I called it after Brett because he was a huge , strong guy who always urged others to do their best , Herrera
paraphrase: Audria Herrera, a nursing student at Colorado Northwestern Community College, recently posed for a photo at the Craig campus. The 34-year-old has received two scholarships from the college - the Brett Stearns Memorial Scholarship and the Albin Salton Nursing Scholarship. Herrera plans to graduate in 2021. Her son, Joel Franco, was a source of inspiration for one of the scholarships, as he was known for his kind and patient nature, even as a baby. Herrera states that he was a rock for the family, and that he always tried to make others laugh when they were sad. The scholarship is named after Franco to honor his memory. Stearns, a physician and avid skier, passed away in December 2015 after falling under the gun at his hunting cabin. He left behind a wife and a son, who are doing well. Herrera named the scholarship after Stearns as he was a strong and encouraging figure who always pushed others to do their best.

SALT LAKE CITY  Evan McMullin sat at a conference table in his modest campaign headquarters here one morning last week, struggling to pick which high-profile Republican had most disappointed him this year.
"Can we just say 'all of
continuation: the above , ' ? he said , pausing and giving out a groan .Mr . McMullin is a candidate for president in the most impossible of contests : The self - styled conservative independent is facing Donald J . Trump in an bid to halt the Republican nominee from taking the White House . But Mr . Trump is doing his best to make Mr . McMullin irrelevant .Already backed by Mitt Romney , the Republican gubernatorial of Massachusetts , the former C . I . A . officer has tried to getting his message out on television in Salt Lake City and other Western states , though his tiny party can barely afford to pay the rent .More frustrating , he said , is that few Republican voters will even consider supporting him . Mr . Trump has dominated that market with voters like Ted Cruz and Ben Carson .Many have already stated that they will not vote for Mr .
paraphrase: Evan McMullin sat in a conference room in his modest campaign headquarters in Salt Lake City, weighing his options for the most disappointing Republican candidate this year. "May as well say 'all of the above,'" he groaned, pausing in his thought process. McMullin, an independent conservative candidate for president, is fighting an uphill battle against Donald J. Trump's bid for the White House. Despite being backed by influential Republicans like Mitt Romney, the former CIA officer is struggling to get his message out to the public, as his tiny party can barely afford basic necessities like renting TV airtime in Salt Lake City and other Western states. What's more frustrating, according to McMullin, is that few Republican voters are willing to consider him as an alternative to Trump, with candidates like Ted Cruz and Ben Carson already dominating that market.

Hang headboards on sturdy cleats.
Measure the distance from the floor up the wall to the desired terminating point at the top of the headboard. Subtract 6 inches and make a mark. Use a level to draw an 18-
continuation: inch - broad square perpendicular to the mark . Draw a 1 - inch boundary around the square .Cut the piece of plywood on a table saw and join it to the mattress ' s frame . Screw the headboard to the cleats .During the headboard installation process , make sure your cleats are secure , then paint , stain or varnish your plywood . Note : The steps below illustrate how to replace a traditional headboard with a considerably lower - profile headboard .The stairs for constructing a elevated headboard are very identical , so use these steps as a guide , and modify them to suit your project . Measure the distance from the floor up the wall to the desired terminating point at the top of the headboard .Subtract 6 inches and produce a mark . Use a level to draw an 18 - inch - broad square parallel to the mark .Draw a 1 - inch boundary around the
paraphrase: To securely mount a headboard, start by measuring the distance from the floor to the desired terminating point at the top of the headboard. Subtract 6 inches and make a mark. Use a level to draw an 18-inch broad square parallel to the mark. Draw a 1-inch boundary around the square. Cut the plywood piece on a table saw and join it to the mattress's frame. Screw the headboard to the sturdy cleats, ensuring they are securely fastened. Finally, paint, stain, or varnish the plywood for a finished look. These steps can also be used to replace a traditional headboard with a lower-profile option by following the same process and modifying it to suit your project.

The Tax and Customs Board (MTA) has signed an agreement with Online accommodation and hospitality marketplace Airbnb which enables hosts to automatically report earnings.
The MTA and Airbnb held a joint press conference on Wednesday, announcing the agreement's signing as well as the
continuation: appointment of the MTA ' s Compliance Department as the enforcement partner in the new program . The MTA says that the new agreement will provide greater tax transparency for the platform ' s hosts and the agency hopes more hosts to come forward and application for accreditation in 2020 .The MTA explained that the taxation agency will work tightly with Airbnb and the private sector to ensure that the new system is functioning to provide details about the platform ' s revenue . According to the agency , hosts that have their rentals on the platform can instantly report their earnings on Airbnb and application for an MTA license .As of July 2020 , the accreditation will be free of charge , while hosts who are already accredited will also be provided the option of paying the license fee through the platform . Airbnb , which offers online
paraphrase: The Tax and Customs Board (MTA) has entered into an agreement with Airbnb, an online accommodation and hospitality marketplace, allowing hosts to automatically report their earnings. The two parties held a joint press conference on Wednesday to announce the agreement's signing and the appointment of the MTA's Compliance Department as the enforcement partner in the new program. The MTA highlights that this new agreement will promote greater tax transparency for the platform's hosts and hopes to see more hosts participate in the accreditation process in 2020. According to the agency, hosts can now instantly report their earnings on Airbnb and apply for an MTA license with ease. As of July 2020, the accreditation process will be free of charge, while existing hosts will have the option to pay the license fee through the platform. Airbnb, which facilitates online bookings and payments, will work closely with the taxation agency to ensure the new system operates smoothly and provides detailed information about the platform's revenue.

input: Twenty-five years ago, at Minneapolis Southern Theater, Gale LaJoye created Snowflake, a one-man show featuring a sad-sack clown who turned a junk-strewn vacant lot into a place of
continuation: beauty . The 50 - minute play was the culmination of more than a year of performance , workshops , audiences and four prior performances in the same lot in South Minneapolis .The idea for Snowflake evolved out of a project in a 1980 downtown beautification project in the same lot . On Nov . 8 , LaJoye and Snowflake will return to the Southern for a new incarnation .At 11 : 30 a . m . Tuesday , he will lead a session of Junk Harvest Day . paraphrase: Twenty-five years ago, at the Southern Theater in Minneapolis, Gale LaJoye debuted Snowflake, a one-man show showcasing a down-on-his-luck clown who transformed a neglected lot into a haven of beauty. The 50-minute performance culminated a year-long creative journey, involving workshops, audience participation, and four previous shows in the same location. Snowflake evolved from a 1980 community project in the same lot, and LaJoye will return to the Southern Theater on November 8 for a fresh take on the production. On that day, he will lead a Junk Harvest Day session at 11:30 a.m., followed by four evenings of Snowflake 2010 performances at 7:30 p.m., during which he will engage with the audience on the recycling-friendly project. input:
There's something important that chronically indecisive people need to understand: They're not actually interested in making a decision. Since this statement flies brazenly in the face of common sense, let me restate it differently.
Indeed, as these individuals anguish
continuation: over their decision , they ' re try to convince themselves that a decision is even necessary . In their mind , the effort they ' re putting forth is an excuse for not makes the decision .It ' s really quite a challenging conundrum : These person believe that they should make a decision but want to avoid doing so . Let ' s move on to the process they follow to choose on a movie , butter on toast , or where to spend their vacation .They procrastinate until the last minute . They acquire all sorts of information about options and trying to relate one to another .At times , they engage in deep and meaningful self - analysis to try and understand their emotional state , feeling that this is required for chose a movie or a dining location . People with the failure to make a decision frequently using the excuse of indecision to resist make a decision .They justify their indecisiveness by stating
paraphrase: There lies a fundamental truth about those chronically indecisive individuals: they don't genuinely want to make a choice. This notion goes against conventional wisdom, so let me rephrase it: Indecisive people often convince themselves that a decision is unnecessary, treating the effort they put forth as an excuse for not making one. It's a tricky predicament, as they feel they should make a decision yet resist doing so. When it comes to selecting a movie, food, or vacation spot, they put off making a decision until the last minute. They gather information on their options, trying to connect them, and sometimes engage in deep self-reflection to understand their emotional state, believing this is essential for choosing. Indecisive individuals often use their indecision as a reason to avoid making a decision, justifying their behavior by claiming they are unsure.

CALGARY, Alberta (Reuters) - Encana Corp (ECA.TO), Canadas largest natural gas producer, slashed its 2015 capital budget by a quarter on Wednesday in response to a slump in global crude oil prices.
The
continuation: company indicated it was targeting production increases of 10 percent per decade through to 2020 . However , Encana , which warned in February it was considering cutting its capital budget , said it expects to produce 20 percent less barrels of oil equivalent this decade than it did last month .Encana indicated it would cut its 2015 capital budget to $ 2 . 3 billion from $ 3 billion and continue to focus on increasing natural gas production in the United States , with drilling plans to expand output from more than 4 billion cubic foot per month ( bcf / d ) this year to more than 5 bcf / d in 2018 . Encana is not the first oil and gas producer to take advantage of the decline in oil prices , which are at six - month lows as the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries has refused to trim
paraphrase: Encana, a leading natural gas producer in Canada, has reduced its capital budget for 2015 by 25% in response to the recent decline in global crude oil prices. Despite this reduction, the company aims to increase production by 10% per decade until 2020. However, Encana has lowered its production forecast for this decade, expecting to produce 20% fewer barrels of oil equivalent compared to its previous forecast. To offset this reduction, the company will focus on expanding its natural gas production in the United States, with plans to increase output from over 4 billion cubic feet per month (bcf/d) this year to over 5 bcf/d in 2018. Like other oil and gas producers, Encana is taking advantage of the current oil price slump, which has seen prices fall to six-month lows due to OPEC's refusal to trim output.

While the Senate debated a lengthy series of amendments to the proposed malpractice reform bill, the Assembly plowed ahead and pushed the plan through committee and to a vote on the floor Tuesday night.
As the Assembly convened at 9:30 p.m
continuation: . in a Special Session to debate the bill , the Senate , leading by Minority Leader John Sampson ( D - Brooklyn ) , issued a report that the Senate would continue to debate the bill until its amendments were adopted .Senate Minority Leader John J . Flanagan ( R - Suffolk County ) said the Senate was meeting its responsibility by permitting as much amendments as possible and presenting the most thoughtful , bipartisan approach to fixing malpractice reform . Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver ( D - Manhattan ) said the Assembly was reaching an agreement on some of the legislation endorsed by the Senate .He reiterated that the Assembly would not be swayed by the Senate or any other proposals . He said the Assembly would continue to move forward to getting a vote on the floor on Tuesday night and that the Assemblys legislation contained
paraphrase: As the Assembly gathered at 9:30 p.m. for a Special Session to discuss the malpractice reform bill, the Senate was engaged in a lengthy debate over amendments to the proposed legislation. Despite the Senate's efforts, the Assembly pushed forward with their own plan, approving it through committee and voting on it on the floor Tuesday night. Senate Minority Leader John Sampson (D-Brooklyn) emphasized the Senate's commitment to debating and adopting amendments, while Senate Minority Leader John J. Flanagan (R-Suffolk County) highlighted the Senate's responsibility in presenting a thorough and bipartisan approach to addressing malpractice reform. Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver (D-Manhattan) reiterated the Assembly's determination to move forward with their own legislation, despite any potential disagreements with the Senate or other proposals. He emphasized that the Assembly would not be swayed and would continue to work towards a floor vote on Tuesday night.

input:
(JTA)  Five of the fatalities in the terrorist truck-ramming attack in New York City on Tuesday afternoon were Argentine tourists celebrating the 30th anniversary of their high school graduation, including one Jewish businessman.
According to Argentinas
continuation: Foreign Ministry , three of those murdered were girls . The casualties are all young adults .The Jewish person was named as Daniel Castro . He was one of the more than 20 men wounded in the incident .His wife , whose name has not been released , is also injured , as is their one - year - old children . Jewish organizations expressed their mourning over the losing of Castro and added that Argentine Jews and others would hold a prayer session for the victims .Among those praying for Castro was his brother , Eduardo Castro , who resides in New York and is not Jewish . Eduardo Castro , who was a childhood acquaintance of Daniel Castros , told a local Argentine radio channel that he had last talked to him about two weeks ago , when his sister had speaking of his familys planning for a trip to Florida .He described his brother as an avid Argentine polo
paraphrase: Five Argentine tourists celebrating their high school graduation anniversary were tragically killed in the terrorist truck attack in New York City, including a Jewish businessman named Daniel Castro. According to the Argentine Foreign Ministry, three of the victims were young women. The Jewish community has expressed their deepest condolences over the loss of Castro, and many are set to hold a prayer session for the victims. Castro's brother, Eduardo, who resides in New York, is among those praying for his brother's soul. In a radio interview, Eduardo shared that he had last spoken to his brother two weeks ago, when his sister was planning a trip to Florida with their family. He remembered Daniel as an avid enthusiast of Argentine polo.

paraphrase:
A security officer outside the Durban residence of convicted fraudster Schabir Shaik.
Shaik is not being taken back to jail, according to reports. Instead, the convicted criminal is keeping busy at his Morningside home in Durban, spending much of his time in the gym. "Exercise helps me maintain my sanity and keeps my mind active," he told Fin24 on Wednesday. "I spend a lot of time at the gym now because it keeps my thinking sharp." Shaik confirmed that he has legal representation, but declined to comment on any potential "shenanigans" between himself and his lawyer. It is believed that he may be negotiating a reduced sentence with SARS and the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA), after serving three years of his 15-month sentence for fraud and fraud. The 74-year-old was released on hospital parole after his conviction.

CCI Systems of
continuation: Walpole , Mass . stated it gives channel partners the ability to provide robust video , internet and telephony services to their customers through specialized video processing .The CCI Systems ADVU company mixes 100 % digital and IP networks , the manufacturer says , and features technologies such as Internet protection , large - speed internet , business video , voice and protection systems in one offering . Adara is a managed service provider ( MSP ) with 20 years experience in the technology arena .Adara stated it gives its channel partners the ability to provide customized solutions to subscribers through its branded managed services namely cloud backup , data storage and managed Internet services . The Adara services are delivered over Adaras platform with the companys end - to - end managed services technology .According to a release , Adara is seeing an increased need for cloud - based technology services that are compliant with governmental data - sharing and information safety rules .
paraphrase: In the lead-up to The Independent Show next week, Adara Technologies has announced a strategic partnership with CCI Systems to offer cloud-based, managed advanced video solutions to mid-to-small sized service providers. CCI Systems, based in Walpole, Massachusetts, specializes in providing robust video, internet, and telephony services to their customers through cutting-edge video processing technologies. input: New versions of two popular golf ball families hitting the market last week was not relatively big news. What did capture plenty of attention was that both are updated high-optic renditions -- each with their own spin. Mind you, non-white golf
continuation: balls for the masses is hardly a news flash , particularly when it comes from either TaylorMade or Callaway , but the latest iterations of their specific products are both notable for a couple of reasons . First , TaylorMade ' s Project ( a ) ( $ 21 . 99 ) is the company ' s first ever pearl - colored ball that is also a three - piece construction with a Surlyn cover .Both of those factors placed the ball into the ' forgiving ' category , but it ' s still meant for better handicappers and beginner golfers . Next , Callaway ' s Hex Tour White ( $ 17 . 99 ) is the company ' s most efficient two - piece distance model and should appeal to golfers of all levels , and particularly beginners and recreational golfers .Callaway advertises Hex Tour White as being the best tour - designed golf ball on the market for under $ 2
paraphrase: Last week saw the launch of updated versions of two popular golf ball lines, but what truly grabbed attention was the innovative twist these new releases brought to the table. While non-white golf balls for the masses is not exactly breaking news, especially from TaylorMade or Callaway, these latest iterations of their specific products are worth noting for several reasons. TaylorMade's Project (a) ($21.99) stands out as the company's first pearl-colored ball with a three-piece construction and Surlyn cover, making it fall under the "forgiving" category. However, it's designed for better handicappers and beginner golfers. On the other hand, Callaway's Hex Tour White ($17.99) is their most efficient two-piece distance model, making it suitable for golfers of all skill levels, including beginners and recreational players. Callaway boasts that Hex Tour White is the best tour-designed golf ball on the market for under $20, offering unparalleled performance at an affordable price.

input: This basic galette recipe can be tailored to fit whatever fruit you have on hand. The key is to scale the amount of sugar and cornstarch. Generally speaking, tart stone fruits (apricots, peaches, nectarines, pl
continuation: ums ) need about a cup of sugar and two tablespoons of cornstarch per apple ; sweet fruits like cherries , blueberries , and blackberries need about a cup of sugar and a tablespoon of cornstarch per apple . Heat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit .In a large bowl , toss together fruit , cinnamon , sugar , and cornstarch . Transfer to a greased baking sheet ( 12 - by - 17 - inch baking sheet works well ) .Roll out dough into a circle big enough to fit on baking sheet and transfer to the pan . Press dough into place on pan .Fold under overhang of dough ; flute edge with a fork . Dot apple filling generously with butter and sprinkle with extra sugar .Slide galette into the oven and bake 40 to 45 minutes , or until
paraphrase: This versatile galette recipe can be customized to suit any fruit you have on hand. The key is to adjust the amount of sugar and cornstarch according to the fruit's sweetness level. Generally, tart fruits like apricots, peaches, nectarines, and plums require about a cup of sugar and two tablespoons of cornstarch per apple, while sweeter fruits like cherries, blueberries, and blackberries need about a cup of sugar and a tablespoon of cornstarch per apple. Heat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. In a large bowl, mix together the fruit, cinnamon, sugar, and cornstarch. Transfer the mixture to a greased 12x17-inch baking sheet. Roll out the dough into a circle big enough to fit on the pan and transfer it to the sheet. Press the dough into place on the pan, fold the overhang of dough under, and flute the edge with a fork. Dot the apple filling with butter and sprinkle with extra sugar. Place the galette in the oven and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the apples are tender.

input:
Monica La Bennett, Vice-President (Operations), CDB (left) and Javier Manzanares, Executive Director ad interim (right), GCF sign the Accreditation Master Agreement.
ST GEORGES, Grenada,
continuation: February 27 , 2020 ( CDB ) : The Caribbean Development Bank ( CDB ) has entered into an Accreditation Master Agreement ( AMA ) with the Green Climate Fund ( GCF ) to formalise their institutional cooperation and prepare for CDBs accreditation with the Fund . GCF Executive Director ad interim , Javier Manzanares , and Monica La Bennett , Vice - President ( Operations ) , CDB signed the Accreditation Master Agreement ( AMA ) on Tuesday , February 25 in New York , at the UN offices .The signing was witnessed by Hon . Franklin Khan , Minister of Sustainable Development of Grenada , on behalf of the Caribbean Community ( CARICOM ) , and His Excellency Paul Kagame , President of the Republic of Rwanda .The AMA is a
paraphrase:
CDB and GCF Sign Accreditation Master Agreement to Strengthen Institutional Cooperation
St. George's, Grenada - February 27, 2020 (CDB) - The Caribbean Development Bank (CDB) and the Green Climate Fund (GCF) have entered into an Accreditation Master Agreement (AMA) to formalize their institutional cooperation and prepare for CDB's accreditation with the Fund. The agreement was signed on Tuesday, February 25 in New York, at the United Nations offices, by Javier Manzanares, Executive Director ad interim of GCF, and Monica La Bennett, Vice-President (Operations) of CDB. The signing was witnessed by Hon. Franklin Khan, Minister of Sustainable Development of Grenada, on behalf of the Caribbean Community (CARICOM), and His Excellency Paul Kagame, President of the Republic of Rwanda.
The AMA is an important milestone in the cooperation between CDB and GCF, as it outlines the terms and conditions for CDB's accreditation with the Fund. The agreement highlights the commitment of both organizations to collaborate on climate change mitigation and adaptation initiatives in the Caribbean region.
Under the AMA, CDB and GCF will work together to develop and implement projects that support the Caribbean region's transition to a low-carbon and resilient future. The agreement also provides a framework for the sharing of knowledge, expertise, and best practices between the two organizations.
"We are pleased to have signed this Accreditation Master Agreement with GCF, which marks an important milestone in our cooperation," said Monica La Bennett, Vice-President (Operations) of CDB. "This agreement will enable us to work more closely together to address the climate change challenges facing the Caribbean region, and to support the region's sustainable development."
"The GCF is pleased to be working with the CDB to support climate change mitigation and adaptation initiatives in the Caribbean region," said Javier Manzanares, Executive Director ad interim of GCF. "This agreement demonstrates our commitment to collaborating with regional organizations to address the pressing climate change challenges facing the region."
The signing of the AMA was witnessed by representatives of CARICOM, the United Nations, and other international organizations. The agreement is expected to enhance the capacity of CDB to access GCF funding for climate change projects in the Caribbean region.

input: ST. LOUIS, MO (KTVI) - The City of St. Louis confirms three additional heat deaths, bringin the total of deaths in the city to 17. The St. Louis City Health Director is now asking the Centers for
continuation: Disease Control to examine . The CDC sent out a team of experts to the cities this weekend .They have been monitoring city water , and educating the neighborhood about the dangers of temperature exposure . Meanwhile , a local educator says many school vehicles have no air heating .She says many older children can be at risk if they are not adequately supervised while waiting for their bus .
paraphrase: ST. LOUIS, MO (KMOV) - The city of St. Louis has reported three additional heat-related deaths, bringing the total number of fatalities to 17. The St. Louis City Health Director has now reached out to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for assistance. A team of CDC experts was deployed to the city over the weekend to monitor the local water supply and educate residents about the dangers of excessive heat exposure. Meanwhile, a local educator has raised concerns about the lack of air conditioning in school vehicles, particularly for older children who may be more vulnerable to heat-related illnesses while waiting for their bus.

input: PANAMA CITY BEACH, Fla. (WJHG/WECP) - Rugby originated in England in the 19th century. For those in America who may still be unfamiliar with the sports, imagine the option offense without pads.
continuation: You ' re probably on the right track . " It ' s a run game .A lot of people believe it ' s a contact sport , but you ' re not allowed to hurt anybody on the field , " added Graham Sharp , a player on the Florida Panhandle Pirates , which is a team situated in Panama City Beach . Pirates captain Michael Barnes recalls his first time watching rugby in the early 2000s in high school ." [ My teammates ] said we ' re going to try rugby and I ' m like , ' are you joking me ? ' " Barnes said .Barnes came to a high school in Florida that had a rugby squad and immediately grew hooked . Barnes now plays for the Pirates and even taking a semester off school to compete rugby professionally in Amsterdam , Netherlands .The game has become a huge sport internationally ,
paraphrase:
Imagine a sport that originated in England in the 19th century, without the bulky pads that are synonymous with American football. That's rugby, a fast-paced and physical game that's gaining popularity in the United States. For those new to the sport, think of it as a run-heavy offense without the need for protective gear. Graham Sharp, a player for the Florida Panhandle Pirates, a team based in Panama City Beach, described rugby as a "run game" that's often mistaken for a contact sport. However, players are not allowed to intentionally harm each other on the field.
Michael Barnes, captain of the Pirates, recalled his initial hesitation towards rugby in high school in the early 2000s. "My teammates told me we were going to try rugby, and I was like, 'Are you joking me?'" Barnes said. Despite his initial reservations, Barnes was hooked after watching a high school rugby match and eventually took a semester off to play professionally in Amsterdam, Netherlands.
Rugby has gained significant traction internationally, with a growing number of fans and players worldwide. The sport has evolved significantly since its inception in England over a century ago, with modern rules and regulations aimed at promoting player safety and fair play. Whether you're a seasoned sports enthusiast or a newcomer to the world of rugby, this sport is definitely worth checking out.

Tuesday night ( Sept . 27 ) show , a PBS - WNET production , finds Alda on stage with such visitors as the comedy duo " Whose Line Is It Anyway ? " ( the teenage Ryan Stiles was once one of Alda ' s TV students ) , Nobel Prize winner Daniel Kahneman , Emmy - win actress Matthew Broderick ( also the voice of Ferris Bueller in " Ferris Bueller ' s Day Off " ) and actress Judith Light .Alda still has the on - stage charisma that we associate with
paraphrase: Alan Alda has had a remarkable career, earning accolades such as seven Emmys and six Golden Globes, as well as an Oscar nomination for his role as a Republican Senator in the 2004 film "The Aviator." He has also written, directed, and produced various plays and films, penned 17 books, and hosted the popular PBS program "Scientific American Frontiers." Now, he is back on TV with "Alan Alda in Scientific American Frontiers: Live in New York," a PBS-WNET production that features Alda on stage with notable guests such as the comedy duo "Whose Line Is It Anyway?" (including teenage actor Ryan Stiles, who once studied with Alda on TV), Nobel Prize winner Daniel Kahneman, Emmy-winning actress Matthew Broderick (also the voice of Ferris Bueller in "Ferris Bueller's Day Off"), and actress Judith Light. Despite his age, Alda still possesses the charismatic stage presence that audiences have come to know and love.

input:

A local business owner whos hoping to put on a music festival as his business approaches an anniversary asked permission from
continuation: the Village Council on Wednesday to hold the event at the park . Clyburns shop Catch 22 , at the corner of South Broadway and Main streets , is in its third year of operation .He said he would like to hold the festival for the last couple of years in order to give it a chance to succeed . He also explained out that hes not use Village resources like water or electricity for the festival .Weve never approached this thing thinking , were going to take over Greenfield Village , he said . I do need to make it clear that Im not putting on a band festival in Greenfield Village .Were puts on a band festival in the park . Village Councilman Dan Gant , who originally opposed the idea , spoke in favor of it .He pointed out that the rules of usage for the park permit the booking of commercial events . But other Village
paraphrase: Mark Clyburn, owner of Catch 22, appeared before the Greenfield Village Council to request permission to host a music festival at Mitchell Park. Clyburn's business is approaching its third anniversary and he aims to give the festival a chance to succeed. He assured the council that he will not use Village resources such as water or electricity for the event. "We've never approached this thing thinking we're going to take over Greenfield Village," he stated. "We want to put on a music festival in the park, not in the Village itself." Village Councilman Dan Gant, who initially opposed the idea, later expressed support for it, pointing out that the park's rules allow for commercial events to be booked.

input:
REDLANDS  Thanks to local Twilight fans, Redlands Community Hospital more than doubled the amount of blood collected at their monthly drive Tuesday.
The hospital hosted the first of two Twilight-themed blood
continuation: drives , organized in partnership with Vitalant . Donors were asked to sign up as Team Edward or Team Jacob in honor of the character Edward Cullen and Jacob Black , werewolf and werewolf respectively , in Stephenie Meyers Twilight series .In exchange for participating , donors earned free door prizes , Twilight - inspired T - shirts and a diploma with their movie ticket voucher . Donors additionally had the ability to donate through the new Vitalant Mobile blood donation bus ." We are so happy to have been able to bring together the community in an effort to collect a lot of blood that will be used in our local community , " added Brenda Pierce , RN , Blood Services Team Leader at RCH . " I would like to thank the community for come out and supporting us . "With backing from Vitalant , RCH will host its
paraphrase:
Redlands Hospital Hosts Successful Twilight-Themed Blood Drive
Redlands Community Hospital recently hosted a successful blood drive, thanks to the enthusiastic support of local Twilight fans. In partnership with Vitalant, the hospital organized two Twilight-themed blood drives, where donors could sign up as either Team Edward or Team Jacob in honor of the series' beloved characters, Edward Cullen and Jacob Black. As a token of appreciation, donors received free door prizes, Twilight-inspired T-shirts, and a diploma upon redeeming their movie ticket voucher. To make the event even more convenient, donors could also donate through the new Vitalant Mobile blood donation bus. According to Brenda Pierce, RN, Blood Services Team Leader at RCH, "We are thrilled to have brought together the community in this effort to collect a significant amount of blood that will be used in our local area. We are grateful to the community for their support."

input: "Cape Cod-meets-Santa Monica is one of the ways chef-owner Marc Taft of Mariettas Chicken and the Egg explains Brine Seafood Shack, his new chic but laid-back restaurant at
continuation: the Culver City Studio Tranquility base in Sony Pictures Entertainment . With no on - location parking , Brine is designed as a rapid - service concept where patrons take up orders through a rolling drive - up windowwith the benefit of a small sidewalk seating if you want to enjoy a breakfast in public , perhaps for lunch or to dinner .The idea is to eat quickly and get on with life . Having recently opened the doors , Taft wanted to see what customers and critics wanted , and fast .To that end , he is spending his mornings tracking the social media feed on the restaurants Instagram website , which has had 7 , 500 followers since its Jan . 30 opening . On Saturday , Taft stood outside , hoping to interact with patrons in real time , with his eyes trained on a screen displaying the Facebook live feed , while surfing the restaurants social
paraphrase: Marc Taft, the chef and owner of Mariettas Chicken and the Egg, has introduced his latest venture, Brine Seafood Shack, in the bustling Culver City Studio Tranquility base of Sony Pictures Entertainment. With a focus on quick and easy dining, the restaurant features a rolling drive-up window for convenient ordering, accompanied by a small sidewalk seating area for those who prefer to enjoy their meals in public. Taft has implemented this rapid service concept to cater to the busy lifestyles of his customers, with the aim of providing them with a hassle-free dining experience. To stay on top of customer feedback and preferences, Taft spends his mornings monitoring the restaurant's Instagram feed, which has garnered a impressive following of 7,500 since its launch on January 30th. On Saturdays, he can be found standing outside the restaurant, actively engaging with customers in real-time through the Facebook live feed, while simultaneously keeping an eye on the restaurant's social media activity. By doing so, Taft is able to provide an exceptional dining experience that is both efficient and enjoyable.

input:
The extent of GOP efforts to prevent black people and Latinos from voting is jaw-dropping. And this Nov. 8, minority voters need to document it so America can see.
Donald Trumps offensive statements and the chaos theyve
continuation: spawned have finally thrown outrage over the Republican Partys abuse of voter suppression to the top of the news . The extent of GOP programs to keep colored folks and Latinos from votes is jaw - dropping .This past year and a half , Republican state legislatures have passed more laws to prohibit access to the polls than in any year since the Voting Rights Act becoming legal in 1965 , notes the National Urban League , one of the countrys major civil rights organisations . We are currently living through one of the darkest chapters in American history .Yet the disgraceful underbelly of American history is still overlooked by many non - voters . The NAACPs This Is Not Normal campaign and former Barack Obama campaign manager , David Plouffe , are attempting to re - energize voter organizations that have disengaged
paraphrase: The Republican Party's schemes to restrict minority voting rights are appalling, and on November 8, these actions must be documented to expose them to the public. Donald Trump's offensive statements and the chaos they have caused have finally sparked outrage over the GOP's manipulation of voter suppression. In the past year and a half, Republican state legislatures have enacted more laws to restrict access to the polls than in any year since the Voting Rights Act was signed into law in 1965, according to the National Urban League, a leading civil rights organization. Unfortunately, many Americans are still oblivious to this disturbing trend in our nation's history. The NAACP's "This Is Not Normal" campaign and former Obama campaign manager David Plouffe are working to reinvigorate disengaged voter organizations to address this issue.

input:
THERE were loud cheers, and a few tears as Hayley Talbot paddled her corflute kayak into Whiting Beach this morning.
With the song "Happy" playing, she raised her paddle in the air as she reached the
continuation: shore, having paddled 1000km from Tully in Queensland."This is just incredible," she said, smiling.She will join the Gold Coast wave after it hits the coast in about two weeks . The Tully Paddlers completed their 2018 adventure in Port Macquarie yesterday after stop at some coastal towns along the way .Hayley is the youngest paddler in the group - one of only two girls took part in the adventure . The third , Tanya Crawford , was a passenger , not a paddler , this time around .The group was in duds from head to toe , looking exhausted and preparing for a well - earned broke . Today , they were looking forward to being pampered , by a spa and a massage .Soon , they will spend a few days in Port Macquarie ,
paraphrase: Hayley Talbot paddled her corflute kayak into Whiting Beach this morning, eliciting cheers and tears from onlookers. As she reached the shore, the song "Happy" played, and she raised her paddle in celebration, having completed a 1000km journey from Tully in Queensland. "This is amazing," she beamed, her smile lighting up her face. The Tully Paddlers concluded their 2018 adventure in Port Macquarie the day before, stopping at various coastal towns along the way. Hayley, the youngest paddler in the group, was one of only two girls participating, with Tanya Crawford serving as a passenger this time around. Exhausted from their journey, the group donned duds from head to toe and looked forward to relaxing with a spa and massage. In the coming days, they will spend time in Port Macquarie before continuing on their journey.

input:
House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a "culture of corruption in Washington" and aims to reduce the role of money in politics.
Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings, the new chairman of the House
continuation: Oversight and Government Reform Committee , said his aim is to develop high ethical standards and practices in Congress and " make sure we live up to the American ideals of honesty and integrity . " The package of bills seeks to curtail " lobbyist abuses " and establish greater transparency in federal elections , notably an ending to the general election matching money project and the disclosure of donors in ads .Besides Cummings , other leading lawmakers sponsoring the legislation include Reps . Zoe Lofgren , D - Calif . , John Conyers , D - Mich . , Louise Slaughter , D - N . Y . , and Debbie Wasserman Schultz , D - Fla . " Every American has the right to expect that their government operates with sincerity and integrity , and that their elected officials serve the public interest , not their own interests
paraphrase:
House Democrats unveil sweeping election and ethics reform package.
On Friday, House Democrats unveiled a comprehensive election and ethics reform package aimed at tackling a "culture of corruption" in Washington and reducing the influence of money in politics.  Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings, the new chairman of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, emphasized the importance of establishing high ethical standards and practices in Congress, and ensuring that lawmakers uphold American ideals of honesty and integrity.
The package of bills seeks to address "lobbyist abuses" and enhance transparency in federal elections, including ending the general election matching money project and disclosing donors in ads. Other leading lawmakers sponsoring the legislation include Reps. Zoe Lofgren (D-Calif.), John Conyers (D-Mich.), Louise Slaughter (D-N.Y.), and Debbie Wasserman Schultz (D-Fla.).
According to Cummings, every American has the right to expect that their government operates with sincerity and integrity, and that their elected officials prioritize the public interest over their own.

input:
It took just 80 years for the Roman Empire to fall apart as a political unit.
When Theodosius the Great died in 395, he bequeathed to his two feckless sonsHonorius, a 10-year-
continuation: old , and Arcadius , ninea huge and increasingly ungovernable Empire that was also in the throes of disintegration . Barbarian tribes from the north had already stormed into the Balkans and portions of Western Europe , but an much larger challenge coming in the form of Romes old enemies , the Persians .By the late 4th millennium the Sassanid Empire was under the rule of Ardashir I , a brilliant and ambitious Persian monarch . The attack of Persian armies through the Roman Empire of the Eastern Roman ( Byzantine ) Empire began in 363 with an incursion into Mesopotamia under Shapur I .In 364 Shapur began to negotiate with the Roman Emperor Julian for the return of several Persian prisoners , and when this was rejected Shapur ordered his forces to invasion Syria , capturing Antioch ,
paraphrase: The Roman Empire crumbled in a remarkable 80 years, collapsing from a vast and complex political entity to a fragmented collection of territories. The passing of Theodosius the Great in 395 CE left his two immature sons, Honorius and Arcadius, to inherit a rapidly deteriorating Empire. As barbarian hordes from the north and Persian armies from the east pressed against the borders, the Empire teetered on the brink of collapse. By the late 4th century, the Sassanid Empire, led by the brilliant and ambitious Ardashir I, had emerged as a powerful force, threatening the Eastern Roman (Byzantine) Empire with invasion. In 363 CE, Shapur I, the Persian monarch, launched a successful campaign against Mesopotamia, marking the beginning of a long and bloody conflict that would span several decades. Despite attempts at negotiation, the Persians continued their assault on the Roman Empire, capturing key territories such as Antioch.

input: The Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS) in Wisconsin works like most other government human services groups, providing child protection services, foster and respite care, elder abuse care, and more. However, they recently launched an
continuation: ambitious 15 - year plan to modernize their approach and activities . This roadmap involves utilizing Salesforce CRM to achieve outcomes that put people at the center of things that they do .After years of hard effort and dedication , the new model of human services would go live on January 1 , 2020 . With such a substantial shift in how they operate , it was vital that they had the right technology in place .For this , they chosen Service Centrals modern technology platform , which merged the best of both Salesforce and cloud applications , with the underlying power of the internet and the best experience it could give . The challenge they faced : how to ensure the health , well - being , and happiness of those that they served in one system and how to getting there .As the go - live date approached , the Salesforce implementation team at CCDHS partnered with Service Central to examine their readiness . Based on this analysis ,
paraphrase:
The Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS) in Wisconsin has embarked on an innovative 15-year plan to revolutionize their approach to providing social services. This comprehensive roadmap aims to place the needs of individuals at the forefront of their operations by leveraging Salesforce CRM. After years of diligent effort, the new model is set to launch on January 1, 2020, with the right technology in place.
CCDHS selected Service Centrals' cutting-edge platform, which seamlessly integrates Salesforce and cloud applications with the power of the internet, to achieve their objectives. The challenge they faced was ensuring the well-being, health, and happiness of those they serve in one cohesive system. As the go-live date approached, the Salesforce implementation team at CCDHS collaborated with Service Central to assess their readiness. Based on this assessment, they were able to identify areas of improvement and ensure a successful transition.

input:
The US president, George Bush, today called on Israel to end its 41-year occupation of Palestinian land and predicted a peace treaty would be signed by the time he leaves office.
Speaking after a meeting with the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, Bush
continuation: said he was eager to secure a lasting reconciliation for Israelis and Palestinians . Bush and Abbas met for more than an hour and discussed attempts to restart talks between Israel and the Palestinians after a two - month hiatus .Speaking in private , Bush claimed he maintained " optimistic and confident " about prospects for a peace deal , a senior administration official stated . The Israeli prime secretary , Ehud Olmert , appreciated Bush ' s personal initiatives to broker a agreement ." These two months , I was not certain that this might be achieved in these two months , but now , for the first time , we have an environment of hope and trust between Israel and the Palestinians , " Olmert stated . Abbas said he believed Bush ' s initiative might end Israel ' s occupation , develop a Palestinian state with Jerusalem as its capital , and
paraphrase:
The United States president, George Bush, urged Israel to end its longstanding occupation of Palestinian territory during a meeting with Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas today. Bush expressed optimism about the possibility of a peace treaty being signed before he leaves office, highlighting his administration's commitment to securing a lasting reconciliation for both Israelis and Palestinians.
Following a one-hour meeting between Bush and Abbas, a senior administration official revealed that the US president remained confident about the prospects for a peace deal. Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Olmert expressed appreciation for Bush's personal efforts to facilitate a resolution, stating that the environment between Israel and the Palestinians has shifted from uncertainty to hope and trust.
Abbas expressed his belief that Bush's initiative could lead to the end of Israel's occupation, the establishment of a Palestinian state with Jerusalem as its capital, and a just resolution to the decades-long conflict.
