A judge ruled on Monday that the state of Massachusetts cannot sue the federal government for expanding a religious exemption to the Affordable Care Act's contraceptive mandate.
"While we are disappointed in this decision, we remain steadfast in our commitment to ensuring affordable and reliable
continuation: access to the full range of womens healthcare services , " saying Kathryn Eidinger , a spokesperson for Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey . The contraceptive mandate , which required faith nonprofits and for - profit businesses with religious affiliations to provide insurance for contraceptives without co - paying , was set to take effect on Tuesday .On Friday , the Supreme Court ruled in favor of employers that are morally opposed to offering coverage for birth control . The Trump administration increased the conscience clause exemption in August , arguing that employers might refuse to cover contraceptive methods that are objectionable for spiritual or ethical reasons .In Massachusetts , some religious nonprofits , Catholic hospitals , and a Catholic university are exempt from the mandate . Some of these groups are suing the federal authorities over the exemption .Heale
paraphrase:
A judge ruled on Monday that the Commonwealth of Massachusetts cannot pursue legal action against the federal government for broadening a religious exemption to the Affordable Care Act's contraceptive requirement.
"While we are disappointed in this ruling, we remain steadfast in our commitment to ensuring accessible and dependable healthcare services for women," stated Kathryn Eidinger, a spokesperson for Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey. The contraceptive requirement, which required faith-based nonprofits and for-profit organizations with religious ties to provide insurance coverage for contraceptives without co-pay, was set to go into effect on Tuesday.
On Friday, the Supreme Court ruled in favor of employers who morally object to providing coverage for birth control. The Trump administration expanded the conscience clause exemption in August, arguing that employers might refuse to cover contraceptive methods that are objectionable for spiritual or ethical reasons. In Massachusetts, some religious nonprofits, Catholic hospitals, and a Catholic university are exempt from the mandate, and some of these groups are suing federal authorities over the exemption.
Healey has expressed concern that the expanded exemption could undermine access to essential healthcare services for women, particularly those in marginalized communities. Despite the setback, Healey's office remains dedicated to ensuring that women have access to a full range of reproductive healthcare services.

The use of the books The Adventures of Huckle
continuation: berry Finn and To Kill a Mockingbird have been temporarily banned while officials at Nandua High School conduct a review , according to WTKR . In a press release , the school said they are in the process of identifying alternate readings for the purpose of illustrating writing form and content in compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act .School authorities said they plan to complete their review of the books and making a final decision by the end of the month . U . S . Rep . Robert C . Bobby Scott , D - Newport News , said he supports the temporary ban and plans to meet with the school .I am not certain why the parent of the student protested about the using of nigger in either book , he said . When I was a pupil , I was not embarrassed by the using of the word , but I was
paraphrase: ACCOMACK COUNTY, Virginia - Two classic American novels have been temporarily banned from a local school district due to concerns raised by a parent about the use of a racial slur. The school district, Nandua High School, is conducting a review of the books, "The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn" and "To Kill a Mockingbird," while ensuring compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act. School officials plan to complete their review and make a final decision by the end of the month. U.S. Representative Robert C. Bobby Scott, D-Newport News, supports the temporary ban and plans to meet with the school. It is unclear why the parent of the student protested the use of the racial slur in either book, as the representative notes that they were not embarrassed by its use when they were a student.

NEW Real Madrid president Florentino Perez is on the verge of launching an audacious transfer swoop for Cristiano Ronaldo.
The 24-year-old Manchester United star was linked to the Spanish giants when Perez was last president back in 2006.
continuation: And it appears as if he is set to make a move for Ronaldo once again . Spanish newspaper As said the teams agent Jorge Mendes was in Madrid on Thursday to meet Perez and consider a new agreement with Ronaldo .And a report by talkSPORT claims the Real president is determined to snap up the 60million star as a replacement for Raul . Raul is not in Perezs planning and he has been given until the end of the year to leave the team .The reigning Spanish and European champions play their final Champions League group game on Tuesday and with a last 16 place already assured , Raul could be handed a rare rest . Its still not clear whether Ronaldo will remain at Old Trafford .Ronaldo gave in a transfer request at the start of this season but despite United
paraphrase: Real Madrid's newly appointed president, Florentino Perez, is poised to make a bold move to bring Cristiano Ronaldo back to the club. This is not the first time Ronaldo has been linked with Real Madrid, as Perez was the president when Ronaldo was last linked with the team in 2006. According to Spanish newspaper AS, Ronaldo's agent, Jorge Mendes, was in Madrid on Thursday to meet with Perez and discuss a potential new agreement. A report by talkSPORT suggests that Perez is determined to sign Ronaldo as a replacement for Raul, who is no longer in his plans. Raul has been given until the end of the year to leave the team, and with Real Madrid's final Champions League group game on Tuesday, he may be given a rare rest. It remains to be seen if Ronaldo will remain at Manchester United, as he submitted a transfer request earlier this season. Despite United's efforts to keep him, it appears that Ronaldo's future is once again up in the air.

A British Columbia engineering science professor has developed a high-resolution scanner that he says will revolutionize how eye diseases are diagnosed to prevent vision loss.
Prof. Marinko Sarunic of Simon Fraser University said doctors currently use low-resolution scanners that
continuation: can miss early changes in the retina . A bright line in the eye , known a lesion , is a classic indication of an early eye disease , he said , but scanners cannot catch up the tiny lesions that might lead to earlier vision failure .Sarunic stated his scanner should be able to diagnose lesions as small as 15 micrometers in width , whereas modern scanners recognize lesions as big as 150 micrometers . Dr . James Marsh of the University of Montreal Health Center said his scanner is at least 10 times faster than conventional ones and can even view tumours in the eye .He said that Sarunics machine will decrease the time and expense of eye scans .
paraphrase: A scientist at Simon Fraser University has invented a cutting-edge eye scanner that could revolutionize how eye diseases are diagnosed, potentially preventing vision loss. Professor Marinko Sarunic explains that current scanners are low-resolution and may miss early signs of eye diseases, such as tiny lesions that can lead to vision problems. His scanner is capable of detecting lesions as small as 15 micrometers in width, significantly outperforming current scanners that can only detect lesions up to 150 micrometers in size. Dr. James Marsh of the University of Montreal Health Center notes that Sarunic's scanner is at least 10 times faster than conventional scanners and can even detect tumors in the eye. Marsh believes that this new technology will reduce the time and cost of eye scans, providing earlier and more accurate diagnoses.

Beaumont buys three variants , each at around 4 . 5 % ABV , or 4 . 5 calories per ounce and 110 calories per bottle .The typical fruity flavor is Lemonade , while Watermelon and Peach coming in seasonal 4 - bags . In terms of ABV , you have to going back to 1992 to find a ale packaged with the same level of caloric restraint , as Heinekens Premium Light ( 99 calories
paraphrase: Beaumont aims to tackle the contentious issue of millennials and their impact on the beer industry. As a response to the common criticism of millennials being accused of devaluing classic flavors in favor of trendy options, Beaumont has taken a proactive approach. They have selected three variants, each with an alcohol by volume (ABV) of around 4.5%, or 4.5 calories per ounce and 110 calories per bottle. The flavors include Lemonade, Watermelon, and Peach, which are available in seasonal 4-packs. Notably, Beaumont's offering boasts a comparable level of caloric restraint as Heineken's Premium Light from 1992, with just 99 calories per serving.

input: SPRINGFIELD -- The Department of Children and Family Services began issuing layoff notices to 600 employees on Friday with the aim of paring its workforce by 375 positions while still meeting its legal obligations to care for abused and neglected children and provide other services
continuation: , agency representatives said . And more layoffs will occur , said Brenda Bass , the agency ' s chief deputy director of field activities ." These layoffs are going to be a slow process , " she said . The 600 workers at the South Fillmore Street agency and in 13 regional headquarters across the state were offered the ability to take early retirement or voluntary transfers as well as have their jobs removed through layoffs .Some of the workers accepted the offers and some refused , a spokeswoman said . The department has one of the greatest workforces in state administration , with more than 6 , 600 employees , and has grown substantially over the previous few years .The cuts will trim the total workforce by about 5 percent . Gov .Rod Blagojevich used government stimulus funding to escape layoffs in
paraphrase: The Department of Children and Family Services recently began issuing layoff notices to 600 employees, with the goal of reducing its workforce by 375 positions while still fulfilling its legal obligations to protect abused and neglected children and provide other essential services. According to Brenda Bass, the agency's chief deputy director of field activities, these layoffs will be carried out gradually and may involve additional workers in the coming weeks. The 600 workers at the South Fillmore Street office and 13 regional headquarters across the state were given the option to accept early retirement, take voluntary transfers, or have their jobs eliminated through layoffs. While some employees accepted these offers, others declined, according to a spokesperson. The department has a significant workforce of over 6,600 employees and has grown in recent years, but these cuts will reduce the total workforce by around 5%. Governor Rod Blagojevich used government stimulus funding to avoid layoffs in other areas of the state administration.

input: Analysis - The prime minister was a media darling in New York, while at home the opposition ramped up attacks over the Meka Whaitiri affair and chased ministers along the trail of the Derek Handley emails. Peter Wilson looks at a busy week
continuation: in Parliament . When Jacinda Ardern was first sworn in as Prime Minister , she was welcomed in the New York Times as a breath of fresh air - a ' minister we want ' who ' was bubbling over with enthusiasm ' .She especially ditched her press secretary to escape a perceived culture of political correctness that the overseas paper felt was stifling the facts . This week , the world ' s media reported the appointment of 12 new members of the Executive Committee of the UN ' s most influential instrument , the Security Council , which has to do with more serious world problems than the dairy debacle or student debt .None of this was to say the PM had no constituency at home . She was in the running to be on the shortlist to receive the Prime Minister ' s residence in Riwaka , at least until Te Tai Tonga MP Rino Tirikatene filed an complaint .And the
paraphrase:
This week in Parliament, the Prime Minister faced a busy agenda, with both domestic and international issues taking center stage. While she was hailed as a media darling in New York, back home the opposition continued to scrutinize her government's actions, particularly in light of the recent Meka Whaitiri affair and the leak of Derek Handley's emails. Despite this, the Prime Minister remained committed to her duties, ditching her press secretary to break free from the perceived culture of political correctness that was hindering the flow of information.
On a more serious note, the world's media reported on the appointment of 12 new members to the Security Council of the United Nations, which is tasked with addressing some of the most pressing global issues. Meanwhile, back home, the Prime Minister faced opposition from Te Tai Tonga MP Rino Tirikatene, who filed a complaint regarding her potential residence in Riwaka. Despite these challenges, the Prime Minister remained steadfast in her commitment to her duties and the people of New Zealand.

input: Father of the Nation' is an honorific bestowed on individuals who are considered the most important in the process of the establishment of a country or a nation. They are instrumental in the birth of their nations by way of liberating them from colonial or other occupation
continuation: or by way of establishing an independent and sovereign nation - nation . The terms Father of the Nation or Mother of the Nation have become a part of popular political terminology and sometimes employed in Asia and Africa .They are often employed as patriotic rhetoric and modeled after Indian Nationalist Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi , the Father of the Nation , but is also associated with South Korean president Syngman Rhee and Israeli political president David Ben - Gurion . More generally , the term is often employed by states as a patriotic term of honor and is modeled after Soviet president Joseph Stalin .It is also used to commemorate nationalist communist leaders who are regarded as " founding fathers " of the state . Most nations have a specific " Father of the Nation " or " Mother of the Nation " .This page contains text from Wikipedia, the Free Encyclopedia - https://wn.com/F
paraphrase:
The term "Father of the Nation" is an honorific title bestowed upon individuals who played a pivotal role in the establishment of a country or nation. These individuals have contributed significantly to the liberation of their nation from colonial or occupation, or the establishment of an independent and sovereign state. The term is often employed in popular political terminology, particularly in Asia and Africa, as a symbol of patriotism and nationalism.
The concept of "Father of the Nation" can be traced back to Indian Nationalist Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, who is widely regarded as the Father of the Nation in India. However, the term has also been associated with other leaders, such as South Korean president Syngman Rhee and Israeli political leader David Ben-Gurion. In some cases, the term is used to commemorate nationalist communist leaders who are regarded as "founding fathers" of the state.
The term "Father of the Nation" is often used as a patriotic term of honor, and is modeled after Soviet president Joseph Stalin. Many nations have a specific "Father of the Nation" or "Mother of the Nation," who have played a significant role in the country's history and development.
Overall, the term "Father of the Nation" signifies the immense contribution made by these leaders towards the establishment and growth of their nation, and serves as a symbol of national pride and appreciation.

input:
The Green Bay Packers and Minnesota Vikings tied at 29-29 after a whirlwind final drive and overtime.
The Packers appeared to make the game-sealing interception in the fourth quarter, but the play was overturned by a penalty on Clay Matthews for driving
continuation: Riley Reiff to the ground . Instead , the Vikings scored the game - winning touchdown on a Hail Mary pass at the end of regulation , and the NFL called the play one of the most amazing pass receptions in NFL history .In the end , however , the Packers were able to punch it in on a Lambeau Field run out by the toe of Mason Crosby . Green Bay only needed the points , and the Vikings were blocked by Jake Ryan on a two - point conversion .All - 22 View : Packers defense , Rodgers picks apart Vikings D
paraphrase: The Packers and Vikings engaged in a thrilling back-and-forth battle, culminating in an overtime standoff. Green Bay appeared to seal the victory with an interception in the fourth quarter, but a penalty on Clay Matthews resulted in the play being reversed. Undeterred, the Vikings capitalized on a Hail Mary pass at the end of regulation to score the game-winning touchdown. In the end, the Packers managed to punch it in on a Lambeau Field run, securing the win despite a valiant effort from the Vikings' defense. All-22 view highlighted the impressive performance of Green Bay's offense, led by Aaron Rodgers' masterful passing.

input: A classic British memoir gets the full costume drama treatment with this beautifully crafted World War I drama, although it never quite transcends the "beloved book" tone, remaining so worthy that it only rarely springs to life. The acting is sharp, as
continuation: are the costumes and setting , and there ' s a vivid story and riveting storyline that effectively depicts the early portion of the wartime and some of the main characters who living through it . But by the end , the filmmakers struggle to make something more out of the narrative .Based on the 1932 autobiography by Canadian Mary Borden , the film recounts how her initiatives to bring German soldiers from World War I as hostages of war back to England helped alter the war ' s outcome and became a major cause in the early 20th century . Its messages might be melodramatic but they ' re also important and moving , and the portrait of the women in the Allied battle effort is a treasure .It ' s a shame that it rarely quite comes to life in the manner that its beautiful and passionate aspects promise . Young Anne ( Kiera Knightley ) arrives in London in 191
paraphrase: This opulent World War I drama, based on the classic British memoir, masterfully captures the era's grandeur and tragedy. Although it sometimes struggles to elevate the narrative beyond its "beloved book" tone, the film's sharp acting, exquisite costumes, and immersive setting transport the viewer to the midst of the war. The film's vivid story and gripping storyline effectively convey the early stages of the war and the indomitable spirits of the main characters who fought through it. However, by the film's conclusion, the makers face a challenge in creating something more profound from the narrative. Based on the 1932 autobiography of Canadian Mary Borden, the movie tells the inspiring tale of how her efforts to bring German soldiers from World War I as hostages of war back to England contributed significantly to the war's outcome and became a significant factor in the early 20th century. Although the film's messages may be melodramatic, they are also moving and important, and the portrayal of the women in the Allied battle effort is a priceless treasure. It is a shame that the film does not quite reach its full potential, as its beautiful and passionate aspects promise. Young Anne (Kiera Knightley) arrives in London in 1914, eager to join the war effort, and her story unfolds against the backdrop of a brutal and unpredictable conflict.

input: ISLAMABAD, Oct 27 (APP): Minister for Finance Senator Muhammad Ishaq Dar Thursday said that due to prudent economic policies of the government, macro economic stability has been achieved and now focus was on the sustainable economic growth for job creation
continuation: and alleviation of poverty . The finance minister was chatting to a delegation of Association of Professionals of Pakistan which called on him here .He said that present government had inherited an economy on the verge of default , additionally impacted by an unprecedented energy situation which was now settled . He said Pakistan has been witnessing unprecedented security climate which was also contributing to economic increase as investment was declining .He said that the development of the economy has picked up , inflation rate dropped , production of steel , electricity , gas and cotton rose to unprecedented level , countrys liquid foreign deposits increased to over $ 20 billion . He added that according to IMF , average growth of Pakistan during final five months was seven percent and it remained constant during 2015 - 16 as well .Senator Ishaq Dar said that cabinet is working
paraphrase:
The finance minister, Senator Muhammad Ishaq Dar, emphasized the government's dedication to achieving sustainable economic growth through prudent economic policies. The minister highlighted the government's success in stabilizing the macroeconomy, which has resulted in a significant improvement in the country's economic indicators. He stated that the government has inherited an economy on the brink of default, but has since made remarkable progress in restoring stability and growth.
The minister highlighted the impact of the current security situation on investment, noting that it has resulted in a decline in investment. However, he expressed confidence that the development of the economy has picked up, and the country's liquid foreign deposits have increased to over $20 billion. He also noted that according to the IMF, Pakistan's average growth rate during the final five months was seven percent, which is a significant improvement from previous years.
Senator Ishaq Dar emphasized that the cabinet is working diligently to ensure the country's economic growth and stability. He highlighted the government's commitment to creating jobs and alleviating poverty, which are critical components of the country's economic development. Overall, the minister's statement highlighted the government's efforts to restore economic stability and growth in the country, while also addressing the challenges posed by the current security situation.

input:
ANKARA (Reuters) - For all of Irans fierce verbal response to fresh U.S. threats of tougher sanctions, some senior officials in Tehran believe the door to diplomacy should stay open.
On Monday, U.S. Secretary
continuation: of State Rex Tillerson said Iran had failed to fulfil the spirit of the atomic deal , and called on all nations to be vigilant in preventing Iran from gaining a atomic weapon . But in Tehran , top diplomats expressed they hope Washington would pull away from President Donald Trumps threats , and pursue to extend the atomic deal , something Iran has so far declined to do .We have often said that if the U . S . would abide by the letter of the nuclear deal and would not harm its interests by sanctions , it would be our natural preference to keep the deal , said one senior Iranian official . The official , talking on condition of anonymity , said Iranian representatives were also worried that Trump , a longtime critic of the atomic deal , might end up destroying it up after Fridays deadline for the European Union to sign off on fresh sanctions
paraphrase: Iranian officials in Tehran believe the door to diplomacy should remain open despite fierce U.S. threats of tougher sanctions, according to Reuters. U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson claimed Iran had failed to uphold the spirit of the nuclear deal, and called on nations to remain vigilant in preventing Iran from acquiring a nuclear weapon. However, top Iranian diplomats hope that Washington will refrain from President Donald Trump's threats and instead extend the nuclear deal, which Iran has thus far declined to do. A senior Iranian official stated that Iran prefers to keep the deal intact if the U.S. abides by its terms and avoids harming its interests through sanctions. The official, who spoke on condition of anonymity, expressed concern that Trump, a longtime critic of the nuclear deal, may ultimately destroy it after Friday's deadline for the European Union to approve new sanctions.

input: Eastern Michigans offense picked up where it left off against Spring Arbor, scoring six of the first eight points in their match up against U of M-D forcing the visiting Wolverines into an early timeout. Easterns defense relied heavily
continuation: on their 3 - 2 matchup zone which forced U of M - D to try and defeat them from the outside , leading to a dismal 22 % shots from beyond the arc . After trailing 2 - 4 , the offense picked up with EMU got a three from Karrington Ward .The Chippewas didnt trail for the remainder of the first half . Eastern closed the half with a 12 - 1 run to come up 26 - 7 with 5 : 01 left .Senior center Charles Smith got the run started with a three and added a free throw after being fouled by U of M - D sophomore guard David Smith . Elijah Minnie scored a couple of times before Charles Smith got the run going for good with a stole and fast break layup .Minnie led all scorers with 13 points in the first half with Smith following closely behind with 12 points .
paraphrase: Eastern Michigan's offense continued to thrive against U of M-D, scoring six of the first eight points and forcing the visiting team into an early timeout. The defense relied heavily on their 3-2 matchup zone, which made the opposing team work hard to score from outside, resulting in a low 22% shooting percentage from beyond the arc. After falling behind 2-4, the offense picked up momentum with a three-pointer from Karrington Ward. The Chippewas didn't trail for the rest of the first half, culminating in a 12-1 run that gave them a comfortable 26-7 lead with 5:01 left. Senior center Charles Smith was the catalyst for the run, starting it with a three-pointer and adding a free throw after being fouled by U of M-D's sophomore guard David Smith. Elijah Minnie also contributed to the run with a couple of baskets, setting the stage for Charles Smith's game-changing steal and fast break layup. Minnie led all scorers with 13 points in the first half, with Smith right behind him with 12 points.

input:
Justin Thomas, ranked No. 2 in the world, is the only potential U.S. Ryder Cup player in the field at Le Golf National for this week's French Open.
PARIS  Justin Thomas discovered just how tough Le Golf National will
continuation: be this week when he teed off at the 18th hole on Monday morning and needed to shoot three shots to escape a fairway bunker , ultimately making bogey . Ill probably say 40 yards , 45 yards off that first one , Thomas say .We didnt hitting our drives that long yesterday and I was still a little little short . Im still not going to give you an precise yardage , but its one of those locations where you hit driver , youre in the trees , and your only alternative is to chip .When I played it , I mean I likely hit two drivers and one fairway steel on the entire front nine , Thomas say . Its the wind , its tough , Thomas say .Ive played on the easy holes a lot , and Ive played on the hard holes a lot . Its going to
paraphrase:
Justin Thomas, ranked No. 2 in the world, is the lone potential U.S. Ryder Cup player competing at Le Golf National this week for the French Open.
On Monday morning, Thomas faced a challenging test at the 18th hole when he found himself in a fairway bunker and needed to make a series of shots to escape with a bogey. He estimated that he was 40-45 yards off the tee on his first shot. Thomas noted that the course was playing tougher than expected, with even the longest drives not reaching the fairway, and the only option was to chip out of the trees. He himself played the front nine with two drivers and a fairway steel, and attributed the difficulty to the wind. Despite the challenges, Thomas has played both the easy and difficult holes extensively and remains optimistic about his performance.

input:
FILE - Afghan security forces stand guard at site of suicide car bombing attack in Kabul, May 19, 2015.
Afghanistan's parliament rejected a second nominee for defense minister on Saturday, leaving a vacuum that has already lasted nine months, while government
continuation: departments went unmanned and army commanders incapable of carrying out their job . The legislature ' s rejection of Rassoul Sardar , an adviser to President Ashraf Ghani , came in a confidence vote on his nomination that was demanded by members of the lower house of parliament .After Sardar ' s candidacy , a parliamentary defense committee rejected his application after he failed to obtain the necessary voting of two - thirds of the lawmakers . " As a member of the safety council , I knew that Rassoul Sardar might not be a bad candidate for security minister .We had hoped that he would be able to bring about positive changes in the security industry , but sadly , this has not been the case , " added Fazel Hadi Muslimyar , head of the security commission and a member of the Islamic Movement of Afghanistan party . Despite
paraphrase:
Afghan security personnel stand watch at the site of a deadly car bombing in Kabul on May 19, 2015.
Amid a prolonged vacuum in the defense ministry, the Afghan parliament has rejected a second nominee for the post, Rassoul Sardar, an advisor to President Ashraf Ghani. The rejection came in a confidence vote on Sardar's nomination, which was demanded by lawmakers in the lower house of parliament. The decision marks the latest setback in the government's efforts to fill key positions, with numerous departments left unmanned and military commanders struggling to carry out their duties.
"As a member of the security commission, I had hoped that Rassoul Sardar might be a suitable candidate for security minister. We had expected him to bring about positive changes in the security sector, but unfortunately, this has not been the case," said Fazel Hadi Muslimyar, head of the security commission and a member of the Islamic Movement of Afghanistan party. Despite the rejection, the security situation in Afghanistan remains a pressing concern, with the country still grappling with the aftermath of decades of conflict.

input: The equity-free programme will begin on January 30, 2017.During each class, over 20 Google teams will provide comprehensive mentoring to late-stage app startups. The three-month programme starts with an all-expenses-paid two-week
continuation: training in California , and two - weeks each in Berlin , Jakarta and Singapore , where they will get to meet more teams and top investors . We believe innovation , particularly in the app ecosystem , can come from anywhere and be applied to any region .It is this doctrine that drives our partnerships and launches like Equity - free , said Megan Sims , Business Development Director , Google Developer Groups , APAC .
paraphrase: On January 30, 2017, a groundbreaking equity-free program will kick off. Throughout the three-month initiative, over 20 Google teams will offer comprehensive mentorship to late-stage app startups. The program begins with an all-expenses-paid two-week training in California, followed by two weeks each in Berlin, Jakarta, and Singapore, where participants will have the opportunity to connect with additional teams and top investors. At Google Developer Groups, we believe that innovation can originate from anywhere and be applied to any region, which drives our partnerships and initiatives like Equity-free. According to Megan Sims, Business Development Director, APAC, this philosophy is at the core of our efforts.

input:
Its often said that when you have two quarterbacks, you dont have one. That typically pertains to teams like the Browns, Jets and 49ers, who seemingly always have competition at the position but never truly find a surefire starter.
This notion
continuation: seems rather silly in the case of the Carolina Panthers , but keep reading and youll see why . The Panthers currently have three quarterbacks on the roster who all have a case to be the starter , and thats assuming Teddy Bridgewater can play .Thats right , Bridgewater , a former No . 1 overall selection in the 2014 draft , has not played since the 2015 season .The good news is he is almost 100 percent and he still has plenty to prove . The bad news is his salary took up 9 . 76 percent of the $ 158 million in cap space the team has already spent .Sunday marks the third game of a four - game preseason schedule , and so far things are a complete mess . What makes Sunday even more exciting is Rivera claiming there is a plan for the matches in order to choose a st
paraphrase: It's often said that having multiple quarterbacks on a team can lead to confusion and uncertainty at the position. However, the Carolina Panthers are currently facing a unique situation where they have not one, not two, but three quarterbacks vying for the starting spot. This development raises questions about the team's ability to find a surefire starter, especially considering the lengthy absence of Teddy Bridgewater, who has not played since the 2015 season due to injury. Despite this setback, Bridgewater is nearing full recovery and is eager to prove himself, but his high salary is a significant factor in the team's cap space constraints. With the preseason entering its third game, the Panthers are facing a challenging decision on how to proceed with their quarterback situation. Head coach Ron Rivera has hinted at a plan in place to help determine the starter, but the excitement around Sunday's matchup is palpable.

input: The belief that there is an Islamic military group that is friendly and another that is evil is a pure myth. All Islamic organizations we see today, from Afghanistan to Algeria and Nigeria, are hostile and subscribe to a takfirist ideology (which
continuation: means they are intolerant of anyone non - Muslim and pursue the worlds domination under Islamic rule ) . There are no exceptions .There are no friendly organizations , and never have been . This is because the history of Islam taught that the fight is not between Muslims and the infidel ; the fight is between Muslims and Muslims who argue with the more extreme segment of Islam .Let us begin with Afghanistan . Today , Pakistans Taqiya Islamist party is referred to as the Taliban .In a sense , they have been in control of the nation for decades now . However , some Islamic militant organisations in Pakistan oppose the Taliban .In Afghanistan , most of those terrorist organizations opposition the Taliban , but all Islamic groups in both country are still Muslims . The only reason for the divisions within Islam is because they believe one group has betrayed the Muslims by either
paraphrase:
The notion that there exists an Islamic military group that is friendly and another that is malevolent is a fallacious belief. All contemporary Islamic organizations across the globe, from Afghanistan to Algeria and Nigeria, are inherently hostile and subscribe to a takfirist ideology, which entails their intolerance towards non-Muslims and their pursuit of global domination under an Islamic regime. There are no exceptions to this rule, and there have never been any benevolent organizations within the Islamic realm. This is due to the historical teachings of Islam, which emphasize that the conflict is not between Muslims and non-Muslims, but rather between Muslims and Muslims who hold divergent views, particularly within the more radical segments of Islam.
In Pakistan, the Taqiya Islamist party is currently referred to as the Taliban, but this group has been in control of the country for decades. However, there are other Islamic militant organizations in Pakistan that oppose the Taliban. Similarly, in Afghanistan, many terrorist organizations oppose the Taliban, yet all Islamic groups in both countries are united in their adherence to Islam. The main source of discord within Islam is due to disagreements over whether one group has betrayed their Muslim brethren by either.

input: I remember the first interview I did about the gender pay gap, back in the 90s, when women had their very own Equal Opportunities Commission. We talked about pay rates reaching parity in full-time work, then getting dragged down by part-
continuation: time and unpaid work . Now , as the WGEA paints a particularly grim image of the 20 - year - plus wait for gender rights , the fight has altered direction : not an unwinnable battle but an insidious thing .How has it become a kind of shadow conflict , and what can we do about it ? Many of the changes weve witnessed in the previous 20 decades are positive .Workplaces are more equal and fairer to men and ladies , but were not seeing the big reforms required to see the glass roof fade . People said this is the millennials fight .But I dont see it . In her new book , Bold : How to Go Big , Create Wealth and Impact the World , Reshma Saujani wrote , For female , there is no finish line .She was talking about work - life stability , but the same might be
paraphrase:
Twenty years have passed since the gender pay gap was first addressed, and yet, the fight for equality remains a persistent shadow. In the 1990s, the Equal Opportunities Commission was instrumental in highlighting the disparities in full-time work, but subsequent years have seen a gradual decline in progress. According to the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA), it may take over two decades for gender rights to be fully realized.
While there have been notable advancements in workplace equality, the journey towards true parity remains elusive. Positive developments include more equal and fair workplaces, but significant reforms are still required to overcome the lingering glass ceiling. The notion that this is the millennials' fight has been espoused, but the reality is that gender inequality is an enduring issue that affects all genders.
Reshma Saujani, in her book Bold, highlights the notion that for women, there is no finish line. This statement extends beyond work-life balance and speaks to the very essence of the fight for gender equality. It is a constant, ongoing struggle that demands persistence and determination.
In conclusion, while progress has been made, the fight for gender equality is far from over. It is a complex, insidious issue that requires ongoing attention and effort to overcome. By acknowledging the reality of the situation and remaining committed to the cause, we can work towards a more equitable future for all genders.

input: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Ra Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ:RARX) today announced that the design of its Phase 2 clinical trial of RA101495 SC for the treatment of generalized my
continuation: asthenia gravis ( gMG ) has been completed . Enrollment is expected to begin in early 2016 .The design of the Phase 2 trial is based on the Phase 1 / 2 data announced by Ra Pharma in October 2015 , showing that RA101495 SC was well tolerated with an acceptable safety profile in patients with gMG . Based on statistics from the Phase 1 / 2 trial , the randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled , Phase 2 trial will compare three doses of RA101495 SC against placebo .It will analyze the drugs effect on muscle strength and patient - reported results . We predict to enter enrollment early next year and complete the trial by the end of 2017 .We
paraphrase: Cambridge, MA - (Business Wire) - Ra Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ:RARX) has announced the completion of the Phase 2 clinical trial design for its RA101495 SC treatment for generalized myasthenia gravis (gMG). Enrollment is expected to begin in early 2016. The trial design is based on the Phase 1/2 data released by Ra Pharma in October 2015, showing that RA101495 SC was well tolerated with a satisfactory safety profile in patients with gMG. The randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled Phase 2 trial will compare three doses of RA101495 SC against placebo, analyzing the drug's effect on muscle strength and patient-reported outcomes. We anticipate entering enrollment in early 2017 and completing the trial by the end of 2017.

input:
Former communications minister Faith Muthambi was not interested in serving South Africans and "wanted to steal" at all cost, the commission of inquiry into state capture heard on Monday.
Acting Government Communication and Information System (GCIS) CEO
continuation: Phumla Williams announced on Monday that former Minister of Communications , Faith Muthambi , sought to destroy the GCIS , and its independence . Williams informed the commission that Muthambi sought to sabotage the Office of the Public Protector , and reappoint ministers loyal to her in the GCIS ." She claimed she wanted to destroy the GCIS as she thought it was a hindrance to her . She was trying to run the organisation .She wanted to reappoint officials who were loyal to her . She wanted to destroy it and reappoint her own officials ." She wanted to destroy the Office of the Public Protector and she said me that she was making sure that I was removed from the office , " she said . Williams claimed that she was threatened to be attacked by a mob during the process of transferring her from the GCIS ." I feel very threatened and I am not exagger
paraphrase: According to testimony given to the state capture inquiry on Monday, former Minister of Communications Faith Muthambi showed no interest in serving the people of South Africa and instead sought to act with self-interest at all costs. GCIS CEO Phumla Williams claimed that Muthambi attempted to undermine the independence of the GCIS and the Office of the Public Protector, and even threatened to attack her physically during the transfer process. Williams stated that Muthambi wanted to reappoint loyal officials to the GCIS and destroy the organization, which she saw as a hindrance to her own ambitions. The inquiry heard that Muthambi made efforts to remove Williams from her position and exert her control over the GCIS.

input:
Will John Kelly Save Trumps Soul?
There hasnt been much good to say about Trump in a long time, but recruiting Kelly suggests that he learns, very belatedly, from his mistakes, and that he
continuation: s get good advice about how to deal with them . His shift towards respecting legal enforcement could have long - term benefits for us all .By Allegra McLeod National Security Adviser John Bolton with President Donald Trump . ( Photo by Tasos Katopodis / Getty Images ) One of the most striking changes during Donald Trumps presidency has been his remarkable commitment to humiliate himself in front of the nation and the world .The time has passed when he could veto laws , secure a favorable treaty , or even recruit a new head of family without simultaneously removing his clothes and making off with the good silver . Trumps personal and political death would have been quick under most situations , but his administrations incompetence and corruption now seem to have saved him , for the moment at least .And all this might have been the work of former Marine General John Kelly . Over the course of the Trump
paraphrase:
Will John Kelly Rescue Trump's Reputation?
John Kelly's appointment as National Security Adviser has raised questions about whether he can help turn Donald Trump's fortunes around. Despite the President's lack of positive coverage in recent times, Kelly's willingness to learn from his mistakes and respect legal enforcement may have long-term benefits for everyone. However, Trump's history of self-humiliation has been a defining characteristic of his presidency, making it difficult to imagine a turnaround without significant changes in his behavior. Will Kelly be able to reverse Trump's downward spiral, or will the President's incompetence and corruption continue to thwart any attempts at rehabilitation? Only time will tell.

input:
Drivers navigate Main at Mill streets in downtown Grass Valley following Monday morning's snow showers which dropped between 6 and 12 inches of snow in places.
Much of Nevada County lived up to its name today when folks awoke to a wintry wonderland
continuation: . The snow arrived down Monday morning and some regions received as much as 12 inches .Treacherous highways forced officials to close a portion of Highway 49 from Penn Valley to Grass Valley and as a result , many school districts in Nevada County were closed as well . Some students did attend a delayed schedule as the schools announced plans to come in at 11 a . m .Many Nevada County companies and community agencies shut for the morning while many others had to quickly improve their operations . Drivers were confronted with difficult situations on the roads while some places had little , if any , snow at all .Heaviest snow fell in parts of Nevada City , but it also deposited in North San Juan and near Penn Valley as well as in parts of Grass Valley and Nevada City . Road situation were a factor in an accident in which a vehicle slid
paraphrase: On Monday morning, drivers navigated through the snow-covered streets of downtown Grass Valley, following the recent snow showers that blanketed the area with 6-12 inches of snow. The unexpected winter wonderland surprise caught many residents off guard, as many areas of Nevada County lived up to their names. Treacherous road conditions prompted authorities to close a portion of Highway 49, causing school districts in the county to shut down as well. Some students attended a delayed schedule, while others waited for their schools to open at 11 am. The sudden snowfall also forced many businesses and community organizations to close for the morning, while others had to quickly adapt their operations. Drivers encountered difficult conditions on the roads, as the heaviest snowfall occurred in specific areas of Nevada City, but also reached parts of Grass Valley, North San Juan, and Penn Valley. A snow-related accident occurred when a vehicle slipped and lost control on the snowy roads.

input: Coming off a round of summer campaigning with Bloc Qubcois chief Gilles Duceppe, Parti Qubcois Leader Pierre Karl Pladeau said Tuesday an independent Quebec would demand its share of federal assets
continuation: but he insisted he wasn ' t intending to give the feds a headache in negotiations . Pladeau added the PQ scheme would rely heavily on get Ottawa to engage with an independent Quebec as it works to secure its share of federal assets .He was in Toronto on Monday to meet with Duceppe and top PQ strategists in preparation for the September election campaign . Pladeau added he ' s not looking to bump heads with Ottawa but if needed , he ' s not afraid of leaving 30 million Quebecers out in the cold to force a settlement ." I believe we ' ll reach an agreement , " he said . " We ' ll reach a agreement as it was done in 1995 , and we will have an agreement as was done in 1995 for pensions , for the national debt , for medicare . "While the province would hope to keep the
paraphrase: After concluding a summer campaign tour with Bloc Quebecois leader Gilles Duceppe, Parti Quebecois leader Pierre Karl Pladeau emphasized Tuesday that an independent Quebec would demand its fair share of federal assets, but he clarified that he was not seeking to create tension in negotiations with Ottawa. Pladeau highlighted that the PQ's plan would heavily rely on Ottawa's willingness to engage with an independent Quebec during the asset negotiation process. Prior to the September election campaign, Pladeau met with Duceppe and top PQ strategists in Toronto. He stressed that he is not afraid to take a strong stance if necessary, even if it means leaving 30 million Quebecers without federal support. Pladeau expressed confidence that an agreement can be reached, much like the one reached in 1995 regarding pensions, the national debt, and medicare. While the province would aim to maintain a favorable agreement, Pladeau acknowledged the possibility of disputes arising during the negotiation process.

input:
No. 5 Stanford (24-5, 10-2 Pac-12) completed a three-game sweep of Washington (15-15, 5-10 Pac-12) with a 6-1 victory on Sunday.
Looking to avenge
continuation: the first sweep in its history , the Cardinal offense went flat to start the match . Sophomore infielder Johnny Clark pulled a hold of a pitch in the top of the second , putting it over the right - field wall for a solo home run and giving Stanford the 1 - 0 lead .Stanford , starting freshman catcher / outfielder Grant Fujimoto , had no issues in the bottom of the second . Sophomore right fielder Jake McCarthy smacked a lead - off triple , giving him a . 321 / . 379 / . 556 slash line on the season .McCarthy then scored on a wild pitch , putting the Cardinal up 2 - 0 . The Cardinal scored its third run of the game on a sacrifice fly from sophomore third baseman Sean Bouchard , giving Stanford a three
paraphrase: Stanford (24-5, 10-2 Pac-12) completed a thrilling three-game series sweep of Washington (15-15, 5-10 Pac-12) with a decisive 6-1 victory on Sunday. Seeking to avenge their first sweep in program history, the Cardinal offense got off to a sluggish start, but sophomore infielder Johnny Clark's solo home run in the top of the second provided the necessary spark. Freshman catcher/outfielder Grant Fujimoto, starting in place of the injured senior catcher, showed no signs of nervousness and smacked a lead-off triple in the bottom of the second. Sophomore right fielder Jake McCarthy, who sports a .321/.379/.556 slash line on the season, followed with a wild pitch RBI, extending Stanford's lead to 2-0. The Cardinal added a third run on a sacrifice fly from sophomore third baseman Sean Bouchard, giving them a comfortable 3-0 cushion.

input:
There is a hearing today on whether presidents should be required to make their tax returns public.
Rep. Richard Neal, D-Mass., then incoming chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, addressed an audience, Nov. 27, during a gathering
continuation: in Boston that was to introduce him as the successor to Ways and Means Chairman Rep . Richard E . Neal , D - Mass . , during his retirement , 1010 WTKK reports . Neal is facing two Democrats for his leadership spot , Rep . Bill Pascrell , D - N . J . , and Rep . Ro Khanna , D - Calif . " While the members of Congress have shown no ability to ever produce a public hearing on this , they are going to waste a whole lot of time with it , " Marc Lotter , the White House director of strategic communications , told CNN ." President Trump has addressed the issue already . " While president , Trumps taxation returns are confidential due to the very strict IRS code regulating confidentiality , Tax Notes explained last year .The code requires that the IRS audit every president and vice presidents personal
paraphrase: There is a crucial hearing today to debate whether leaders should make their tax returns public. Representative Richard Neal, the incoming chair of the House Ways and Means Committee, spoke at a recent event in Boston, where he was introduced as the successor to outgoing Chairman Richard E. Neal. Neal is facing opposition from two other Democrats, Representative Bill Pascrell and Representative Ro Khanna, for the leadership position. Marc Lotter, the White House director of strategic communications, criticized Congress for wasting time on the issue while failing to produce a public hearing on it. President Trump has already addressed the matter, with his tax returns confidential due to strict IRS regulations protecting personal information. Tax Notes explained last year that the IRS audits every president and vice president's personal tax returns.

input:
KISSIMMEE, Fla. (WSVN)  A Vietnam War veteran passed away before he was able to be reunited with his beloved stolen service dog.
According to Fox 35, 67-year-old Joseph Hanson was walking last
continuation: week in Birmingham , Alabama , when he was attacked . Police said he was knocked down and his French bulldog mix service pet , Abu , was confiscated .The retired Navy commander was taken to the hospital , where he later passed away . Hansons daughter , Brandi , said the emotional toll of losing her father is compounded by the losing of Abu .Im heartbroken , she said . I dont sure how Im going to make it .Hanson was in the last year of his life when he was attacked and stealing from , but that was not what killed him . While he was hospitalized , his family says he had heart surgery .
paraphrase: Joseph Hanson, a Vietnam War veteran, passed away before he could be reunited with his beloved stolen service dog, Abu. According to Fox 35, Hanson was attacked while walking in Birmingham, Alabama, and his French bulldog mix service pet was taken. The 67-year-old retired Navy commander was hospitalized but later passed away due to complications from the attack. Hanson's daughter, Brandi, is heartbroken by the loss of her father and the loss of Abu, saying she is not sure how she will cope. Despite being in the last year of his life, Hanson's family notes that he underwent heart surgery while hospitalized.

input: TAPACHULA, Mexico (AP)  Thousands of Central American migrants resumed an arduous trek toward the U.S. border Monday, with members bristling at suggestions there could be terrorists among them and saying the caravan is being used for
continuation: political reasons . Food and medical supplies are available for anyone who needs them and Mexican authorities are promising help in the nation ' s southern countries .Caravan members say they will attempt to escape buses . The Mexican government gave that announcement Friday after Trump says " caravans " of migrants would be halted if they tried to enter the U . S . illegally ." We want to say very clearly that the situation we are living is very dangerous , " Reyes said , stating that the " unjust " treatment has produced mistrust of U . S . authorities . Luis Ricardo Froidmont , a Honduran attorney and human rights activist , said the convoy " will keep on " even if it does encounter barriers along the way ." People are going to resist , " Froidmont says . " We ' ll be on the side of the highway , there will be protests and
paraphrase: In Tapachula, Mexico, a large caravan of Central American migrants resumed their journey towards the US border on Monday, with some members expressing frustration at suggestions that terrorists may be among them. The caravan members insist that the trek is not being used for political reasons, and Mexican authorities have provided food and medical supplies for those in need. Despite the government's warning of potential danger, the migrants remain determined to reach the US border, with some even vowing to evade buses and continue on foot. The Honduran attorney and human rights activist, Luis Ricardo Froidmont, stated that the convoy will continue to push forward, even if faced with obstacles along the way. "People are going to resist," Froidmont said, adding that the caravan will maintain its presence on the highways, with protests and other forms of resistance.

Twenty-one-year-old Valejah Savon Johnson was taken into custody on Tuesday night on a charge of second-degree attempted murder after witnesses reported that he fired multiple shots at a vehicle carrying Robert Mayes, who was holding onto the hood of Johnson's vehicle in downtown Lafayette, according to a court filing. input: UPPER EAST SIDE  The Second Avenue subway blast that sprayed debris high into the air above 72nd street was sparked by an underground explosion the force of which hit a steel plate covering the work site at street level, the MTA revealed Wednesday.
continuation: The blast came from an underground explosion at around 10 : 30 a . m . that damaged a portion of the train ' s foundation , MTA spokesman Aaron Donovan added . " It seems clear the source was a utility vent box located on 72nd road which has recently been replaced .That ' s why we do the utility box inspections , " Donovan replied . " There ' s no evidence this was a planned or deliberate act . "The utility vents are used to channel water away from the subway tunnels . Donovan said there are a variety of utility vents at the 72nd Street station location , and that they will be inspected by cities and state agencies to ensure everything was faulty .Cops say an MTA worker was hurt by flying debris and took to Roosevelt Hospital , where he was treated
paraphrase: An explosion on the Second Avenue subway line, triggered by an underground blast, caused debris to fly high above 72nd Street. According to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA), the blast occurred at around 10:30 a.m. and damaged a portion of the train's foundation. MTA spokesperson Aaron Donovan revealed that the source of the explosion was an underground utility vent box located on 72nd Road, which had recently been replaced. Donovan clarified that the utility vents are used to direct water away from the subway tunnels and that there are various vents at the 72nd Street station location. The MTA will work with city and state agencies to ensure that all vents are inspected and that everything is in good working order. Meanwhile, an MTA worker was injured by flying debris and was taken to Roosevelt Hospital for treatment.

input:
GREENSBURG, Ind. An Indiana man is facing a murder charge after allegedly admitting to killing his girlfriend.
Jason Eaton, 43, walked into the Greensburg Police Department on Tuesday with a woman and asked to talk to an officer. He
continuation: told them he had killed his girlfriend , Shannon Warner , 40 , last weekend , according to WTHR . Eaton apparently called 911 on Saturday , said he found Warner hanging in the basement of their Greensburg residence .But an autopsy showed Warner was shooting several twice . Eaton was indicted and convicted with murder .The crime is the sixth homicide in the Greensburg area since last October .
paraphrase: An Indiana man, Jason Eaton, 43, has been charged with murder after allegedly confessing to killing his girlfriend, Shannon Warner, 40, in their Greensburg residence. Eaton walked into the Greensburg Police Department on Tuesday with a woman and requested to speak with an officer, where he admitted to the crime. According to WTHR, Eaton claimed he found Warner hanging in the basement on Saturday, but an autopsy revealed that Warner had been shot multiple times. Eaton was indicted and convicted of murder, marking the sixth homicide in the Greensburg area since last October.

PULGA  In December 2012, a fierce winter storm toppled five steel towers that support the same PG&E transmission line that malfunctioned minutes before the Camp Fire roared to life.
Six years later, the 115,000-volt Caribou
continuation: - Palermo communication connection stands stark and shattered in Pulga , 30 kilometers south of Paradise , California , for a second time . This time , it was the utilitys corroded and rotted power poles that broke .Suspected by Cal Fire officials , along with faulty or aged distribution lines , as the main cause of the deadliest and most destructive wildfire in the states history , the Camp Fire injured 85 people and destroyed 18 , 804 structures , most of them homes . Due to a technicality , PG & E has not paid a $ 30 million settlement to the state to repair the affected line a settlement that Gov .Gavin Newsom stated the utility wont get if it fails to abide by the terms of the deal . The corporation has also failed to finish
paraphrase: In December 2012, a severe winter storm toppled five steel towers supporting the same PG&E transmission line that malfunctioned just before the Camp Fire ignited. Six years later, the 115,000-volt Caribou-Palermo communication connection lies in ruins in Pulga, 30 kilometers south of Paradise, California, for a second time. This time, it was the utility's corroded and rotted power poles that broke, suspected by Cal Fire officials as the main cause of the deadliest and most destructive wildfire in the state's history. The Camp Fire injured 85 people and destroyed 18,804 structures, most of them homes. Due to a technicality, PG&E has yet to pay a $30 million settlement to the state to repair the affected line, despite a statement from Gov. Gavin Newsom that the utility will not receive the funds if it fails to abide by the terms of the deal. The corporation has also failed to complete other necessary repairs.

input: Aside from LGs crazily stunning OLED Canyon, the biggest smack-you-round-the-face televisual spectacle of the 2018 CES comes courtesy of Samsungs The Wall.
continuation: An enormous 146in OLED television with an 8K resolution ( 4320x2160px , so 4x the resolution of 4K ) and infinite flexibility , its one of the strangest things Ive ever saw , and one that you can enjoy right now at Samsungs experience centre . But beyond the novelty , the technology itself is intriguing .The Wall uses a new OLED panel from Samsung that ' s just 0 . 8mm wide . Thats thinner than the 3 . 5mm most thinnest ultra - HD OLED screens and around a third of the height of most LCDs .It ' s also extremely lightweight . Samsung believes its the lightest OLED its ever made .That panel is married to a backplane that using red , green and green OLEDs along with transparent OLED
paraphrase: Samsung's groundbreaking 146-inch 8K OLED television, known as "The Wall," stole the show at CES 2018 with its jaw-dropping visuals and unparalleled flexibility. The stunning display boasts a resolution of 4320x2160 pixels, which is four times higher than 4K, making it an immersive experience like no other. Visitors to Samsung's experience center can witness the incredible technology firsthand. The OLED panel, measuring just 0.8mm in width, is the thinnest and lightest panel ever produced by Samsung, offering a substantially improved viewing experience compared to traditional LCDs. The panel is paired with a backplane that utilizes red, green, and blue OLEDs, along with transparent OLED technology, to create a truly unique and captivating display.

paraphrase:
Being named on the Forbes Africa 30 Under 30 list in 2018 is a significant career achievement, but I believe it serves as a call to action rather than my greatest accomplishment. Many young people in the entertainment sector today are focused on expanding their social media following and generating short-term income through various means, but we must not forget that as young people, we have the power to effect meaningful change through our artwork.
Currently, I am working on various artistic projects, including songwriting and producing a second song, as well as a second short film that I produced. My biggest success to date is the first song we dropped, "Miss Manor," which has been picked up by Universal Music and is being distributed globally. Polands ruling conservative government has moved to reinstate supreme court judges it forcibly retired, acting on an injunction issued by Europes highest court.
On Wednesday the Law and Justice (PiS) party submitted the relevant legislation on
continuation: the supreme court to the president . According to Polish law , the bill will coming into force after a signature by President Andrzej Duda .The legislation would apply to the 27 forced retirements in the fall of 2017 . The European court of justice had decided the PiS - leading governments attempts to introduce early retirement on supreme court courts as procedural inadequacies .However , the European commission ruled last week that the PiS cabinet violated EU ideals and making no major attempt to reduce the politicisation of the Polish supreme court . PiS hailed the courts ruling on Wednesday , with the partys parliamentary speaker , Elzbieta Witek , tweeting : Thank you for the victory .The supreme court has remained a flashpoint between the ruling party and EU structures . In April , the
paraphrase: The conservative government in Poland has taken steps to reinstate Supreme Court judges it previously forced into retirement, following an injunction issued by Europe's top court. On Wednesday, the Law and Justice (PiS) party submitted relevant legislation to the president for signing, which will come into effect after President Andrzej Duda's signature. The legislation will apply to the 27 forced retirements in 2017, as ruled by the European Court of Justice. However, the European Commission has previously found that the PiS cabinet violated EU principles by not making a sufficient effort to reduce political influence over the Polish Supreme Court. Despite this, PiS has hailed the court's ruling on Wednesday, with the party's parliamentary speaker, Elzbieta Witek, tweeting "Thank you for the victory." The Supreme Court has remained a contentious issue between the ruling party and EU institutions, with tensions escalating in April when the European Commission ruled that the PiS cabinet had violated EU principles.

input: In the most Well, duh news youll read this week, Moto2 rider Romano Fenati got dumped by his current team and, most likely, the team he planned to run for in 2019 after grabbing another

Had the team disbanded Fenati for one of his adventures on - track , the Honda RC212V powered squad would have raced without a rider at the race .So yeah , that didnt sit too well with the manufacturer , who pulled the plug on its ties to the team . Moto2 squad Tech3 , which has been fielding Fenatis car in
paraphrase: In a shocking turn of events, Moto2 rider Romano Fenati has been dropped by his current team and may face suspension from the sport after a recent on-track collision. According to reports, the FIM has asked the team to release Fenati due to the incident, which could potentially lead to him being banned from racing. The team, owned by LCR Honda, has been operating as a satellite squad for the manufacturer, and Honda has since severed ties with the team in response to the incident. The loss of Fenati's ride has left the Moto2 squad Tech3 without a rider for the upcoming race.

input: DOVER, Del. (AP)  Ryan Blaney kept the party rolling from his first win this season long enough to stimulate business at his favorite bar. He soaked in the celebration from his checkered flag on the roval at Charlotte.
continuation: And he also celebrated with beers in Victory Lane from the Martinsville win . He would keep up that celebration into a different kind of bar at Dover International Speedway one where the brews he and the rest of the Cup drivers were chugging for the month of May are served on tap .Blaney posted the second shortest odds of the race favorites as low as 9 - 2 to winner the Coca - Cola 600 at DraftKings Sportsbook but he didnt reach for the bottle until after a lengthy ride back to his motorcoach , stop to chatting with many of his NASCAR Truck Series rivals on the way . It took a few hours to become comfortable in victory lane , whether its a Cup win or whatever it is , Blaney said Monday .A lot of times in victory lane , youre walking up there and there
paraphrase: Ryan Blaney continued to savor the aftermath of his recent racing triumphs at bars he frequently visits. He recently won at Charlotte and Martinsville, and he was in high spirits as he indulged in beers in Victory Lane. As the month of May at Dover International Speedway approached, he looked forward to enjoying more drinks on tap at his favorite bar. As the favorite to win the Coca-Cola 600 at DraftKings Sportsbook, Blaney's odds were as low as 9-2, but he didn't crack open a bottle until he had taken the time to relax and socialize with his NASCAR Truck Series rivals after his victory. According to Blaney, it can take some time to feel at ease in victory lane, whether it's a Cup win or something else entirely.

input:
Security always comes down to securing applications.
The whole point of firewalls is to hide internally deployed network applicationsassumed to have exploitable vulnerabilities somewherefrom the outside world.
The main weakness of firewalls is that they are
continuation: focused on safety , which isnt precisely the same thing as a consumer experience : That is , how firewalls behave when it comes to performance and availability . So , firewall regulations are ( a ) hard to configure and manage and ( b ) for sure can negatively affect application availability and performance .Again , that doesnt mean all firewalls are bad . Just not as great as they could be .Then there are proxies . Proxies are programs that route and filter traffic between the Internet and private systems .And while theyre not new , proxies are growing increasingly essential to the enterprise . One of the most important reasons is that they enable secure entry to applications .So , as far as enhancing application quality and availability , proxies are essential . A good example of this is the Secure Web Gateway ( SWG ) .But truly , its all about the protection .
paraphrase: Security is essentially about safeguarding applications, and firewalls play a crucial role in this by hiding internal network applications assumed to have vulnerabilities from external threats. However, firewalls' primary weakness lies in their narrow focus on safety, which can compromise performance and availability. As a result, configuring and managing firewall regulations can be challenging and may negatively impact application availability and performance. While not all firewalls are ineffective, they could be better in certain aspects. Proxies, on the other hand, are becoming increasingly vital in the enterprise, as they enable secure access to applications and enhance their quality and availability. A suitable example of this is the Secure Web Gateway (SWG). Ultimately, the main priority is safeguarding applications to ensure optimal security.

input: Attorney General William Barr's inclusion of the phrase does not exonerate in his summary on Sunday afternon of the Mueller report has become a much-needed security blanket for liberal journalists. For the past 24 hours, CNN analysts, commentators
continuation: , and guests have returned to the Barr memo time and again , promising they will have fuller responses once the report is released . They still havent provided fuller responses .But CNNs experts were convinced the Barr memo would eventually give answers . It was baffling that Bill Barr chose to lying to the nation , said CNN ' s Brian Fallon .It was baffling that Bill Barr chose to mislead and misinform . Wrote CNNs Matthew Miller , Attorney General Barr failed in his duty to be forthright .Instead , he has proven that he cannot be trusted . CNN reports that Barr did not appear to fully describe the distinction in the reports summary .They promise more answers when the full report is released . But Fallon is adamant : There was utterly no reason to say a lie .
paraphrase: William Barr's use of the phrase "does not exonerate" in his summary on Sunday afternoon has become a security blanket for liberal journalists, with CNN analysts, commentators, and guests returning to the memo time and again. Despite promising fuller responses once the report is released, CNN's experts were convinced that the Barr memo would provide answers. However, CNN's Brian Fallon found it baffling that Barr chose to mislead and misinform the nation, while Matthew Miller argued that Barr failed in his duty to be forthright. CNN reports that Barr may have missed an opportunity to clearly explain the distinction in the summary, and Fallon remains adamant that there was no reason for Barr to lie.

input:
A public policy group says states should not rush into leasing existing road assets to the private sector.
In a report released Tuesday, March 24, the Philadelphia-based Pew Center on the States urged states considering public-private partnerships for infrastructure to exercise caution
continuation: and choose projects carefully . The document argues that without clear guidelines , organizations often become budget engineers shifting the burden of financial responsibility from the private sector to the government , and compromising their own monetary health in the process .Pews report says a shift toward performance - based contracts could assist avoid potential trouble . The statement also demands that states shouldnt lock themselves into long - term agreements or ignore sound corporate principles .Its no wonder that our highways , schools and other facilities have fallen into such disrepair , when policymakers have long neglected basic economics , said Pew President and CEO Rebecca R . M . Williams . Its critical that states not rush to depend purely on partnerships to repair our broken system .Fundamentally , the document emphasizes how important it is that states take advantage of
paraphrase: The Pew Center on the States has urged cautious consideration of public-private partnerships for infrastructure, warning that states must exercise fiscal responsibility to avoid potential financial burdens. In a report released Tuesday, March 24, the Philadelphia-based organization cautions against budget engineering and long-term agreements that could compromise the financial health of both the private sector and government. The report recommends shifting towards performance-based contracts to avoid potential pitfalls and ensure sound corporate principles. According to Pew President and CEO Rebecca R. M. Williams, the neglect of basic economics by policymakers has led to the deterioration of facilities such as highways and schools. The organization emphasizes the importance of states not relying solely on partnerships to repair the broken system, but rather taking a comprehensive approach to ensure fiscal responsibility.

input: LOS ANGELES  The primary backer of an effort to get a ban on circumcision on the ballot in Santa Monica is abandoning her push, saying the proposed legislation had been misrepresented as an effort to impinge on religious freedom. A similar measure in San
continuation: Francisco refused to getting on the ballot . She says she resigned her support for the initiative because it had been tainted by accusations that it was discriminatory and attempted to limit religious freedom .Proponents of the ban believe that circumcision should not be mandated on infants because its traumatic , violates their rights and deprives them of a normal sex life . Critics believe it is barbaric and infringes on parental rights , religious freedom and the civil liberties of both boys and boys .Early last year , about 70 percent of San Franciscans who voting on the bill dismissed the idea of prohibiting the method .
paraphrase: Santa Monica's leading supporter of a ban on circumcision has dropped their campaign, claiming that the proposed legislation was misrepresented as an attack on religious freedom. A similar measure in San Francisco was rejected from being put to a vote. The supporter resigned their support due to accusations of discrimination and attempts to restrict religious freedom. Advocates for the ban believe that circumcising infants is traumatic, violates their rights, and denies them a normal sex life. Opponents argue that it is barbaric and infringes on parental rights, religious freedom, and the civil liberties of both boys and girls. Last year, around 70% of San Franciscans who voted on the issue rejected the idea of prohibiting the practice.

input: The Promise: Using the Apple device's built-in accelerometers, the Dynolicious application measures vehicle acceleration (0-60 mph, 1/4-mile trap speed and elapsed time, etc), and cornering and braking grip. With that
continuation: information , the app can provide the car feedback on how to drive the car in the quickest possible way . Using the Apple device ' s built - in accelerometers , the Dynolicious software controls vehicle acceleration ( 0 - 60 mph , 1 / 4 - mile trap speed and elapsed time , etc ) , and cornering and braking grip .With that information , the app can provide the car feedback on how to drive the car in the quickest possible way . Dynolicious screens the acceleration and cornering force data of the user ' s vehicle in a comprehensible way , but also shows the results in an easily interpreted graphical layout .The advantages of this app is that it can be used to optimize any driver ' s efficiency behind the wheel , including data logged over multiple running for comparison . The app can also be used to drive for fuel consumption as well , and can save tracks of user ran , and how
paraphrase: The Apple device's built-in accelerometers enable the Dynolicious application to measure a vehicle's acceleration, cornering, and braking grip, providing real-time feedback on how to drive the car in the most efficient way possible. By leveraging these built-in sensors, the app can control vehicle acceleration, cornering, and braking forces, offering valuable insights for drivers to optimize their driving techniques. Dynolicious presents the acceleration and cornering force data in an easily digestible format, while also displaying the results in a visually intuitive graphical layout. With this innovative app, drivers can compare data from multiple runs, monitor fuel consumption, and save tracks of their drives for future reference. The app's user-friendly interface makes it easy to use and interpret the data, making it an indispensable tool for any driver looking to improve their driving skills.
