input: ORLANDO -- Leading Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson believes that federal and state official overreacted in trying to save Terri Schiavo, a Florida woman who died in 2005 as her husband and family battled over whether to keep her alive despite her
continuation: husband ' s say - so . During an appearance at a conservative conference , Carson said that both state and federal authorities overreacted by cut off food and water that Schiavo required to survive ." And they are not dealing with other situations where that might be the appropriate thing , " he said , according to the Orlando Sentinel . " There are people who die of starvation .There are people who dying because of thirst . I have to agree with the courts .I believe there needs to be a level of common sense that is exercised . " When the state legislature eventually intervened , the federal authorities swooped in and attempted to take the issue out of state hands , something that eventually landed the case in the courts .After many court fights and federal intervention , Schiavo died . It ' s not the first time Carson , a retired pediatric neurosurgeon ,
paraphrase: Ben Carson, a leading Republican presidential candidate, believes that federal and state officials overreacted in their efforts to save Terri Schiavo, a Florida woman who passed away in 2005. During a recent appearance at a conservative conference, Carson argued that authorities should have exercised more common sense in their handling of the situation. He noted that there are people who die of starvation and dehydration, and that the authorities should have taken a more balanced approach. According to the Orlando Sentinel, Carson believes that the courts were right in their decision, but that the state and federal authorities should have shown more restraint in their intervention. The case eventually made its way to the courts, and after numerous legal battles, Schiavo passed away. Carson, a retired pediatric neurosurgeon, has expressed similar views on other occasions, emphasizing the importance of common sense and restraint in such situations.

input: At 29, Gretchen Daily is a rising star of population biology. She works at both UC-Berkeleys Energy and Resources Group and Stanford Universitys Center for Conservation Biology on a fellowship specifically created for her. Daily recently made
continuation: headlines for her pioneering research on uses economic incentives to save the biodiversity in Brazils Amazon . Fortune magazine called her one of The 100 Most Powerful Women in Business last year , and shes been described as the brightest light in the world of sustainable development by the Chicago Tribune .The worlds food supply is at risk . World hunger is at an all - time high : 925 million people are food - insecure , according to the World Health Organization .In the last decade , the proportion of people with sufficient food to eat has decreased . Over the last few years , global food supply is expected to expand by 70 percent , yet the proportion of people who demand food will expand by 15 percent , says the United Nations .Theres no silver bullet solution , but researchers are studying a promising strategy :
paraphrase: At 29, Gretchen Daily is a rising star in the field of population biology, working at both UC Berkeley's Energy and Resources Group and Stanford University's Center for Conservation Biology on a fellowship tailored to her skills. Daily has made headlines for her groundbreaking research on using economic incentives to protect biodiversity in Brazil's Amazon. Fortune magazine has named her one of the 100 Most Powerful Women in Business, and she has been hailed as the brightest light in sustainable development by the Chicago Tribune. Unfortunately, the world's food supply is under threat, with global hunger at an all-time high of 925 million people, according to the World Health Organization. In the last decade, the proportion of people with sufficient food has decreased, despite a projected 70% expansion of the global food supply over the next few years. The United Nations predicts that the demand for food will increase by 15% during this time, highlighting the urgent need for innovative solutions to ensure food security. While there is no single solution, researchers are exploring promising strategies to address this complex issue.

The Massachusetts baseball team was looking to build some momentum heading into the final stretch of the 2016 by winning its second to last nonconference game remaining on the schedule Wednesday afternoon in Lowell.
The Minutemen got down early with UMass Lowell scoring two
continuation: runs in the first and third innings but the momentum shifted back in favor of UMass in the top of the fourth when Logan Jaciuk led off the inning with a home run over the center field wall . UMass added another run in the next inning to pull to within one before Jordan DiCicco led off the inning with a home run , his seventh of the season , to knot the match at 4 - 4 .Leading 6 - 4 in the bottom of the sixth , the River Hawks rallied for three runs , two of which were on wild pitches , to take a 7 - 6 lead and earn the win . The Minutemen have two more games remaining on their summer slate , a four game series at Binghamton that opens Thursday morning .
paraphrase:

The Minutemen faced an early deficit as UMass Lowell scored two runs in the first and third innings, but they managed to turn the tide in their favor in the top of the fourth when Logan Jaciuk led off with a home run over the center field wall. UMass continued to fight back, adding another run in the next inning to narrow the gap to one. Jordan DiCicco then led off the inning with a home run, his seventh of the season, to tie the game at 4-4.
Unfortunately, the River Hawks rallied in the bottom of the sixth, scoring three runs, two of which were on wild pitches, to take a 7-6 lead and secure the victory. With two more games remaining on their summer schedule, the Minutemen will look to bounce back at Binghamton, where they will begin a four-game series on Thursday morning.

On December 31, 1937, 20th-century Uzbekistans most popular novelist, Abdulla Qodir
continuation: , along with his wife and two kids , were executed by firing squad in their home town of Turon . Both Qodirs children came on to become famous writers themselves : Lutfis work was nominated for the 1990 National Prize of the Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic and Nigoras 2002 book My Family Imagines has been printed by Glagoslav in 2005 .He believed the love of life is more essential than love for art , his wife continues , in the first - person narrative , at the beginning of the new fiction by Hamid Ismailov , the first Uzbek novelist to have won the EBRD Literature Prize .
paraphrase:
Hamid Ismailov's prize-winning Uzbek novel highlights Central Asian literature.
On December 31, 1937, renowned Uzbek novelist Abdulla Qodir, along with his family, including his wife and two children, were tragically executed by firing squad in their hometown of Turon. Miraculously, both of Qodir's children grew up to become accomplished writers themselves. Lutfis work was nominated for the prestigious National Prize of the Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic in 1990, while Nigoras 2002 book, My Family Imagines, was published by Glagoslav in 2005. According to Qodir's wife, her husband believed that the love of life was more important than love for art, a sentiment that resonates throughout Ismailov's new fiction, which marks the first time an Uzbek novelist has won the EBRD Literature Prize.

input: THE economic plan being chartered during the ongoing 2017-2018 budget debate aims to stabilise the countrys finances, Deputy Prime Minister K Peter Turnquest said yesterday, as he underscored the continued need to reduce discretionary spending
continuation: at the Government level . Mr Turnquest provided the details in a speech he gave to the Cabinet Retreat at the Weekend Sun Resort in Mangrove Cay , Exuma .It is in this context that our current economic stabilisation policy focuses on budget consolidation , reining in expenditures as well as realising potential additional revenues from expenditure controls and the taxation reform process , he said . Moreover , as our economic stabilisation policy is focused on ensuring we move towards reducing our debt to GDP ratio from 93 . 5 per cent in 2016 to 80 per cent by 2020 , we cannot forget that our expenditures must go down as a fraction of our GDP if we wish to reduce our debt .He added : The present fiscal deficit , which averages
paraphrase:
The government's budget plan for 2017-2018, which is currently being discussed, aims to stabilize the country's finances, according to Deputy Prime Minister K Peter Turnquest. He emphasized the need to reduce discretionary spending at the government level during a speech at the Cabinet Retreat at the Weekend Sun Resort in Mangrove Cay, Exuma.
The country's economic stabilization policy focuses on budget consolidation, reducing expenditures, and realizing potential additional revenues through expenditure controls and tax reform, Turnquest said. Additionally, the policy aims to reduce the country's debt-to-GDP ratio from 93.5% in 2016 to 80% by 2020, which requires a decrease in government expenditures as a percentage of GDP. Turnquest noted that the current fiscal deficit, which averages, must be addressed to achieve this goal.

The ritual began in 1921 , when Herbert Hoover arrived to the White House to serve a supper in honor of journalists who reported
paraphrase:
Trump to Pass on White House Correspondents' Dinner, but Will Speak with Talk Radio Host. A Break from Tradition.
In a departure from standard presidential candidate behavior, Donald Trump will not attend this year's White House Correspondents' Association dinner, according to a statement released on Tuesday. However, the businessman and reality TV star will engage in a radio interview with conservative talk radio host Hugh Hewitt. The move marks a shift from the typical ceremony, which provides candidates with an opportunity to showcase their wit and humor to journalists and the public. The tradition began in 1921, when Herbert Hoover served a dinner in honor of reporters who covered the White House.

A GP clinic in Edinburgh which is changing to a telephone assessment system three days a week has warned its 6,000 patients they could be turned away.
The changes at the Links Medical Centre come into force on Wednesday, May 1.
A statement
continuation: on the practices website stated its GPs feel these changes are the right ones to make in order to secure and maintain the future of our service for the long - term . However , it said : These changes are happening to ensure we maintain a viable service for our patients and therefore we may need to turn patients away from our walk - in service .We want you to book an appointment if you felt you have a problem requiring medical attention that is urgent or cannot wait until the next day . Our recently trained Practice Nurses can assess and treat many difficulties and we can refer to other facilities where necessary .The changes come in a week where it was confirmed the citys 65 GP practices have shed 128 full - time equivalent GPs and almost 500 full - time equivalent practice nurses in the last five years . Health Secretary Jeane Fre
paraphrase: The Links Medical Centre in Edinburgh is transitioning to a telephone assessment system three days a week, potentially turning away 6,000 patients. The changes take effect on May 1 and aim to secure the practice's long-term viability. While GPs feel these changes are necessary, they may need to deny walk-in appointments to ensure the sustainability of the service. Patients are advised to book an appointment for urgent or non-urgent medical issues that cannot wait until the next day. The practice has recently trained Practice Nurses to assess and treat a variety of conditions, and referrals can be made to other facilities when necessary. These changes come at a time when Edinburgh's 65 GP practices have lost 128 full-time equivalent GPs and almost 500 full-time equivalent practice nurses in the last five years, according to Health Secretary Jeane Freeman.

input:
LOWER PAXTON TOWNSHIP, DAUPHIN COUNTY, Pa. - Police are reminding people of the importance of reporting crimes to police and not just posting about them on social media.
If you're a social media user,
continuation: there ' s a good chance you have some crime blotter friends on Facebook . Not everyone who posts in a group like this might have a genuine report , and it ' s easy to form an view about the severity of the criminal .But if you ' re talking about an incident you ' re not involved in , your suggestions could create the investigation to become an embarrassment . Police said it ' s important to post about the incident on social media if you have anything to offer .If you don ' t , you can help the investigation going wrong . There is a right way and a wrong way to manage reporting crime on social media .Simply reporting that there ' s been a crime is not the end . " And sometimes I believe it could be a misconception that the authorities are notified by social media and they can take over the investigation and be the investigator , but that ' s not always the case , " Lower Pa
paraphrase: In Lower Paxton Township, Dauphin County, Pennsylvania, police are reminding residents of the significance of reporting crimes directly to them instead of simply posting about them on social media. While social media platforms may provide a convenient means of sharing information, relying solely on these channels can lead to inaccurate assumptions about the severity of the crime. Moreover, unverified suggestions from non-involved individuals can hinder the investigation, potentially causing it to become mishandled. It is essential to report incidents on social media while offering relevant information, but simply stating that a crime has occurred is not sufficient. The correct approach involves providing detailed accounts while acknowledging the limitations of social media in facilitating the investigation. Police stress that they should be notified directly to ensure a thorough and effective investigation.

input: Erin Cordray is radiography program director at Community College of Baltimore County. What does a radiographer's job entail? Radiography uses X-ray radiation to create images of the tissues, organs, bones and vessels that make up the human
continuation: body . The radiographer need always meet proper protocols in order to minimize radiation exposure and ensure that the image is of sufficient quality .As a part of her responsibilities , Cordray manages clinical placement for the radiography classes and is responsible for submitting radiography children to the ARRT . She also helps organize a five - week summer apprenticeship course , which allows high school children to spend a week shadowing radiography children , to getting a sense of what a radiographer ' s work is like .Read on to find about Cordray ' s ideas into the radiography profession . I believe I started in radiography because of my math and scientific backgrounds .I didn ' t know too little about radiography as a career when I joined the program . I wasn ' t very interested in it , but once I got in the program , I enjoyed it .I was able to take X - rays of my friends
paraphrase: Erin Cordray is the director of the radiography program at Community College of Baltimore County. As a radiographer, Cordray's job involves using X-ray radiation to create images of the human body's internal structures, including tissues, organs, bones, and vessels. To ensure proper protocols are followed to minimize radiation exposure and produce high-quality images, Cordray manages clinical placements for radiography students and submits their work to the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT). Additionally, she organizes a five-week summer apprenticeship program for high school students to shadow radiography professionals and gain insight into the field. Cordray believes her interest in radiography stemmed from her strong background in math and science, and she found the field to be enjoyable once she immersed herself in it, even taking X-rays of her friends.

input:
Immensely wealthy and powerful men like Peter Thiel and Elon Musk want to live forever. But at what cost?
In a 2011 New Yorker profile, Peter Thiel, tech-philanthropist and billionaire, surmised that probably the
continuation: only thing that matters is how many people you have admired and how much you have loved them . Its really hard to think that the quantity of time you spend playing video games or watching pornography is going to do anything other than distract you from having more experiences .But now he wants a cryopreserved head on ice . Like many Silicon Valley pioneers , Thiel has been predicting imminent suicide .In a recent chat , the PayPal co - founder told me , I hope Im wrong , but Im reasonably confident that the world is going to end in our lifetimesprobably not this decade , but soon , probably within 100 years . It is no surprise , then , that Thiel has undertaken longevity science , having invested heavily in studies into both rejuvenation and cryonics .Thiel told the
paraphrase: Billionaires like Peter Thiel and Elon Musk desire to live indefinitely, but at what cost? In a 2011 New Yorker profile, Thiel, a tech philanthropist and billionaire, suggested that the only thing that truly matters in life is the number of people we have admired and the depth of our love for them. He believes that spending time on frivolous activities like video games or pornography is a distraction from having meaningful experiences. However, Thiel now wants to have his head cryopreserved, a notion he has been predicting for some time. Many Silicon Valley pioneers, including Thiel, have expressed fears about the end of the world, with Thiel estimating that it could happen within the next 100 years. As a result, Thiel has invested heavily in longevity science, including research into rejuvenation and cryonics.

input:
Now that flood waters have begun to recede, Texas victims of Tropical Storm Harvey face another challenge: eviction notices. Even worse, some people are still on the hook for rent on apartments they cant live in.
Sheri Ilo
continuation: ki , a strategy analyst with the Texas Low Income Housing Information Service , has heard from a number of residents who are faced eviction and cant even enter the residences they leased . If an apartment is totally underwater , of course the tenant cant be evicted from the unit , Iloki says .This is not a reason for tenants to cease pay rent , however . If youre facing a flood and have to evacuate , youre protected under the Texas Property Code .This includes property in flood zones or susceptible to storms . You can also refuse to pay rent if the residence has no heat , water or electricity .For the subsequent two months , Houston has been declared a major disaster area by President Donald Trump , meaning the Federal Emergency Management Agency ( FEMA ) can provide aid to anything hurt by the hurricane . That includes
paraphrase:
As the floodwaters begin to recede in Texas, a new challenge emerges for victims of Tropical Storm Harvey: eviction notices. Despite the difficult circumstances, some individuals are still being held responsible for rent on apartments they cannot inhabit.
Sheri Iloki, a strategy analyst with the Texas Low-Income Housing Information Service, has received several reports of tenants facing eviction and being unable to enter their leased residences. According to Iloki, if an apartment is completely submerged in water, the tenant cannot be evicted from that unit. However, this does not mean that tenants should cease paying rent. If a flood forces evacuation, the Texas Property Code provides protection for property in flood zones or vulnerable to storms. Additionally, tenants have the right to refuse rent payments if their residence lacks essential services such as heat, water, or electricity. For the next two months, Houston has been designated as a major disaster area by President Donald Trump, allowing the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to provide aid to affected properties. This includes assistance for anything damaged by the hurricane.

Experts recommend that adults get at least seven hours of sleep per night, but 44.7% of Hawaiians
continuation: have been slept less than six hours per night in 2014 . Hawaiis citizens prefer to have less cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases , compared to those in other states .Their health is mainly credited to the states healthy lifestyle habits , which includes 55 % of Hawaiians exercising in 2015 .
paraphrase: Hawaii's lifestyle may hold unexpected advantages, as its residents are the only ones in the country with an average life expectancy of 81 years. While experts suggest adults should get at least seven hours of sleep per night, a surprising 44.7% of Hawaiians have reported sleeping less than six hours per night in 2014. Notably, Hawaiians prefer to reduce their risk of cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases compared to other states. The primary factor contributing to their excellent health is their adherence to a healthy lifestyle, with 55% of Hawaiians exercising in 2015.

input: Its no secret that ride-hailing company Uber has been concerned about its competitors in the race to build autonomous cars. But text messages released as part of Ubers ongoing litigation with Googles self-driving car project
continuation: Waymo demonstrate that Waymo CEO John Krafcik had a change of heart in 2015 after Krafcik was approached by Ubers led autonomous car engineer , Anthony Levandowski , who encouraged the CEO to disengage the Waymo engineers from their work on the self - driving automobile program . Anything else is a failure , wrote Levandowski , requesting Krafcik to flipping a switch .Levandowski has been accused of stealing 14 , 000 files from Googles self - driving automobile program that included technology related to lidar and circuit panel designs , and Waymo has alleged that the files , and the resulting autonomous software , are now being used in Ubers autonomous car systems . Googles parent company Alphabet filed a complaint in February of this year .Read the remainder of
paraphrase:
Uber's rivalry with Waymo in the race to develop autonomous cars has been well-documented. However, newly released text messages as part of Uber's ongoing legal battle with Waymo reveal that Waymo CEO John Krafcik underwent a transformation in 2015 after being approached by Uber's lead autonomous car engineer, Anthony Levandowski. Levandowski reportedly encouraged Krafcik to disengage Waymo's engineers from their self-driving car program, stating that "anything else is a failure" and urging Krafcik to "flipping a switch."
Levandowski has faced allegations of stealing 14,000 files from Google's self-driving car program, including technology related to lidar and circuit panel designs. Waymo has further accused Levandowski of using these stolen files to develop Uber's autonomous car systems. In February of this year, Google's parent company Alphabet filed a complaint regarding these allegations.

input:
An NYPD administrative judge and its firearms review panel criticized the conduct of three police officers involved in the 2012 shooting death of a Bronx 18-year-old, records obtained by the Daily News show.
The judge's decision involving Officer Richard Haste, who
continuation: shot at 18 - year - old Ramarley Graham in his father ' s bathroom , was the culmination of an independent police inquiry . It will now be sent to Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly and the NYPD ' s Law Department for a final decision , which can include resignation from the force .At issue is whether Haste overreacted when he trying to arrest Graham for a gun he suspected Graham of having as part of an continuing narcotics investigation . Graham ' s parents and their lawyers have called the shot unjustified , and they have said Haste , who faces a grand jury conviction for manslaughter in the case , shot Graham because he was black .But Haste and other policemen involved in the shot - a detective and a sergeant - claimed the teenager was resisting arrest and resisting instructions , and that he grabb
paraphrase:
An NYPD administrative judge and its firearms review panel have criticized the actions of three police officers involved in the 2012 shooting death of a Bronx teenager, according to records obtained by the Daily News.
The judge's decision involving Officer Richard Haste, who shot at 18-year-old Ramarley Graham in his father's bathroom, was the result of an independent police inquiry. It will now be forwarded to Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly and the NYPD's Law Department for a final decision, which could include disciplinary action, including resignation from the force. The issue at hand is whether Haste overreacted when he attempted to arrest Graham, who was suspected of possessing a gun in the course of an ongoing narcotics investigation. Graham's parents and their legal representatives have deemed the shot as unjustified, with some claiming that Haste, who faces a grand jury conviction for manslaughter in the case, shot the teenager due to his race. However, Haste and other officers involved in the shooting have argued that Graham was resisting arrest and failing to comply with instructions, leading to the fatal confrontation.

input: The Fleurieu & Kangaroo Island Region 7 hosted its annual Champion of Champions match last Saturday at Yankalilla Bowling Club on what turned out to be a great day for bowls. In the Men's Fours, the Kangaroo
continuation: Island team defeated the Fleurieu team 18-9.The winners were Jim Bauer, Gary Speller, Greg Helm and Jim Behn.The Men ' s Pairs competition was contested between Phil Ingoldsby and Paul Buchanan and John Speller and David Pickworth , who taken out the doubles 19 - 15 . The Mixed Triples squad of Rob and Jane Macdonald , John and Pat Webb , and Harry Ford defeated the Kangaroo Island team 25 - 10 .The Ladies Fours squad from the Kangaroo Island club were represented by Anne Paynter , Dianne Bolch , Nancy Davis and Cheryl Harris who defeated their Fleurieu counterparts 15 - 9 . The victorious Mixed Fours squad was Barbara Bauer , David Howarth , Wendy Black and Tom Sikora who overcame the Fleurieu team 1
paraphrase: The Yankalilla Bowling Club recently hosted the annual Champion of Champions match, where the Fleurieu & Kangaroo Island Region 7 teams battled it out in various categories. On a sunny day, the Kangaroo Island team emerged victorious in the Men's Fours, defeating the Fleurieu team by a score of 18-9. The winning quartet consisted of Jim Bauer, Gary Speller, Greg Helm, and Jim Behn. In the Men's Pairs competition, Phil Ingoldsby and Paul Buchanan defeated John Speller and David Pickworth in a tight match, winning 19-15. The Mixed Triples team of Rob and Jane Macdonald, John and Pat Webb, and Harry Ford dominated their Kangaroo Island opponents, securing a 25-10 victory. The Ladies Fours team from the Kangaroo Island club, consisting of Anne Paynter, Dianne Bolch, Nancy Davis, and Cheryl Harris, emerged victorious against their Fleurieu counterparts, winning 15-9. Finally, the Mixed Fours team of Barbara Bauer, David Howarth, Wendy Black, and Tom Sikora triumphed over the Fleurieu team, winning 18-12.

input: BlackBerry Ltd. has signed a deal to acquire U.S. artificial intelligence and cybersecurity company Cylance for US$1.4 billion in cash. The Ontario-based company called Cylance a pioneer in applying artificial intelligence, algorithmic
continuation: science and machine learning to cybersecurity software , providing predictive and preventive security capabilities . It said Cylance ' s tech will complement its BlackBerry Spark platform , providing real - time protection intelligence to protect BlackBerry customers against a broad variety of internet attacks and securing applications running in the cloud , on the endpoint or in the information center .We intend Cylance to quickly deliver us advanced products that will assist us to tackle the huge market opportunity in front of us , John Chen , BlackBerry ' s executive chairman and CEO , said in a statement . Chen called Cylance the world ' s leading machine learning and artificial intelligence firm , helping to reduce the most pervasive and powerful cyber raids .BlackBerry announced in October that it would purchase California - based cybersecurity startup Radianse Inc . for US $ 219 million . The company is now pushing to turn around its core operations .
paraphrase: BlackBerry Ltd. has reached an agreement to acquire U.S. artificial intelligence and cybersecurity company Cylance for a hefty $1.4 billion in cash. The Ontario-based firm hailed Cylance as a trailblazer in harnessing AI, algorithms, and machine learning to fortify cybersecurity software, providing cutting-edge protection against a wide range of internet threats and securing applications running in the cloud, on endpoints, or in data centers. According to John Chen, BlackBerry's executive chairman and CEO, the acquisition aims to rapidly deliver advanced products that can help the company tackle the significant market opportunity ahead. Chen labelled Cylance as the world's leading machine learning and AI firm, with the capability to fortify BlackBerry's offerings and better safeguard customers against the most persistent and sophisticated cyber attacks. In October, BlackBerry had also announced its plan to purchase California-based cybersecurity startup Radianse Inc. for $219 million as part of its efforts to revitalize its core operations.

input: MEDELLIN, Colombia  Chiles Palestino qualified for the third round of the Copa Libertadores on Tuesday after beating Colombian side Independiente Medellin on penalties to win the second leg of the second round at
continuation: home 2 - 1 . Palestino trailed 1 - 0 on aggregate go into the match and could have been defeated from the Copa Libertadores , the South American equivalent of the Champions League , at the end of the match .But a late equalizer by Israeli winger Eitan Tibi and the goalkeeper Sergio Valencias penalties made Palestino progress to the group stage of the Copa Libertadores . Palestino players celebrated wildly at the end of the match and later had to be calmed down by coaching staff .
paraphrase: Medellin, Colombia - Chiles Palestino advanced to the third round of the Copa Libertadores on Tuesday following their penalty shootout victory over Colombian side Independiente Medellin in the second leg of the second round at home. Palestino trailed 1-0 on aggregate heading into the match and were in danger of being eliminated from the prestigious South American competition. However, a late equalizer by Israeli winger Eitan Tibi and a series of precise penalties from goalkeeper Sergio Valencia secured Palestinos progression to the group stage of the Copa Libertadores. Exuberant Palestino players celebrated wildly at the final whistle before being calmed down by coaching staff.

input: There's a lot of confusion around cloud computing. What is it exactly? Who is it for? What can it do? Hardly surprising then that groups are springing up that claim to help people understand the concept, see beyond the hype and get
continuation: the best out of it . One such group , the Cloud Industry Forum ( CIF ) is establishing its own online education portal to support companies in discovering cloud computing opportunities .The organization says its content will assist companies from all backgrounds - from huge enterprises to SMEs - to better understand the possibilities cloud computing provides . It says the portal will educate subscribers about cloud computing and enable resources for companies to analyze and planning their migration to the cloud .The organization is building content in partnership with the CIF membership . The platform will include practical guides , white papers , checklists , tools and recommendations that are easy to use and adapt to a corporation ' s latest business model .Initial areas to be covered include cloud security , business case creation , adoption and implementation , migration and interoperability . " Cloud computing is complex and we ' re hopeful that the Cloud Industry Forum ' s internet education portal will assist companies of all sizes to manage the challenges
paraphrase:
There is a great deal of misunderstanding surrounding cloud computing, making it challenging for individuals and organizations to comprehend its true nature and potential. In an effort to address this confusion, various groups have emerged that aim to provide clarity and insight into the concept. One such organization, the Cloud Industry Forum (CIF), is taking a proactive approach by creating an online educational portal to support companies in navigating the complex world of cloud computing.
The CIF portal is designed to assist companies of all sizes, from enterprises to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), in understanding the diverse possibilities that cloud computing offers. The organization emphasizes that the portal will provide practical guides, white papers, checklists, tools, and recommendations that are easy to use and adapt to a company's specific business model.
The initial areas of focus for the portal will include cloud security, creating a strong business case, adoption and implementation, migration, and interoperability. The CIF is working with its membership to develop this content, ensuring that it is comprehensive and relevant to the needs of its users.
In summary, the CIF's online education portal aims to address the confusion surrounding cloud computing by providing a comprehensive and practical resource for companies to learn, understand, and leverage the full potential of this technology.

input: press release: Father of newgrass and King of Telluride Sam Bush has long since established himself as roots royalty, revered for both his solo and sideman work, which includes time with Emmylou Harris, Lyle Lovett, and B
continuation: ela Fleck and the Flecktones . But hes never done anything quite like whats coming to Milwaukees Pabst Theater next Tuesday : a full - on power - trio reunion with his New Grass Revival bandmates , fiddler John Cowan and fiddle master Bela Fleck .The band , whose self - titled debut was originally released in 1971 , created an album overflowing with dynamic collaborations and innovative melodies , notably Elizabeth Reed , a Fleck original that remained a cornerstone of the Allman Brothers repertoire . And the New Grass Revival is a powerhouse force to be reckoned with : The band has published 15 studio albums , including three in a row that entered the top 25 on Billboards bluegrass charts ; sold out 40 of 42 appearances at Telluride
paraphrase: Sam Bush, the "Father of Newgrass" and "King of Telluride," has long been hailed as a roots music legend, recognized for his solo and sideman work with the likes of Emmylou Harris, Lyle Lovett, and Bela Fleck and the Flecktones. But next Tuesday's Pabst Theater performance in Milwaukee promises to be a truly special event  a full-on power trio reunion with his New Grass Revival bandmates, fiddler John Cowan, and fiddle master Bela Fleck. This reunion is a rare opportunity to experience the band's dynamic collaborations and innovative melodies, including their original composition "Elizabeth Reed," which remains a staple of the Allman Brothers' repertoire. With 15 studio albums under their belt, including three that charted in the top 25 of Billboard's bluegrass charts, and sold-out shows at Telluride, the New Grass Revival is a formidable force in the world of roots music.

input: File photograph by George Sakkestad. Saratoga High School junior Iris Lu spends some time studying in the schools library last Fall. Saratoga High School ranked 4th-best in California on Niche.com
continuation: s Best High Schools in America list . paraphrase: George Sakkestad captured a photograph of a student studying in the library at Saratoga High School last fall. I perhaps have a incomplete understanding of teams/SFB and would like to ask for a bit of assistance.
As I understand it, SFB has two options, cloud and on premise. As far as I know cloud is not available in SA
continuation: , so we have to install and run SFB on premise . But I would like to see if it is possible to configure our team site in another datacenter than where SFB is situated .As far as I understand it is currently possible to create a team site that is accessible to everybody using their email address . Can we configure a team site so it is only accessible to the users in the team that SFB belongs to ?For security purposes , this is not possible . The Exchange Team Sites support , however , allow for optional authentication and a special name for the location .Can we configure a team site so it is only accessible to the users in the team that SFB belongs to ? For security purposes , this is not possible . The Exchange Team Sites support , however , allow for optional authentication and a special name for the site .Actually I have discovered that Exchange Team Sites are not limited to SFB and Office Communications Server . It is possible to make Exchange Team
paraphrase:
I'm having a bit of trouble grasping the intricacies of SFB and would love some guidance.
As I understand it, SFB offers two options: cloud and on-premise. Unfortunately, the cloud version isn't available in my region, so we'll have to install and run SFB on-premise. However, I'm curious if it's possible to configure our team site in a different data center than where SFB is located. Currently, it's possible to create a team site that's accessible to everyone using their email address. Can we configure the team site so that it's only accessible to the users in the team that SFB belongs to? I'm afraid this isn't possible for security reasons. However, Exchange Team Sites do offer support for optional authentication and a unique name for the site.
I've discovered that Exchange Team Sites aren't exclusive to SFB and Office Communications Server. It's possible to make Exchange Team Sites more versatile by allowing access for users in different teams.

Chattanooga instituted a similar program in 2006. That city has about 6,400 employees compared to Lexington's 6,000.
The director of risk management there told the council the program is saving the city about $5 million a year, making
continuation: it an essential tool in assisting Chattanooga retain the same low tax prices . " If we start changing the landscape of risk coverage with voluntary employee buy - back or other avenues , then we are putting the City of Lexington at risk for tax increases , " Layton says .Mayor Newsome expressed fears over the health of his employees and that they would receive the same level of care regardless of whether they had health insurance . " They ' re our employees , they ' re our relatives , and we don ' t want them to have any more gaps than they currently do .That ' s one of the problems I had with the ( medical insurance program ) where the employees don ' t really have a choice in health healthcare , they just have a choice of insurance , " he said . A proposal by Councilman Don Eslinger , R - 7 , to only decrease the cities ' s
paraphrase: In 2006, Chattanooga launched a similar program, boasting a workforce of around 6,400 employees, comparable to Lexington's 6,000. The director of risk management at Chattanooga revealed to the council that the program is currently saving the city around $5 million annually, making it a crucial tool in maintaining low taxes. "If we begin to alter the landscape of risk coverage through voluntary employee buy-backs or other avenues, we are putting the City of Lexington at risk for tax increases," Layton explained. Mayor Newsome expressed concerns about the health of his employees and ensuring they receive adequate care, regardless of whether they have health insurance. "They are our employees, they are our relatives, and we don't want them to have any more gaps than they currently do," he said. "That's one of the issues I had with the medical insurance program where employees don't have a choice in healthcare, they just have a choice of insurance." A proposal by Councilman Don Eslinger, R-7, suggested decreasing the city's budget, but Mayor Newsome remained opposed to the idea.

Already making use of USB 3.1 on your PC? Take a look at Vantec's latest NexStar external storage device for SSDs and small HDDs.
As the flood gates open for USB 3.1 devices, the storage market
continuation: is benefiting from a slew of NVMe devices . Among the many devices is the latest Vantec NexStar Plus , which is aiming at users who desire to future - proof their PCs .While it features a variety of storage configurations , it ' s all oriented towards PCIe - based drives . The Vantec NexStar Plus connects to the host PC through a USB Type - C network .This cable is 1 . 8m long . The main unit is housed in a case that ' s very similar to a basic black UBS enclosure .Inside the unit , there are four cooling fans . There ' s a fan at the bottom of the unit , two more that sit in the plastic frame of the USB Type - C connector and the last one on the side .On the NexStar Plus , you want a USB Type - C to Type - A and SATA to
paraphrase: Are you already utilizing the latest USB 3.1 technology on your computer? Take a look at Vantec's cutting-edge NexStar external storage device, designed to accommodate both SSDs and small HDDs. As the market embraces the USB 3.1 standard, storage solutions are witnessing a surge of NVMe devices. The latest Vantec NexStar Plus is one such device, catering to users seeking to future-proof their PCs. With multiple storage configurations available, this device is specifically designed for PCIe-based drives and connects to your host PC via a 1.8m USB Type-C cable. The main unit is housed in a sleek black enclosure, featuring four cooling fans for efficient heat dissipation. These include a bottom fan, two fans integrated into the plastic frame of the USB Type-C connector, and a side fan. The NexStar Plus offers a versatile storage solution with a USB Type-C to Type-A adapter and a SATA connector, ensuring compatibility with various devices.

The Santa Cruz Public Works Department is attempting to position the city to receive state funding that would add lanes at the heavily trafficked intersection of Highway 1 and Highway 9.
The city has completed design plans for the project and will need to acquire several properties
continuation: to accommodate the project , which includes four intersections . The project is expected to cost $ 30 million , and might be funded through Proposition 1B , a bond legislation approved in 2006 that authorized money for road upgrades .The city is just got begun with the purchase process and as of mid - May had not sold any buildings . In addition to the four intersections , the project would include turning lanes , bike lanes and trail access , and a new bridge over Highway 1 .In order to obtain the funding , the project need be shovel ready by the end of this summer , said Gary Stradlund , the public works manager . In the past , there have been instances where the state had to take back money that was not utilized in a timely manner .Public works is helping with city planners to draft environmental documents and application for a Caltrans approval that would need several public
paraphrase: The Santa Cruz City Department is working towards securing state funding to expand the intersection of Highways 1 and 9, which experiences heavy traffic. The city has finalized the design plans and must acquire additional properties to accommodate the project, which involves four intersections. The project is estimated to cost $30 million and may be funded through Proposition 1B, a bond legislation approved in 2006 that provides money for road upgrades. As of mid-May, the city has not sold any buildings. The project will include turning lanes, bike lanes, and trail access, as well as a new bridge over Highway 1. In order to secure the funding, the project must be ready to begin construction by the end of the summer, according to Gary Stradlund, the public works manager. In the past, the state has had to retrieve unused funds due to delays in project completion. The public works department is collaborating with city planners to prepare environmental documents and apply for Caltrans approval, which will require public involvement.

The only question is, can they attract the same number of viewers as the Mexican rivalry? The rest is up to us, the fans. input: Andy Eccleshalls Changing Times shows an actual walk back through time as one strolls down Main Street. Starting with the present day near the fountain, as you approach the water, you walk back through the decades with
continuation: each step bringing you closer to the past . In the far distance , the red roof of Central Union Church at the time of this photograph is partially noticeable .There are several images from the 1890s on the OC Fairgrounds in Costa Mesa with colorful views of several of the original rides such as a merry - go - round and even a roller coaster ( which burned down after only a few years ) along with images of the carousel horses still on exhibit at the fairgrounds today . Last weekend was the 3rd Annual Burgeoning Burger Festival , a charity festival which Ive been honored to photograph since it began .This years fest was held at the Hangar at the OC Fairgrounds and included 17 different food trucks giving different definitions of what a burger may be . The design and fabrication of A Day in the Garden was
paraphrase:
Andy Eccleshall's Time Trail takes you on a journey through the ages as you stroll down Main Street. Starting from the present day near the fountain, you step back in time with each step, bringing you closer to the past. In the distance, the red-tiled roof of Central Union Church is visible, a reminder of a bygone era.
The Orange County Fairgrounds in Costa Mesa hold secrets from the 1890s, with vibrant images of classic rides such as a merry-go-round and a roller coaster (which tragically burned down after just a few years). You can still see the beautiful carousel horses on display at the fairgrounds today.
Last weekend marked the 3rd Annual Burgeoning Burger Festival, a charity event that I've had the privilege of capturing through my lens. This year's fest was held at The Hangar at the OC Fairgrounds, where 17 different food trucks offered unique interpretations of the classic burger.
The creation and craftsmanship of A Day in the Garden are a true marvel.

input:
How David Bowie helped my autistic son become himself.
When my son Benj was a small boy of 4 and 5 with virtually no original language and no ability or desire to play in conventional ways, he and I connected through music. I
continuation: d find him at his desk , poring over the contents of cassette cases Id brought home from the radio stations where I worked . Hed pick out the cassette he desired , and sit in his high chair listening to the tiny , crackly speakers that played my song .He knew the collection by heart ; at times hed even told me what to play next before I could find the case . He also knowing what to do when a song concluded .Without fail , after every tune hed clamber up onto my shoulder and reach up to pat the side of my face . I was not certain how to explain this to other families .I begun to reference it in passing , wanting to gauge the response of parents of other tiny students . I wanted to understand if Id ever felt comfortable mentioning it in the context of my own sons education .Most families didnt seem to getting it . Many I spoke to did not
paraphrase:
David Bowie's Impact on My Son's Self-Discovery
As a mother, I witnessed my son Benj's transformation through music, thanks to David Bowie. At the age of 4 and 5, Benj had limited language skills and struggled to engage in conventional play. However, when I played Bowie's music for him, he would sit mesmerized, listening intently to the tiny speakers on his high chair. He knew the collection by heart and even directed me to play specific songs. After each tune, he would climb onto my shoulder and pat my face, displaying a deep connection to the music. I found it challenging to explain this unique bond to other parents, and I often referenced it in passing. While some seemed intrigued, many failed to understand the depth of Benj's connection to Bowie's music. Nonetheless, I was convinced of its significance in his self-discovery journey.

input:
The most popular teething rings contain hormone-disrupting chemicals, a new study warns.
Endocrine-disrupting chemicals are banned from use in products for children.
However, no studies have ever tested plastic teethers for
continuation: the presence of substances that disrupt hormones , experts at Tel Aviv University said . The survey measured for 18 different phthalates in a range of popular teething toys .The results showed 14 had amounts that were either above or just below the highest limit set by requirements . Endocrine - disrupting compounds ( EDCs ) are present in a variety of common products , particularly teething toys .While research demonstrate that these toys can prevent babies from chewing on objects and toys , they may increase their danger of exposure to EDCs . The American Academy of Pediatrics ( AAP ) says babies should not be shown anything that might pose a choking danger , which includes toys with little parts that can fit into a babys mouth .In addition , the AAP recommends that teething toys should not have twists and be soft
paraphrase: A recent study has raised concerns about the presence of endocrine-disrupting chemicals in popular teething rings. These chemicals, which are banned from use in children's products, were found in 14 of the 18 teething toys tested, with levels either above or just below the maximum allowable limit. While teething toys can help prevent babies from chewing on objects and toys, they may also increase their exposure to these potentially harmful compounds. The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that babies should not be given any objects that could pose a choking hazard, including toys with small parts that can fit into their mouths. Additionally, teething toys should not have twists or be too soft, as these can also pose a choking hazard.

input: Winchendon is a small country town in northern Massachusetts, right on the border with New Hampshire. The local rustic landscapes lends to outdoor activities such as hiking, cycling, boating, fishing, swimming and other adventures at Lakes Monomonac
continuation: and Wicwas . The interesting fact is , that the weather of this tiny town is much milder than the weather of the bigger cities of the Eastern USA .The local settlement was established in 1659 . It was later named after John Winchendon , a landowner who owned the place from the Native American .The first public schools were established in 1662 and the first chapel came in 1682 . The property of this place was originally called Winchendon Heights and has become known since 1905 .According to the records , the town of Winchendon had a population of 124 persons in 1800 , which growing to 365 persons by 1810 . It reached to its height with over 2 , 000 persons in 1910 .The official inhabitants declined to
paraphrase: Tucked away in northern Massachusetts, near the New Hampshire border, lies the quaint town of Winchendon. Surrounded by picturesque countryside, the town offers an array of outdoor activities, including hiking, cycling, boating, fishing, swimming, and more at nearby Lakes Monomonac and Wicwas. A unique fact about this small town is that its weather is significantly milder than the bigger cities of the Eastern USA. Established in 1659, the local settlement was named after John Winchendon, a landowner who owned the area from the Native American tribe. The first public schools were established in 1662, and the first chapel came in 1682. Known as Winchendon Heights since 1905, the property's original name has been preserved through the years. According to records, the town's population grew from 124 persons in 1800 to 365 persons by 1810, reaching its peak with over 2,000 inhabitants in 1910. However, the official population declined to a smaller number in recent years.

input: The Chancellor has taken to the TV studios once ahead of what was intended to be the UKs final week inside the European Union. He needed up commenting on reports in several of this mornings papers that the Cabinet was preparing to oust
continuation: him from his office in a plot being headed by the Foreign Secretary , Jeremy Hunt . Its the first time that a Government minister has been publicly implicated in the plot against a Prime Minister .Tory backbenchers have took note , and are lining up to speak to the press . Theyre aghast at the Cabinet leaks .He joins The Independents former Westminster correspondent Heather Stewart , alongside Telegraph Chief Political Correspondent Christopher Hope , Channel 4s Political Editor Gary Gibbon and Financial Times Columnist Anatole Kaletsky , for a fascinating political roundtable . The rogue trader in a non - licensed brokerage firm will be charged with computer and telecommunication offences in Finland and Sweden .
paraphrase: The Chancellor recently appeared on TV to address speculation surrounding his future in the UK's government. He addressed reports in various newspapers that some members of the Cabinet, including Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt, were plotting to remove him from office. This marks the first time a government minister has been publicly implicated in a plot against a Prime Minister. Tory backbenchers are taking notice and speaking to the press, expressing their shock at the leaks within the Cabinet. The Chancellor joined a political roundtable with journalists from various outlets, including The Independent's Heather Stewart, The Telegraph's Christopher Hope, Channel 4's Political Editor Gary Gibbon, and Financial Times Columnist Anatole Kaletsky. Additionally, a rogue trader in a non-licensed brokerage firm will be charged with computer and telecommunication offences in Finland and Sweden.

input:
This is the last of a series of essays on Adam Curtiss essay series All Watched Over by Machines of Loving Grace, which you can watch for free here. I previously wrote about the series here and here.
One of Curtis
continuation: s several sources is Nafeez Ahmed . And Curtiss is one of Ahmeds biggest fans : Ahmed writes of him : Adam Curtis , who lately finished a series of documentaries for BBC2 called All Watched Over by Machines of Loving Grace , tells the story of how Nafeez Ahmed alerted him to the secret logic of the great conflict on terror con .( Nafeez Ahmeds essay here , one of the longest essays on Ahmeds site , is curious in this light : it is more of a defense of the prophet Daniel than a defense of Curtis , though it does describe Curtiss work as genuinely amazing . ) Ahmed , in a YouTube interview posted at the start of Curtiss series , seems more like a man wearing bunny ears than the terrifying figure he has made himself out to be
paraphrase: In the final essay of Adam Curtiss series, "All Watched Over by Machines of Loving Grace," he highlights Nafeez Ahmed as one of his primary sources. Curtis holds Ahmed in high regard, citing him as a crucial figure in exposing the underlying logic behind the global conflict on terror. Ahmed's essay, available on his website, offers a more in-depth defense of the prophet Daniel than Curtis' work, but both pieces share a mutual appreciation for Curtis' remarkable documentaries. In a YouTube interview at the series' onset, Ahmed presents a more lighthearted demeanor than his intimidating online persona.

input: The second batch of beneficiaries of the collaboration between the Federal University of Technology, Akure (FUTA) and the Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University (FAMU), Tallahassee, United States (US) have departed for the US to
continuation: study the field of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering . The beneficiaries who were led by the Acting Vice Chancellor , Professor Olumuyiwa Olumola , left Nigeria in batches of 50 each between July 2019 and January 2020 .This is part of the steps took by the University to develop and diversify its academic population by attracting highly talented and driven pupils from all sectors of society . The Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University ( FAMU ) and the Federal University of Technology , Akure ( FUTA ) reached into an Agreement in January 2017 with the objective of jointly developing and promoting an International Experience ( IE ) curriculum .According to the Director of Inter - University Relations , Professor Adegbola Adefemi , FAMU , the Universitys representation at the FUTA IE program includes staff members
paraphrase: The second group of students selected for the collaborative program between Federal University of Technology, Akure (FUTA) and Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University (FAMU), Tallahassee, USA, has departed for the US to pursue studies in Mechanical and Electrical Engineering. Led by the Acting Vice Chancellor, Professor Olumuyiwa Olumola, the students left Nigeria in batches of 50 between July 2019 and January 2020. This initiative is part of FUTA's efforts to diversify its academic population by attracting highly talented and motivated students from all backgrounds. The agreement between FAMU and FUTA, reached in January 2017, aims to develop and promote an International Experience (IE) curriculum. According to the Director of Inter-University Relations, Professor Adegbola Adefemi, FAMU, FAMU staff members are also participating in the program.

input:
The real value of a companyhospitals includedis not only in money, but in social good.
Daily conversations in healthcare are increasingly dominated by money. Healthcare reform is relentlessly focused on cost cutting. Hospitals are frantically developing strategies to
continuation: expand diagnostic facilities , yet still meet stringent standards of cost containment . Even the monetary difficulties at for - profit hospitals are framed by the quarterly financial statements of their holding companies , which have never had trouble compelling investors to put their money on the table .The majority of our time , however , is spending with patients , parents and our professional colleagues . This is where real value is created , whether its measured in a revenue / loss declaration or not .We must warn ourselves that at the heart of medicine is a tremendous humanity which benefits from hospitals which caring strongly for the people they serve . No one can argue against the obvious truth that healthcare remains a required and deeply important service .People continue to find their way to hospitals to find caring and comfort . They put their trust in our experts .They rest easy that their communities will continue to
paraphrase: The true value of a company is not limited to financial gains, but also encompasses the social good it provides. In the healthcare industry, monetary concerns are increasingly taking center stage, with cost-cutting measures dominating daily conversations. Despite this, hospitals are strategically expanding their diagnostic capabilities while maintaining stringent financial standards. However, the primary focus of healthcare professionals remains on providing quality care to patients, parents, and colleagues. This is where the true value of a hospital lies, beyond mere financial gains. We must recognize that at the core of medicine is a deep humanity that is nurtured by hospitals that prioritize the well-being of those they serve. Healthcare may be a lucrative industry, but its importance cannot be overstated. People continue to seek medical attention and find solace in hospitals, entrusting their care to skilled professionals. In the end, the value of a hospital extends far beyond the balance sheet, encompassing the countless lives it touches and improves.

input:
Lesley and John Brown with their daughter Louise, the world's first 'test tube baby'.
IT is an irony that the parents of Louise Brown, the worlds first test tube baby, would today be ineligible for
continuation: IVF treatment in Scotland . Professor Ian Craft , an embryologist at the Centre for Reproductive Medicine at the Beatson Institute in Glasgow , says that IVF and reproductive methods are falling behind the needs of the general population .It is 40 years since Louise Brown , a small bundle of brown - skinned , red - eyed good health , was born to her tearful and proud mothers in Oldham , Greater Manchester . An operation in a specialised unit at Oldham General Hospital removed eggs from Louises mother , Jean Brown , and fertilised them with sperm from her husband John .The resulting embryo was then moved to her mothers uterus , where it implanted and her mums life as a mother had begun . Over the previous four decades , IVF has grown to be a major industry in Britain , with many private centers selling IVF treat
paraphrase:
Lesley and John Brown, together with their daughter Louise, the first 'test tube baby', face a twist of fate. Despite being the parents of the pioneering IVF baby, they would today be ineligible for IVF treatment in Scotland due to advancements in reproductive technology. Professor Ian Craft, an embryologist at the Centre for Reproductive Medicine at the Beatson Institute in Glasgow, highlights the discrepancy between the needs of the general population and the current IVF capabilities.
Forty years have passed since Louise Brown, a healthy and energetic child with distinctive brown skin and bright red eyes, was born in Oldham, Greater Manchester. Her birth marked a groundbreaking moment in reproductive medicine, as an operation at Oldham General Hospital involved removing eggs from her mother, Jean Brown, and fertilizing them with sperm from her husband John. The resulting embryo was then implanted in her mother's uterus, and Jean's journey as a mother began.
Over the past four decades, IVF has flourished into a significant industry in the UK, with numerous private clinics offering IVF treatments. However, despite the progress made, IVF is still struggling to keep pace with the demands of the general population, according to Professor Craft.

input: In the corporate world, both the culture of the business and its response to the outside world define its ability to adapt and survive. This includes attitude to risk and innovation, approach to corporate social responsibility, team building, diversity and inclusion policies and its bribery
continuation: and corruption . Over the previous two decades , I have been privy to some of the best and worst of business behaviour .Having witnessed some of the most terrible failings of people and structures , Im now exploring the reasons that managers fail to grasp the potential benefits of involving workers in decision making . I have discovered that what requires to be understood is the emphasis on maintaining the status quo within organisations and the opposition to reform that usually hinders progress .The first step is to comprehend the reason why this arises . In The Fear Factor , Adam Galinsky explains that leaders who oppose creativity are particularly sensitive to any losses , particularly when they threaten their spot at the top .They will attempt to block any new concepts that might lead in them losing control . This often results to innovation being impeded or stifled as it can directly influence the perceived control and power of a leader
paraphrase: In the business world, the company's cultural backbone and its response to external influences play a crucial role in its adaptability and longevity. This includes its appetite for risk, approach to social responsibility, team building, diversity and inclusion policies, and its stance on corruption. Over the past two decades, I have witnessed both exemplary and subpar business practices. My observations have led me to investigate why leaders often fail to appreciate the benefits of involving employees in decision-making processes. I have discovered that the emphasis on maintaining the status quo and the resistance to change often hinders progress. Understanding the reasons behind this behavior is essential, as leaders who are sensitive to potential losses are more likely to stifle creativity and innovation, which could threaten their position of power. By comprehending the root cause of this opposition to reform, organizations can take the first step towards unlocking their full potential.

input:
Remember the Milk is an online task managing system.
Last week I posted with suggestions and resources for managing your email inbox. Todays post is also about productivity  its about to-do list applications. More to-do
continuation: list applications are available on the web and as wireless applications than any other kind of software . One of the most important software in my productivity arsenal is a to - do list app .The most common reason that people procrastinate is because they dont understand what to do next . If Im clear about what my next action step is , it becomes much easier to complete that act .This is why a to - do list application is so powerful . You know the phrase , a picture is worth a thousand words ?Well , I believe that the same is true for to - do lists . The more precise and visual a list is , the more likely it is that you will complete the objectives .Visuals communicate more information than lists of words . There are two ways to create a to - do list application that Im going to define today .The first method is a online application ( a to - do list app that you access from your internet browser
paraphrase:
Mind the Tasks is an internet-based task management platform.
Last week, I shared tips and resources for managing email inboxes. Today, I will discuss productivity, focusing on to-do list applications. There are more to-do list applications available on the web and as mobile apps than any other type of software. One of the most valuable tools in my productivity arsenal is a to-do list app. Most people procrastinate because they don't know what to do next. If I have a clear idea of what my next action step is, completing it becomes much easier. This is why a to-do list application is so powerful. The phrase "a picture is worth a thousand words" applies here. The more detailed and visual the list is, the more likely I am to complete my objectives. Visuals convey more information than lists of words. Today, I will outline two ways to create a to-do list application: an online application (a to-do list app that you access through your internet browser) and the other method is a mobile app (a to-do list app that you can use on your mobile device).

input: "We implore you to exercise your oversight responsibilities to make improving conditions at immigration detention facilities a top priority for ICE and ensure the humane treatment of detainees in federal custody," said the letter spearheaded by Oregon Democratic Rep. Suzanne Bonamici and Texas Democratic
continuation: Rep . Veronica Escobar . The lawmakers called on Johnson to sought transparency from ICE on how the agency complies with the Public Health Service Act , which applies to certain medical facilities such as hospitals , nursing homes , and hospice centers .The legislation also demands yearly reporting by the agency . " We have heard from first - hand accounts that some ICE prison establishments are grossly understaffed , placing detainees at risk of violence and unacceptable interaction with correctional agents and contractors ." It is also uncertain how the facilities are treating those with pre - current medical conditions or communicable diseases , " the lawmakers added . Immigration agencies have faced controversy for a raft of issues at detention establishments around the nation amid the pandemic , particularly staff members lacking required protective equipment and
paraphrase:
Lawmakers are urging the head of ICE to prioritize improving conditions at immigration detention facilities and ensuring the humane treatment of detainees in federal custody. In a letter spearheaded by Oregon Democratic Rep. Suzanne Bonamici and Texas Democratic Rep. Veronica Escobar, the lawmakers emphasize the need for oversight and transparency from ICE regarding its compliance with the Public Health Service Act, which applies to certain medical facilities such as hospitals, nursing homes, and hospice centers. The legislation also requires annual reporting by the agency.
According to the lawmakers, there have been first-hand accounts of understaffing at ICE prison establishments, putting detainees at risk of violence and unacceptable interactions with correctional agents and contractors. Moreover, there is uncertainty around how these facilities are treating individuals with pre-existing medical conditions or communicable diseases. Amid the pandemic, immigration agencies have faced criticism for a range of issues at detention facilities, including staff members lacking necessary protective equipment and inadequate medical care.
Overall, the lawmakers are urging ICE to take immediate action to address these concerns and ensure the humane treatment of detainees in their custody.

input: The medical device space is a slow-moving behemoth bogged down by regulation and in need of disruptive ideas and design innovation. In recent years, we've seen a number of interesting ideas emerge in the space from designing handwashing to the ways that
continuation: businesses are manufacturing and distributing . What if medical machine startups could collaborate with world - class teams of designers to model faster and test brands quicker ?That ' s precisely what we did when we partnered with Sutardja Center at UC Berkeley for Design + New Ventures . As part of the Design + New Ventures program , design students partnered with teams of health entrepreneurs to hack medical machines from September to December 2018 .Design crews are making up of design students from UC Berkeley , Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory , and UC Davis , along with entrepreneurs in residence . The course features the teams taking one product from the idea phase through the early prototyping phase .This process is all accomplished during the Spring semester , with the end result being a public presentation of the model at the end of the semester . This is not
paraphrase: The medical technology sector is a sluggish behemoth mired in bureaucracy and in dire need of disruptive ideas and innovative design. Recently, we have observed a surge of exciting developments in this field, from designing handwashing stations to novel methods of manufacturing and distributing medical devices. What if medical device startups could collaborate with top-notch design teams to accelerate their product development cycles? That is exactly what we accomplished when we partnered with the Sutardja Center at UC Berkeley for the Design + New Ventures program. As part of this initiative, design students teamed up with healthcare entrepreneurs to brainstorm and prototype medical devices over a period of six months. This collaboration resulted in the creation of innovative products that addressed pressing healthcare needs. The design students, who came from UC Berkeley, Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, and UC Davis, worked alongside entrepreneurs-in-residence to develop prototypes that were showcased at the end of the semester. This partnership not only fostered creativity and innovation but also provided valuable insights into the healthcare industry, helping to bridge the gap between design and entrepreneurship.

paraphrase: The pinnacle of life's experiences lies in eagerly anticipated sequels to groundbreaking mobile games, particularly those that have redefined the genre.
