input:
The online registration for the merit based undergraduate courses in University of Delhi has concluded today after it was extended for one day.
New Delhi: The online registration for the merit based undergraduate courses in University of Delhi has concluded today after it was extended for one
continuation: day . The varsity today said that the last date for filling the online form for these subjects was 30 September .It said that there will be no further extension in the last date . The merit based programs in DU comprise BA , BSc , BCom , BBA , BCA and BA ( Honours ) .Delhi University had started the registration gateway for entry to these programs from 15 September . Around 1 . 5 lakh seats are available for entry to several courses in DU .In 2017 , around 87 , 800 students taken admissions in different programs in Delhi University .
paraphrase: The digital registration for merit-based undergraduate programs in the University of Delhi has come to a close today, after being extended for one day. The last date for filling out the online application form was September 30th. The university has confirmed that there will be no further extensions to this deadline. The merit-based programs offered by DU include BA, BSc, BCom, BBA, BCA, and BA (Honours). Registration for these programs opened on September 15th, and around 1.5 lakh seats are available for admission to various courses in DU. In 2017, around 87,800 students were admitted to different programs in Delhi University.

input:
From Pennsylvania to Phuket, Iceland to Indonesia, the options are proliferating.
Eating in Paris once meant meat, cream and cheese. But not anymore. Just ask Portland resident Jennifer Willett, who visited Paris in September for a week
continuation: with her 17 - year - old children . Willett , whose dietary preferences were once limited to organic and locally sourced , has found a different way to travel ." We went to several wonderful vegan and vegetarian establishments , " she said . " We had some amazing dishes and one of the nicest meals was in a small hole - in - the - wall restaurant that was mostly meat and cheese but did one dish that was dairy - free and a vegan cake .The diner was packed . " Just as plates , cups and flatware are built of more than plastic , our plates are no longer covered with just three categories of meal .Our plates now carry all types of foods , particularly when traveling . The plant - based movement remains to expand and affect not only the way we ate but the way we travel , too ." In the past few
paraphrase: From the rolling hills of Pennsylvania to the sun-kissed beaches of Phuket, the options for travelers are multiplying. Gone are the days when eating in Paris meant a meal heavy on meat, cream, and cheese. Today, there are countless vegetarian and vegan options available, even in the City of Light. Portland resident Jennifer Willett recently traveled to Paris with her 17-year-old children and discovered a whole new world of plant-based cuisine. "We visited several incredible vegan and vegetarian restaurants," she said. "We enjoyed some truly delicious dishes, including a dairy-free and vegan cake at a small, unassuming eatery that was otherwise meat and cheese-heavy. The place was packed with happy diners." As travelers continue to seek out new experiences and alternative ways of living, the plant-based movement is transforming not only the way we eat but also the way we travel. No longer are our plates limited to just three categories of meals; instead, they are filled with a diverse array of foods from around the world. Whether you're exploring the urban jungle of Paris or the natural beauty of Iceland, there's never been a more exciting time to venture out and discover the world on a plant-based plate.

input:
BOTTOM LINE: Charlotte hosts Memphis aiming to continue its three-game home winning streak.
The Hornets have gone 17-8 at home at the Spectrum Center. Charlotte averages 44.6 rebounds per game and is 16-5 when winning the
continuation: rebound battle . The Tigers are 2 - 3 against opponents in the Central league .Memphis is the first team to score at least 100 points in seven consecutive games against the Hornets since Utah performed the feat in 14 consecutive games from March 13 , 2004 to Nov . 28 , 2005 . TOP PERFORMERS : LaMelo Ball leads the Hornets scoring 21 points per game .Terry Rozier is averaging 4 . 7 assists over the last 10 games for Charlotte . De ' Anthony Melton leads the Tigers with 4 . 6 assists per game and averages 15 . 8 points .Jonas Valanciunas is averaging 17 . 5 points over the last 10 games for Memphis .
paraphrase:
Charlotte looks to extend its three-game home winning streak when they host Memphis. The Hornets have a strong record at the Spectrum Center, boasting a 17-8 record there. They also excel on the glass, averaging 44.6 rebounds per game, and are 16-5 when winning the rebound battle. The Tigers, on the other hand, have struggled against teams in the Central division, going 2-3 in their last five games against opponents in that league. Memphis is the first team to score at least 100 points in seven consecutive games against the Hornets since Utah achieved the feat in 14 consecutive games from March 13, 2004 to November 28, 2005.
Leading the Hornets in scoring is LaMelo Ball, who averages 21 points per game. Terry Rozier has been a key contributor for Charlotte, averaging 4.7 assists over the last 10 games. De'Anthony Melton leads the Tigers in assists, averaging 4.6 per game, and scores 15.8 points per game on average. Jonas Valanciunas is Memphis' top scorer, averaging 17.5 points over the last 10 games.

input: Northeast Maryland holds many attractions, and cultural opportunities for visitors and residents including the Aberdeen Proving Grounds, the National Aquarium of Baltimore, the Baltimore Inner Harbor and Camden Yards, the Bulle Rock Golf Course, and major medical centers and universities
continuation: . If you select a location in the northeast , you may have a swift drive to one of our nation ' s largest cities : Baltimore .Hampden Farmers ' Market It is currently the oldest and largest farmers ' market in Baltimore and it takes held every Saturday , May - December . The Hampden Farmers ' Market boasts 50 merchants offering things from fresh produce to crabs , with live music and games for kids in the summertime .Eutaw Place , Baltimore , MD Hours : Saturday from 7 : 00 am - 1 : 00 pm Between 2008 - 2012 , 19th - century graffiti was discovered along the walls of a portion of the Baltimore & Potomac ( B & P ) Railroad Tunnel . The B & P was one of the first railroad tunnels built
paraphrase:
Discover the treasures of Northeast Maryland, where a wealth of attractions and cultural experiences await. From the historic Aberdeen Proving Grounds to the bustling Baltimore Inner Harbor and Camden Yards, there's something for everyone to enjoy. Take a quick drive to Baltimore, one of America's largest cities, or explore the scenic Bulle Rock Golf Course.
At the Hampden Farmers' Market, you can savor the freshest produce, seafood, and other local delights every Saturday from May to December. With over 50 merchants, this vibrant market offers a lively atmosphere with live music and entertainment for kids. Located in the heart of Baltimore, the market is a must-visit for any foodie or shopper.
For history buffs, the Baltimore & Potomac Railroad Tunnel is a fascinating find. Discovered between 2008 and 2012, the 19th-century graffiti along the walls of this historic tunnel is a remarkable glimpse into the past. Don't miss this unique opportunity to explore a piece of America's rich railroad heritage.
So why wait? Come and experience the charm of Northeast Maryland for yourself. With its blend of history, culture, and natural beauty, it's an adventure you won't soon forget.
Hours: Saturday, 7:00 am - 1:00 pm

input:
Future historians will probably refer to the first quarter of the 21st century as the Bike Age. Bikes are everywhere  and theres no escaping them.
No one denies that theyre a good idea in terms of reducing pollution
continuation: , but they do , however , interfere with the ability to drink coffee at a green corner caf in the mornings unless one worn a long jacket . And for the young generation , they are slowly becoming a potential danger for conflict with the law .Thats because those who ride them seem to be deaf to everyone elses demands . Copenhagens roads are filled with bicycles in every season .No one carries a coat , though , because cars , vehicles and motorcycles have no place there . The streets of the capital are blocked to vehicles from 7am until 6pm .Inevitably , chaos bursts out . The town is spending a lot of money on green mobility , but it has just one issue : the drivers are not go along with it .And its not just that they ride shabbily . It is actually that the authorities are having
paraphrase: Future historians are likely to refer to the early 21st century as the Bicycle Era. Bicycles are ubiquitous, and it's impossible to escape them. While they are widely recognized for their environmental benefits, they do present some challenges. For instance, they can interfere with the ability to enjoy a morning coffee at a cozy caf, especially for those who don't wear long jackets. Moreover, the younger generation may perceive them as a potential legal issue, as bicycle riders tend to be resistant to others' demands. Copenhagen is a prime example of this trend, with bicycles dominating the streets in every season. However, the absence of cars, vehicles, and motorcycles on the city's roads creates chaos during the morning rush hour, when the streets are blocked to vehicle traffic from 7am to 6pm. Despite the city's investment in green mobility, the drivers are not on board with the initiative, which has led to some awkward encounters. It's not just the riders' poor cycling skills that are the issue; it's also the authorities' inability to win them over.

" In its road car form , the SS is a very aggressive looking car with nice , squared - off edges , so that ' s where the styling for the race car sort of took from , " Eric Warren , president chief of brand content and motorsports relations at Chevrolet , said ." A lot of the iconic Chevy styling elements are also present . . . . That Chevy bow - tie badge will always be at the front of the car , and the Chevy SS emblem will always be there . "He said Chev
paraphrase: On Saturday, Chevrolet unveiled its new SS sedan at Daytona International Speedway, which it will compete in NASCAR races. If NASCAR had not agreed to redesign race cars and make them more relevant to fans, Chevrolet may have pulled out of the sport. The SS will be available to the public later this year. NASCAR tested a prototype SS at Las Vegas Motor Speedway in March, featuring a production-ready chassis and safety features like a roll cage. According to Eric Warren, president and chief of brand content and motorsports relations at Chevrolet, the SS is a boldly styled car with sharp edges, and the race car version took inspiration from its road-going counterpart. continuation: for everything from storm defences to finance and scientific research . It drops sharply by more than a third as a share of national earnings , in large part because of a surge in self - employment .Self - employed persons have to pay income tax on 100 per cent of the money they earn , whereas a corporation paid no corporation tax on its last 300 , 000 of profit . The comparison in contributions from the self - employed and the employed to the UK Treasury is stark : Those who
paraphrase:
ere's a paraphrased version of the input passage:
INPUT: Britons are transferring a whopping 93 billion pounds annually to businesses, equivalent to over 3,500 pounds per household in the UK.
OUTPUT: According to a comprehensive analysis, UK taxpayers are handing over a substantial amount of money to companies through various forms of grants, subsidies, and tax breaks. This amounts to around 1 in 8 of the government's spending going towards supporting businesses, as revealed by a report by the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development. Moreover, the study found that individuals contribute only 33% of national earnings in taxes, the lowest among 33 OECD member countries. This is largely due to the growing number of self-employed individuals who have to pay income tax on all their earnings, whereas corporations only pay taxes on their profits above 300,000 pounds. The comparison between the contributions from self-employed individuals and employed workers to the UK Treasury is striking, with the former paying significantly more in taxes.

input:
A video from conservative activist James O'Keefe sparked this most recent effort to strip NPR of public funding.
Washington (CNN) -- The House of Representatives passed legislation Thursday that would bar federal funding for National Public Radio -- a longtime target of conservatives irritated
continuation: by its programming , but the bill is expected to be watered down before it hits the president ' s desk . The amendment to the federal budget would ban federal grants to NPR and public broadcasters " for any purpose . "It would also restrict funding of federal money to other radio and radio broadcasters " operated or managed by any Federal , State , or local government " and in excess of 15 % of their total income . House leaders say the bill , which passed 238 - 187 , would saving federal taxpayers nearly $ 440 million over five weeks .But others have a more dire opinion of the impact of the proposal : At least 1 , 000 jobs might be removed , think followers of public broadcasting . But there is nothing chance the bill will become law .A variant of it was v
paraphrase:
A recent undercover video by conservative activist James O'Keefe has ignited renewed calls to defund National Public Radio (NPR).
In a surprising turn of events, the House of Representatives passed a bill on Thursday that would strip NPR of federal funding. The legislation, which passed 238-187, aims to ban federal grants to NPR and other public broadcasters for any purpose, as well as restrict funding for radio and radio broadcasters operated or managed by any federal, state, or local government, and exceeding 15% of their total income. House leaders claim that the bill would save federal taxpayers nearly $440 million over five years. However, critics of the proposal warn that it could result in the loss of at least 1,000 jobs in the public broadcasting industry. Despite these concerns, it is uncertain whether the bill will become law, as a similar version of it has been vetoed in the past.

input:
AN award-winning taxidermist from North Yorkshire is bringing a long-lost bird back from extinction  at least in model form.

continuation: until September 29 . This is the latest of a string of new shows following a successful season for the museum which saw the first - ever Chicory Flower Festival draw thousands of visitors to the town .Earlier this year they placed on the first Ivy celebration where they learned that Kendal is in reality one of only three places in the nation where the Ivy plant can develop . The exhibition , which is free , is being held in partnership with the East Lothian Natural History Museum .It will exhibit more than 40 models of birds , mostly extinct ones , from a variety of sources , notably the collection of Cumbrian taxidermist Carl Church , and a visiting glass eye exhibit from the Creature Effects workshop in Scotland . Museum manager Brian Marshall says : Weve recently had some newest items , notably a pair of Dodo feet , which we were able to
paraphrase: Renowned North Yorkshire taxidermist Carl Church is set to showcase his impressive creations at the Great Dodo Exhibition at Kendal Museum from July 4th to September 29th. This exhibition follows a successful season for the museum, which saw the first-ever Chicory Flower Festival attract large crowds to the town. Earlier this year, they hosted the first Ivy celebration, where they discovered that Kendal is one of only three places in the country where the Ivy plant can grow. The exhibition, which is free, is a collaboration with the East Lothian Natural History Museum and will feature over 40 models of extinct birds, including those from Church's extensive collection and a visiting glass eye exhibit from Scotland's Creature Effects workshop. Museum manager Brian Marshall remarks, "We've recently acquired some new additions, including a pair of Dodo feet, which we are eager to display."

input: DEEP in the dark depths of the ocean, there are dragons. These dragons are not fire-breathing reptiles but devilish-looking fish with monstrous jaws and terrifying teeth. And their fire is a beam of red light that shines from a
continuation: small bulb - like organ in the corner of their mouths . The chin - jabber or bioluminescent deep - ocean angler , _ Lantern fish _ ( _ Myctophum _ sp . )Vital to most life in the ocean , phytoplankton blooms occur when the presence of nutrients and the availability of sunlight trigger a sudden growth in the population of phytoplankton . They are bright red and sometimes appear like the globes of fruit that include canned preserves ._ Anthopleura elegantissima _ is another jellyfish with bioluminescent organs . Besides using bioluminescence to lure prey , luminous creatures can shield themselves .When attacked by a predator , they simply flicker . It ' s like drop the bedclothes on the floor when someone
paraphrase: Deep within the mysterious depths of the ocean, there lurk dragons. Unlike the fire-breathing reptiles of legend, these dragons are aquatic creatures with grotesque mouths full of razor-sharp teeth. Their fiery breath emits a crimson glow from a small organ in the corner of their mouths. The chin-jabber, or bioluminescent deep-ocean anglerfish, is a vital component of the ocean's ecosystem. As the presence of nutrients and sunlight increases, phytoplankton populations suddenly bloom, illuminating the dark waters like lanterns. The anthopleura elegantissima jellyfish, with its bioluminescent organs, is another creature that uses this ability to lure prey and defend itself. When threatened, these creatures can simply flicker or drop their bioluminescence, making them nearly invisible to predators.

Jude in the early 1980s , he was frequently sexually abused by Monsignor William J . Lynn , the parish priest who is accused of transferring or assigning dozens of priests to new congregations while they stayed under state and / or diocesan instructions to remain away from children . The civil lawsuit asserts that in 1983 , while 12 , Lynn invited Doe and another altar child to his apartment for a sleepover .After the boys got into bed , Lynn allegedly
paraphrase: A man from Arizona filed a lawsuit against the Archdiocese of Philadelphia on Monday, claiming church officials protected a sexually abusive priest who he says molested him at his Northeast Philadelphia parish and caused him years of mental health problems. The man, identified only by a pseudonym, was born in 1971 and attended St. Jude School and St. Jude Parish in the Germantown section of Philadelphia. He frequently attended the parish throughout his childhood and early adulthood, according to the lawsuit. The man alleges that while he was an altar server at St. Jude in the early 1980s, he was repeatedly sexually abused by Monsignor William J. Lynn, the parish priest who is accused of transferring or assigning dozens of priests to new congregations while they were under state and diocesan restrictions to avoid contact with children. The civil lawsuit asserts that in 1983, when he was 12, Lynn invited the man and another altar server to spend the night at his apartment. After the boys went to bed, Lynn allegedly engaged in sexual misconduct with them.

Can Grizzlies get city's trust back like Memphis basketball, football?
Memphis football and basketball have regained the city's trust. Can Grizzlies do the same?
Memphis athletic director Tom Bowen stood along the sideline at Liberty Bowl Memorial Stadium taking in
continuation: the scene with an anxious look . The Memphis football team was trailing Houston by 18 points in the third quarter .A goal line stand was up next . If the Grizzlies had failed to make the NCAA finals , what would he have to say to Memphis supporters who expected more ?How could he understand such a year ? The next year , when the Tigers were setting to make their first trip to the Cotton Bowl Classic , Bowen was on the field inside the locker hall in Dallas with a microphone in front of him .He was joined by Memphis football coach Mike Norvell , and he faced reporters who sought to see if his statement in 2016 was sincere . " I am confident and certain that we will not letting our city down , " Bowen said at the press conference ." We will not letting you down . "
paraphrase:
Can Grizzlies win back the city's trust like Memphis basketball and football?
Memphis athletic director Tom Bowen watched anxiously as the Grizzlies struggled on the field, their chances of making the NCAA finals looking grim. If they failed, he would have to explain to passionate fans why their expectations had not been met. A year later, he faced reporters again, this time in Dallas, where the Tigers were preparing to play in the Cotton Bowl Classic. Bowen remained confident, insisting that the team would not let the city down.

Sutton Plant in Wilmington, North Carolina. The Charlotte Observer, in an editorial on August 30, brought attention to the pressing issue of major waterways facing a raw sewage crisis. Meanwhile, the Wetsuweten Nation in British Columbia has been fiercely campaigning to halt the development of a fracked gas pipeline that would traverse its unceded territory. TC Energy, the company behind the project, has been engaging in negotiations and, more recently, arrests, but the provincial government has remained eerily quiet on the matter. The fate of the project will soon be decided by the B.C. Supreme Court. In a separate development, the Trump administration's proposal to lift the 2015 restriction on methane venting and flaring from petroleum and gas wells has sparked a legal showdown in Canada.

input: Amid all the handwringing over the cast exodus at SNL is the minor detail of how much, even with the ensemble at so-called full strength, the jokes land like water dripping from a faucet.
continuation: Only in an alternate universe does SNL with its weekly average of fewer than eight laughs per episode , in my estimation have any right to exist . With 34 decades on the air and a multi - platform reach , the program looks to exist in a Nielsen bubble , proving yet again that audiences voting with their remotes .Cast and crew members can always find solace in knowing that the program SNL has produced a legacy of material to one day be picked apart by discerning fans . Consider the 1997 - 98 season .The weekly average of laughs that year was the lowest I have ever recorded and the lowest it has ever been since . The season was legendary .Two of its episodes Animal House and JFK were listed among the 20 best - ever . If we were to compile a list of SNL classics from 1
paraphrase: Despite the numerous concerns about the departure of SNL cast members, it's worth noting that even with the ensemble at full strength, the jokes often fall flat like water dripping from a faucet. In an alternate universe, SNL's consistent average of fewer than eight laughs per episode could be overlooked, but in reality, the program seems to exist in a Nielsen bubble, with audiences voting with their remotes. However, the show's long-running legacy of material provides comfort to cast and crew members, who can take solace in the fact that their work will be picked apart by discerning fans in the future. For instance, the 1997-1998 season, which saw the lowest weekly average of laughs in SNL history, is often cited as one of the show's best, with two episodes, "Animal House" and "JFK," ranking among the top 20 episodes of all time.

Vodafone says any move by Britain to
paraphrase: Vodafone warns that any ban on Huawei equipment in UK 5G networks would result in significant financial losses and delayed rollout. The company estimates that such a move would cost hundreds of millions of pounds and slow down the deployment of new technology. The National Cyber Security Center is currently reviewing the safety of using Huawei equipment, following the recent security regulations lifted on Hong Kong. Vodafone, along with other networks, relies on Huawei as a trusted provider, and the potential threat to their relationship raises concerns about the security of their networks.

input: When the Elsas and Supermen trick-or-treat their way to our doorsteps next week, some will be toting an orange box with the word UNICEF on it. Since 1950, four years after the organization was founded
continuation: , UNICEF has collected donations through its Halloween fundraiser . Thirty - five percent of the monies collected is utilized to fulfill the groups own Trick or Treat for UNICEF project , which is aiming at youth in Africa , Asia , Europe , and Latin America who fight to access schooling , safe water , and the fundamental necessities of life .The rest of the funds are distributed to regional organisations for specific purposes , notably behavioral health programs , parenting seminars , and sports . Weve all donated to charity , and we just found this campaign when we were looking at UNICEFs portal , says Father and Daughter President and CEO Larry Schneider .Whats really neat about this is that the kids have control over where the money goesthey decide . Schneider says that the company is glad to be part of this project , particularly because the campaign not only works
paraphrase: When the trick-or-treaters arrive next week, some will be carrying a distinctive orange box with the UNICEF logo. Since 1950, UNICEF has been collecting donations through its Halloween fundraiser, with 35% of the funds going towards its own 'Trick or Treat for UNICEF' project, which aims to provide essential resources such as education, safe water, and basic necessities to youth in Africa, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. The remaining funds are distributed to local organizations for various purposes, including mental health programs, parenting seminars, and sports initiatives. As a proud supporter of charitable causes, I recently discovered this campaign while exploring UNICEF's website. According to Father and Daughter President and CEO Larry Schneider, the campaign is unique because the children have a say in where the money goes - they get to decide. Schneider is delighted to be a part of this project, which not only helps those in need but also teaches children the value of giving back.

President Donald Trump is planning to return to Texas next month to raise money for his re-election campaign, according to people familiar with his plans.
Trump has scheduled fundraisers on April 10 in Houston and San Antonio, according to those sources. Asked
continuation: about Trump ' s plans , the White House did not directly answer . " The president is thankful to have the backing of the Lone Star State , where he has numerous followers and many amazing friends , " news secretary Sarah Sanders told in a statement ." As we often do , we will announce any and all events when they are finalized . " Both fundraisers will be shut to the public , guests said .Trump and his team are impatient to start raising funding for his 2020 re - election effort . So far , the president has not done any visits outside of Washington since taking office in 2017 and has done only a handful of activities in his home state .In 2018 , Trump ' s fundraising was disrupted because he spending a majority of the month in Washington and did not visit for any big events . Trump is making a conscious effort to
paraphrase: President Donald Trump is set to return to Texas in April to host fundraisers for his re-election campaign, according to sources close to his plans. The events, scheduled for April 10 in Houston and San Antonio, will be closed to the public, with Trump and his team eager to begin fundraising for his 2020 campaign. While the White House declined to directly address Trump's plans, press secretary Sarah Sanders released a statement expressing the president's gratitude for the support of the Lone Star State, where he has a strong following and many loyal friends. Sanders added that more information on the events would be shared when available. This marks a departure from Trump's previous activities in Washington, where he has spent most of his time since taking office in 2017, and a handful of events in his home state. In 2018, Trump's fundraising efforts were hampered due to his extended stay in the nation's capital. Now, he is making a conscious effort to reach out to supporters across the country.

It's been a hellish year for music. Rick Parfitt died the day before (December 24). So many legends have passed away this year  from David Bowie to Prince to Leonard Cohen to Glenn Frey.
When I was in school,
continuation: we had this assignment . In the upper - year sociology class , I had to pick a rock star from one of the rock ' n ' roll icons of the late twentieth century .My first choice was Jimi Hendrix . I penned an essay , detailing how he was a cultural icon because his guitar solos were so intricate that they were virtually unfathomable .But he gave us a glimpse of his talent by recording them in small fragments . Jimi Hendrix wasn ' t your typical rock star .He performed in a recording studio in New York for less than a year in 1966 , and death immediately after in a London hotel room . He revolutionized guitar recording .I still have my article , and that ' s not a joke the paper was done in crayon , so it looks like it was scribbled on a roads billboard . I used to think that composing my
paraphrase:
It has been a difficult year for the music industry, with the passing of several legendary artists. Rick Parfitt's death on December 24th was a particularly hard blow. This year has seen the loss of many icons, including David Bowie, Prince, Leonard Cohen, and Glenn Frey.
In my high school days, I had a assignment in my upper-year sociology class where I had to choose a rock star from one of the most influential musicians of the late 20th century. My first choice was Jimi Hendrix. I wrote an essay detailing how his intricate guitar solos made him a cultural icon. Although he only recorded a small portion of his solos, they were so impressive that they were nearly impossible to comprehend. Hendrix was not your typical rock star. He spent only a year recording in a New York studio in 1966 before his untimely death in a London hotel room. He revolutionized the way guitar was recorded, and I still have my handwritten essay, which was done in crayon and looks like it was scribbled on a billboard. I used to think that writing an essay about Jimi Hendrix was a daunting task, but it was actually quite enjoyable.

The Seattle area has a new biotechnology company -- and this one is going to try attacking cancer by examining antibodies instead of tumors.
Johnny Stine, founder and chief scientist of the new Spaltudaq Corp., said the approach, if it
continuation: works , might one day become the heart of a future biopharmaceutical sector in King County . The corporation , financed with $ 600 , 000 , will start human tests of the cancer - fighting antibodies in June .The hope is that the company will create one or more effective cancer medicines within three years . The corporation has raised the first $ 500 , 000 to launch experiments on a herpes disease , which Stine said has a very good shot of killing disease .For Stine , the enterprise became out of an 18 - month journey that began at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center . Cancer - controlling drugs of the future could rely on a new weapon : the bodies ' s own immune system , to attack tumors .In the 1960s , scientists originally realized that proteins called
paraphrase: A new biotechnology firm in the Seattle area, Spaltudaq Corp., is poised to revolutionize cancer treatment by focusing on antibodies rather than tumors. Founder and chief scientist Johnny Stine believes this innovative approach could pave the way for a future biopharmaceutical sector in King County. The company, which has secured $600,000 in funding, will begin human trials of its cancer-fighting antibodies in June, with the goal of developing effective cancer medicines within three years. Spaltudaq Corp. has already raised the first $500,000 to launch experiments on a herpes disease, which Stine believes has a high potential for success. This venture is the culmination of an 18-month journey that began at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, where Stine discovered the potential of harnessing the body's immune system to attack tumors. Cancer drugs of the future may rely on this novel weapon, one that could significantly improve cancer treatment outcomes.

input: Asked where they had their most memorable campus experiences, Dartmouth students polled back when I was an undergraduate most frequently identified the Hopkins Center for the Arts. It is certainly the site I would have identified if asked. I still recall, to take just one example

paraphrase: When asked about their most memorable campus experiences, Dartmouth students frequently cited the Hopkins Center for the Arts, which is also the location I would have chosen. From the ornate wooden support pillars in the Kroll Performance Hall to the cozy bookstalls located within the Hanover Malls walkway, every aspect of the building's design is carefully considered and executed. The Hopkins Center's impressive acoustics, spacious seating, and seamless integration of different elements make it a true masterpiece of Dartmouth's built environment. The college's esteemed alumni represent all seven of the Arts and Sciences colleges.

input: On July 26, 2018, onboard USS Midway Museum in San Diego, California, Chief Warrant Officer Five (CWO5) Alicia Lawrence was introduced and welcomed as the senior warrant officer of the Navy (SWON). She assumed the prestigious title and
continuation: role of SWON from CWO5 David Westrick who served in that position since 2012 . CWO5 Westrick sat as SWON during a period of transformation and transition for the Chief Warrant Officer Community and will be retiring from active duty on 31 July 2018 .CWO5 Westrick took the SWON name as a re - activation of the office and position . CWO5 Lawrence , a 31 - month Navy veteran , was born in Boston and is a alumnus of Massachusetts Institute of Technology ( MIT ) with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering .Her debut assignment was to U . S . Naval Ship Repair Facility & Japan Regional Maintenance Center ( SRF & JRMC ) in Yokosuka , Japan , where she served as a Warrant Officer Second Class (
paraphrase: On July 26, 2018, at the USS Midway Museum in San Diego, California, Chief Warrant Officer Five (CWO5) Alicia Lawrence was introduced and welcomed as the Navy's Senior Warrant Officer (SWON). She succeeded CWO5 David Westrick, who held the position since 2012, and will be retiring from active duty on July 31, 2018. Westrick previously reactivated the office and position of SWON. Lawrence, a 31-month Navy veteran from Boston, graduated from Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering. Her first assignment was to the U.S. Naval Ship Repair Facility & Japan Regional Maintenance Center (SRF & JRMC) in Yokosuka, Japan, where she served as a Warrant Officer Second Class.

The Football Association charged him for the incident, where he kicked a ball boy. Hazard was already facing a three-match automatic suspension, but the new charges might result in an extended ban. A disciplinary hearing is scheduled for March 20, and a decision is not expected before then. As a result, Hazard will miss the upcoming Premier League match against Fulham and the first leg of Chelsea's Europa League last-16 tie against Sparta Prague. Hazard's stunning 4-0 loss at Arsenal in the League Cup quarterfinals proved to be the final nail in the coffin for the Chelsea winger, as he was sent off for the first time in his career after the incident with the ball boy.

input: NAFTA's environmental watchdog voted unanimously not to investigate oil sands tailings ponds pollution, despite recommendations from staff to launch a probe. It's the third time a NAFTA probe has been blocked by the Canadian government, pending a decision on Canada's controversial
continuation: climate change legislation . Ottawa blocks investigations into oil sands contamination Nearly a years ago the Canadian cabinet suggested a NAFTA watchdog to ensure that international commerce did not harm the environment .A NAFTA report on petroleum sands tailings dams tells contamination is a risk to " indigenous peoples , fish and wildlife , and municipal water supplies . " But now Canada has used its power as the host government to block a NAFTA probe into those pollution issues , and its the third time it has happened .Last week the Commission for Environmental Cooperation ( CEC ) , the watchdog created in the North American Free Trade Agreement ( NAFTA ) , unanimously voting not to examine petroleum sands tailings ponds pollution . Despite a proposal from the CECs environmental staff to launch a investigation , the commissions
paraphrase: The NAFTA environmental watchdog has rejected a proposal to investigate pollution from oil sands tailings ponds, marking the third time the Canadian government has blocked a probe through its power as host country. The decision was made despite recommendations from the watchdog's environmental staff to launch an investigation into the contamination risks to indigenous communities, fish, and wildlife, as well as municipal water supplies. The Commission for Environmental Cooperation (CEC), the NAFTA-mandated watchdog, unanimously voted against examining the pollution issues, highlighting the Canadian government's continued efforts to avoid scrutiny of its environmental record under the trade agreement.

input:
Dinshaw Billimoria and Sulochana in Ardeshir Iranis Heer Ranjha made in 1929. Photo: Courtesy Donnabelle Garga.
India might be celebrating the centenary of cinema this year,
continuation: but the first Indian talkie , Heer Ranjha ( 1929 ) , continues a mystery . No footage or even stills of the film have remained , even though it received an honorable mention at the Venice Film Festival and helped boost the career of Devika Rani and Noorjehan .The legacy of this key work by Ardeshir Irani is elusivethe secrets around Heer Ranjha have expanded , not receded , in the last 90 years . It was the first Indian sound film , and the first to move to Italy .No one remembers it , and yet it paved the way for todays Bollywood , says Donnabelle Garga , who runs a production company in Mumbai named Studio Garga . It was initially reported in The Film Weekly of India that Heer Ranjha was one of the most
paraphrase: In 1929, filmmaker Ardeshir Irani created the iconic movie "Heer Ranjha," which was a milestone in Indian cinema's history. Despite its significance, little is known about the film, including any footage or stills from it. The movie received an honorable mention at the Venice Film Festival and marked the beginning of the illustrious careers of Devika Rani and Noorjehan. However, the legacy of this pioneering work by Irani remains shrouded in mystery, with the secrets surrounding it growing rather than fading over time. It was India's first sound film and the first to be shot in Italy, and yet, it remains largely forgotten. According to Donnabelle Garga, a film producer from Mumbai who runs Studio Garga, the lack of knowledge about Heer Ranjha has not diminished its impact on modern Bollywood. In fact, it paved the way for the industry's current success. Despite this, no one remembers the film, highlighting the elusive nature of its legacy.

input:
A RADICAL shake-up, including a new school in Basingstoke, may be necessary to combat poor exam results, the deputy leader of the borough council believes.
Councillor Ranil Jayawardena says too many children in
continuation: Basingstoke and Deane are being failed by the present education system . He has called for a liberal shake - up to include altering the age at which GCSE and A - levels are took by teenagers to tackle what he called the present crisis .The Tory councillor said : We are currently failing too several young people through our education system . Too several young people in Basingstoke are not being educated well enough to succeed in adult life .I believe that the present crisis is the result of introducing GCSEs and A - grades at the wrong age and too soon . It is completely wrong that our education system sees 15 and 16 - year - olds take GCSEs , with such a high percentage of the young people not passing .It is also wrong that 17 and 18 - year - olds take A - grades so early
paraphrase:
To address the poor exam results in Basingstoke, a significant overhaul of the education system may be necessary, according to the deputy leader of the borough council, Councillor Ranil Jayawardena. He believes that the current system is failing too many young people, as they are not being adequately prepared for success in adulthood. Jayawardena proposes altering the age at which GCSEs and A-levels are taken by teenagers to tackle the crisis. He argues that introducing these exams at a too early age has led to a high percentage of students not passing.
In Jayawardena's view, the current education system is flawed as it sees 15 and 16-year-olds taking GCSEs, which can hinder their ability to succeed. He also believes that taking A-levels too early can have a negative impact on a student's academic performance. By implementing this change, Jayawardena hopes to provide a better foundation for young people in Basingstoke to excel in their academic pursuits.

input:
Catholic Charities Southern Maryland Food Bank says it is in desperate need of pasta, rice, canned food and other dry goods.
A food bank in Southern Maryland that supplies many smaller food pantries and charities was gratified to get some donations following a
continuation: recent public appeal , but is already looking for food donations . Catholic Charities Southern Maryland Food Bank , in La Plata , says it is in frantic need of pasta , wheat , canned food and other dry supplies .It had collected $ 60 , 000 in money gifts from several large firms and other donations but has been receiving few gifts of food , authorities said . As recently as last Thursday , the food bank had been receiving cans of food in half - pint or smaller sizes , leading to many being thrown out .In the three nights before Christmas , the food bank gave away 40 , 000 lbs of food to several meal pantries and similar organizations . This weekend , the food bank will donate food again to about 40 smaller institutions , who in turn deliver it to the needy , said Adrienne Garceau , spokeswoman for
paraphrase: Catholic Charities Southern Maryland Food Bank is urgently in need of various dry goods such as pasta, rice, and canned food, following a recent appeal for donations. Despite receiving financial gifts from several large firms and other donations, the food bank has been receiving limited amounts of food donations, according to authorities. In fact, the food bank had to throw out many cans of food in half-pint or smaller sizes due to the lack of larger sizes. To address the need, the food bank will be donating food to approximately 40 smaller institutions this weekend, which will then distribute the food to those in need. Spokeswoman Adrienne Garceau emphasized the importance of continued donations to support the food bank's efforts in providing food to those who are struggling.

input: The vast majority of the 45 Amazon.com customers who have reviewed Bloomberg Businessweek writer Brad Stones new book, The Everything Store: Jeff Bezos and the Age of Amazon, gave it five stars. Lone among them, however, is a
continuation: prolific but definitely negative reviewer named K . McGlothen . McGlothen has apparently been left bad reviews about 15 novels a week since July 2011 , most of them for non - fiction business and finance literature .( If you want to see what were speaking about , click here . ) Weve reached out to Stone and Amazon for comment , but have yet to hear back .Of course , critics from Amazon readers have never been the most accurate guides to quality . Some critics , in fact , even in non - fiction , merely parrot the PR from the publisher or the writer .But thats a good thing , right ? Its not as though authors were somehow more honest when Amazon was not in the business of releasing reviews .Stones book , which chronicles the emergence of Amazon from a nascent internet bookseller to the biggest corporation in
paraphrase: The vast majority of Amazon.com customers who have reviewed Brad Stone's book, The Everything Store: Jeff Bezos and the Age of Amazon, have given it a perfect five-star rating. However, one notable exception is K. McGlothen, who has left a series of scathing reviews on various non-fiction business and finance literature books since July 2011. While some reviewers on Amazon may not always provide the most accurate assessments of quality, Stone's book, which chronicles Amazon's evolution from a fledgling internet bookseller to the world's largest corporation, has received widespread acclaim. Despite efforts to obtain comment from Stone and Amazon, we have yet to hear back. While some may argue that authors are more honest when publishers and writers are not involved in the review process, it is clear that Stone's book has struck a chord with many readers.

input:
A new album is set for release later this year.
TLC have announced their first ever UK show, taking to Londons Koko on May 9. Tickets will be on sale this Friday (March 24).
Since the death of
continuation: Lisa Left Eye Lopes in 2002 , TLC have played a handful of one - off gigs at Coachella and other festivals , notably with surviving member Rozonda Chilli Thomas joining Nelly and Flo Rida onstage at the 2016 MTV VMAs . The pair are also set to return to music in May , when theyll debut their debut album in 15 decades , TLC .The tracklist for the album includes first song Way Back , which dropped previous this week ( March 20 ) . The follow - up to their final release 3D , TLC features production from Pharrell Williams , Salaam Remi , Dallas Austin , Dr . Luke , Trevor McNevan , Dallas Austin , Shondrae Crawford , Chase & Chris , Wylid and Sean Garrett .
paraphrase: TLC is gearing up to release their highly anticipated new album later this year. In a thrilling announcement, the group has confirmed their first-ever UK concert at London's prestigious Koko venue on May 9. Ticket sales will begin this Friday, March 24. Since the untimely passing of Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes in 2002, TLC has performed sporadically at festivals like Coachella, with surviving member Rozonda "Chilli" Thomas joining forces with Nelly and Flo Rida at the 2016 MTV VMAs. The duo is now set to make a triumphant return to the music scene with their long-awaited debut album in 15 years, titled TLC. The album features an impressive lineup of producers, including Pharrell Williams, Salaam Remi, Dallas Austin, Dr. Luke, Trevor McNevan, Dallas Austin, Shondrae Crawford, Chase & Chris, Wylid, and Sean Garrett. Fans are eagerly awaiting the release of the album's lead single, "Way Back," which dropped earlier this week on March 20.

input:
WASHINGTON  Republican David Yancey won a drawing to break a tie in the disputed 94th District race in Newport News Thursday however his opponent is expected to challenge the decision, possibly seeking yet another recount.
Control of the House of Delegates is
continuation: in the balance with Democrats one seat away from broken Republican control of the chamber . Rocky Holcomb , Democratic Delegate for the 94th District , released the following statement .There is zero question that I won the 94th District . A botched process , intimidation and voter suppression at the polls clearly flipped the race in favor of my opponent .For the Commonwealth of Virginia to be governed by politicians it would be best for Virginians to elect , the election of 94th District must be fixed , and the winner must be elected .
paraphrase: Republican David Yancey has emerged victorious in the tightly contested 94th District race in Newport News, according to a drawing held on Thursday. However, his opponent, Democrat Rocky Holcomb, has vowed to challenge the decision, possibly leading to yet another recount. With the control of the House of Delegates hanging in the balance, Democrats are now just one seat away from breaking the Republican Party's hold on the chamber. Holcomb released a statement expressing his belief that he won the election, citing concerns over a "botched process," intimidation, and voter suppression at the polls. He emphasized the importance of ensuring that the Commonwealth of Virginia is governed by elected officials, and called for the election in the 94th District to be rectified and the true winner to be elected.

input: WASHINGTON  The professions expected to show one of the biggest job growth rates in 2017 and the largest growth in sheer number of jobs will be trade skills, according to a year-end report from CareerBuilder and labor market data provider Emsi.
continuation: In 2016 , about one in five hire managers reported problems filling job openings , according to the CareerBuilder poll . Employment outlooks for industrial and medical care professionals are bright in 2017 , according to the poll .About two - thirds of employers plan to addition new workers , according to CareerBuilder . Retail , hospitality , human resources and business operations are expected to indicate the biggest gains in 2017 as employers bring on seasonal workers and those forging expansion planning , according to the poll .CareerBuilder , which has nearly 300 , 000 employers as customers , reported that 44 percent of hiring executives intend to hire seasonal workers for the 2016 holiday season . This is down from 47 percent in 2015 , the poll noted .A separate Career
paraphrase: The upcoming year is expected to bring significant job growth in various fields, particularly trade skills, according to a recent report by CareerBuilder and labor market data provider Emsi. In 2016, one in five hiring managers encountered difficulties filling job openings, as revealed in a CareerBuilder poll. The employment outlook for industrial and medical care professionals looks promising in 2017, with two-thirds of employers planning to add new workers. Retail, hospitality, human resources, and business operations are expected to experience significant gains in 2017, as employers prepare for the holiday season and expansion plans. In fact, 44% of hiring executives surveyed by CareerBuilder intend to hire seasonal workers for the 2016 holiday season, down from 47% in 2015.

input:
Noah Cyrus had no desire to follow her sister Miley Cyrus into a pop music as a child because she was so focused on becoming an equestrian.
In addition to acting in several TV shows, the 18-year-old star was
continuation: also signed up as a model when she was six - years - old . In 2016 , she took a role in rom - com " Every Day " , but didn ' t release any music until she signed a deal with her sister ' s coach , Brand Sense .During an interview with the ' The Elvis Duran Show ' on Tuesday ( 24Jul18 ) , she described not wanting to pursue music for so long , insisting she just wanted to be a horse - rider . " I never , ever wanted to be an musician , " she described ." I was fascinated with horses and loved it and I was riding and competing . It was something that I wanted to do ." I wanted to be an equestrian and I just never wanted to be an musician . I mean , I kind of thought it was impossible ( but I didn ' t want to do music ) . "Noah was already
paraphrase: As a young girl, Noah Cyrus had no interest in following in her sister Miley's footsteps in the pop music industry. Instead, she was fixated on becoming an equestrian, devoting herself to horse riding and competition. At just six years old, she was signed up as a model, and by 2016, she had landed a role in the romantic comedy "Every Day." However, it wasn't until she signed with her sister's coach, Brand Sense, that she began to explore music. During an interview with "The Elvis Duran Show," Noah revealed that she never wanted to pursue music, instead, her passion lies in horses and equestrianism. "I never wanted to be a musician," she expressed. "I was fascinated with horses and loved it, and I was riding and competing. It was something I wanted to do." Despite her initial reservations, Noah eventually began to embrace her musical talents, but her love for horses remains a significant part of her identity.

input:
Taipei Mayor Ko Wen-je, center, shakes hands with temple-goers during a visit to the Taipei Songshan Fengtian Temple yesterday, the second day of the Lunar New Year holiday.
Taipei Mayor Ko Wen-je
continuation: ( ) yesterday visited Songshan Fengtian Temple ( ) , the oldest temple in Taipei , on the second day of the Lunar New Year holiday . Ko and his wife Wu Chi - ling ( ) asked temple - goers to pray for blessings for Taiwan and the nations recovery from the COVID - 19 pandemic .Afterward , they stayed to greet the worshippers and take a mandarin orange ( ) tying to a wishing stick , a New Year custom . Ko also gave a Lunar New Year text to the temples worshippers via his Facebook page .Every year , this place , which has stood the test of time , becomes more and more extraordinary , Ko wrote . The individuals who
paraphrase: Taipei Mayor Ko Wen-je paid a visit to the historic Taipei Songshan Fengtian Temple on the second day of the Lunar New Year celebrations, accompanied by his wife Wu Chi-ling. As they entered the temple, they asked the devotees to offer prayers for the well-being of Taiwan and the global recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. Following the prayer session, they mingled with the worshippers and participated in the traditional custom of tying mandarin oranges to wishing sticks, symbolizing good luck and prosperity in the new year. Mayor Ko also shared a heartfelt Lunar New Year message with the temple devotees through his Facebook page, highlighting the temple's enduring significance and the growing sense of community spirit. "As time goes by, this place, which has stood the test of time, becomes more extraordinary," he wrote. "Its people, likewise, are becoming more and more remarkable, bringing hope and inspiration to us all."

input:
Cecil Brunsons life in the air  and the guile he showed in the Vietnam War  will be honored Saturday at the Tennessee Aviation Hall of Fame.
Growing up in Memphis, Lt. Col. Cecil Brunson only
continuation: wanted to be a Tuskegee Airman . Brunson , who received the Congressional Medal of Honor , the Navy Cross and Silver Star , among various other honors , died at his home in Knoxville on April 15 .He was 91 . Famous for escaping multiple enemy ambushes , Brunson became a role model , an inspiration for those who grew up in segregated neighborhoods , and one of the best pilots in the United States .The Tennessee Aviation Hall of Fame will induct Brunson Saturday , recognizing him for his brave deeds in Vietnam and for his dedication to the creation of the Tennessee State Museum . The gala will be place at the Shelby Farms Shelby House in Germantown ." Cecil was a hero . There was no doubt about that , " added Bill Beasley , a Knoxville attorney who has known Brunson for
paraphrase: Lieutenant Colonel Cecil Brunson's remarkable life and military achievements will be recognized on Saturday at the Tennessee Aviation Hall of Fame. Growing up in Memphis, Brunson dreamed of joining the prestigious Tuskegee Airmen. Throughout his distinguished career, he received numerous accolades, including the Congressional Medal of Honor, the Navy Cross, and the Silver Star. Brunson passed away at his home in Knoxville on April 15 at the age of 91, leaving behind a legacy of bravery and inspiration. His heroics in Vietnam, including evading multiple enemy ambushes, earned him the admiration of his peers and the respect of those who grew up in segregated neighborhoods. The Tennessee Aviation Hall of Fame will induct Brunson on Saturday, honoring his courage and commitment to the creation of the Tennessee State Museum. The ceremony will take place at the Shelby Farms Shelby House in Germantown. "Cecil was a true hero, there's no doubt about it," said Bill Beasley, a Knoxville attorney who has known Brunson for years.

input:
Thirty-four states  half with Republican governor  have seized upon the massive infusion of Medicaid expansion revenue.
Imagine an 18 wheeler pulling up to one of the five Mississippi River bridges and dumping 45 crates 4 feet tall and of $100 bills
continuation: nearly $ 1 billion in all . Thats what Mississippi received under the Affordable Care Act in federal Medicaid dollars in 2015 , by far its biggest one - year infusion of federal cash in its history .When hospitals and nursing families complain about federal health insurance program cuts , this might be why . The HHS Office of Inspector General ( OIG ) investigated issues in medical review in Mississippi in the mid of last year .One concern : Doctors said the state doesnt assign the appropriate reviews for problems revealed in their records , making it difficult to make excellent choices about patient care , OIG noted . Hospitals in southern and rural states have had difficulties when nursing families take over and have skimpy caring and record kept , which can lead to patient health issues .Medicaid also
paraphrase: At least 34 states have taken advantage of the significant increase in Medicaid expansion funding. Visualize an 18-wheeler unloading 45 tall and $100 bills crates worth nearly $1 billion at one of the five Mississippi River bridges. This is the amount Mississippi received in federal Medicaid dollars in 2015, its largest single year infusion of federal funds in history. When healthcare providers and families complain about cuts to the federal health insurance program, this may be why. The HHS Office of Inspector General (OIG) investigated issues in medical review in Mississippi in the middle of last year. One concern is that the state is not assigning appropriate reviews for problems revealed in medical records, making it challenging to make informed decisions about patient care, according to the OIG. Southern and rural hospitals have faced difficulties when nursing families take over and provide inadequate care, leading to patient health issues. Medicaid also faces challenges in these areas.

input:
It's hard not to be charmed by his new perkier outlook on life.
Married life may have mellowed British wind-up merchant Example in recent years, but when you're a popstar it must be hard not to divulge
continuation: all your dirty little secrets to a man who wipes his ass on your brain . The last time we heard from him , Example was playing I was never into the whole pop / dance crossover thing .It ' s like he was playing it cool , lest we misconstrue him as something he wasn ' t . Now he ' s down with the kids and is ( grudgingly ) playing it safe on comeback single Scream and Shout .Vocally he ' s left The Sims over the synth heavy bass - leading track , but musically this is pretty much as far removed from his roots as can be without putting drones into fits . Then again , he ' s probably doing it for a different audience , and who doesn ' t love their pop crossover ?Even Example himself claims to have been pleasantly surprised by the song ( which features Calvin Harris
paraphrase: It's hard not to be enchanted by his recent transformation. Married life may have mellowed Example, but as a popstar, he can't help but spill his secrets to someone who has a significant influence on his creative process. Last we heard from him, Example was not a fan of the pop-dance crossover genre, but now he's embracing it with his comeback single, Scream and Shout. Although vocally, he's sticking to his roots, musically, this track is a departure from his usual style, catering to a new audience. Even Example himself has expressed surprise at how much he enjoys the song, which features Calvin Harris.

input:
Pedro Gonzalez faces up to 48 years in prison for allegedly attempting to beat Dita Richterova to death.
Friends have set up a GoFundMe page for Dita Richterova, who was severely beaten during an attack at the Brush
continuation: Prairie Drive - In . Dita Richterova , who was severely beaten during an attack at the Brush Prairie Drive - In , and her assailant have a history of altercations .A person accused of viciously beating a girl into a coma and chasing after her with a baseball bat has been accused with assault in a court appearance Thursday . Pedro Gonzalez is accused of trying to beat Dita Richterova to death .A Bellingham court put bail at $ 1 . 2 million for Gonzalez , 29 , who was indicted Thursday on accusations of attack in the first and first degree . The Associated Press reports Gonzalez faces up to 48 years in prison if sentenced on the felony attack counts .Gonzalez ' s public defender , Eric Jenson , said his client has a history of
paraphrase: Pedro Gonzalez is facing the possibility of a lengthy prison sentence after being charged with attempting to brutally beat Dita Richterova to death. Friends of the victim have created a GoFundMe page to help cover medical expenses and other costs incurred during her severe beating at the Brush Prairie Drive-In. The attack resulted in Richterova being placed in a coma, and her assailant has a history of altercations with the victim. In a court appearance on Thursday, Gonzalez was indicted on charges of assault and faced bail set at $1.2 million. If convicted, Gonzalez could face up to 48 years in prison. According to the Associated Press, Gonzalez's public defender, Eric Jenson, revealed that his client has a history of violent behavior.
